JAP: Yonah!?
FR: Yonah ?!
OUPS: Yonah!?

JAP: Brother? Hey, you wanna hear about the crazy dream I had last night?
FR: Papa ? Dis, papa, tu veux que je te raconte le rêve étrange que j'ai fait hier ?
OUPS: Brother? Hey, you wanna hear about the crazy dream I had last night?

JAP: Mmm?
FR: Hum ?
OUPS: Mmm?

JAP: Be careful, Brother. All right?
FR: Sois prudent, d'accord papa#?
OUPS: Be careful, Brother. All right?

JAP: ...I love you, Brother.
FR: ... Je t'aime, papa.
OUPS: ...I love you, Brother.

JAP: ...I'll take care of the place while you're gone.
FR: ... Je prendrai soin de la maison en ton absence.
OUPS: ...I'll take care of the place while you're gone.

JAP: Brother... I'm sorry I'm sick...
FR: Papa... Je suis désolée d'être malade...
OUPS: Brother... I'm sorry I'm sick...

JAP: Howdy there! I think Popola's expecting you in the library, isn't she?
FR: Bonjour#! Popola ne t'avait pas demandé d'aller la rejoindre à la bibliothèque#?
OUPS: Howdy there! I think Popola's expecting you in the library, isn't she?

JAP: Hey, I heard Popola needs help with some kinda job.
FR: J'ai entendu dire que Popola a besoin de ton aide.
OUPS: Hey, I heard Popola needs help with some kinda job.

JAP: I think she's waitin' for ya in the library.
FR: Je crois que Popola t'attend à la bibliothèque.
OUPS: I think she's waitin' for ya in the library.

JAP: Guess the tavern's not open yet.
FR: La taverne n'a pas l'air d'être encore ouverte.
OUPS: Guess the tavern's not open yet.

JAP: Mornin'.
FR: Bonjour !
OUPS: Mornin'.

JAP: Hello, Devola.
FR: Salut, Devola.
OUPS: Hello, Devola.

JAP: It's dangerous to run like this!
FR: Tu m'as l'air d'attaque ce matin !
OUPS: It's dangerous to run like this!

JAP: I'll be careful!
FR: Tu me connais. C'est pour ma fille que je travaille.
OUPS: I'll be careful!

JAP: I know Yonah means everything to you, but don't overwork yourself, all right?
FR: Je sais que Yonah est ce qu'il y a de plus important pour toi, mais ne te surmène pas trop, d'accord#?
OUPS: I know Yonah means everything to you, but don't overwork yourself, all right?

JAP: Good morning. How's Yonah doing today?
FR: Bonjour. Comment va Yonah aujourd'hui#?
OUPS: Good morning. How's Yonah doing today?

JAP: Her cough isn't any better.
FR: Sa toux ne s'améliore pas.
OUPS: Her cough isn't any better.

JAP: Mmm...that's worrisome. I hope she gets well soon.
FR: Hum... Voilà qui est inquiétant. J'espère qu'elle se remettra bientôt.
OUPS: Mmm...that's worrisome. I hope she gets well soon.

JAP: Me too.
FR: Moi aussi.
OUPS: Me too.

JAP: I feel so helpless. Other than making sure she eats properly, there just isn't much I can do for her.
FR: Je suis si désemparé... Je ne peux pas faire grand-chose pour elle à part m'assurer qu'elle mange assez.
OUPS: I feel so helpless. Other than making sure she eats properly, there just isn't much I can do for her.

JAP: ...Most days I feel like a total failure.
FR: La plupart du temps, j'ai l'impression de ne servir à rien.
OUPS: ...Most days I feel like a total failure.

JAP: Oh, stop that! You're the finest brother a girl could hope to have.
FR: Oh, ne dis pas des choses pareilles#! Elle ne pourrait pas avoir un père plus attentif que toi.
OUPS: Oh, stop that! You're the finest brother a girl could hope to have.

JAP: Well, anyway, I was hoping you could take care of this for me.
FR: Au fait, j'ai une faveur à te demander.
OUPS: Well, anyway, I was hoping you could take care of this for me.

JAP: I got a request from someone in the shopping district. They need you to get some mutton from the northern plains.
FR: L'apothicaire du marché aimerait que tu ailles chasser des moutons sur la plaine septentrionale.
OUPS: I got a request from someone in the shopping district. They need you to get some mutton from the northern plains.

JAP: Got it. I'm on my way.
FR: D'accord, je m'en occupe.
OUPS: Got it. I'm on my way.

JAP: Since you're going to the plains, let me give you a map.
FR: Voici une carte de la plaine.
OUPS: Since you're going to the plains, let me give you a map.

JAP: It'll come in handy, trust me.
FR: Tu en auras probablement besoin.
OUPS: It'll come in handy, trust me.

JAP: Oh, and one more thing...
FR: Oh, et j'oubliais...
OUPS: Oh, and one more thing...

JAP: Would you mind purchasing three medicinal herbs from the client while you're at it?
FR: Quand tu remettras le mouton à l'apothicaire, pourrais-tu m'acheter trois herbes médicinales pendant que tu y es#?
OUPS: Would you mind purchasing three medicinal herbs from the client while you're at it?

JAP: I used my last one earlier.
FR: Il ne m'en reste plus.
OUPS: I used my last one earlier.

JAP: Here's some money.
FR: Tiens, ça devrait être assez.
OUPS: Here's some money.

JAP: I don't think herbs cost this much.
FR: À ce que je sache, les herbes médicinales ne coûtent pas aussi cher.
OUPS: I don't think herbs cost this much.

JAP: Well then, buy some for Yonah while you're at it.
FR: Eh bien, profites-en pour acheter quelque chose pour Yonah.
OUPS: Well then, buy some for Yonah while you're at it.

JAP: You don't have to—
FR: Tu n'as pas à...
OUPS: You don't have to—

JAP: It's okay. Really.
FR: J'insiste.
OUPS: It's okay. Really.

JAP: That's three pieces of mutton and three medicinal herbs, all right? Thanks!
FR: Trois gigots de mouton pour l'apothicaire et trois herbes médicinales pour moi. Tu as bien noté#? Merci d'avance#!
OUPS: That's three pieces of mutton and three medicinal herbs, all right? Thanks!

JAP: Thanks, Popola. ...For everything.
FR: Merci, Popola... Merci pour tout.
OUPS: Thanks, Popola. ...For everything.

JAP: Huh?
FR: Hum ?
OUPS: Huh?

JAP: You know? All the work you give me.
FR: Merci de m'aider à trouver du travail.
OUPS: You know? All the work you give me.

JAP: You've been telling the villagers that I'm for hire, haven't you?
FR: C'est toi qui as dit aux villageois qu'ils pouvaient m'embaucher, n'est-ce pas ?
OUPS: You've been telling the villagers that I'm for hire, haven't you?

JAP: Oh, that? It's nothing.
FR: Oh, ça ? Ce n'est rien.
OUPS: Oh, that? It's nothing.

JAP: They need help, and you need money to take care of Yonah. This way everyone wins.
FR: Ils ont besoin d'aide et tu as besoin d'argent pour prendre soin de Yonah. Tout le monde y gagne.
OUPS: They need help, and you need money to take care of Yonah. This way everyone wins.

JAP: I suppose so.
FR: Je suppose.
OUPS: I suppose so.

JAP: (...Yonah?)
FR: (Yonah...?)
OUPS: (...Yonah?)

JAP: (What is she doing here?)
FR: (Mais qu'est-ce qu'elle fait ici#?)
OUPS: (What is she doing here?)

JAP: Yonah?
FR: Yonah#?
OUPS: Yonah?

JAP: Oh! Hey, Brother!
FR: Oh#! Salut, papa#!
OUPS: Oh! Hey, Brother!

JAP: Dammit, Yonah. You know you're too sick to be outside!
FR: Bon sang, Yonah#! Tu sais pourtant que tu es trop malade pour te promener dans le village#!
OUPS: Dammit, Yonah. You know you're too sick to be outside!

JAP: Look at you. Now your ribbon is coming undone and everything...
FR: Et regarde, ton ruban s'est dénoué. Tu vas le perdre si tu ne fais pas attention...
OUPS: Look at you. Now your ribbon is coming undone and everything...

JAP: S-sorry, Brother.
FR: Dé-désolée, papa...
OUPS: S-sorry, Brother.

JAP: I just thought...I thought maybe I'd go to the library and see if they had any books about my sickness.
FR: Seulement... Je me suis dit qu'il y aurait peut-être des livres sur ma maladie à la bibliothèque.
OUPS: I just thought...I thought maybe I'd go to the library and see if they had any books about my sickness.

JAP: Yonah...
FR: Oh, Yonah...
OUPS: Yonah...

JAP: Just let me worry about that, all right?
FR: Ne te fais pas tant de souci.
OUPS: Just let me worry about that, all right?

JAP: You just need to eat and sleep and focus on getting better. If you do that, your illness will take care of itself.
FR: Tâche de bien manger, de te reposer et dis-toi tous les jours que tu iras bientôt mieux. Si tu le fais, ta maladie se guérira toute seule.
OUPS: You just need to eat and sleep and focus on getting better. If you do that, your illness will take care of itself.

JAP: ...You really think so?
FR: ... Vraiment#?
OUPS: ...You really think so?

JAP: Yeah, I do.
FR: J'en suis certain.
OUPS: Yeah, I do.

JAP: Listen, I've got a lot of work to do, so I'll be back in a while. Okay?
FR: écoute, le travail m'attend, mais je rentrerai bientôt, d'accord ma chérie#?
OUPS: Listen, I've got a lot of work to do, so I'll be back in a while. Okay?

JAP: Okay!
FR: D'accord#!
OUPS: Okay!

JAP: Doesn't seem like anyone's here.
FR: On dirait qu'il n'y a personne.
OUPS: Doesn't seem like anyone's here.

JAP: Hey. You wanted some mutton?
FR: Vous vouliez de la viande de mouton#?
OUPS: Hey. You wanted some mutton?

JAP: Oh, thank you! You wouldn't believe how popular this stuff is lately.<PAGE>Here. This isn't much, but I'd like you to have it.
FR: Oh, merci beaucoup#! Tout le monde en raffole ces temps-ci#! Tiens, ce n'est pas grand-chose, mais j'aimerais que tu l'acceptes.
OUPS: Oh, thank you! You wouldn't believe how popular this stuff is lately.<PAGE>Here. This isn't much, but I'd like you to have it.

JAP: And tell Popola I said thanks, okay?
FR: Et remercie aussi Popola de ma part, d'accord#?
OUPS: And tell Popola I said thanks, okay?

JAP: I'll do that.
FR: Bien sûr.
OUPS: I'll do that.

JAP: Ah, you must be the man Popola sent. I need three pieces of mutton as soon as you can, all right?
FR: Ah, c'est Popola qui t'envoie#? J'ai besoin de trois gigots de mouton dès que possible#!
OUPS: Ah, you must be the man Popola sent. I need three pieces of mutton as soon as you can, all right?

JAP: (I think Popola wanted three medicinal herbs...)
FR: (Je crois que Popola voulait trois herbes médicinales...)
OUPS: (I think Popola wanted three medicinal herbs...)

JAP: I got the mutton. ...Those sheep are squirrelly little bastards.
FR: J'ai apporté trois gigots de mouton à l'apothicaire. ... Ces bêtes sont moins dociles qu'elles n'en ont l'air.
OUPS: I got the mutton. ...Those sheep are squirrelly little bastards.

JAP: Oh, and here's your herbs.
FR: Oh, et voici les herbes médicinales que tu voulais.
OUPS: Oh, and here's your herbs.

JAP: Thank you.
FR: Merci.
OUPS: Thank you.

JAP: And yes, those sheep can be surprisingly tough!
FR: Et oui, ces moutons peuvent être féroces#!
OUPS: And yes, those sheep can be surprisingly tough!

JAP: Anyway, you look exhausted, so why don't you call it a day? I'm sure Yonah would love some extra time with you.
FR: Tu as l'air épuisé. Je crois que tu as assez travaillé pour aujourd'hui. Tu devrais rentrer. Je suis certaine que Yonah aimerait pouvoir passer plus de temps avec toi.
OUPS: Anyway, you look exhausted, so why don't you call it a day? I'm sure Yonah would love some extra time with you.

JAP: Yeah. I'm sure she would.
FR: Tu as raison.
OUPS: Yeah. I'm sure she would.

JAP: Hey, Brother, about that dream I had today...
FR: Hé, papa#! Je veux finir de te raconter mon rêve...
OUPS: Hey, Brother, about that dream I had today...

JAP: There was me and... Um...
FR: J'étais quelque part et euh...
OUPS: There was me and... Um...

JAP: I think there was a big pink goat or something...
FR: Je crois qu'il y avait une énorme chèvre rose et...
OUPS: I think there was a big pink goat or something...

JAP: I guess I kinda forgot the rest. But it was really crazy!
FR: Euh, j'ai oublié le reste. Il était vraiment bizarre#!
OUPS: I guess I kinda forgot the rest. But it was really crazy!

JAP: That's all right, Yonah. I've got a story for you this time.
FR: Ne t'en fais pas, Yonah. Que dirais-tu que je te raconte plutôt une histoire#?
OUPS: That's all right, Yonah. I've got a story for you this time.

JAP: Have you ever heard of a flower called the Lunar Tear?
FR: As-tu déjà entendu parler des larmes lunaires#? Ce sont des fleurs.
OUPS: Have you ever heard of a flower called the Lunar Tear?

JAP: That's a silly name.
FR: Quel nom ridicule#!
OUPS: That's a silly name.

JAP: Maybe. But people say that the Lunar Tear will grant the wish of anyone who finds one.
FR: Tu as sans doute raison. Toutefois, certains prétendent qu'une larme lunaire peut exaucer le vœu de la personne qui la trouve.
OUPS: Maybe. But people say that the Lunar Tear will grant the wish of anyone who finds one.

JAP: But only very good boys and girls are ever able to find one. So you have to keep being good, all right?
FR: Mais seuls les enfants sages arrivent à en trouver, alors tu dois toujours être sage, d'accord#?
OUPS: But only very good boys and girls are ever able to find one. So you have to keep being good, all right?

JAP: Could...could a Lunar Tear make me better?
FR: Est-ce qu'une... une larme lunaire pourrait me guérir#?
OUPS: Could...could a Lunar Tear make me better?

JAP: Of course. It can do anything.
FR: Bien sûr. Elle peut exaucer n'importe quel vœu.
OUPS: Of course. It can do anything.

JAP: Hmm...
FR: Hum...
OUPS: Hmm...

JAP: Yonah? Is something wrong?
FR: Yonah#? Quelque chose ne va pas#?
OUPS: Yonah? Is something wrong?

JAP: N-no! It's nothing.
FR: Non#! Ce n'est rien.
OUPS: N-no! It's nothing.

JAP: Good night, Brother.
FR: Bonne nuit, papa.
OUPS: Good night, Brother.

JAP: All right, I'm off. See you later.
FR: Bon, j'y vais. À plus tard, ma chérie.
OUPS: All right, I'm off. See you later.

JAP: And stay out of trouble today, all right?
FR: Sois sage, d'accord#?
OUPS: And stay out of trouble today, all right?

JAP: All right.
FR: D'accord.
OUPS: All right.

JAP: The Lunar Tear...
FR: Une larme lunaire...
OUPS: The Lunar Tear...

JAP: Got any work for me today?
FR: As-tu du travail pour moi aujourd'hui#?
OUPS: Got any work for me today?

JAP: I do have something, but...I don't know. It's going to be a bit of an ordeal.
FR: Oui, mais... Ce ne sera pas du gâteau.
OUPS: I do have something, but...I don't know. It's going to be a bit of an ordeal.

JAP: Sounds right up my alley.
FR: Ça me convient parfaitement.
OUPS: Sounds right up my alley.

JAP: I suppose so.
FR: Sans doute.
OUPS: I suppose so.

JAP: You know about the little wooden bridge that's out in the northern plains, right?
FR: Tu sais que le pont de bois de la plaine septentrionale s'est effondré, n'est-ce pas#?
OUPS: You know about the little wooden bridge that's out in the northern plains, right?

JAP: Yeah. The old thing finally fell over.
FR: Oui, on ne peut plus traverser la gorge.
OUPS: Yeah. The old thing finally fell over.

JAP: Well, we had a team of carpenters working on it, but they were attacked by Shades.
FR: Eh bien, les menuisiers qui le réparaient se sont fait attaquer par des Ombres.
OUPS: Well, we had a team of carpenters working on it, but they were attacked by Shades.

JAP: What!? Shades in the northern plains?
FR: Comment#?! Encore des Ombres sur la plaine septentrionale#?
OUPS: What!? Shades in the northern plains?

JAP: Yes, I know. Apparently it was overcast, and the Shades caught them off guard.
FR: Oui, je sais, c'est inquiétant. À ce qu'il paraît, le ciel était nuageux et les Ombres les ont pris de court.
OUPS: Yes, I know. Apparently it was overcast, and the Shades caught them off guard.

JAP: One of the carpenters was seriously injured.
FR: Un des menuisiers est grièvement blessé.
OUPS: One of the carpenters was seriously injured.

JAP: So you want me to go take 'em out.
FR: Tu veux que j'aille me débarrasser d'elles, c'est ça#?
OUPS: So you want me to go take 'em out.

JAP: Yes, but be careful! It's a dangerous job.
FR: Oui, mais sois prudent#! Ce sera dangereux#!
OUPS: Yes, but be careful! It's a dangerous job.

JAP: My favorite kind.
FR: J'adore le danger.
OUPS: My favorite kind.

JAP: I can't live on charity forever. I have to do something to help this village.
FR: Je ne peux pas vivre d'aumônes éternellement. Je dois aider les villageois.
OUPS: I can't live on charity forever. I have to do something to help this village.

JAP: You know, yesterday I killed some Shades right by the village gate. Damn things were hiding in the shadows...
FR: Hier, j'ai tué des Ombres qui rôdaient tout près de la porte du village, tu sais. Elles s'étaient camouflées à l'ombre.
OUPS: You know, yesterday I killed some Shades right by the village gate. Damn things were hiding in the shadows...

JAP: Oh? That's a bit disconcerting.
FR: Ah bon#? C'est plutôt alarmant...
OUPS: Oh? That's a bit disconcerting.

JAP: Anyway, are you sure you want to take this job?
FR: Alors, es-tu certain de vouloir accepter cette tâche#?
OUPS: Anyway, are you sure you want to take this job?

JAP: I'm sure. Leave it to me.
FR: Oui, je m'en occupe.
OUPS: I'm sure. Leave it to me.

JAP: Sorry to put you through all this trouble...
FR: Je suis désolée d'avoir à te demander de prendre autant de risques...
OUPS: Sorry to put you through all this trouble...

JAP: There we go.
FR: Et voilà.
OUPS: There we go.

JAP: That should take care of the Shades for a while.
FR: Les Ombres devraient nous laisser tranquilles pendant quelque temps.
OUPS: That should take care of the Shades for a while.

JAP: Oh! You're back!
FR: Oh#! Tu es de retour#!
OUPS: Oh! You're back!

JAP: Yep.
FR: Comme tu peux le constater.
OUPS: Yep.

JAP: Is everything all right? Were you hurt?
FR: As-tu éliminé les Ombres#? Es-tu blessé#?
OUPS: Is everything all right? Were you hurt?

JAP: Ah, that was nothing.
FR: Tout s'est bien passé.
OUPS: Ah, that was nothing.

JAP: I've been so worried! I felt like I sent you into a really dangerous situation, and if something had—
FR: J'étais morte d'inquiétude#! Tu as couru un grand danger par ma faute et si quelque chose t'était arrivé, je...
OUPS: I've been so worried! I felt like I sent you into a really dangerous situation, and if something had—

JAP: Popola? I'm fine. You can stop worrying now.
FR: Popola#? Je n'ai rien. Tu peux arrêter de te faire du souci.
OUPS: Popola? I'm fine. You can stop worrying now.

JAP: I'm glad...
FR: Je suis soulagée...
OUPS: I'm glad...

JAP: Oh, by the way. Those carpenters left you some money.
FR: Au fait, les menuisiers veulent t'offrir cette récompense.
OUPS: Oh, by the way. Those carpenters left you some money.

JAP: Thanks. ...Again.
FR: Merci... une fois de plus.
OUPS: Thanks. ...Again.

JAP: Now it's you who needs to stop worrying! Go buy something nice for Yonah, okay?
FR: Et maintenant, c'est toi qui dois arrêter de t'inquiéter#! Va acheter un cadeau à Yonah, d'accord#?
OUPS: Now it's you who needs to stop worrying! Go buy something nice for Yonah, okay?

JAP: Oh, um...speaking of Yonah, she came by here this afternoon.
FR: Oh, euh, au sujet de Yonah... Elle est venue à la bibliothèque cet après-midi.
OUPS: Oh, um...speaking of Yonah, she came by here this afternoon.

JAP: Dammit! Not again!
FR: Bon sang#! Pas encore#!
OUPS: Dammit! Not again!

JAP: Don't be so angry! She just wanted to ask me a question.
FR: Ne te mets pas en colère#! Elle ne voulait que me demander quelque chose.
OUPS: Don't be so angry! She just wanted to ask me a question.

JAP: What about?
FR: Que voulait-elle savoir#?
OUPS: What about?

JAP: She was asking about the outside world.
FR: Elle m'a posé des questions sur le monde extérieur.
OUPS: She was asking about the outside world.

JAP: Why would she suddenly care about what happens outside the village?
FR: Pourquoi s'intéresse-t-elle soudain à ce qu'il y a à l'extérieur du village#?
OUPS: Why would she suddenly care about what happens outside the village?

JAP: I don't know...
FR: Je n'en ai aucune idée.
OUPS: I don't know...

JAP: Oh, well. I guess kids don't always make sense.
FR: Hum... Les enfants n'ont pas toujours une raison logique pour faire ce qu'ils font.
OUPS: Oh, well. I guess kids don't always make sense.

JAP: Don't worry. I told her she wasn't allowed outside of the village.
FR: Ne t'en fais pas, je lui ai dit qu'elle n'était pas censée sortir du village.
OUPS: Don't worry. I told her she wasn't allowed outside of the village.

JAP: Thanks. And sorry she was bugging you.
FR: Merci. Je suis désolé qu'elle soit venue t'embêter.
OUPS: Thanks. And sorry she was bugging you.

JAP: It's not a bother. Now go home. She's probably worried about you.
FR: Elle ne m'a pas dérangée. Allez, va la retrouver. Elle se demande sûrement pourquoi tu n'es toujours pas rentré.
OUPS: It's not a bother. Now go home. She's probably worried about you.

JAP: Good plan.
FR: Tu as raison.
OUPS: Good plan.

JAP: Thanks. And sorry she was bugging you.
FR: Merci. Je suis désolé qu'elle soit venue t'embêter.
OUPS: Thanks. And sorry she was bugging you.

JAP: It's not a bother. Now go home. She's probably worried about you.
FR: Elle ne m'a pas dérangée. Allez, va la retrouver. Elle se demande sûrement pourquoi tu n'es toujours pas rentré.
OUPS: It's not a bother. Now go home. She's probably worried about you.

JAP: Good plan.
FR: Tu as raison.
OUPS: Good plan.

JAP: ...Yonah?
FR: ...#Yonah#?
OUPS: ...Yonah?

JAP: Where'd she go?
FR: Où est-elle passée#?
OUPS: Where'd she go?

JAP: I swear, if she's gone to the library again...
FR: Si elle est encore retournée à la bibliothèque, je vais la gronder#!
OUPS: I swear, if she's gone to the library again...

JAP: Hmm... Doesn't look like she's here.
FR: Hum... Je ne la vois nulle part.
OUPS: Hmm... Doesn't look like she's here.

JAP: I'd better go ask Popola.
FR: Popola l'a peut-être aperçue.
OUPS: I'd better go ask Popola.

JAP: Hey, Popola. Was Yonah here again?
FR: Dis, Popola, aurais-tu vu Yonah#?
OUPS: Hey, Popola. Was Yonah here again?

JAP: Hmm? No, haven't seen her.
FR: Yonah#? Non.
OUPS: Hmm? No, haven't seen her.

JAP: That's strange. She's not home, either.
FR: C'est étrange, elle n'est pas à la maison.
OUPS: That's strange. She's not home, either.

JAP: Really?
FR: Vraiment#?
OUPS: Really?

JAP: Yeah. I figured she came here to bug you some more.
FR: Je me suis dit qu'elle avait peut-être d'autres questions à te poser.
OUPS: Yeah. I figured she came here to bug you some more.

JAP: Nope, she hasn't been back since earlier. She should be home by now.
FR: Non, elle n'est pas revenue depuis. Elle aurait pourtant dû être rentrée il y a un bon moment...
OUPS: Nope, she hasn't been back since earlier. She should be home by now.

JAP: Did she say where she was going?
FR: A-t-elle dit où elle allait#?
OUPS: Did she say where she was going?

JAP: No. She just asked me where she could find a Lunar Tear. She's so cute.
FR: Non, mais elle m'a demandé où on pouvait trouver une larme lunaire. Elle est si mignonne#!
OUPS: No. She just asked me where she could find a Lunar Tear. She's so cute.

JAP: I told her how they used to grow around the Lost Shrine.
FR: Je lui ai dit que des larmes lunaires poussaient autrefois près du temple oublié.
OUPS: I told her how they used to grow around the Lost Shrine.

JAP: Why the hell is Yonah asking about Lunar Tears?
FR: Pourquoi Yonah voudrait-elle savoir où en trouver#?
OUPS: Why the hell is Yonah asking about Lunar Tears?

JAP: ...Oh, goddammit!
FR: ... Oh, bon sang#!
OUPS: ...Oh, goddammit!

JAP: What is it? What's wrong!?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?!
OUPS: What is it? What's wrong!?

JAP: Yesterday I told her a story about how Lunar Tears can grant wishes.
FR: Hier, je lui ai raconté la légende qui dit que les larmes lunaires peuvent exaucer des vœux.
OUPS: Yesterday I told her a story about how Lunar Tears can grant wishes.

JAP: ...And?
OUPS: ...And?

JAP: She asked me if it could cure her, and I said it could, and then...
FR: Elle m'a demandé si une larme lunaire pouvait la guérir et je lui ai répondu que oui...
OUPS: She asked me if it could cure her, and I said it could, and then...

JAP: Gods, I'm such an idiot!
FR: Je ne suis qu'un imbécile#!
OUPS: Gods, I'm such an idiot!

JAP: You don't think she went to look for one, do you!?
FR: Tu crois qu'elle est allée en chercher une#?!
OUPS: You don't think she went to look for one, do you!?

JAP: If she's finally learned the extent of her illness...
FR: Si elle s'est rendue compte de la sévérité de sa maladie...
OUPS: If she's finally learned the extent of her illness...

JAP: Oh, damn it all!
FR: Oh, bon sang#!
OUPS: Oh, damn it all!

JAP: What's the fastest way to the Lost Shrine?
FR: Où est le temple oublié#?
OUPS: What's the fastest way to the Lost Shrine?

JAP: Through the eastern gate.
FR: Au-delà de la porte de l'est.
OUPS: Through the eastern gate.

JAP: I'm gonna go check it out.
FR: Je vais y jeter un coup d'œil.
OUPS: I'm gonna go check it out.

JAP: I have to find Yonah first.
FR: Je dois d'abord retrouver Yonah.
OUPS: I have to find Yonah first.

JAP: I have to check out the eastern gate.
FR: Je dois me rendre à la porte de l'est.
OUPS: I have to check out the eastern gate.

JAP: What's that?
FR: Qu'est-ce que c'est...?
OUPS: What's that?

JAP: Yonah... I can't believe she really went to the Lost Shrine...
FR: Yonah... Je n'arrive pas à croire qu'elle soit vraiment allée au temple oublié...
OUPS: Yonah... I can't believe she really went to the Lost Shrine...

JAP: Oh, hey there!
FR: Salut#!
OUPS: Oh, hey there!

JAP: Wanna let a girl buy ya a drink?
FR: Puis-je t'offrir un verre#?
OUPS: Wanna let a girl buy ya a drink?

JAP: I can't drink! And now midday, isn't it?
FR: ... Il n'est pas un peu tôt#?
OUPS: I can't drink! And now midday, isn't it?

JAP: Hah! When you live in a place where the sun never sets, what difference does it make!?
FR: Pfft#! Quand on vit dans un endroit où le soleil ne se couche jamais, ça n'a pas vraiment d'importance#!
OUPS: Hah! When you live in a place where the sun never sets, what difference does it make!?

JAP: I love this tavern. It's the nerve center of the whole village! Folks come here to relax or swap stories or even look for work.
FR: J'adore cette taverne. C'est le cœur du village#! Les gens viennent y prendre un verre, colporter les dernières rumeurs et même chercher du travail.
OUPS: I love this tavern. It's the nerve center of the whole village! Folks come here to relax or swap stories or even look for work.

JAP: Hmm... What've we got today...
FR: Hum... Voyons voir...
OUPS: Hmm... What've we got today...

JAP: Come back whenever you have a free minute!
FR: Reviens me voir bientôt#!
OUPS: Come back whenever you have a free minute!

JAP: This isn't the way to the Lost Shrine.
FR: Ce n'est pas le chemin qui mène au temple oublié.
OUPS: This isn't the way to the Lost Shrine.

JAP: Look at this rockslide...
FR: Un éboulement...
OUPS: Look at this rockslide...

JAP: There's no way Yonah could have made it past here.
FR: Yonah n'a pas pu emprunter ce sentier.
OUPS: There's no way Yonah could have made it past here.

JAP: Maybe she found some other way in...
FR: Elle a peut-être trouvé un autre chemin...
OUPS: Maybe she found some other way in...

JAP: Looks like you can get outside from here.
FR: Cette porte mène sans doute à l'extérieur.
OUPS: Looks like you can get outside from here.

JAP: That ladder's broken.
FR: Cette échelle est endommagée.
OUPS: That ladder's broken.

JAP: I could probably get up there if I had something to stand on.
FR: Je pourrais probablement grimper là-haut en mettant quelque chose contre le mur.
OUPS: I could probably get up there if I had something to stand on.

JAP: Yonah!
FR: Yonah !
OUPS: Yonah!

JAP: Bah! Stop! For the love of all that is holy, stop pounding me!
FR: Bah ! Arrête ! De grâce, cesse de me marteler ainsi !
OUPS: Bah! Stop! For the love of all that is holy, stop pounding me!

JAP: Then move!
FR: Alors, dégage !
OUPS: Then move!

JAP: It seems our task is more difficult than I first envisioned.
FR: On dirait que notre tâche est plus difficile que je ne l'avais escompté.
OUPS: It seems our task is more difficult than I first envisioned.

JAP: I'm sorry... I didn't mean to... I just wanted to help.
FR: Je suis désolée... Je ne voulais pas... Je voulais juste t'aider.
OUPS: I'm sorry... I didn't mean to... I just wanted to help.

JAP: It's all right, Yonah, don't worry about it. Are you okay? Are you hurt?
FR: Ce n'est pas grave, Yonah. Ne t'en fais pas. Ça va ? Tu es blessée ?
OUPS: It's all right, Yonah, don't worry about it. Are you okay? Are you hurt?

JAP: Ahem! Perhaps we'd best depart, hmm?
FR: Arhem ! Nous ferions sans doute mieux de quitter cet endroit.
OUPS: Ahem! Perhaps we'd best depart, hmm?

JAP: This shrine's gonna collapse. Come on, Yonah! We have to move!
FR: Le temple va s'effondrer. Viens, Yonah ! Nous devons partir !
OUPS: This shrine's gonna collapse. Come on, Yonah! We have to move!

JAP: She has the Black Scrawl...
FR: Elle a la nécrose runique.
OUPS: She has the Black Scrawl...

JAP: Yeah...
FR: Oui...
OUPS: Yeah...

JAP: When did this happen?
FR: Quand est-elle tombée malade#?
OUPS: When did this happen?

JAP: A month ago. Maybe a little more.
FR: Il y a un peu plus d'un mois.
OUPS: A month ago. Maybe a little more.

JAP: The disease curses the afflicted with strange runic symbols that gradually spread over
FR: Cette maladie recouvre peu à peu le corps de ceux qui en souffrent d'étranges
OUPS: The disease curses the afflicted with strange runic symbols that gradually spread over

JAP: the entire body.
FR: symboles runiformes.
OUPS: the entire body.

JAP: And I fear...it is fatal.
FR: Et j'ai bien peur... qu'elle soit mortelle.
OUPS: And I fear...it is fatal.

JAP: I know...
FR: Je sais...
OUPS: I know...

JAP: Oh, Yonah...
FR: Oh, Yonah...
OUPS: Oh, Yonah...

JAP: Come. It's best to let her sleep.
FR: Viens. Il vaut mieux la laisser se reposer.
OUPS: Come. It's best to let her sleep.

JAP: Ah, damn it all!
FR: Ah, bon sang !
OUPS: Ah, damn it all!

JAP: Why does it have to be Yonah? Why not me?
FR: Pourquoi Yonah ? Pourquoi pas moi ?
OUPS: Why does it have to be Yonah? Why not me?

JAP: Of all people, why my only sister!?
FR: Pourquoi ma fille unique...?!
OUPS: Of all people, why my only sister!?

JAP: I would gladly help her, had I the means to do so.
FR: Je l'aiderais volontiers si j'en avais le pouvoir.
OUPS: I would gladly help her, had I the means to do so.

JAP: No. I'm not gonna leave now.
FR: Non. Je ne vais pas la quitter maintenant.
OUPS: No. I'm not gonna leave now.

JAP: I don't feel like talking right now.
FR: Je n'ai pas envie de parler.
OUPS: I don't feel like talking right now.

JAP: Oh, you're back! I was worried about you. I heard you went through the eastern gate and... Is that a book?
FR: Tu es de retour ! Quel soulagement ! J'avais entendu dire que tu étais parti par la porte de l'est et j'étais inquiète, mais... C'est un livre ?
OUPS: Oh, you're back! I was worried about you. I heard you went through the eastern gate and... Is that a book?

JAP: Never mind the book—
FR: Peu importe le livre...!
OUPS: Never mind the book—

JAP: Now see here! I am Grimoire Weiss, and you will treat me with the proper respect!
FR: Mais dis donc ! Un peu de respect ! Je suis le Grimoire Weiss, après tout !
OUPS: Now see here! I am Grimoire Weiss, and you will treat me with the proper respect!

JAP: Wait, you're Grimoire Weiss? Oh, that is so cool!
FR: Quoi, tu es le Grimoire Weiss ? Ouah, trop fort !
OUPS: Wait, you're Grimoire Weiss? Oh, that is so cool!

JAP: ...You know him?
FR: ... Tu le connais ?
OUPS: ...You know him?

JAP: Of course! He's the white book mentioned in the song I was singing.
FR: Bien sûr ! C'est le livre blanc dont parle la chanson que je chantais.
OUPS: Of course! He's the white book mentioned in the song I was singing.

JAP: ...He's in your song?
FR: ... Ta chanson parle de lui ?
OUPS: ...He's in your song?

JAP: Yeah, the Song of the Ancients. It's an old tune that's been passed down through generations of villagers.
FR: Oui, elle est intitulée « Chant des Anciens ». C'est une vieille mélodie qui a été transmise de génération en génération dans le village.
OUPS: Yeah, the Song of the Ancients. It's an old tune that's been passed down through generations of villagers.

JAP: It's in a forgotten language, so I doubt you could make much sense out of it.
FR: Les paroles sont dans une langue morte, alors je doute que tu puisses les comprendre.
OUPS: It's in a forgotten language, so I doubt you could make much sense out of it.

JAP: Do you know what it says?
FR: Et toi, sais-tu ce que la chanson raconte ?
OUPS: Do you know what it says?

JAP: Well, it's not like I studied it or anything, but I can tell you bits and pieces.
FR: Je ne l'ai jamais étudiée à fond, mais je peux te la résumer.
OUPS: Well, it's not like I studied it or anything, but I can tell you bits and pieces.

JAP: There's this terrible black book that shows up and starts spreading disease all over
FR: Elle raconte l'histoire d'un terrible livre noir qui surgit soudainement et disperse à tous les vents les germes
OUPS: There's this terrible black book that shows up and starts spreading disease all over

JAP: the place.
FR: d'une maladie.
OUPS: the place.

JAP: But then this white book appears and saves the world and everyone's happy.
FR: Mais ensuite un livre blanc apparaît, sauve l'humanité et tout le monde est heureux.
OUPS: But then this white book appears and saves the world and everyone's happy.

JAP: You know how it goes.
FR: C'est toujours la même rengaine.
OUPS: You know how it goes.

JAP: Hmm...
FR: Hum...
OUPS: Hmm...

JAP: What is it?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il ?
OUPS: What is it?

JAP: Never mind.
FR: Rien.
OUPS: Never mind.

JAP: Tell me about this black book. Where is it from? How does it work?
FR: Ce livre noir, d'où vient-il#? Comment attaque-t-il les gens#?
OUPS: Tell me about this black book. Where is it from? How does it work?

JAP: What? ...It's just a song. I don't know what it means.
FR: Quoi...? Ce n'est qu'une chanson. Je ne sais pas ce qu'elle veut dire.
OUPS: What? ...It's just a song. I don't know what it means.

JAP: What kind of idiot sings a song without knowing what it means!?
FR: Quelle sorte d'imbécile chante une chanson sans savoir ce qu'elle veut dire ?!
OUPS: What kind of idiot sings a song without knowing what it means!?

JAP: This kind of idiot? ...Look, why don't you go to the library and ask Popola?
FR: Quelle sorte de...? écoute, pourquoi ne vas-tu pas plutôt le demander à Popola à
OUPS: This kind of idiot? ...Look, why don't you go to the library and ask Popola?

JAP: She's smarter than me. Maybe she knows.
FR: la bibliothèque ? Elle est plus intelligente que moi. Elle en sait peut-être plus.
OUPS: She's smarter than me. Maybe she knows.

JAP: Popola, huh? All right.
FR: Hum, Popola ? D'accord.
OUPS: Popola, huh? All right.

JAP: If you wanna know about the Song of the Ancients, talk to Popola.
FR: Si tu veux en savoir plus au sujet du chant des Anciens, va voir Popola.
OUPS: If you wanna know about the Song of the Ancients, talk to Popola.

JAP: We should go talk to Popola.
FR: Nous devrions aller parler à Popola.
OUPS: We should go talk to Popola.

JAP: We should go talk to Popola.
FR: Nous devrions aller parler à Popola.
OUPS: We should go talk to Popola.

JAP: I heard about Yonah. I...I don't know what to say. I'm so sorry.
FR: J'ai appris ce qui était arrivé à Yonah. Je... je ne sais pas quoi te dire. Je suis tellement désolée.
OUPS: I heard about Yonah. I...I don't know what to say. I'm so sorry.

JAP: Maybe you can help. What do you know about the song that Devola was singing?
FR: Tu peux peut-être m'aider. Que sais-tu au sujet de la chanson que fredonne souvent Devola#?
OUPS: Maybe you can help. What do you know about the song that Devola was singing?

JAP: Is that...is that Grimoire Weiss?
FR: Ce livre... Est-ce le Grimoire Weiss#?
OUPS: Is that...is that Grimoire Weiss?

JAP: You know Weiss?
FR: Tu connais Weiss#?
OUPS: You know Weiss?

JAP: Finally! Someone who appreciates quality when they see it.
FR: Enfin#! Quelqu'un qui sait apprécier les objets de qualité#!
OUPS: Finally! Someone who appreciates quality when they see it.

JAP: Yes, well, the Song of the Ancients. Let's see...
FR: Oui, bon, le chant des Anciens... Voyons voir...
OUPS: Yes, well, the Song of the Ancients. Let's see...

JAP: Oh, gods. That's it. ...That's IT!
FR: Grands dieux#! J'ai compris#!
OUPS: Oh, gods. That's it. ...That's IT!

JAP: ...Wh-what's it?
FR: ... Qu'as-tu compris#?
OUPS: ...Wh-what's it?

JAP: If the black book spreads chaos─if it spreads the Black Scrawl─then the white book must be able to cure it!
FR: Si le livre noir disperse les germes d'une maladie, par exemple ceux de la nécrose runique, alors le livre blanc doit pouvoir les détruire#!
OUPS: If the black book spreads chaos─if it spreads the Black Scrawl─then the white book must be able to cure it!

JAP: I need to find these Sealed Verses...
FR: Il faut que je trouve ces vers scellés...
OUPS: I need to find these Sealed Verses...

JAP: Perhaps the matter I infused in the shrine is one of these Sealed Verses of which you speak.
FR: Ce que j'ai absorbé dans le temple est peut-être ce dont tu parles.
OUPS: Perhaps the matter I infused in the shrine is one of these Sealed Verses of which you speak.

JAP: Yeah, I think you're right, Weiss. And that means you're gonna save Yonah.
FR: Oui, je crois que tu as raison, Weiss, et ça veut dire que tu sauveras ma petite fille.
OUPS: Yeah, I think you're right, Weiss. And that means you're gonna save Yonah.

JAP: Guys, don't get too excited. This is just some old legend.
FR: Du calme, ce n'est qu'une vieille légende.
OUPS: Guys, don't get too excited. This is just some old legend.

JAP: Weiss is real enough, isn't he?
FR: Weiss est bien réel, non#?
OUPS: Weiss is real enough, isn't he?

JAP: And if he's real, the rest of it must be, too. He can cure the Black Scrawl...I know it.
FR: Et s'il existe, le reste doit aussi être vrai. Il peut guérir la nécrose runique, j'en suis certain.
OUPS: And if he's real, the rest of it must be, too. He can cure the Black Scrawl...I know it.

JAP: And yet you know nothing regarding the whereabouts of Grimoire Noir?
FR: Cependant, tu ne sais pas où se trouve le Grimoire Noir, Popola ?
OUPS: And yet you know nothing regarding the whereabouts of Grimoire Noir?

JAP: Sorry, but there's nothing about that in any of the records.
FR: Il n'y a rien à ce sujet dans les archives, désolée.
OUPS: Sorry, but there's nothing about that in any of the records.

JAP: What we do know is that there's a number of these Sealed Verses out there.
FR: Ce dont nous sommes certains, c'est qu'il existe plusieurs de ces vers scellés à travers le monde.
OUPS: What we do know is that there's a number of these Sealed Verses out there.

JAP: And it also appears that the Shades you fight and these Verses are intrinsically linked.
FR: Et il semblerait aussi que ces Ombres que tu as combattues y sont intrinsèquement liées, <NIER>.
OUPS: And it also appears that the Shades you fight and these Verses are intrinsically linked.

JAP: Fine. Then I kill 'em all and take what I need.
FR: Très bien. Je les éliminerai toutes et j'obtiendrai ce dont j'ai besoin.
OUPS: Fine. Then I kill 'em all and take what I need.

JAP: Have you gone completely mad?
FR: Aurais-tu perdu la tête ?
OUPS: Have you gone completely mad?

JAP: What an absurdly reckless plan!
FR: Quel plan absurde et irresponsable !
OUPS: What an absurdly reckless plan!

JAP: I won't stand around while my sister dies! Tell me where to find 'em!
FR: Je ne vais pas rester ici à rien faire alors que ma fille est mourante ! Dis-moi où je peux les trouver !
OUPS: I won't stand around while my sister dies! Tell me where to find 'em!

JAP: Now wait just one minute!
FR: Mais attends !
OUPS: Now wait just one minute!

JAP: You're really going to do this, huh?
FR: Tu comptes vraiment le faire, n'est-ce pas ?
OUPS: You're really going to do this, huh?

JAP: Well, all right...
FR: Bon, d'accord...
OUPS: Well, all right...

JAP: I've heard the Shades are gathering near a village called The Aerie.
FR: J'ai entendu dire que les Ombres se rassemblent près d'un village appelé l'Aire.
OUPS: I've heard the Shades are gathering near a village called The Aerie.

JAP: It's past the bridge on the northern plains. They should be done with the repairs by now.
FR: Il est situé de l'autre côté du pont de la plaine septentrionale.
OUPS: It's past the bridge on the northern plains. They should be done with the repairs by now.

JAP: I marked it on your map for you.
FR: Celui-ci devrait maintenant être réparé. J'ai noté son emplacement sur ta carte.
OUPS: I marked it on your map for you.

JAP: Maybe you could find one of the Sealed Verses there.
FR: Tu pourras peut-être y trouver un des vers scellés.
OUPS: Maybe you could find one of the Sealed Verses there.

JAP: And be careful...
FR: Et soyez prudents...
OUPS: And be careful...

JAP: Good luck, you two.
FR: Bonne chance.
OUPS: Good luck, you two.

JAP: Whoa—wait, wait. You're actually going to go find the Sealed Verses?
FR: Oh, une petite minute ! Tu vas vraiment aller à la recherche des vers scellés ?
OUPS: Whoa—wait, wait. You're actually going to go find the Sealed Verses?

JAP: Yeah.
FR: Oui.
OUPS: Yeah.

JAP: But that's crazytown! You know how hard that's gonna be!?
FR: Mais c'est de la folie ! Tu te rends compte à quel point ce sera difficile ?!
OUPS: But that's crazytown! You know how hard that's gonna be!?

JAP: ...Not as hard as watching Yonah die.
FR: ... Pas aussi difficile que de regarder Yonah mourir.
OUPS: ...Not as hard as watching Yonah die.

JAP: I promise I'll be safe, Brother. I'll wait right here and not get into any trouble.
FR: Il ne m'arrivera rien, papa. Je te le promets. Je vais t'attendre ici et je ne ferai pas de bêtises.
OUPS: I promise I'll be safe, Brother. I'll wait right here and not get into any trouble.

JAP: I'll even drink that medicine Popola made, even though it's really gross.
FR: Je boirai même le remède qu'a préparé Popola, même s'il est dégoûtant.
OUPS: I'll even drink that medicine Popola made, even though it's really gross.

JAP: Just...just come back for me. Okay?
FR: Mais promets-moi que tu reviendras bientôt, d'accord ?
OUPS: Just...just come back for me. Okay?

JAP: It appears to be deserted.
FR: On dirait qu'il n'y a personne.
OUPS: It appears to be deserted.

JAP: This must be the chief's house...
FR: Ce doit être la demeure du chef...
OUPS: This must be the chief's house...

JAP: What is it!?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il ?!
OUPS: What is it!?

JAP: What's that?
FR: Qu'est-ce que c'est ?
OUPS: What's that?

JAP: Nice flowers.
FR: Jolies fleurs.
OUPS: Nice flowers.

JAP: Those are Lunar Tears, legendary flowers of almost perfect beauty.
FR: Ce sont des larmes lunaires, des fleurs légendaires d'une beauté quasi parfaite.
OUPS: Those are Lunar Tears, legendary flowers of almost perfect beauty.

JAP: That's...that's the flower I told Yonah about.
FR: C'est... c'est la fleur dont je parlais à Yonah.
OUPS: That's...that's the flower I told Yonah about.

JAP: Hey there.
FR: Ça va#?
OUPS: Hey there.

JAP: Why did you save me?
FR: Pourquoi tu m'as sauvée#?
OUPS: Why did you save me?

JAP: Because you're human.
FR: Parce que tu es humaine.
OUPS: Because you're human.

JAP: Apparently you don't see too well.
FR: Tu m'as pas regardée de près, on dirait.
OUPS: Apparently you don't see too well.

JAP: We've not the time to debate your humanity, woman!
FR: Nous n'avons pas le temps de discuter ton humanité#!
OUPS: We've not the time to debate your humanity, woman!

JAP: Look, you're half-human, I'm being followed by a talking book. Let's call it even.
FR: Tu es à moitié humaine et je suis accompagné d'un livre qui parle. Nous sommes quittes.
OUPS: Look, you're half-human, I'm being followed by a talking book. Let's call it even.

JAP: ...My name's Kainé.
FR: … Je m'appelle Kainé.
OUPS: ...My name's Kainé.

JAP: Ah! A name we heard back in the village.
FR: Ah#! Nous avons entendu ce nom au village.
OUPS: Ah! A name we heard back in the village.

JAP: Look, nothing good is gonna happen if you stick with me. Why don't you take off?
FR: écoute, tu t'attireras que des ennuis en restant avec moi. Tu ferais mieux de partir.
OUPS: Look, nothing good is gonna happen if you stick with me. Why don't you take off?

JAP: Oh, and one more thing...
FR: Oh, et j'oubliais...
OUPS: Oh, and one more thing...

JAP: I'm hunting that thing. You stay the hell away from it.
FR: Cette Ombre est ma proie. Je te défends de t'en approcher.
OUPS: I'm hunting that thing. You stay the hell away from it.

JAP: Get lost already.
FR: Fous-moi la paix.
OUPS: Get lost already.

JAP: Hmm, what next...
FR: Hum... Que devrions-nous faire#?
OUPS: Hmm, what next...

JAP: <LIST=1089>Go talk to Popola.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1089>Allons voir Popola.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1089>Go talk to Popola.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1090>Go check on Yonah.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1090>Allons voir Yonah.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1090>Go check on Yonah.</LIST>

JAP: We need some leads. Let's go talk to Popola.
FR: Nous avons besoin de plus d'informations. Allons voir Popola.
OUPS: We need some leads. Let's go talk to Popola.

JAP: I'm worried about Yonah. Let's go see how she's doing.
FR: Je me fais du souci pour Yonah. Allons la voir.
OUPS: I'm worried about Yonah. Let's go see how she's doing.

JAP: A Shade of that size? Within The Aerie?
FR: Une Ombre de cette taille#? À l'intérieur de l'Aire#?
OUPS: A Shade of that size? Within The Aerie?

JAP: Yeah. Damn near took my head off, too.
FR: Oui, et j'ai eu de la chance de m'en tirer.
OUPS: Yeah. Damn near took my head off, too.

JAP: Got a letter for you.
FR: J'ai une lettre pour toi.
OUPS: Got a letter for you.

JAP: Oh, thank you.
FR: Merci.
OUPS: Oh, thank you.

JAP: ...Oh dear.
FR: ... Oh non.
OUPS: ...Oh dear.

JAP: What's wrong?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What's wrong?

JAP: It's from the mayor of Seafront. He says that a horde of Shades have appeared in The Aerie.
FR: Le maire de Littoral croit que des Ombres pourraient avoir envahi l'Aire.
OUPS: It's from the mayor of Seafront. He says that a horde of Shades have appeared in The Aerie.

JAP: That's bad news. My weapon was damn near useless against the one we faced there.
FR: Ça ne me dit rien qui vaille. Mon arme ne m'a pas servi à grand-chose contre l'Ombre géante que nous avons combattue là-bas.
OUPS: That's bad news. My weapon was damn near useless against the one we faced there.

JAP: Perhaps there's some way to strengthen that weapon of yours?
FR: Saurais-tu comment <NIER> pourrait améliorer son épée, Popola#?
OUPS: Perhaps there's some way to strengthen that weapon of yours?

JAP: There's a shop at the entrance to the Junk Heap that might be able to help.
FR: Il y a une armurerie à l'entrée de la montagne des robots. Le forgeron pourra sans doute te prêter main-forte.
OUPS: There's a shop at the entrance to the Junk Heap that might be able to help.

JAP: If you bring them raw materials, they can make new and powerful weapons.
FR: Si tu lui apportes les matériaux nécessaires, il forgera des armes plus puissantes.
OUPS: If you bring them raw materials, they can make new and powerful weapons.

JAP: Interesting. Guess I'll pay 'em a visit.
FR: Bien, j'irai y jeter un coup d'œil.
OUPS: Interesting. Guess I'll pay 'em a visit.

JAP: Oh, but it's not free, you know.
FR: Au fait, ses services ne sont pas gratuits.
OUPS: Oh, but it's not free, you know.

JAP: It'll cost you around 1,000 gold or so.
FR: Ça devrait te coûter environ 1000G.
OUPS: It'll cost you around 1,000 gold or so.

JAP: If you need money, try visiting the tavern.
FR: Si tu as besoin d'argent, va à la taverne.
OUPS: If you need money, try visiting the tavern.

JAP: That's usually where people go if they're looking to hire someone.
FR: C'est là que se rassemblent les gens qui désirent embaucher quelqu'un.
OUPS: That's usually where people go if they're looking to hire someone.

JAP: Thanks. I appreciate it.
FR: Merci. J'apprécie ton aide.
OUPS: Thanks. I appreciate it.

JAP: Got it.
FR: D'accord.
OUPS: Got it.

JAP: If you need money, try visiting the tavern.
FR: Si tu as besoin d'argent, va à la taverne.
OUPS: If you need money, try visiting the tavern.

JAP: That's usually where people go if they're looking to hire someone.
FR: C'est là que se rassemblent les gens qui désirent embaucher quelqu'un.
OUPS: That's usually where people go if they're looking to hire someone.

JAP: Thanks. I appreciate it.
FR: Merci. J'apprécie ton aide.
OUPS: Thanks. I appreciate it.

JAP: Thanks.
FR: Merci.
OUPS: Thanks.

JAP: I know I'm really sick, but I'm trying to hang in there.
FR: Je sais que je suis gravement malade, mais je tiens bon.
OUPS: I know I'm really sick, but I'm trying to hang in there.

JAP: I know how hard you're trying, so I'm trying my hardest too.
FR: Tu travailles dur pour moi, alors j'essaie de faire de mon mieux.
OUPS: I know how hard you're trying, so I'm trying my hardest too.

JAP: You're very brave, Yonah.
FR: Tu es très courageuse, Yonah.
OUPS: You're very brave, Yonah.

JAP: But that means you can't get hurt either!
FR: Promets-moi qu'il ne t'arrivera rien#!
OUPS: But that means you can't get hurt either!

JAP: Just...just be careful, okay?
FR: Sois... sois prudent, d'accord#?
OUPS: Just...just be careful, okay?

JAP: I'm always careful.
FR: Je le suis toujours.
OUPS: I'm always careful.

JAP: Jakob! I'm huuungry!
FR: Jakob ! J'ai faaaaaim !
OUPS: Jakob! I'm huuungry!

JAP: Jakob! I'm huuungry!
FR: Jakob ! J'ai faaaaaim !
OUPS: Jakob! I'm huuungry!

JAP: I know, hold on. Maybe we have some old bread here...
FR: Je sais, attends un peu. On a peut-être un vieux quignon de pain quelque part…
OUPS: I know, hold on. Maybe we have some old bread here...

JAP: Hey.
FR: Salut.
OUPS: Hey.

JAP: Oh! Welcome! Please, come in!
FR: Oh ! Bienvenue ! Je vous en prie, entrez !
OUPS: Oh! Welcome! Please, come in!

JAP: I heard you're the guys to talk to if I want my weapon strengthened?
FR: J'ai entendu dire que tu pouvais améliorer mon arme...
OUPS: I heard you're the guys to talk to if I want my weapon strengthened?

JAP: You bet! I'm the finest smith in these parts! ...Er, usually.
FR: C'est exact#! Je suis le meilleur forgeron de la région#! ...#Euh, d'habitude.
OUPS: You bet! I'm the finest smith in these parts! ...Er, usually.

JAP: See, my brother and I build items from scrap we find in the Junk Heap, but we're a little low on supplies at the moment.
FR: Nous modifions, mon frère et moi, des armes à l'aide de la ferraille que nous trouvons dans la montagne des robots.<PAGE>Malheureusement, nous sommes actuellement à court de matériaux.
OUPS: See, my brother and I build items from scrap we find in the Junk Heap, but we're a little low on supplies at the moment.

JAP: The Junk Heap?
FR: La montagne des robots#?
OUPS: The Junk Heap?

JAP: Well, that's just what we call it.
FR: C'est le nom que nous lui avons donné.
OUPS: Well, that's just what we call it.

JAP: Folks say it used to be a military base. I don't know about that, but there's lots of
FR: Certains disent que c'était une base militaire. Je ne sais pas si c'est vrai,
OUPS: Folks say it used to be a military base. I don't know about that, but there's lots of

JAP: great stuff in there.
FR: mais on peut y trouver toutes sortes de matériaux intéressants.
OUPS: great stuff in there.

JAP: It's not exactly the safest place in the world, but we gotta eat, you know?
FR: Ce n'est pas l'endroit le plus sûr qui soit, mais il faut bien gagner son pain.
OUPS: It's not exactly the safest place in the world, but we gotta eat, you know?

JAP: Where are your parents?
FR: Où sont vos parents#?
OUPS: Where are your parents?

JAP: Our father died when Gideon was very young. And Mom is...
FR: Notre père est mort quand Gidéon était petit. Et maman...
OUPS: Our father died when Gideon was very young. And Mom is...

JAP: She's out right now. Getting supplies. But I'm sure she'll be—
FR: Elle est partie ravitailler le magasin. Je suis certain qu'elle sera bientôt...
OUPS: She's out right now. Getting supplies. But I'm sure she'll be—

JAP: Mom's been gone for seven days! When's she comin' back!?
FR: Ça fait sept jours que maman est partie#! Quand est-ce qu'elle va revenir#?!
OUPS: Mom's been gone for seven days! When's she comin' back!?

JAP: That's a long time.
FR: C'est une longue absence.
OUPS: That's a long time.

JAP: It's getting harder to find good scrap. She probably had to go deep into the Heap.
FR: C'est de plus en plus difficile de trouver de la ferraille qui en vaut la peine.
OUPS: It's getting harder to find good scrap. She probably had to go deep into the Heap.

JAP: I'm so huuuungry!!!
FR: Elle a probablement dû s'aventurer loin dans la montagne.
OUPS: I'm so huuuungry!!!

JAP: So as long as we bring you the materials, you can forge our weapons?
FR: J'ai faaaaaim#!!
OUPS: So as long as we bring you the materials, you can forge our weapons?

JAP: Yeah. Normally I'd go myself, but it's really dangerous in there right now and so...
FR: Alors, si je t'apporte les matériaux nécessaires, tu pourras améliorer mes armes#?
OUPS: Yeah. Normally I'd go myself, but it's really dangerous in there right now and so...

JAP: No problem. We'll do it.
FR: Oui. En temps normal, j'irais les chercher moi-même, mais il est vraiment dangereux de s'aventurer dans la montagne ces derniers temps...
OUPS: No problem. We'll do it.

JAP: You...you will?
FR: Ne t'en fais pas. Je m'en occuperai.
OUPS: You...you will?

JAP: I need a new weapon.
FR: Vrai-vraiment#?
OUPS: I need a new weapon.

JAP: And besides, you need inventory for your shop. ...Right?
FR: J'ai besoin d'une arme plus puissante. Et de toute façon, tu veux te réapprovisionner, non#?
OUPS: And besides, you need inventory for your shop. ...Right?

JAP: Well, yes, but...
FR: Euh, oui, mais...
OUPS: Well, yes, but...

JAP: It's settled, then. What do you need?
FR: Alors, c'est décidé. De quoi as-tu besoin#?
OUPS: It's settled, then. What do you need?

JAP: Well, to improve your weapon, I'll need three titanium alloys.
FR: Eh bien, pour améliorer votre arme, il me faudrait trois morceaux d'alliage de titane.
OUPS: Well, to improve your weapon, I'll need three titanium alloys.

JAP: You can get them from the defense robots around the mountain.
FR: Vous pourrez en obtenir en éliminant des robots qui protègent la montagne.
OUPS: You can get them from the defense robots around the mountain.

JAP: Got it.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: Got it.

JAP: Here's a map of the complex. You're probably going to need it.
FR: Tenez, c'est le plan de la montagne. Vous en aurez probablement besoin.
OUPS: Here's a map of the complex. You're probably going to need it.

JAP: Well, to improve your weapon, I'll need three titanium alloys.
FR: Eh bien, pour améliorer votre arme, il me faudrait trois morceaux d'alliage de titane.
OUPS: Well, to improve your weapon, I'll need three titanium alloys.

JAP: You can get them from the defense robots around the mountain.
FR: Vous pourrez en obtenir en éliminant des robots qui protègent la montagne.
OUPS: You can get them from the defense robots around the mountain.

JAP: Got it.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: Got it.

JAP: And be careful, please! It's gotten really scary in there.
FR: Et s'il vous plaît, soyez prudent#! C'est un endroit dangereux#!
OUPS: And be careful, please! It's gotten really scary in there.

JAP: I'll need to get three titanium alloys from you.
FR: Il me faudra trois morceaux d'alliage de titane.
OUPS: I'll need to get three titanium alloys from you.

JAP: Is Mom back yet? Is she?
FR: Alors, est-ce que maman est revenue#?
OUPS: Is Mom back yet? Is she?

JAP: It appears to be shut off.
FR: On dirait qu'il ne fonctionne pas.
OUPS: It appears to be shut off.

JAP: Waaaah! I'm lonely! I wanna go find Moooooom!
FR: Ouiiiin#! Je m'ennuie#! Je veux aller trouver maman#!
OUPS: Waaaah! I'm lonely! I wanna go find Moooooom!

JAP: Hello again!
FR: Oh, bonjour#!
OUPS: Hello again!

JAP: We got your materials.
FR: J'ai les matériaux dont tu avais besoin.
OUPS: We got your materials.

JAP: Ah, thank you very much! I'll level your weapon up right away.
FR: Ah, merci beaucoup#! Je vais améliorer votre arme dès maintenant.
OUPS: Ah, thank you very much! I'll level your weapon up right away.

JAP: Normally I'd charge for this, but you can have this one for free.
FR: Habituellement, vous devriez payer, mais cette fois, c'est gratuit#!
OUPS: Normally I'd charge for this, but you can have this one for free.

JAP: Here you go!
FR: Voilà#!
OUPS: Here you go!

JAP: And thanks again! This ought to keep us going for a while longer.
FR: Merci encore#! Grâce à vous, nous pourrons nous débrouiller pendant quelque temps.
OUPS: And thanks again! This ought to keep us going for a while longer.

JAP: MOOOOOOOM! WAAAAAAAAAAH!
FR: Mamaaaaaaaaaaaan#! Ouiiiiiiiiiiiin#!
OUPS: MOOOOOOOM! WAAAAAAAAAAH!

JAP: What's wrong now?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il maintenant#?
OUPS: What's wrong now?

JAP: I'm sorry. He's just impatient, and he thinks we should go look for Mom.
FR: Je suis désolé. Il est impatient. Il pense que nous devrions aller chercher maman.
OUPS: I'm sorry. He's just impatient, and he thinks we should go look for Mom.

JAP: We just need to wait, okay? She'll be back soon.
FR: Nous n'avons qu'à l'attendre, d'accord ? Elle rentrera bientôt.
OUPS: We just need to wait, okay? She'll be back soon.

JAP: MOOOOOOOM! WAAAAAAAAAAH!
FR: Mamaaaaaaaaaaaan#! Ouiiiiiiiiiiiin#!
OUPS: MOOOOOOOM! WAAAAAAAAAAH!

JAP: Weiss...
FR: Weiss...
OUPS: Weiss...

JAP: Yes, yes, I know. We're off to search for the misplaced mother, aren't we?
FR: Oui, oui, j'ai compris. Nous irons à la recherche de la pauvre mère en errance, c'est ça#?
OUPS: Yes, yes, I know. We're off to search for the misplaced mother, aren't we?

JAP: Please, no! I already owe you far more than I can ever repay!
FR: Oh, non#! Je vous en prie#! Je vous dois déjà beaucoup plus que je ne pourrais jamais vous rendre#!
OUPS: Please, no! I already owe you far more than I can ever repay!

JAP: Save it. I don't care.
FR: Ne t'inquiète pas pour ça.
OUPS: Save it. I don't care.

JAP: You don't understand! Our mother is...
FR: Vous ne comprenez pas#! Maman est...
OUPS: You don't understand! Our mother is...

JAP: ...Yes?
OUPS: ...Yes?

JAP: ...Never mind.
FR: ... Non, rien.
OUPS: ...Never mind.

JAP: Mom usually went pretty deep inside the mountain.
FR: Maman s'aventure souvent loin dans la montagne.
OUPS: Mom usually went pretty deep inside the mountain.

JAP: I think she used the elevator a lot, so I'd better give you the activation code.
FR: Elle prend tout le temps l'ascenseur, alors je devrais vous en donner le code d'accès.
OUPS: I think she used the elevator a lot, so I'd better give you the activation code.

JAP: Mom usually took the elevator down. The robots in the lower levels are pretty strong, so be careful.
FR: Maman prend habituellement l'ascenseur. Les robots des niveaux inférieurs sont plus dangereux, alors faites attention.
OUPS: Mom usually took the elevator down. The robots in the lower levels are pretty strong, so be careful.

JAP: *Sniff* ...Hurry up and find Mom, 'kay?
FR: Snif#! ...#Dépêchez-vous de trouver maman, d'accord#?
OUPS: *Sniff* ...Hurry up and find Mom, 'kay?

JAP: It's a woman's body.
FR: C'est le cadavre d'une femme.
OUPS: It's a woman's body.

JAP: I fear we've discovered the delinquent mother...
FR: J'ai bien peur que nous ayons découvert la mère fugitive des garçons...
OUPS: I fear we've discovered the delinquent mother...

JAP: She's got company.
FR: Et elle n'est pas seule.
OUPS: She's got company.

JAP: It's a male.
FR: C'est un homme.
OUPS: It's a male.

JAP: Hmmm... Cosmetics, a travel bag, and money.
FR: Hum... Un nécessaire de toilette, un sac de voyage et de l'argent.
OUPS: Hmmm... Cosmetics, a travel bag, and money.

JAP: Not exactly metal-harvesting gear, is it?
FR: Ce n'est pas vraiment le matériel approprié pour se ravitailler en métal.
OUPS: Not exactly metal-harvesting gear, is it?

JAP: Disgusting! She abandoned her children to seek comfort in the arms of a swain!
FR: C'est dégoûtant#! Elle a abandonné ses enfants et trouvé refuge dans les bras de son amant#!
OUPS: Disgusting! She abandoned her children to seek comfort in the arms of a swain!

JAP: Ah, dammit. This is... Damn.
FR: Ah, bon sang...!
OUPS: Ah, dammit. This is... Damn.

JAP: So much for miracles. Though in truth, I'm sure you suspected this all along.
FR: Tu peux oublier ton miracle. Mais en fait, je suis certain que tu t'en doutais depuis le début.
OUPS: So much for miracles. Though in truth, I'm sure you suspected this all along.

JAP: What will you tell the children?
FR: Que vas-tu dire aux enfants ?
OUPS: What will you tell the children?

JAP: ...I don't know.
FR: ... Je ne sais pas.
OUPS: ...I don't know.

JAP: What's this...? A perfume bottle?
FR: Qu'est-ce que c'est...? Un flacon de parfum ?
OUPS: What's this...? A perfume bottle?

JAP: It smells of roses.
FR: Une odeur de roses...
OUPS: It smells of roses.

JAP: I guess I should bring this back to them.
FR: Je devrais le rapporter aux garçons.
OUPS: I guess I should bring this back to them.

JAP: Where's Mom?
FR: Où est maman#?
OUPS: Where's Mom?

JAP: <LIST=1126>She's in heaven now.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1126>Elle est au ciel.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1126>She's in heaven now.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1127>I couldn't find her.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1127>Je ne l'ai pas trouvée.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1127>I couldn't find her.</LIST>

JAP: She's, uh... She's in heaven now.
FR: Elle, euh... Elle est au ciel.
OUPS: She's, uh... She's in heaven now.

JAP: What?
FR: Quoi#?
OUPS: What?

JAP: Your mother's left this world.
FR: Votre mère n'est plus de ce monde.
OUPS: Your mother's left this world.

JAP: Liar!
FR: Menteur#!
OUPS: Liar!

JAP: I don't believe you!
FR: Je te crois pas#!
OUPS: I don't believe you!

JAP: I couldn't find her. I'm sorry.
FR: Je ne l'ai pas trouvée. Je suis désolé.
OUPS: I couldn't find her. I'm sorry.

JAP: Oh, no...
FR: Oh, non...
OUPS: Oh, no...

JAP: Did you look EVERYWHERE? Did you yell her name and stuff?
FR: Avez-vous cherché partout#? Avez-vous crié son nom#?
OUPS: Did you look EVERYWHERE? Did you yell her name and stuff?

JAP: ...Why didn't you try harder!?
FR: ...#Pourquoi vous avez pas fait plus d'efforts#?!
OUPS: ...Why didn't you try harder!?

JAP: Gideon! He tried his best!
FR: Gidéon#! Il a fait de son mieux#!
OUPS: Gideon! He tried his best!

JAP: Really, you don't have to scold—
FR: Ne le réprimande pas...
OUPS: Really, you don't have to scold—

JAP: How much more do I have to wait for her?
FR: Combien de temps est-ce que je dois encore l'attendre#?
OUPS: How much more do I have to wait for her?

JAP: Mooooooom!
FR: Mamaaaaaaaaaan#!
OUPS: Mooooooom!

JAP: Did she die alone?
FR: Est-elle morte seule#?
OUPS: Did she die alone?

JAP: Uh...
FR: Euh...
OUPS: Uh...

JAP: ...It's okay. I know all about it.
FR: ... Ça va, je suis au courant.
OUPS: ...It's okay. I know all about it.

JAP: Just tell me: Did she die with the one she loved?
FR: Dites-le-moi... Est-elle morte avec celui qu'elle aimait#?
OUPS: Just tell me: Did she die with the one she loved?

JAP: We found two bodies. It appears they left this life as one.
FR: Nous avons trouvé deux corps. Il semblerait qu'ils aient quitté ce monde au même moment.
OUPS: We found two bodies. It appears they left this life as one.

JAP: ...Okay. That's okay.
FR: ... D'accord. Bien.
OUPS: ...Okay. That's okay.

JAP: Come again?
FR: Pardon ?
OUPS: Come again?

JAP: Mom was always so frustrated, you know? Torn between her duty to us and her heart...
FR: Maman était tellement frustrée, vous savez ? Déchirée entre son devoir de mère et son cœur...
OUPS: Mom was always so frustrated, you know? Torn between her duty to us and her heart...

JAP: I think... I think this is best.
FR: Je crois... Je crois que c'est mieux ainsi.
OUPS: I think... I think this is best.

JAP: You forgive her?
FR: Tu lui pardonnes ?
OUPS: You forgive her?

JAP: She was my mother, but she was also human, and prone to failure. I know that.
FR: C'était ma mère, mais elle était aussi humaine et portée à faire des erreurs. Je le sais bien.
OUPS: She was my mother, but she was also human, and prone to failure. I know that.

JAP: We found this next to her.
FR: Nous avons trouvé ceci près d'elle.
OUPS: We found this next to her.

JAP: Oh... It smells like her bread.
FR: Oh... C'est l'odeur de son pain.
OUPS: Oh... It smells like her bread.

JAP: It smells like her.
FR: C'est l'odeur de maman.
OUPS: It smells like her.

JAP: Dammit... I'm not gonna cry.
FR: Non... Il ne faut pas que je pleure.
OUPS: Dammit... I'm not gonna cry.

JAP: If Gideon sees me like this... Dammit...
FR: Si Gidéon m'aperçoit... Bon sang...
OUPS: If Gideon sees me like this... Dammit...

JAP: I hope I did the right thing...
FR: J'espère que j'ai pris la bonne décision...
OUPS: I hope I did the right thing...

JAP: Thank you. Thank you for everything you've done.
FR: Merci. Merci pour tout ce que vous avez fait pour nous.
OUPS: Thank you. Thank you for everything you've done.

JAP: You did the right thing. Never doubt it.
FR: Tu as pris la bonne décision. N'en doute jamais.
OUPS: You did the right thing. Never doubt it.

JAP: Mom... I wanna see Mom...
FR: Maman... Je veux voir maman...
OUPS: Mom... I wanna see Mom...

JAP: I'll do whatever it takes to keep the two of us together.
FR: Je ferais n'importe quoi pour que nous restions ensemble.
OUPS: I'll do whatever it takes to keep the two of us together.

JAP: He doesn't speak about Mom as much these days.
FR: Mon frère ne parle plus autant de maman ces derniers temps.
OUPS: He doesn't speak about Mom as much these days.

JAP: Jakob?
FR: Jakob ?
OUPS: Jakob?

JAP: Yeah?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il ?
OUPS: Yeah?

JAP: Can you read me a story?
FR: Tu peux me lire une histoire ?
OUPS: Can you read me a story?

JAP: In a bit, okay? I've got a customer right now.
FR: Dans un moment, d'accord ? Je dois d'abord servir ce client.
OUPS: In a bit, okay? I've got a customer right now.

JAP: Yonah?
FR: Yonah#?
OUPS: Yonah?

JAP: Ngh...
FR: Oooh...
OUPS: Ngh...

JAP: Yonah!? What is it!?
FR: Yonah#?! Qu'y a-t-il#?!
OUPS: Yonah!? What is it!?

JAP: It...h-hurts.
FR: J'ai mal...
OUPS: It...h-hurts.

JAP: It's going to be all right.
FR: Oh, ma chérie...
OUPS: It's going to be all right.

JAP: I'll go get some medicine. Just hold on.
FR: Je vais aller chercher des médicaments. Ne bouge pas.
OUPS: I'll go get some medicine. Just hold on.

JAP: Brother...
FR: Papa...
OUPS: Brother...

JAP: What?
FR: Quoi#?
OUPS: What?

JAP: Don't do anything...d-dangerous.
FR: Ne prends pas... de risques.
OUPS: Don't do anything...d-dangerous.

JAP: I won't.
FR: Tu n'as pas à t'inquiéter.
OUPS: I won't.

JAP: Brother...
FR: Papa...
OUPS: Brother...

JAP: What?
FR: Quoi#?
OUPS: What?

JAP: Don't do anything...d-dangerous.
FR: Ne prends pas... de risques.
OUPS: Don't do anything...d-dangerous.

JAP: I won't.
FR: Tu n'as pas à t'inquiéter.
OUPS: I won't.

JAP: The Black Scrawl seems to be advancing at a furious rate.
FR: La nécrose runique semble s'aggraver rapidement.
OUPS: The Black Scrawl seems to be advancing at a furious rate.

JAP: She needs something to stop her pain.
FR: Je dois trouver un remède contre la douleur.
OUPS: She needs something to stop her pain.

JAP: Let's see if Popola's got any ideas.
FR: Popola saura sans doute où en trouver.
OUPS: Let's see if Popola's got any ideas.

JAP: You have any pain medicine, Popola?
FR: Sais-tu où je pourrais me procurer un remède contre la douleur, Popola#?
OUPS: You have any pain medicine, Popola?

JAP: Pain medicine?
FR: Pourquoi en as-tu besoin#?
OUPS: Pain medicine?

JAP: It's for Yonah. Her pain is... It's getting really bad.
FR: C'est pour Yonah... Elle souffre beaucoup.
OUPS: It's for Yonah. Her pain is... It's getting really bad.

JAP: That poor girl!
FR: La pauvre...!
OUPS: That poor girl!

JAP: Well... I guess we could try a shaman fish.
FR: Hum... Je suppose que tu pourrais lui donner une potion préparée à partir d'un poisson-shaman.
OUPS: Well... I guess we could try a shaman fish.

JAP: Never heard of it.
FR: Je n'en ai jamais entendu parler.
OUPS: Never heard of it.

JAP: You can catch them at Seafront. Their livers contain a chemical that's said to dull even the strongest pain.
FR: On peut en attraper en pêchant sur la plage de Littoral. Leur foie contient une enzyme qui aide à calmer même la douleur la plus intense.
OUPS: You can catch them at Seafront. Their livers contain a chemical that's said to dull even the strongest pain.

JAP: Great. ...So where's Seafront?
FR: Bien. Et où se trouve Littoral#?
OUPS: Great. ...So where's Seafront?

JAP: Out beyond the southern plains.
FR: De l'autre côté de la plaine méridionale.
OUPS: Out beyond the southern plains.

JAP: Shades have been spotted there recently, so be careful.
FR: On a aperçu des Ombres sur la plaine récemment. Sois prudent.
OUPS: Shades have been spotted there recently, so be careful.

JAP: Once you arrive at Seafront, you'll probably need to catch the fish yourself.
FR: Une fois parvenu à Littoral, tu devras probablement attraper le poisson toi-même.
OUPS: Once you arrive at Seafront, you'll probably need to catch the fish yourself.

JAP: They don't keep very well, so people often use them as soon as they're caught.
FR: Les poissons-shamans se gâtent vite, alors on les utilise dès que possible.
OUPS: They don't keep very well, so people often use them as soon as they're caught.

JAP: Argh! Shades! Go away!
FR: Aaah ! Des Ombres ! Laissez-moi tranquille !
OUPS: Argh! Shades! Go away!

JAP: You saved me...
FR: Tu m'as sauvé la vie...
OUPS: You saved me...

JAP: Things are getting really bad here...
FR: La situation empire chaque jour...
OUPS: Things are getting really bad here...

JAP: Here you go. Make good use of it, all right?
FR: Tiens... Fais-en bon usage.
OUPS: Here you go. Make good use of it, all right?

JAP: I tell you, that old lady in the lighthouse is a royal pain!
FR: Cette vieille femme qui vit dans le phare est enquiquinante#!
OUPS: I tell you, that old lady in the lighthouse is a royal pain!

JAP: I think her bad attitude is all that keeps her alive!
FR: Je crois que c'est son comportement hostile qui la garde en vie#!
OUPS: I think her bad attitude is all that keeps her alive!

JAP: That "illness" she has seems awfully suspicious!
FR: La «#maladie#» dont elle souffre me semble terriblement suspecte#!
OUPS: That "illness" she has seems awfully suspicious!

JAP: I think she's just a big faker! There! I said it! Now what!?
FR: Je suis certaine qu'elle l'a inventée#! Voilà#! Je l'ai dit tout haut#!
OUPS: I think she's just a big faker! There! I said it! Now what!?

JAP: That old woman in the lighthouse has her own troubles... Ah, never mind.
FR: La vieille femme du phare a ses soucis, elle aussi... Ah, oubliez ça.
OUPS: That old woman in the lighthouse has her own troubles... Ah, never mind.

JAP: Whew... I'm...so tired...
FR: Ouf... Je suis... épuisée...
OUPS: Whew... I'm...so tired...

JAP: A shaman fish? I... Yeah, I dunno. I've never seen one of those for sale before.
FR: Un poisson-shaman#? Je... Hum... Je ne sais pas trop... Les magasins n'en vendent pas.
OUPS: A shaman fish? I... Yeah, I dunno. I've never seen one of those for sale before.

JAP: It may be useful as a remedy, but it tastes terrible!
FR: Même s'il est utile pour préparer des médicaments, le poisson-shaman a très mauvais goût.
OUPS: It may be useful as a remedy, but it tastes terrible!

JAP: Shaman fish? Try asking the old man up by the quay. If anyone knows, it'd be him.
FR: Un poisson-shaman#? Vous devriez vous adresser au vieil homme près du quai. Si quelqu'un peut vous aider, c'est probablement lui.
OUPS: Shaman fish? Try asking the old man up by the quay. If anyone knows, it'd be him.

JAP: I doubt we'll have much luck blundering around blindly for a shaman fish.
FR: Je doute que tu puisses trouver un poisson-shaman tout seul.
OUPS: I doubt we'll have much luck blundering around blindly for a shaman fish.

JAP: You got a better idea?
FR: Aurais-tu une meilleure idée#?
OUPS: You got a better idea?

JAP: Perhaps we could try asking some of the townspeople for advice.
FR: Tu devrais peut-être interroger les habitants de la ville.
OUPS: Perhaps we could try asking some of the townspeople for advice.

JAP: Now see, Weiss? Why didn't you just say that in the first place instead of being so surly about it?
FR: Pourquoi n'as-tu pas suggéré de le faire dès le début au lieu de maugréer#?
OUPS: Now see, Weiss? Why didn't you just say that in the first place instead of being so surly about it?

JAP: A shaman fish? I... Yeah, I dunno. I've never seen one of those for sale before.
FR: Un poisson-shaman#? Je... Hum... Je ne sais pas trop... Les magasins n'en vendent pas.
OUPS: A shaman fish? I... Yeah, I dunno. I've never seen one of those for sale before.

JAP: It may be useful as a remedy, but it tastes terrible!
FR: Même s'il est utile pour préparer des médicaments, le poisson-shaman a très mauvais goût.
OUPS: It may be useful as a remedy, but it tastes terrible!

JAP: Shaman fish? Try asking the old man up by the quay. If anyone knows, it'd be him.
FR: Un poisson-shaman#? Vous devriez vous adresser au vieil homme près du quai. Si quelqu'un peut vous aider, c'est probablement lui.
OUPS: Shaman fish? Try asking the old man up by the quay. If anyone knows, it'd be him.

JAP: This is getting us nowhere.
FR: Tout ça ne mène à rien.
OUPS: This is getting us nowhere.

JAP: You got that right.
FR: À qui le dis-tu#!
OUPS: You got that right.

JAP: Perhaps our time would be better spent tracking down an expert in the field.
FR: Nous devrions peut-être nous adresser à un maître pêcheur.
OUPS: Perhaps our time would be better spent tracking down an expert in the field.

JAP: You think there's one around here?
FR: Tu crois que nous pourrions en trouver un#?
OUPS: You think there's one around here?

JAP: Of course! This is a fishing village, is it not?
FR: Mais bien sûr#! Cette ville est un port de pêche, non#?
OUPS: Of course! This is a fishing village, is it not?

JAP: Then why didn't you suggest that when we first got here!?
FR: Alors, pourquoi n'as-tu pas suggéré de le faire quand nous sommes arrivés#?
OUPS: Then why didn't you suggest that when we first got here!?

JAP: You humans! Always asking for help rather than thinking for yourselves.<PAGE>It really is a loathsome habit.
FR: Pfft#! Les êtres humains ne savent pas se débrouiller seuls. Ils dépendent toujours de l'aide d'autrui.<PAGE>C'est une très mauvaise habitude.
OUPS: You humans! Always asking for help rather than thinking for yourselves.<PAGE>It really is a loathsome habit.

JAP: Oh ho! There's the man we want!
FR: Ah, l'homme que nous cherchons est là-bas#!
OUPS: Oh ho! There's the man we want!

JAP: I still don't understand why we didn't just ask this guy first.
FR: Je ne comprends toujours pas pourquoi nous ne lui avons pas demandé son aide dès notre arrivée.
OUPS: I still don't understand why we didn't just ask this guy first.

JAP: Because. Now, off with us.
FR: Parce que. Allons-y.
OUPS: Because. Now, off with us.

JAP: Oh? You wish to search by yourself?
FR: Oh#? Tu veux le trouver toi-même#?
OUPS: Oh? You wish to search by yourself?

JAP: Well, I can hardly imagine a more commendable thing.
FR: Voilà une très louable proposition.
OUPS: Well, I can hardly imagine a more commendable thing.

JAP: Perhaps I could lend you a helping hand? Err, so to speak.
FR: Je pourrais peut-être te donner un coup de main#? Euh, en quelque sorte...
OUPS: Perhaps I could lend you a helping hand? Err, so to speak.

JAP: Eh? Shaman fish? Oh, sure, sure. I could catch ya one of them without ever tryin'!
FR: Hein#? Un poisson-shaman#? Oh, bien sûr#! Je pourrais en attraper un les yeux fermés#!
OUPS: Eh? Shaman fish? Oh, sure, sure. I could catch ya one of them without ever tryin'!

JAP: But why give a feller a fish when ya can teach him?
FR: Mais pourquoi donner un poisson à quelqu'un quand on peut lui apprendre comment le pêcher lui-même#?
OUPS: But why give a feller a fish when ya can teach him?

JAP: ...Here. Take this pole and give 'er a shot.
FR: ... Tiens. Essaie toi-même avec cette canne à pêche.
OUPS: ...Here. Take this pole and give 'er a shot.

JAP: You can catch shaman fish on the beach.
FR: Tu peux attraper des poissons-shamans en pêchant sur la plage.
OUPS: You can catch shaman fish on the beach.

JAP: How do ya fish? ...Is that a serious question?
FR: Quoi#? Tu sais pas comment pêcher#?! Impossible#!
OUPS: How do ya fish? ...Is that a serious question?

JAP: You gotta move yer body away from where the fish is going. Got it?
FR: T'as qu'à bouger dans la direction opposée à celle du poisson#! Compris#?
OUPS: You gotta move yer body away from where the fish is going. Got it?

JAP: Here, lemme give ya a lure while I'm at it.
FR: Tiens, je vais même te donner une amorce.
OUPS: Here, lemme give ya a lure while I'm at it.

JAP: Fishing is a test of wills 'tween man and beast! Never give up the fight!
FR: La pêche est un test de volonté entre l'Homme et la bête#! Abandonne jamais#!
OUPS: Fishing is a test of wills 'tween man and beast! Never give up the fight!

JAP: Guess we'd better find a good fishing spot...
FR: Essayons de trouver un bon endroit pour pêcher...
OUPS: Guess we'd better find a good fishing spot...

JAP: You can catch shaman fish on the beach. Good luck.
FR: Tu peux attraper des poissons-shamans en pêchant sur la plage. Bonne chance.
OUPS: You can catch shaman fish on the beach. Good luck.

JAP: Hold it!
FR: Attendez !
OUPS: Hold it!

JAP: Huh?
FR: Hein ?
OUPS: Huh?

JAP: I said, hold it! Over here!
FR: J'ai dit, attendez ! Par ici !
OUPS: I said, hold it! Over here!

JAP: How can you just ignore an old woman in need!? Oh, I weep for this generation!
FR: Comment pouvez-vous ignorer une vieille femme dans le besoin ?! Oh, comme je déplore la nouvelle génération !
OUPS: How can you just ignore an old woman in need!? Oh, I weep for this generation!

JAP: The children of this age are nothing but selfish, heartless cads!
FR: Les enfants de nos jours ne sont que d'égoïstes goujats sans-cœur !
OUPS: The children of this age are nothing but selfish, heartless cads!

JAP: Wait, are you talking about me?
FR: Un instant, vous parlez de moi ?
OUPS: Wait, are you talking about me?

JAP: Oh, ignore her! We've a quest to complete!
FR: Oh, ignore-la ! Nous avons une quête à accomplir !
OUPS: Oh, ignore her! We've a quest to complete!

JAP: People like that are best left to their own devices.
FR: Il vaut mieux laisser les gens comme elle se débrouiller sans intervenir.
OUPS: People like that are best left to their own devices.

JAP: Oh! Ohhhhhhh! Oh, the pain!
FR: Oh ! Oooooooooooh !<PAGE>Oh, comme j'ai mal !
OUPS: Oh! Ohhhhhhh! Oh, the pain!

JAP: What's wrong?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il ?
OUPS: What's wrong?

JAP: My illness has returned! It must have been the shock of seeing this rude floating book!
FR: C'est une rechute#! Le choc d'apercevoir ce bouquin volant impoli doit en être la cause#!
OUPS: My illness has returned! It must have been the shock of seeing this rude floating book!

JAP: Rude? B-BOOK!? Now see here, madam! I'll have you know—
FR: Impoli ? Bouquin ?! Hé, oh, un instant, madame ! Sachez que...
OUPS: Rude? B-BOOK!? Now see here, madam! I'll have you know—

JAP: You! You did this! Oh, what a terrible thing you are!
FR: Toi ! C'est ta faute ! Quel terrible objet tu es !
OUPS: You! You did this! Oh, what a terrible thing you are!

JAP: Why, you insolent crone! How dare you address me like some common paperback!?
FR: Insolente vieille bique ! Comment oses-tu t'adresser à moi comme si je n'étais qu'un livre de poche ?!
OUPS: Why, you insolent crone! How dare you address me like some common paperback!?

JAP: Easy, Weiss.
FR: Ça suffit, Weiss.
OUPS: Easy, Weiss.

JAP: You there! Boy! Would you truly abandon a pitiful old woman to this cruel world?
FR: Et vous, jeune homme ! Abandonneriez-vous vraiment une vieille femme pitoyable en ce monde cruel ?
OUPS: You there! Boy! Would you truly abandon a pitiful old woman to this cruel world?

JAP: Are you asking me? Oh, do please ask me...
FR: Tu me le demandes ? Oh, dis que c'est à moi que tu le demandes...!
OUPS: Are you asking me? Oh, do please ask me...
