JAP: Accept the old woman's request?
FR: Voulez-vous accéder à la demande de la vieille femme#?
OUPS: Accept the old woman's request?

JAP: <LIST>Yes</LIST>
FR: <LIST>Oui</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST>Yes</LIST>

JAP: <LIST>No</LIST>
FR: <LIST>Non</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST>No</LIST>

JAP: Accept the old woman's request?
FR: Voulez-vous accéder à la demande de la vieille femme#?
OUPS: Accept the old woman's request?

JAP: <LIST=1174>Yes</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1174>Oui</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1174>Yes</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1175>No</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1175>Non</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1175>No</LIST>

JAP: Accept the old woman's request?
FR: Voulez-vous accéder à la demande de la vieille femme#?
OUPS: Accept the old woman's request?

JAP: <LIST=1174>Yes</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1174>Oui</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1174>Yes</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1175>No</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1175>Non</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1175>No</LIST>

JAP: Good heavens, I can't believe how much cajoling that took!
FR: Par le ciel, je n'arrive pas à croire tout l'effort que j'ai dû y mettre !
OUPS: Good heavens, I can't believe how much cajoling that took!

JAP: You're welcome?
FR: Euh, de rien ?
OUPS: You're welcome?

JAP: I am at a loss as to what aid we could possibly give a woman who is so clearly able to
FR: J'ai peine à imaginer quelle sorte d'aide nous pourrions apporter à une femme qui
OUPS: I am at a loss as to what aid we could possibly give a woman who is so clearly able to

JAP: talk her way into anything.
FR: sait manifestement convaincre quiconque de lui donner ce qu'elle désire.
OUPS: talk her way into anything.

JAP: I need you to go to the post office and tell them to deliver my mail!
FR: Je veux que vous alliez au bureau de poste pour demander qu'on m'apporte mon courrier#!
OUPS: I need you to go to the post office and tell them to deliver my mail!

JAP: I can't fathom why they haven't been here yet...
FR: Je ne comprends pas pourquoi on ne te l'a toujours pas apporté...!
OUPS: I can't fathom why they haven't been here yet...

JAP: Ohhh! Ohhhhhhhh, the pain!
FR: Oooh ! Oooooooh, quelle douleur !
OUPS: Ohhh! Ohhhhhhhh, the pain!

JAP: Enough! We'll go to the post office! Just...stop saying things.
FR: Assez ! Nous irons au bureau de poste ! Arrêtez de vous lamenter.
OUPS: Enough! We'll go to the post office! Just...stop saying things.

JAP: Well? What are you waiting for, a gilded invitation? Get going!
FR: Eh bien ! Qu'attendez-vous ? Une invitation formelle ? Ouste !
OUPS: Well? What are you waiting for, a gilded invitation? Get going!

JAP: The children of this age are nothing but selfish, heartless cads!
FR: Les enfants de nos jours ne sont que d'égoïstes goujats sans-cœur !
OUPS: The children of this age are nothing but selfish, heartless cads!

JAP: You there! Boy! Would you truly abandon a pitiful old woman to this cruel world?
FR: Et vous, jeune homme ! Abandonneriez-vous vraiment une vieille femme pitoyable en ce monde cruel ?
OUPS: You there! Boy! Would you truly abandon a pitiful old woman to this cruel world?

JAP: Are you asking me? Oh, do please ask me...
FR: Tu me le demandes ? Oh, dis que c'est à moi que tu le demandes...!
OUPS: Are you asking me? Oh, do please ask me...

JAP: Afternoon!
FR: Bonjour.
OUPS: Afternoon!

JAP: There's an old lady at the coast who wants her mail. ...Badly.
FR: Une vieille femme qui vit près de la côte voudrait vraiment avoir son courrier.
OUPS: There's an old lady at the coast who wants her mail. ...Badly.

JAP: Oh, you mean the lighthouse lady?
FR: Oh, vous voulez dire la vieille femme du phare#?
OUPS: Oh, you mean the lighthouse lady?

JAP: The very same. Now, could you please deliver her parcels and silence her flapping gums!?
FR: C'est bien elle. Auriez-vous l'amabilité de lui apporter son courrier et mettre fin à ses jérémiades#?!
OUPS: The very same. Now, could you please deliver her parcels and silence her flapping gums!?

JAP: Sorry, but I just hurt my leg. I won't be delivering anything for a while.
FR: Je regrette, mais je me suis fait mal à la jambe, alors je ne pourrai pas distribuer le courrier pendant quelque temps.
OUPS: Sorry, but I just hurt my leg. I won't be delivering anything for a while.

JAP: She won't like that at all.
FR: Ça ne lui plaira pas du tout.
OUPS: She won't like that at all.

JAP: What about your sacred postman's oath? "Neither wind, nor sleet, nor terrible monsters of the night shall keep thee from—"
FR: Qu'en est-il de votre serment sacré de postier#? N'êtes-vous pas censé distribuer le courrier en toutes circonstances, quoi qu'il arrive#?
OUPS: What about your sacred postman's oath? "Neither wind, nor sleet, nor terrible monsters of the night shall keep thee from—"

JAP: Fine. I'll do it. Give me the mail.
FR: Très bien, je vais le faire moi-même. Donnez-moi le courrier.
OUPS: Fine. I'll do it. Give me the mail.

JAP: But...but the oath! This slackjawed layabout has a duty to the town!
FR: Mais... et le serment#?! Ce paresseux a un devoir à remplir envers cette ville#!
OUPS: But...but the oath! This slackjawed layabout has a duty to the town!

JAP: Oh, that's a huge help, thank you. Just uh...be careful, all right?
FR: Cela me rendrait vraiment service#! Je vous remercie.
OUPS: Oh, that's a huge help, thank you. Just uh...be careful, all right?

JAP: That lady has a bit of a temper...
FR: Soyez... euh, prudent, d'accord#? Cette vieille femme a un sacré caractère...
OUPS: That lady has a bit of a temper...

JAP: You don't say?
FR: Oh vraiment#?
OUPS: You don't say?

JAP: Um...
FR: Euh...
OUPS: Um...

JAP: You know, since...
FR: Je me demandais si...
OUPS: You know, since...

JAP: Oh, what is it now!?
FR: Oh, et quoi encore ?
OUPS: Oh, what is it now!?

JAP: Are you from Popola's village?
FR: Habitez-vous le même village que Popola#?
OUPS: Are you from Popola's village?

JAP: How'd you know that?
FR: Oui, comment l'avez-vous deviné#?
OUPS: How'd you know that?

JAP: You're dressed differently than most folks.
FR: Vous êtes habillé différemment.
OUPS: You're dressed differently than most folks.

JAP: Anyway, would you mind taking this letter back to Popola when you return?
FR: Pourriez-vous lui apporter cette lettre#?
OUPS: Anyway, would you mind taking this letter back to Popola when you return?

JAP: Sure. Why not?
FR: Bien sûr. Pourquoi pas#?
OUPS: Sure. Why not?

JAP: Bah! We might as well take the postman's oath ourselves!
FR: Pfft#! Tu devrais devenir postier pendant que tu y es#!
OUPS: Bah! We might as well take the postman's oath ourselves!

JAP: I don't hear the crone. ...And I'm sure I would if she were here!
FR: Je n'entends pas les cris de cette vieille mégère. Elle n'est pas dans les environs. Je suis convaincu que nous pourrions l'entendre, sinon#!
OUPS: I don't hear the crone. ...And I'm sure I would if she were here!

JAP: Folks call her the "lighthouse lady," right?
FR: Les habitants de la ville l'appellent «#la vieille femme du phare#», non#?
OUPS: Folks call her the "lighthouse lady," right?

JAP: Well, let's go check the lighthouse.
FR: Eh bien, allons jeter un coup d'œil au phare.
OUPS: Well, let's go check the lighthouse.

JAP: What an absurd waste of time this is.
FR: Quelle prodigieuse perte de temps#!
OUPS: What an absurd waste of time this is.

JAP: Thanks again for helping me.
FR: Merci encore pour votre aide.
OUPS: Thanks again for helping me.

JAP: Comin' in!
FR: Bonjour.
OUPS: Comin' in!

JAP: ...Oh. You.
FR: ... Oh. C'est vous.
OUPS: ...Oh. You.

JAP: What do you want?
FR: Que me voulez-vous#?
OUPS: What do you want?

JAP: We have retrieved your letter.
FR: Nous t'avons apporté ton courrier.
OUPS: We have retrieved your letter.

JAP: The postman hurt his leg. That's why he—
FR: Le postier s'est fait mal à la jambe. C'est pour cette raison que...
OUPS: The postman hurt his leg. That's why he—

JAP: That's no excuse! It's his job to deliver the mail, no matter what! Didn't he take the postman's oath!?
FR: Ce n'est pas une bonne excuse#! C'est son travail#! Il doit distribuer le courrier quoi qu'il arrive#! N'a-t-il pas prononcé le serment des postiers#?!
OUPS: That's no excuse! It's his job to deliver the mail, no matter what! Didn't he take the postman's oath!?

JAP: The thought that anyone would actually bother to write you a letter staggers the imagination.
FR: Il est atterrant d'imaginer que quelqu'un pourrait se donner la peine de t'écrire une lettre.
OUPS: The thought that anyone would actually bother to write you a letter staggers the imagination.

JAP: Such a rude book! ...I'll have you know, this is from someone very dear to me.
FR: Quel bouquin impertinent#!... Puisque tu veux le savoir, c'est une lettre d'un être cher.
OUPS: Such a rude book! ...I'll have you know, this is from someone very dear to me.

JAP: Well, I suppose I should give you something for your trouble.
FR: Eh bien, je suppose que je devrais vous donner quelque chose en retour.
OUPS: Well, I suppose I should give you something for your trouble.

JAP: Let's deliver that letter to Popola.
FR: Apportons la lettre à Popola.
OUPS: Let's deliver that letter to Popola.

JAP: We need to get the shaman fish to Yonah.
FR: Nous devons apporter le poisson-shaman à Yonah.
OUPS: We need to get the shaman fish to Yonah.

JAP: The thought that anyone would actually bother to write you a letter staggers the imagination.
FR: Il est atterrant d'imaginer que quelqu'un pourrait se donner la peine de t'écrire une lettre.
OUPS: The thought that anyone would actually bother to write you a letter staggers the imagination.

JAP: Such a rude book! ...I'll have you know, this is from someone very dear to me.
FR: Quel bouquin impertinent#!<PAGE>... Puisque tu veux le savoir, c'est une lettre d'un être cher.
OUPS: Such a rude book! ...I'll have you know, this is from someone very dear to me.

JAP: B-Brother... Everything hurts...
FR: Papa... J'ai mal...
OUPS: B-Brother... Everything hurts...

JAP: It's all right. I'm going to make some medicine for you.
FR: Ne t'en fais pas, je vais te préparer un remède.
OUPS: It's all right. I'm going to make some medicine for you.

JAP: It won't taste very good, but I need you to take it anyway.
FR: Je te préviens, il goûte mauvais, mais tu dois le boire jusqu'à la dernière goutte.
OUPS: It won't taste very good, but I need you to take it anyway.

JAP: Okay... I'll take it.
FR: D'accord...
OUPS: Okay... I'll take it.

JAP: Good girl.
FR: Bien.
OUPS: Good girl.

JAP: Hi, Brother!
FR: Bonjour, papa#!
OUPS: Hi, Brother!

JAP: How are you feeling?
FR: Comment te sens-tu#?
OUPS: How are you feeling?

JAP: Great! The pain is totally gone!
FR: En pleine forme#! La douleur a complètement disparu#!
OUPS: Great! The pain is totally gone!

JAP: That's fantastic, Yonah!
FR: C'est formidable, Yonah#!
OUPS: That's fantastic, Yonah!

JAP: That's really fantastic.
FR: C'est vraiment formidable.
OUPS: That's really fantastic.

JAP: Hey, Brother?
FR: Dis, papa...
OUPS: Hey, Brother?

JAP: Yeah?
FR: Quoi#?
OUPS: Yeah?

JAP: Remember that old lady in Seafront that you told me about?
FR: Tu te souviens de cette vieille femme de Littoral dont tu m'as parlé#?
OUPS: Remember that old lady in Seafront that you told me about?

JAP: Do you think there's anything I could do for her?
FR: Tu crois que je pourrais l'aider#?
OUPS: Do you think there's anything I could do for her?

JAP: I bet she's in a lot of pain.
FR: Je parie qu'elle souffre beaucoup.
OUPS: I bet she's in a lot of pain.

JAP: Yonah, never mind her. You need to worry about making yourself better.
FR: Ne t'inquiète pas pour elle, Yonah. Tu dois d'abord te rétablir.
OUPS: Yonah, never mind her. You need to worry about making yourself better.

JAP: ...I'm sorry.
OUPS: ...I'm sorry.

JAP: Fine. I'll go check on her.
FR: Bon, d'accord, j'irai lui rendre visite.
OUPS: Fine. I'll go check on her.

JAP: Really!?
FR: Vraiment#?!
OUPS: Really!?

JAP: That's an awful lot better than having you run off on me again...
FR: Je ne voudrais pas que tu t'enfuies encore une fois...
OUPS: That's an awful lot better than having you run off on me again...

JAP: Hee hee! Thanks, Brother! You're the best!
FR: Hi, hi, hi#! Merci#! Tu es le meilleur papa au monde#!
OUPS: Hee hee! Thanks, Brother! You're the best!

JAP: All the nightmares in all the worlds could not prepare me for the horror of conversing with that woman again.
FR: Mêmes les pires cauchemars imaginables ne sauraient me préparer à devoir endurer de nouveau cette vieille chipie#!
OUPS: All the nightmares in all the worlds could not prepare me for the horror of conversing with that woman again.

JAP: I need to go talk to Popola. Stay here and get some rest, all right?
FR: Je dois aller voir Popola. Reste ici et repose-toi bien, d'accord#?
OUPS: I need to go talk to Popola. Stay here and get some rest, all right?

JAP: All right!
FR: D'accord#!
OUPS: All right!

JAP: I'm worried about The Aerie. Could you swing up there and check on it for me?
FR: Je m'inquiète au sujet de l'Aire. Pourrais-tu aller y jeter un coup d'œil#?
OUPS: I'm worried about The Aerie. Could you swing up there and check on it for me?

JAP: Got a letter for you.
FR: J'ai une lettre pour toi.
OUPS: Got a letter for you.

JAP: Oh, thank you.
FR: Merci.
OUPS: Oh, thank you.

JAP: ...Oh dear.
FR: ... Oh non.
OUPS: ...Oh dear.

JAP: What's wrong?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What's wrong?

JAP: It's from the mayor of Seafront. He says that a horde of Shades have appeared in The Aerie.
FR: Le maire de Littoral croit que des Ombres pourraient avoir envahi l'Aire.
OUPS: It's from the mayor of Seafront. He says that a horde of Shades have appeared in The Aerie.

JAP: I'd rather leap into a fire than revisit that unsociable hellhole!
FR: Je préférerais me jeter dans un feu que de retourner dans ce village de sauvages#!
OUPS: I'd rather leap into a fire than revisit that unsociable hellhole!

JAP: But there's still so many people there...
FR: Mais ses habitants ont probablement besoin d'aide...! Pourrais-tu aller y jeter un coup d'œil, <NIER>#?
OUPS: But there's still so many people there...

JAP: You got it. I'll leave right away.
FR: Entendu. Je partirai immédiatement.
OUPS: You got it. I'll leave right away.

JAP: Black Scrawl got your kid, huh?
FR: Ta fille a la nécrose runique, c'est ça#?
OUPS: Black Scrawl got your kid, huh?

JAP: Yeah. And we need the Sealed Verses to cure her.
FR: Oui, et nous devons trouver les vers scellés pour la guérir.
OUPS: Yeah. And we need the Sealed Verses to cure her.

JAP: Gotcha.
FR: Compris.
OUPS: Gotcha.

JAP: What is it?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What is it?

JAP: Well, I'm not sure if this will help, but I know a guy who has the same disease.
FR: Je sais pas si ça peut t'aider, mais je connais quelqu'un d'autre qui a la nécrose runique.
OUPS: Well, I'm not sure if this will help, but I know a guy who has the same disease.

JAP: He's a king, actually, and his kingdom has been working on a cure for a while.
FR: À vrai dire, c'est un roi. Tous les apothicaires de son royaume essaient de trouver un moyen de le guérir.
OUPS: He's a king, actually, and his kingdom has been working on a cure for a while.

JAP: I guess it's possible they have something.
FR: Ils pourraient en savoir plus.
OUPS: I guess it's possible they have something.

JAP: Do you truly think they have discovered a cure?
FR: Crois-tu vraiment qu'ils ont trouvé un remède#?
OUPS: Do you truly think they have discovered a cure?

JAP: I said it's possible. I didn't say it happened.
FR: C'est possible. J'en suis pas certaine.
OUPS: I said it's possible. I didn't say it happened.

JAP: The place is called Facade. It's deep within the desert.
FR: Le roi gouverne la ville de Façade, dans le désert.
OUPS: The place is called Facade. It's deep within the desert.

JAP: Any chance is better than no chance at all. I say we try it.
FR: Si nous avons la moindre chance de guérir Yonah, cela en vaut la peine. Allons-y#!
OUPS: Any chance is better than no chance at all. I say we try it.

JAP: If this proves successful, it would certainly make our task a good deal easier.
FR: Si leurs recherches ont été fructueuses, notre tâche n'en sera que plus facile.
OUPS: If this proves successful, it would certainly make our task a good deal easier.

JAP: Hey.
FR: Dis.
OUPS: Hey.

JAP: Mm? What is it?
FR: Oui, qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: Mm? What is it?

JAP: I'll wait outside.
FR: Je t'attendrai à l'extérieur.
OUPS: I'll wait outside.

JAP: That's crazy. It's dangerous out here.
FR: Aurais-tu perdu la tête#? C'est dangereux !
OUPS: That's crazy. It's dangerous out here.

JAP: I like being alone.
FR: J'aime être seule.
OUPS: I like being alone.

JAP: Hmm...
FR: Hum...
OUPS: Hmm...

JAP: If you head out from another exit, I'll just meet you there.
FR: Si tu utilises une autre sortie, j'irai t'y rejoindre.
OUPS: If you head out from another exit, I'll just meet you there.

JAP: You sure you won't come? I was hoping to introduce you to Yonah...
FR: Tu ne veux pas voir le village#? J'aurais aimé te présenter Yonah...
OUPS: You sure you won't come? I was hoping to introduce you to Yonah...

JAP: Don't force the issue, now. Her mind is clearly made up.
FR: Ne t'acharne pas. Elle a pris sa décision.
OUPS: Don't force the issue, now. Her mind is clearly made up.

JAP: Not everyone loves the company of others as much as you, mmm?
FR: Certaines personnes n'aiment pas la compagnie d'autrui autant que toi.
OUPS: Not everyone loves the company of others as much as you, mmm?

JAP: All right. I won't push it.
FR: Entendu, je n'insisterai pas.
OUPS: All right. I won't push it.

JAP: See ya.
FR: À plus.
OUPS: See ya.

JAP: That poor girl...
FR: La pauvre...
OUPS: That poor girl...

JAP: Kainé could've led a normal life if not for those terrible Shades.
FR: Si ce n'était de ces terribles Ombres, Kainé aurait pu mener une vie normale.
OUPS: Kainé could've led a normal life if not for those terrible Shades.

JAP: If only we possessed half the courage that Kainé has shown...
FR: Si seulement nous possédions la moitié du courage dont Kainé fait preuve...
OUPS: If only we possessed half the courage that Kainé has shown...

JAP: Who are these guys?
FR: Qui sont-ils ?
OUPS: Who are these guys?

JAP: I do not know, but they appear to be preventing us from entering.
FR: Je ne sais pas, mais on dirait qu'ils veulent nous empêcher d'entrer.
OUPS: I do not know, but they appear to be preventing us from entering.

JAP: What manner of place is this?
FR: Quel est cet endroit ?
OUPS: What manner of place is this?

JAP: Looks like a graveyard...
FR: On dirait un cimetière...
OUPS: Looks like a graveyard...

JAP: The headstones seem to be lacking names.
FR: Il n'y a pas d'inscription sur les pierres tombales.
OUPS: The headstones seem to be lacking names.

JAP: Also, why do they shine as if they were carved from the rock just yesterday?
FR: Hum, pourquoi reluisent-elles comme si elles venaient tout juste d'être sculptées#?
OUPS: Also, why do they shine as if they were carved from the rock just yesterday?

JAP: ...There's nothing here.
FR: ...#Il n'y a rien ici.
OUPS: ...There's nothing here.

JAP: Make haste! We shall be buried in sand if we remain here any longer.
FR: Partons. Nous pourrions être ensevelis nous aussi si nous restions plus longtemps.
OUPS: Make haste! We shall be buried in sand if we remain here any longer.

JAP: You want a filter, right? Knock yourself out. I'll wait here.
FR: Tu veux un filtre, non ? Amuse-toi bien. Je t'attends ici.
OUPS: You want a filter, right? Knock yourself out. I'll wait here.

JAP: I suppose a quick stroll about town is in order.
FR: Je suppose qu'une petite promenade à travers la ville s'impose.
OUPS: I suppose a quick stroll about town is in order.

JAP: I can't understand a thing these people are saying.
FR: Je ne comprends pas un mot de ce qu'ils disent.
OUPS: I can't understand a thing these people are saying.

JAP: They speak a language I have never before encountered.
FR: Ils parlent une langue que je n'ai jamais entendue.
OUPS: They speak a language I have never before encountered.

JAP: Maybe I should have studied languages when I was a kid...
FR: J'aurais peut-être dû apprendre d'autres langues quand j'étais petit… Tu pourrais parler mille langues différentes,
OUPS: Maybe I should have studied languages when I was a kid...

JAP: You could speak a thousand tongues and still fail if you lack knowledge of another's culture.
FR: mais toujours échouer si tu ne possèdes pas les connaissances nécessaires pour comprendre la culture d'un autre peuple.
OUPS: You could speak a thousand tongues and still fail if you lack knowledge of another's culture.

JAP: The king lives in the big building. Figure out the rest for yourself.
FR: Le roi habite le grand bâtiment, là-bas. Pour ce qui est du reste, vous devrez vous débrouiller.
OUPS: The king lives in the big building. Figure out the rest for yourself.

JAP: What about you?
FR: Tu ne viens pas avec nous ?
OUPS: What about you?

JAP: I'll stay here. I hate crap like this.
FR: Je vous attendrai ici. Je déteste ce genre de truc.
OUPS: I'll stay here. I hate crap like this.

JAP: I don't know whether to thank you or wish you ill.
FR: Je ne sais pas si je devrais te remercier ou te maudire.
OUPS: I don't know whether to thank you or wish you ill.

JAP: I suppose a quick stroll about town is in order.
FR: Je suppose qu'une petite promenade à travers la ville s'impose.
OUPS: I suppose a quick stroll about town is in order.

JAP: The language they use here is pretty crazy.
FR: Leur langue est plutôt bizarre.
OUPS: The language they use here is pretty crazy.

JAP: So good luck with that.
FR: Bon courage.
OUPS: So good luck with that.

JAP: I'd wager that huge structure is the king's manor.
FR: Je parie que cet édifice là-bas est le palais.
OUPS: I'd wager that huge structure is the king's manor.

JAP: How do we even get there?
FR: Comment allons-nous y accéder ?
OUPS: How do we even get there?

JAP: With willpower and smarts, my good man!
FR: Avec un peu d'astuce et de volonté !
OUPS: With willpower and smarts, my good man!

JAP: No entry, it would seem...
FR: Il semblerait que nous ne pouvons pas entrer...
OUPS: No entry, it would seem...

JAP: I sure wish I understood this language of theirs.
FR: Si seulement je pouvais comprendre leur langue...!
OUPS: I sure wish I understood this language of theirs.

JAP: This is pointless. Let us go back.
FR: Tout cela ne mène à rien. Rentrons.
OUPS: This is pointless. Let us go back.

JAP: Come on, Weiss. Help me out here.
FR: Allez, Weiss. Aide-moi un peu.
OUPS: Come on, Weiss. Help me out here.

JAP: I am a brilliant book of unspeakable value, not some dog-eared travel guide!
FR: Je suis un livre formidable d'une valeur inestimable, pas un guide touristique !
OUPS: I am a brilliant book of unspeakable value, not some dog-eared travel guide!

JAP: Oh! And what happened to helping others, mmm?
FR: On ne veut plus aider les gens dans le besoin, c'est ça#?
OUPS: Oh! And what happened to helping others, mmm?

JAP: Oh! And what happened to helping others, mmm?
FR: On ne veut plus aider les gens dans le besoin, c'est ça#?
OUPS: Oh! And what happened to helping others, mmm?

JAP: Oh, ho! Look! This one lacks the power of speech! Perhaps she can communicate
FR: Oh, ho ! Regarde ! Elle est muette ! Elle peut peut-être communiquer par signes...
OUPS: Oh, ho! Look! This one lacks the power of speech! Perhaps she can communicate

JAP: through gesture... Let me see...
FR: Voyons voir...
OUPS: through gesture... Let me see...

JAP: ...Thank...you.
FR: « Merci. »
OUPS: ...Thank...you.

JAP: You're welcome?
FR: De rien ?
OUPS: You're welcome?

JAP: I...am Fyra.
FR: « Je... m'appelle... Fyra. »
OUPS: I...am Fyra.

JAP: Are...you...in trouble?
FR: « Avez-vous... besoin... d'aide ? »
OUPS: Are...you...in trouble?

JAP: No, we just need to ask your leaders about something.
FR: Non, nous voulons seulement poser quelques questions à ceux qui gouvernent la ville.
OUPS: No, we just need to ask your leaders about something.

JAP: But I can't do that unless I can understand them.
FR: Mais je ne peux pas le faire si je ne les comprends pas.
OUPS: But I can't do that unless I can understand them.

JAP: I...can...
FR: « Je... peux... »
OUPS: I...can...

JAP: Guide...you? Oh, she will act as our guide! How fortuitous!
FR: « ... vous... guider. » Oh, elle nous servira de guide ! Quel coup de veine !
OUPS: Guide...you? Oh, she will act as our guide! How fortuitous!

JAP: But...first...
FR: « Mais d'abord... »
OUPS: But...first...

JAP: I must...explain...this town.
FR: « Je dois... vous expliquer... les coutumes de la ville... »
OUPS: I must...explain...this town.

JAP: I'm not here for a tour.
FR: Je ne veux pas de visite guidée.
OUPS: I'm not here for a tour.

JAP: No... There are rules to follow...
FR: « Non... Il faut respecter... la loi... »
OUPS: No... There are rules to follow...

JAP: Follow...me. ...Well, there you have it.
FR: « Suivez... moi. » C'est tout ce qu'elle a dit.
OUPS: Follow...me. ...Well, there you have it.

JAP: (This is an item shop.)
FR: (Voici l'apothicairerie.)
OUPS: (This is an item shop.)

JAP: (All shops and houses in this city must abide by the following rule:)
FR: (Tous les bâtiments de la ville doivent être construits en tenant compte de la loi suivante#:)
OUPS: (All shops and houses in this city must abide by the following rule:)

JAP: (Rule 106: Do not live on level ground.)
FR: (Loi nº#106#: n'habitez jamais sur un terrain plat.)
OUPS: (Rule 106: Do not live on level ground.)

JAP: Rule 106?
FR: La loi nº 106 ?
OUPS: Rule 106?

JAP: (We have many rules.)
FR: (Nous avons plusieurs lois.)
OUPS: (We have many rules.)

JAP: Is Rule 106 the reason for your labyrinthine system of staircases?
FR: La loi nº 106 est-elle la cause de ce système labyrinthique d'escaliers ?
OUPS: Is Rule 106 the reason for your labyrinthine system of staircases?

JAP: (Yes. That is the rule.)
FR: (Oui. C'est la loi.)
OUPS: (Yes. That is the rule.)

JAP: Well, I suppose eccentric people deserve an eccentric town.
FR: Eh bien, je suppose qu'un peuple excentrique mérite une ville excentrique.
OUPS: Well, I suppose eccentric people deserve an eccentric town.

JAP: (This is a sand-skiff dock.)
FR: (Voici le quai de la gondole des sables.)
OUPS: (This is a sand-skiff dock.)

JAP: (Rule 115,017: You must view the town by ship before purchasing any items.)
FR: (Loi nº#115#017#: avant de pouvoir faire un achat, chacun doit d'abord admirer la ville par gondole.)
OUPS: (Rule 115,017: You must view the town by ship before purchasing any items.)

JAP: Oh, come now! What could possibly be the point of such an absurd rule!?
FR: Oh, voyons ! Quelle peut bien être l'utilité d'une loi aussi absurde ?!
OUPS: Oh, come now! What could possibly be the point of such an absurd rule!?

JAP: (I don't know. It's a rule that was in place when I first came here, not a new one.)
FR: (...#Je ne sais pas. Ce n'est pas une nouvelle loi. Elle avait déjà été promulguée lorsque je suis arrivée ici.)
OUPS: (I don't know. It's a rule that was in place when I first came here, not a new one.)

JAP: Hold on. Your people are still making rules?
FR: Un instant... Ton peuple adopte encore de nouvelles lois ?
OUPS: Hold on. Your people are still making rules?

JAP: (Yes. I heard that we passed Rule 124,046 earlier this month.)
FR: (Oui. J'ai entendu dire que la loi nº#124#046 avait été promulguée il y a une dizaine de jours.)
OUPS: (Yes. I heard that we passed Rule 124,046 earlier this month.)

JAP: Of all the idiocy! I could never live in this city.
FR: Que d'inepties ! Jamais je ne pourrais vivre dans cette ville.
OUPS: Of all the idiocy! I could never live in this city.

JAP: (This is a grocery.)
FR: (Voici l'épicerie.)
OUPS: (This is a grocery.)

JAP: (Rule 11,034: You must live at a level appropriate to your position.)
FR: (Loi nº#11#034#: chacun doit habiter à un niveau propre à sa position.)
OUPS: (Rule 11,034: You must live at a level appropriate to your position.)

JAP: Ah! So the aristocracy lives in the top levels, while the commoners subsist below?
FR: Ah ! L'aristocratie réside donc sur les niveaux supérieurs, alors que la populace habite aux niveaux inférieurs ?
OUPS: Ah! So the aristocracy lives in the top levels, while the commoners subsist below?

JAP: (Yes.)
FR: (Oui.)
OUPS: (Yes.)

JAP: Seems like a rather unpleasant rule for those on the bottom.
FR: Cela semble être une loi quelque peu désagréable pour ceux qui demeurent tout en bas.
OUPS: Seems like a rather unpleasant rule for those on the bottom.

JAP: Does this girl plan to drag us about the entire town in this fashion!?
FR: Cette fille compte-t-elle nous traîner ainsi à travers toute la ville ?!
OUPS: Does this girl plan to drag us about the entire town in this fashion!?

JAP: The kid sure does love her rules, doesn't she?
FR: Cela ne fait aucun doute, les lois de cette ville lui tiennent à cœur.
OUPS: The kid sure does love her rules, doesn't she?

JAP: (This is a strange-thing store.)
FR: (Voici le magasin de curiosités.)
OUPS: (This is a strange-thing store.)

JAP: Hold on—a "strange-thing" store?
FR: Euh, un magasin de « curiosités » ?!
OUPS: Hold on—a "strange-thing" store?

JAP: (Yes. A store that sells strange things.)
FR: (Oui, on y vend des objets curieux.)
OUPS: (Yes. A store that sells strange things.)

JAP: ...Such as?
FR: ... Pourrais-tu nous donner un exemple ?
OUPS: ...Such as?

JAP: (I don't know. The things are so strange, no one is sure what they do.)
FR: (Pas vraiment. Personne ne sait à quoi ils servent.)
OUPS: (I don't know. The things are so strange, no one is sure what they do.)

JAP: Yeah, that's pretty strange.
FR: Tu as raison, c'est plutôt curieux.
OUPS: Yeah, that's pretty strange.

JAP: (This is a store that sells raw materials.)
FR: (Ce magasin vend des matériaux.)
OUPS: (This is a store that sells raw materials.)

JAP: (We use this material to make masks.)
FR: (Nous utilisons ces matériaux pour fabriquer des masques.)
OUPS: (We use this material to make masks.)

JAP: (Rule 12: Do not neglect your mask.)
FR: (Loi nº#12#: ne négligez pas votre masque.)
OUPS: (Rule 12: Do not neglect your mask.)

JAP: (If you want to live here, you must have a mask on at all times.)
FR: (Tous ceux qui vivent ici doivent porter un masque en tout temps.)
OUPS: (If you want to live here, you must have a mask on at all times.)

JAP: Yes, I was beginning to suspect that.
FR: Oui, je commençais à m'en douter.
OUPS: Yes, I was beginning to suspect that.

JAP: (This is a weapon shop.)
FR: (Voici l'armurerie.)
OUPS: (This is a weapon shop.)

JAP: (This concludes your tour of the city.)
FR: (Ainsi se termine votre visite de la ville.)
OUPS: (This concludes your tour of the city.)

JAP: (Thank you for your patience. I will now guide you to the king's manor.)
FR: (Merci d'avoir patienté. Je vous guiderai maintenant au palais.)
OUPS: (Thank you for your patience. I will now guide you to the king's manor.)

JAP: Thanks.
FR: Merci.
OUPS: Thanks.

JAP: These rules are enough to make a sensible man reach for the noose!
FR: Ces lois pourraient rendre fou même l'homme le plus sain d'esprit !
OUPS: These rules are enough to make a sensible man reach for the noose!

JAP: I don't know how you survive in a place with so many inconvenient prescripts.
FR: Je ne sais pas comment tu peux survivre dans un endroit assujetti par tant de préceptes ennuyeux.
OUPS: I don't know how you survive in a place with so many inconvenient prescripts.

JAP: (It's not so bad.)
FR: (Ce n'est pas si mal que ça.)
OUPS: (It's not so bad.)

JAP: (Although I used to ask the same question. And then someone told me...)
FR: (Cependant, un jour j'ai posé la même question et quelqu'un m'a répondu...)
OUPS: (Although I used to ask the same question. And then someone told me...)

JAP: ("Rules do not exist to bind you. They exist so you may know your freedoms.")
FR: («#Le but des lois n'est pas de contraindre, mais de révéler la liberté.#»)
OUPS: ("Rules do not exist to bind you. They exist so you may know your freedoms.")

JAP: (When I look at it like that, they don't bother me.)
FR: (Quand je considère la question de cette façon, les lois ne me dérangent pas.)
OUPS: (When I look at it like that, they don't bother me.)

JAP: Whatever gets you through the day.
FR: Si ça peut t'aider de voir les choses ainsi...
OUPS: Whatever gets you through the day.

JAP: (This is the king's manor.)
FR: (Voici le palais.)
OUPS: (This is the king's manor.)

JAP: (However, we have no king now.)
FR: (Cependant, nous n'avons pas de roi actuellement.)
OUPS: (However, we have no king now.)

JAP: You have no king?
FR: Pas de roi ?
OUPS: You have no king?

JAP: (Our king was stricken with a foul black illness, and so passed away.)
FR: (Notre roi a succombé à une ignoble maladie obscure.)
OUPS: (Our king was stricken with a foul black illness, and so passed away.)

JAP: (His son, the prince, now rules this land.)
FR: (Le prince, son fils, gouverne désormais le royaume.)
OUPS: (His son, the prince, now rules this land.)

JAP: The Black Scrawl...
FR: La nécrose runique...
OUPS: The Black Scrawl...

JAP: (This is the prince's royal advisor. He would know far more about these things than I.)
FR: (Voici le conseiller du prince. Il en sait probablement plus que moi à ce sujet.)
OUPS: (This is the prince's royal advisor. He would know far more about these things than I.)

JAP: Thank you. All of this touring has been helpful for understanding your language.
FR: Je te remercie. Ta visite guidée m'a aidé à mieux comprendre ta langue.
OUPS: Thank you. All of this touring has been helpful for understanding your language.

JAP: I believe I will be able to speak with this advisor myself.
FR: Je crois que je pourrai m'adresser moi-même au conseiller.
OUPS: I believe I will be able to speak with this advisor myself.

JAP: We need to talk to the prince.
FR: Nous aimerions demander une audience au prince.
OUPS: We need to talk to the prince.

JAP: (I'm afraid the prince is not taking outside visitors at present.)
FR: (Je regrette, mais le prince ne donne pas d'audience actuellement.)
OUPS: (I'm afraid the prince is not taking outside visitors at present.)

JAP: (I would appreciate it if you could come back another day.)
FR: (Veuillez revenir un autre jour.)
OUPS: (I would appreciate it if you could come back another day.)

JAP: My patience for this kind of thing has long ago evaporated!
FR: Toutes ces vexations ont lassé ma patience il y a longtemps !
OUPS: My patience for this kind of thing has long ago evaporated!

JAP: (I'm sorry!)
FR: (Je suis désolée#!)
OUPS: (I'm sorry!)

JAP: It's not your fault, Fyra. Let's go back to Kainé for now.
FR: Ce n'est pas ta faute, Fyra. Allons retrouver Kainé.
OUPS: It's not your fault, Fyra. Let's go back to Kainé for now.

JAP: Finish your business?
FR: Prêts à partir#?
OUPS: Finish your business?

JAP: Yeah. Thankfully we met a girl who helped us get around.
FR: Oui. Nous avons eu de la chance. Une jeune fille a accepté d'être notre guide.
OUPS: Yeah. Thankfully we met a girl who helped us get around.

JAP: ...A girl?
FR: ... Une jeune fille#?
OUPS: ...A girl?

JAP: Slow down! I can barely... "The person...who saved me?" Surely you don't mean Kainé!?

OUPS: Kainé? Helped you? This foul-mouthed hussy!?

FR: (Bonjour#! J'ai terminé le filtre. Désolé de vous avoir fait attendre.)
OUPS: (Hello! I finished the filter. Sorry to keep you waiting.)

JAP: (Hey, did you hear the news!?)
FR: (Hé, vous avez entendu#?!)
OUPS: (Hey, did you hear the news!?)

JAP: (The prince is missing!)
FR: (Le prince a disparu#!)
OUPS: (The prince is missing!)

JAP: (What!? Then we're in violation of Rule 83,348!)
FR: (Comment#?! Alors, nous sommes en violation de la loi nº#83#348#!)
OUPS: (What!? Then we're in violation of Rule 83,348!)

JAP: What's going on?
FR: Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: What's going on?

JAP: (The prince is gone! And according to Rule 83,348,
FR: (Le prince a disparu#! Et selon la loi nº#83#348, nous devons partir immédiatement
OUPS: (The prince is gone! And according to Rule 83,348,

JAP: we have to start looking for him right away!)
FR: à sa recherche#!)
OUPS: we have to start looking for him right away!)

JAP: (But Rule 50,527 states that only nobility may enter the temple!)<PAGE>(...Oh no! That means we CAN'T go look for him!)
FR: (Mais la loi nº#50#527 dit que seuls les nobles peuvent pénétrer dans le temple#!)<PAGE>(Oh, non#! Cela veut dire qu'il nous est impossible d'aller à sa recherche#!)
OUPS: (But Rule 50,527 states that only nobility may enter the temple!)<PAGE>(...Oh no! That means we CAN'T go look for him!)

JAP: (But what about Rule 83,348?)

OUPS: (But what about Rule 83,348?)

JAP: (What about Rule 50,527!?)

OUPS: (What about Rule 50,527!?)

JAP: (Hmmmmm...)
OUPS: (Hmmmmm...)

JAP: (Hmmmmm...)

FR: (Je vais sauver le prince#!)
OUPS: (I'm going to save the prince!)

FR: (Non#! C'est impossible#!)
OUPS: (No! You can't!)

FR: (Aurais-tu oublié la loi nº#50#527#?)
OUPS: (Have you forgotten about Rule 50,527?)

JAP: (Oh, screw the rules!)
FR: (Oh, je me fiche des lois#!)
OUPS: (Oh, screw the rules!)

JAP: You could just ask an outsider to go save him. Then no one violates a rule.
FR: Tu pourrais demander à un étranger d'aller le sauver. Ainsi, personne n'enfreindrait la loi.
OUPS: You could just ask an outsider to go save him. Then no one violates a rule.

JAP: (Huh?)
FR: (Hein#?)
OUPS: (Huh?)

JAP: You know, an outsider. Like me.
FR: Oui, euh, un étranger. Comme moi.
OUPS: You know, an outsider. Like me.

JAP: And oh, what luck! There just happens to be an outsider here who can't stop meddling
FR: Regardez, c'est votre jour de chance ! Par le plus grand des hasards, il y a justement
OUPS: And oh, what luck! There just happens to be an outsider here who can't stop meddling

JAP: in the affairs of others!
FR: un étranger qui ne peut s'empêcher de s'ingérer dans les affaires des autres !
OUPS: in the affairs of others!

JAP: (Impossible. We could never ask such a thing.)
FR: (Impossible#! Nous ne pourrions jamais vous présenter une telle requête#!)
OUPS: (Impossible. We could never ask such a thing.)

FR: Je m'en charge.
OUPS: I'll do it.

JAP: Fyra told me about Rule 1,024. You know that one, right?
FR: Fyra m'a appris la loi nº 1024. Vous la connaissez, non ?
OUPS: Fyra told me about Rule 1,024. You know that one, right?

JAP: Rule 1,024: You must honor the request of any outsider owed a debt.
FR: Loi nº 1024 : accédez à la requête de tout étranger à qui vous êtes redevable.
OUPS: Rule 1,024: You must honor the request of any outsider owed a debt.

FR: Pourquoi ai-je accepté de voyager avec des gens si dévoués envers autrui ?
OUPS: Why did I ever agree to travel with such a pack of do-gooders?

JAP: Let's go.
FR: Allons-y.

JAP: Let's go.
FR: Allons-y.
OUPS: Let's go.

JAP: (Thank you.)
FR: (Merci.)
OUPS: (Thank you.)

JAP: (Having an outsider handle this violates no rules, but it still feels very wrong.)
FR: (Demander à un étranger de trouver le prince n'enfreint pas de loi, mais cela ne me plaît pas du tout.)
OUPS: (Having an outsider handle this violates no rules, but it still feels very wrong.)

JAP: (We must rescue the prince, but the rules must be obeyed!)
FR: (Nous devons sauver le prince tout en respectant la loi#!)
OUPS: (We must rescue the prince, but the rules must be obeyed!)

JAP: (Let me show you the way.)
FR: (Laissez-moi vous montrer le chemin.)
OUPS: (Let me show you the way.)

JAP: (You'll need my guidance to get through the sandstorm.)
FR: (Sans moi, vous ne pourrez pas traverser la tempête de sable.)
OUPS: (You'll need my guidance to get through the sandstorm.)

JAP: Okay. We'll take it from here.

OUPS: (Oh, and one more thing...)

JAP: I figured you'd come back.
FR: Je savais que tu reviendrais.
OUPS: I figured you'd come back.

JAP: Don't get all weepy, okay? It's not like I was searching for you.
FR: T'excite pas trop, d'accord ? C'est pas comme si je te cherchais.
OUPS: Don't get all weepy, okay? It's not like I was searching for you.

JAP: So you were simply lost?
FR: Alors, tu t'es simplement égarée ?
OUPS: So you were simply lost?

JAP: Fuck off, book!
FR: Va te faire foutre, bouquin !
OUPS: Fuck off, book!

JAP: (Prince!)
FR: (Votre Altesse#!)
OUPS: (Prince!)

JAP: (My liege, have you any idea of the trouble we've—)
FR: (Votre Altesse, vous rendez-vous compte du...)
OUPS: (My liege, have you any idea of the trouble we've—)

JAP: (Ah! The Royal Mask!)
FR: (Ah ! Le masque royal !)
OUPS: (Ah! The Royal Mask!)

JAP: (Our people have suffered since the king's death.)
FR: (Notre peuple a enduré beaucoup de peines depuis le décès du roi.)
OUPS: (Our people have suffered since the king's death.)

JAP: (I was too young to bridge the gap between our people and other civilizations.)
FR: (J'étais trop jeune pour faire le lien entre notre ville et les autres pays.)
OUPS: (I was too young to bridge the gap between our people and other civilizations.)

JAP: (Trade has come to a halt. We lack food and water, and the people despair for it.)

OUPS: (Trade has come to a halt. We lack food and water, and the people despair for it.)

JAP: (This mask is an emblem of the king.)

OUPS: (This mask is an emblem of the king.)

JAP: (With it, I can project a strong image to other lands, and our people can be prosperous
FR: (Grâce à lui, je peux présenter une image de force et de stabilité aux autres pays.
OUPS: (With it, I can project a strong image to other lands, and our people can be prosperous

JAP: once more.)
FR: Notre peuple saura retrouver sa prospérité d'autrefois.)

JAP: (My prince...)
FR: (Votre Altesse...)
OUPS: (My prince...)

OUPS: ("Rules do not exist to bind you. They exist so you may know your freedoms.")

OUPS: (Those are the words of the previous king. ...My father.)

OUPS: (And now that I have his mask, I believe I can ascend to the throne. Is this correct?)

JAP: (Of course! Hail! All hail the new king!)
FR: (Certes#! Vive le roi#! Vive le nouveau roi#!)
OUPS: (Of course! Hail! All hail the new king!)

JAP: (We never forget a debt, no matter how much time has passed!)
FR: (Nous nous acquittons toujours de nos dettes de reconnaissance, quoi qu'il arrive#!)
OUPS: (We never forget a debt, no matter how much time has passed!)

JAP: (We never forget a debt, no matter how much time has passed!)

FR: (Nous nous acquittons toujours de nos dettes de reconnaissance, quoi qu'il arrive#!)
OUPS: (We never forget a debt, no matter how much time has passed!)

JAP: (We never forget a debt, no matter how much time has passed!)
FR: (Nous nous acquittons toujours de nos dettes de reconnaissance, quoi qu'il arrive#!)
OUPS: (We never forget a debt, no matter how much time has passed!)

JAP: (We never forget a debt, no matter how much time has passed!)
FR: (Nous nous acquittons toujours de nos dettes de reconnaissance, quoi qu'il arrive#!)
OUPS: (We never forget a debt, no matter how much time has passed!)

JAP: (I apologize to you, my foreign friends, for all of your hardships.)
FR: (Je vous demande pardon pour toutes les épreuves que vous avez endurées, mes amis étrangers.)
OUPS: (I apologize to you, my foreign friends, for all of your hardships.)

FR: (En tant que souverain de Façade, je vous accorderai une faveur, j'en fais le serment#!)
OUPS: (I swear by my new position as the king of Facade, I shall grant whatever you desire!)

JAP: (Please! What is it I can do for you?)
FR: (Quel est votre vœu le plus cher#?)
OUPS: (Please! What is it I can do for you?)

JAP: I appreciate the offer, but I'll have to pass.
FR: Votre offre est généreuse, mais je ne peux pas l'accepter.
OUPS: I appreciate the offer, but I'll have to pass.

JAP: (Then think of a wish I can grant on behalf of another!)
FR: (Alors, laissez-moi exaucer le vœu d'une autre personne en votre nom#!)
OUPS: (Then think of a wish I can grant on behalf of another!)

FR: Je crois que c'est un ordre...
OUPS: I think he just gave us an order...

JAP: A new wish...
FR: Un autre vœu...
OUPS: A new wish...

JAP: Fine. I want you to make Rule Zero. And it's gonna say that if people don't like a rule,
FR: D'accord. Je veux que vous promulguiez la loi zéro, celle qui dira que si les gens n'aiment pas une loi,
OUPS: Fine. I want you to make Rule Zero. And it's gonna say that if people don't like a rule,

JAP: they can vote to change it.
FR: ils peuvent la changer en organisant un vote.
OUPS: they can vote to change it.

JAP: A splendid idea!
FR: Quelle merveilleuse idée !

JAP: (Very well.)
FR: (Qu'il en soit ainsi.)
OUPS: (Very well.)

JAP: (What? But, my king! This cannot be!)
FR: (Comment#? Mais, Votre Majesté#! C'est impossible#!)
OUPS: (What? But, my king! This cannot be!)

JAP: (Our people have long memories.)
FR: (Notre peuple n'oublie pas facilement.)
OUPS: (Our people have long memories.)

JAP: (We shall never forget the debt we owe you, no matter how hard the times.)
FR: (Nous graverons vos exploits dans notre mémoire et nous vous resterons toujours redevables, quoi qu'il arrive.)
OUPS: (We shall never forget the debt we owe you, no matter how hard the times.)

JAP: (Such is the way of the Masked People.)
FR: (Telle est la tradition du peuple masqué.)
OUPS: (Such is the way of the Masked People.)

JAP: (And thus, we shall grant your request.)
FR: (Nous vous accordons donc votre requête.)
OUPS: (And thus, we shall grant your request.)

JAP: (Still, that alone cannot repay our debt to you.)
FR: (Toutefois, ce n'est pas suffisant.)
OUPS: (Still, that alone cannot repay our debt to you.)

JAP: (Please accept this.)
FR: (Veuillez accepter ceci.)
OUPS: (Please accept this.)

FR: (...#Je te remercie, Fyra, et je suis désolé de t'avoir tant causé d'inquiétude.)
OUPS: (Thank you, Fyra. And I am sorry for all I put you through.)

JAP: (It's...it's not a problem!)
FR: (Ce... ce n'est rien, Votre Majesté#!)
OUPS: (It's...it's not a problem!)

JAP: We're not done here yet.
FR: Je dois parler au roi.
OUPS: We're not done here yet.

JAP: I'd like to ask you about the Black Scrawl.
FR: J'aimerais vous poser une question au sujet de la nécrose runique.
OUPS: I'd like to ask you about the Black Scrawl.

JAP: (Ah, yes. The foul disease that claimed my father's life.)
FR: (Ah, la maladie insidieuse qui a emporté mon père...)
OUPS: (Ah, yes. The foul disease that claimed my father's life.)

JAP: We heard that you were searching for a cure. Did you ever learn anything?
FR: On dit que vos apothicaires étaient à la recherche d'un remède. Qu'ont-ils découvert#?
OUPS: We heard that you were searching for a cure. Did you ever learn anything?

JAP: (I'm sorry, no. Everything we tried ended in failure.)
FR: (Pas grand-chose. Aucune de leurs potions n'a eu d'effet.)
OUPS: (I'm sorry, no. Everything we tried ended in failure.)

JAP: It seems there is no way around it. We'll have to collect the Sealed Verses one by one.
FR: Il semblerait que nous n'avons pas le choix. Nous devrons trouver tous les vers scellés.
OUPS: It seems there is no way around it. We'll have to collect the Sealed Verses one by one.

JAP: Yeah. Thankfully, there aren't too many left.
FR: Oui. Heureusement que nous y sommes presque.
OUPS: Yeah. Thankfully, there aren't too many left.

JAP: (Pardon me, but what are these "Sealed Verses"?)
FR: (Que sont ces vers scellés dont vous parlez#?)
OUPS: (Pardon me, but what are these "Sealed Verses"?)

JAP: We're not sure. But if I find them all, I can save my sister from the Black Scrawl.
FR: Nous n'en sommes pas certains, mais si j'arrive à tous les récupérer, je pourrai guérir ma fille de la nécrose runique.
OUPS: We're not sure. But if I find them all, I can save my sister from the Black Scrawl.

JAP: You...don't know what they are?
FR: Tu... ne sais pas ce qu'ils sont#?
OUPS: You...don't know what they are?

JAP: I don't know and I don't much care. I just want to save my sister.
FR: Non, et je m'en fiche. Mon seul souci est de sauver ma fille.
OUPS: I don't know and I don't much care. I just want to save my sister.

JAP: I'll run around collecting a bunch of crystal horse manure if that's what it takes.
FR: Je ferais n'importe quoi pour y arriver.
OUPS: I'll run around collecting a bunch of crystal horse manure if that's what it takes.

JAP: (One moment, please!)
FR: (Attendez un instant#!)
OUPS: (One moment, please!)

JAP: (Can I ask you to visit us again?)
FR: (Auriez-vous l'amabilité de revenir nous rendre visite un jour#?)
OUPS: (Can I ask you to visit us again?)

JAP: (To return as friends?)
FR: (En tant qu'amis#?)
OUPS: (To return as friends?)

JAP: Sure. Why not?
FR: Bien sûr, pourquoi pas ?
OUPS: Sure. Why not?

JAP: Just try not to get yourself kidnapped again, hmmm?
FR: Essayez tout de même de ne pas vous faire enlever encore une fois, d'accord ?
OUPS: Just try not to get yourself kidnapped again, hmmm?

JAP: (Oh, thank you! And I promise to be careful!)
FR: (Oh, merci#! Je promets que je serai prudent#!)
OUPS: (Oh, thank you! And I promise to be careful!)

JAP: (Come visit us soon, okay!?)
FR: (Revenez nous rendre visite bientôt, d'accord#?)
OUPS: (Come visit us soon, okay!?)

JAP: I fear for the future of Facade. No matter how good his intentions, with a king so young...
FR: L'avenir de Façade me paraît hasardeux. Même avec les meilleures intentions du monde, le roi est si jeune…
OUPS: I fear for the future of Facade. No matter how good his intentions, with a king so young...

JAP: The people will make up for whatever the king lacks.
FR: Le peuple comblera les lacunes de leur roi.
OUPS: The people will make up for whatever the king lacks.

JAP: I imagine we'll come back to a whole new slew of rules!
FR: Je parie que nous aurons une myriade de nouvelles lois à découvrir lors de notre prochaine visite.
OUPS: I imagine we'll come back to a whole new slew of rules!

JAP: Probably. But rules seem to work for them, so who are we to say otherwise?
FR: Probablement. Mais leurs lois semblent leur convenir, alors ce n'est pas à nous de prétendre le contraire.
OUPS: Probably. But rules seem to work for them, so who are we to say otherwise?

JAP: Oh, come now!
FR: Oh, voyons !
OUPS: Oh, come now!

JAP: There are as many ways to view the world as there are people in it.
FR: Chaque peuple a sa propre façon de voir le monde.
OUPS: There are as many ways to view the world as there are people in it.

JAP: Perhaps you have learned something on this journey after all!
FR: Tu auras peut-être appris quelque chose au cours de notre périple, après tout !
OUPS: Perhaps you have learned something on this journey after all!

JAP: Maybe. What do you think, Kainé?
FR: C'est possible. Qu'en penses-tu, Kainé ?
OUPS: Maybe. What do you think, Kainé?

JAP: Don't care.
FR: Je m'en fous.
OUPS: Don't care.

JAP: (Hey, you came back! Oh, here! Watch this...)
FR: (Vous êtes revenus#! Oh, regardez un peu...!)
OUPS: (Hey, you came back! Oh, here! Watch this...)

JAP: You sure you should be tossing the Royal Mask around like that?
FR: Êtes-vous certain que vous devriez jouer ainsi avec le masque royal#?
OUPS: You sure you should be tossing the Royal Mask around like that?

JAP: (I'm not "tossing it around!" I'm spinning it. And this is serious business!)
FR: (Je ne joue pas#! Je le fais tournoyer#! Et c'est du sérieux#!)
OUPS: (I'm not "tossing it around!" I'm spinning it. And this is serious business!)

JAP: (My liege, the mask was not meant to be spun in such a manner!
FR: (Votre Majesté, le masque n'est pas fait pour être tournoyé ainsi#!
OUPS: (My liege, the mask was not meant to be spun in such a manner!

JAP: ...Oh, dear.)
FR: Oh, misère...)
OUPS: ...Oh, dear.)

JAP: I suppose one cannot expect a man to change his ways overnight. ...Even a king.
FR: Je suppose qu'on ne peut pas s'attendre à ce qu'un homme change du jour au lendemain… #Même un roi.
OUPS: I suppose one cannot expect a man to change his ways overnight. ...Even a king.

JAP: (What!? What is it!?)
FR: (Quoi#?! Qu'y a-t-il#?!)
OUPS: (What!? What is it!?)

JAP: Oh, excuse me.
FR: Oh, pardonnez-moi.
OUPS: Oh, excuse me.

JAP: (It's all right. We weren't discussing anything important.)
FR: (Ne vous inquiétez pas. Nous ne parlions pas de choses importantes.)
OUPS: (It's all right. We weren't discussing anything important.)

JAP: (Not important!?)
FR: (Pas importantes#?!)
OUPS: (Not important!?)

JAP: You seem rather troubled, King. Would you tell us of it?
FR: Vous avez l'air anxieux, Votre Majesté. Voulez-vous discuter de vos problèmes avec nous#?
OUPS: You seem rather troubled, King. Would you tell us of it?

JAP: Weiss? We're leaving.
FR: Weiss#? Partons.
OUPS: Weiss? We're leaving.

JAP: Oh, I see how it is! You're the only one allowed to help others! Pah!
FR: Oh, c'est ça, j'ai compris#! Tu es le seul qui puisse aider autrui#! Pfft#!
OUPS: Oh, I see how it is! You're the only one allowed to help others! Pah!

JAP: The king and Fyra are having an...emotional moment.
FR: Le roi et Fyra voulaient continuer leur conversation... en privé.
OUPS: The king and Fyra are having an...emotional moment.

JAP: You're a book; I didn't think you'd understand.
FR: Tu es un livre, tu ne pourrais pas comprendre.
OUPS: You're a book; I didn't think you'd understand.

JAP: All grimoires are not the same! Some of us have highly-tuned emotions!
FR: Chaque grimoire est unique#! Certains d'entre nous peuvent détecter avec aisance les états émotionnels des humains#!
OUPS: All grimoires are not the same! Some of us have highly-tuned emotions!

JAP: ...True, this is not a skill I possess, but still!
FR: Il est vrai que cela n'est pas ma spécialité, mais tout de même#!
OUPS: ...True, this is not a skill I possess, but still!

JAP: Oh, so not all books are socially inept. ...It's just you.
FR: Oh, alors ce ne sont pas tous les livres qui sont insensibles. ...#Ce n'est que toi.
OUPS: Oh, so not all books are socially inept. ...It's just you.

JAP: Yonah?
FR: Yonah#?
OUPS: Yonah?

JAP: Oh. H-hi, Brother.
FR: Oh, salut papa...
OUPS: Oh. H-hi, Brother.

JAP: How are you feeling?
FR: Comment te sens-tu#?
OUPS: How are you feeling?

JAP: I'm okay. Sometimes it still hurts, but that fish medicine you got helps a lot.
FR: Je vais bien. Parfois, j'ai encore mal, mais le remède à base de poisson que tu as préparé aide à calmer la douleur.
OUPS: I'm okay. Sometimes it still hurts, but that fish medicine you got helps a lot.

JAP: Good.
FR: Bien.
OUPS: Good.

JAP: Um...Brother?
FR: Euh... Dis, papa#?
OUPS: Um...Brother?

JAP: Are you gonna stay here tonight?
FR: Passeras-tu la nuit ici#?
OUPS: Are you gonna stay here tonight?

JAP: <LIST=1298>I'll stay with you.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1298>Je vais rester avec toi.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1298>I'll stay with you.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1299>I can't stay today.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1299>Pas aujourd'hui, ma chérie.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1299>I can't stay today.</LIST>

JAP: Oh. ...Okay. I understand.
FR: Oh. Je comprends...
OUPS: Oh. ...Okay. I understand.

JAP: But next time you come back, we should spend some time together. 'Kay?
FR: La prochaine fois, promets-moi de rester un peu plus longtemps, d'accord#?
OUPS: But next time you come back, we should spend some time together. 'Kay?

JAP: But next time you come back, we should spend some time together. 'Kay?
FR: La prochaine fois, promets-moi de rester un peu plus longtemps, d'accord#?
OUPS: But next time you come back, we should spend some time together. 'Kay?

JAP: Yaaaay! Brother's going to stay home tonight!
FR: Youpi#! Papa passe la nuit à la maison#!
OUPS: Yaaaay! Brother's going to stay home tonight!

JAP: Easy, Yonah! You'll hurt something.
FR: Du calme, Yonah#! Tu pourrais te faire mal.
OUPS: Easy, Yonah! You'll hurt something.

JAP: Tee-hee! I don't care! I'm just happy I get to see you!
FR: Hi, hi, hi#! Peu importe#! Je suis contente#! Tu es là#!
OUPS: Tee-hee! I don't care! I'm just happy I get to see you!

JAP: It's late. You should go to bed.
FR: Il se fait tard. Tu devrais aller te coucher.
OUPS: It's late. You should go to bed.

JAP: Okay. Night, Brother!
FR: D'accord. Bonne nuit, papa#!
OUPS: Okay. Night, Brother!

JAP: (...Whoa. That was a messed-up dream.)
FR: (Quel drôle de rêve...)
OUPS: (...Whoa. That was a messed-up dream.)

JAP: (I never thought I'd be hunting Sealed Verses in there.)
FR: (Jamais je n'aurais pensé pouvoir trouver un vers scellé dans un endroit comme la forêt des légendes.)
OUPS: (I never thought I'd be hunting Sealed Verses in there.)

JAP: Morning, Brother!
FR: Bonjour, papa#!
OUPS: Morning, Brother!

JAP: ...Hey.
FR: Hum...
OUPS: ...Hey.

JAP: What's wrong? You look all tired, and you have these weird black circles under your eyes.
FR: Qu'est-ce qui ne va pas#? Tu as l'air fatigué et tes yeux sont tout cernés.
OUPS: What's wrong? You look all tired, and you have these weird black circles under your eyes.

JAP: It's nothing. I just... I had a strange dream, and I didn't sleep very well.
FR: Ce n'est rien. Je n'ai pas bien dormi la nuit dernière. J'ai fait des rêves étranges.
OUPS: It's nothing. I just... I had a strange dream, and I didn't sleep very well.

JAP: Oh! I have weird dreams all the time!
FR: Oh#! Je fais tout le temps des rêves étranges#!
OUPS: Oh! I have weird dreams all the time!

JAP: I know.
FR: Je sais.
OUPS: I know.

JAP: Actually, I had a totally weird dream last night!
FR: À vrai dire, j'ai fait un rêve vraiment bizarre la nuit dernière#!
OUPS: Actually, I had a totally weird dream last night!

JAP: Did you now?
FR: Ah, bon#?
OUPS: Did you now?

JAP: There was a boy, and me, and we were playing this game together!
FR: Je jouais à un jeu avec un garçon...
OUPS: There was a boy, and me, and we were playing this game together!

JAP: What kind of game?
FR: Quelle sorte de jeu#?
OUPS: What kind of game?

JAP: It was called Guess The Word! ...I think he made it up, because I never heard of it before.
FR: Il s'appelait «#Devine le mot#!#». Le garçon doit l'avoir inventé, parce que je n'en ai jamais entendu parler.
OUPS: It was called Guess The Word! ...I think he made it up, because I never heard of it before.

JAP: How did it work?
FR: Comment y joue-t-on#?
OUPS: How did it work?

JAP: Um, well, the boy would move his mouth but no words would come out, so I had to guess what he was trying to say.
FR: Euh, une personne articule des mots en silence et l'autre essaie de deviner ce qu'elle dit.
OUPS: Um, well, the boy would move his mouth but no words would come out, so I had to guess what he was trying to say.

JAP: It was hard. I wanted to play hide-and-seek, but we had to play his dumb game instead.
FR: C'était difficile. Moi, je voulais jouer à cache-cache, mais il m'a forcée à jouer à son jeu ennuyeux.
OUPS: It was hard. I wanted to play hide-and-seek, but we had to play his dumb game instead.

JAP: ...What did he say?
FR: ... As-tu pu deviner ce qu'il disait#?
OUPS: ...What did he say?

JAP: I dunno. All I could figure out was "dream" and "Forest of Myth."
FR: Pas vraiment. Je n'ai compris que les mots «#rêve#» et «#forêt des légendes#».
OUPS: I dunno. All I could figure out was "dream" and "Forest of Myth."

JAP: But he said he'd be back, so I gotta study. Then I can figure out everything and win!
FR: Mais il a dit qu'il reviendrait, alors je dois m'exercer#! Si je m'exerce assez, je pourrai deviner tout ce qu'il dit et gagner#!
OUPS: But he said he'd be back, so I gotta study. Then I can figure out everything and win!

JAP: You're gonna help me study, right, Brother?
FR: Tu vas m'aider à m'exercer, hein, papa#?
OUPS: You're gonna help me study, right, Brother?

JAP: Yeah, sure...
FR: Bien sûr...
OUPS: Yeah, sure...

JAP: You're gonna help me study, right, Brother?
FR: Tu vas m'aider à m'exercer, hein, papa#?
OUPS: You're gonna help me study, right, Brother?

JAP: You appear lost in thought. ...This frightens me.
FR: Tu as l'air perdu dans tes pensées. ... Cela m'inquiète.
OUPS: You appear lost in thought. ...This frightens me.

JAP: It's nothing. Don't worry about it.
FR: Ce n'est rien. Tu n'as pas à t'en faire.
OUPS: It's nothing. Don't worry about it.

JAP: Come on. I need to go ask Popola something.
FR: Viens, j'ai quelque chose à demander à Popola.
OUPS: Come on. I need to go ask Popola something.

JAP: Hmmm...
FR: Hum...
OUPS: Hmmm...

JAP: What's up, Popola?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il Popola#?
OUPS: What's up, Popola?

JAP: Oh, hi, <NIER>. I just got a strange letter in the mail.
FR: Oh, bonjour, <NIER>. Je viens de recevoir une lettre étrange.
OUPS: Oh, hi, <NIER>. I just got a strange letter in the mail.

JAP: That is certainly one bizarre piece of writing.
FR: Quelle singulière missive que voilà#!
OUPS: That is certainly one bizarre piece of writing.

JAP: Yeah, it's strange all right. Who's it from?
FR: Tu as raison, elle est bizarre. Qui te l'a envoyée#?
OUPS: Yeah, it's strange all right. Who's it from?

JAP: The mayor of a small village in the Forest of Myth. It's a wooded area up north.
FR: Le maire du village de la forêt des légendes, au nord d'ici.
OUPS: The mayor of a small village in the Forest of Myth. It's a wooded area up north.

JAP: The Forest of Myth...!?
FR: La forêt des légendes...?!
OUPS: The Forest of Myth...!?

JAP: They're a bright and talkative group of people. Something like this is very out of character for them.
FR: Les habitants sont pourtant de caractère jovial et bavard. Ça ne leur ressemble pas du tout.
OUPS: They're a bright and talkative group of people. Something like this is very out of character for them.

JAP: I have a bad feeling about this...
FR: Je suis inquiète...
OUPS: I have a bad feeling about this...

JAP: I'll check it out.
FR: J'irai voir de quoi il en retourne.
OUPS: I'll check it out.

JAP: Er, you will? But...
FR: Ah bon#? Mais...
OUPS: Er, you will? But...

JAP: Don't worry about it. I've got business there anyway.
FR: Ce n'est rien. Je devais justement m'y rendre.
OUPS: Don't worry about it. I've got business there anyway.

JAP: Oh...well, all right. Thank you.
FR: Oh... Je vois. Je te remercie.
OUPS: Oh...well, all right. Thank you.

JAP: The village is to the north, after you cross the small wooden bridge in the northern plains.
FR: La forêt des légendes est située au nord-est de la plaine septentrionale, au-delà du pont de bois.
OUPS: The village is to the north, after you cross the small wooden bridge in the northern plains.

JAP: The Deathdream is such a strange illness. I'm so happy you saved those people.
FR: Le songe mortel est une maladie bien étrange. Je suis heureuse que vous ayez sauvé les villageois.
OUPS: The Deathdream is such a strange illness. I'm so happy you saved those people.

JAP: Yeah. Dealing with all those words was a pain in the ass.
FR: Avoir à se battre contre des mots est une véritable corvée.
OUPS: Yeah. Dealing with all those words was a pain in the ass.

JAP: Even I, with my natural love for words, have no desire to visit that place ever again.
FR: J'espère vivement ne jamais avoir à revisiter cet endroit, même avec mon inclination naturelle pour la prose.
OUPS: Even I, with my natural love for words, have no desire to visit that place ever again.

JAP: You guys did well.
FR: Vous avez fait du bon travail.
OUPS: You guys did well.

JAP: Ah, <NIER>!
FR: Ah, <NIER>#!
OUPS: Ah, <NIER>!

JAP: Huh?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il, Popola#?
OUPS: Huh?

JAP: I almost forgot. Yonah was looking for you.
FR: J'oubliais presque, Yonah aimerait que tu ailles lui rendre visite.
OUPS: I almost forgot. Yonah was looking for you.

JAP: Oh?
FR: Ah bon#?
OUPS: Oh?

JAP: She said she needed something from you.
FR: Elle a dit qu'elle avait besoin de quelque chose. Elle s'ennuie sûrement de toi. Tu devrais aller la voir.
OUPS: She said she needed something from you.

JAP: Yeah, I guess so. Thanks, Popola.
FR: Tu as raison. Merci, Popola.
OUPS: Yeah, I guess so. Thanks, Popola.

JAP: You guys did well.
FR: Vous avez fait du bon travail.
OUPS: You guys did well.

JAP: She didn't say what it was about, but she looked pretty concerned.
FR: Elle ne m'a pas dit ce qu'elle voulait, mais elle avait l'air inquiète.
OUPS: She didn't say what it was about, but she looked pretty concerned.

JAP: Brother! Yay!
FR: Papa#! Tu es de retour#! Youpi#!
OUPS: Brother! Yay!

JAP: Popola said you needed something?
FR: Popola m'a dit que tu as besoin de quelque chose.
OUPS: Popola said you needed something?

JAP: I need a favor.
FR: J'aimerais que tu me rendes un service.
OUPS: I need a favor.

JAP: What is it?
FR: Quel service#?
OUPS: What is it?

JAP: Um...
FR: Euh...
OUPS: Um...

JAP: Yonah? I can't help if you don't tell me.
FR: Allez, Yonah. Je ne peux pas t'aider si tu ne me dis pas ce que tu veux.
OUPS: Yonah? I can't help if you don't tell me.

JAP: Yeah, I guess...
FR: Je suppose que tu as raison...
OUPS: Yeah, I guess...

JAP: Yonah? Please. Out with it.
FR: S'il te plaît, Yonah. Dis-le-moi.
OUPS: Yonah? Please. Out with it.

JAP: I need you to help my friend!
FR: J'aimerais que tu aides mon ami#!
OUPS: I need you to help my friend!

JAP: Your friend?
FR: Quel ami#?
OUPS: Your friend?

JAP: I have a friend and he sent me a letter and now I need you to help.
FR: L'ami qui m'a envoyé une lettre et qui a besoin de ton aide#!
OUPS: I have a friend and he sent me a letter and now I need you to help.

JAP: Someone wrote you a letter?
FR: Tu as reçu une lettre#?
OUPS: Someone wrote you a letter?

JAP: A pen pal! How delightful!
FR: Tu es en correspondance avec quelqu'un#? Comme c'est charmant#!
OUPS: A pen pal! How delightful!

JAP: So who is this friend?
FR: De qui s'agit-il#?
OUPS: So who is this friend?

JAP: Um, well, he's kinda─
FR: Euh, eh bien, il...
OUPS: Um, well, he's kinda─

JAP: It's a guy!?
FR: C'est un garçon#?!
OUPS: It's a guy!?

JAP: Yes, and he's sick and in a whole lot of trouble!
FR: Oui, et il est malade et il a beaucoup d'ennuis#!
OUPS: Yes, and he's sick and in a whole lot of trouble!

JAP: And I know that you and Weissey are the only ones who can help him!
FR: Et je sais que tu es le seul qui puisse l'aider#! Avec l'aide de Weissounet, bien sûr#!
OUPS: And I know that you and Weissey are the only ones who can help him!

JAP: ...Weissey?
FR: ... Weissounet#?
OUPS: ...Weissey?

JAP: Tell me about this guy.
FR: Parle-moi de ton ami.
OUPS: Tell me about this guy.

JAP: He lives in this really big house down south, and he's super nice, and he's my friend.
FR: Euh, il habite dans une énorme maison au sud du village, il est très gentil et c'est mon ami.
OUPS: He lives in this really big house down south, and he's super nice, and he's my friend.

JAP: You have to help him, Brother! Please?
FR: Tu dois l'aider, papa#! Je t'en supplie#!
OUPS: You have to help him, Brother! Please?

JAP: Yonah, listen...
FR: écoute, Yonah...
OUPS: Yonah, listen...

JAP: Pleeeeeease!?
FR: S'il te plaîîîîîîîît#?
OUPS: Pleeeeeease!?

JAP: Great. Now what do I do?
FR: Oh, bon sang. Que devrais-je faire#?
OUPS: Great. Now what do I do?

JAP: <LIST=2698>I'll do it. I can't say no to her.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=2698>Je ne peux rien lui refuser.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=2698>I'll do it. I can't say no to her.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=2699>No way! She's too young for a boyfriend!</LIST>
FR: <LIST=2699>Non#! Elle est beaucoup trop jeune pour avoir un petit ami#!</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=2699>No way! She's too young for a boyfriend!</LIST>

JAP: Okay. I'll see if I can help.
FR: D'accord, je ferai tout mon possible.
OUPS: Okay. I'll see if I can help.

JAP: Yaaaay! Thank you, Brother! Thank you!
FR: Youpi#! Merci, papa#!
OUPS: Yaaaay! Thank you, Brother! Thank you!

JAP: Yonah, I don't think you should be─
FR: Yonah, tu ne devrais pas...
OUPS: Yonah, I don't think you should be─

JAP: Oh, come ON, Brother! You have to help!
FR: Oh, allez, papa#! Il faut que tu l'aides#!
OUPS: Oh, come ON, Brother! You have to help!

JAP: *Grumble*
FR: *soupir*
OUPS: *Grumble*

JAP: Thanks, Brother!
FR: Merci, papa#!
OUPS: Thanks, Brother!

JAP: ...Great. My kid's got a boyfriend.
FR: ... Merveilleux. Ma fille a un petit ami.
OUPS: ...Great. My kid's got a boyfriend.

JAP: You should tread with caution. This lad may be your future son-in-law.
FR: Tu devrais user de circonspection. Ce jeune homme pourrait être un jour ton gendre.
OUPS: You should tread with caution. This lad may be your future son-in-law.

JAP: Weiss! We are NOT discussing this!
FR: Ça suffit, Weiss#!
OUPS: Weiss! We are NOT discussing this!

JAP: We've been waiting for you.
FR: Nous vous attendions.
OUPS: We've been waiting for you.

JAP: Please, right this way.
FR: Veuillez me suivre, s'il vous plaît.
OUPS: Please, right this way.

JAP: Please wait here.
FR: Veuillez attendre ici.
OUPS: Please wait here.

JAP: Waiting's a bitch. Just lemme know if any Shades show up, okay?
FR: Attendre, toujours attendre... Quelle chierie ! Réveillez-moi si des Ombres se pointent, d'accord ?
OUPS: Waiting's a bitch. Just lemme know if any Shades show up, okay?

JAP: I don't get how she can sleep at a time like this.
FR: Je ne comprends pas comment elle peut dormir dans une telle situation.
OUPS: I don't get how she can sleep at a time like this.

JAP: She must have nerves of pure steel.
FR: Elle doit avoir des nerfs d'acier.
OUPS: She must have nerves of pure steel.

JAP: Uh... Now why don't we head back...?
FR: Euh... Nous devrions sans doute aller retrouver Kainé...
OUPS: Uh... Now why don't we head back...?

JAP: ...Maybe.
FR: ... Peut-être.
OUPS: ...Maybe.

JAP: It's locked.
FR: Elle est fermée à clef.
OUPS: It's locked.

JAP: Hey, where'd Kainé go?
FR: Mais... où est passée Kainé ?
OUPS: Hey, where'd Kainé go?

JAP: I knew this was a terrible idea! Haunted manors and the like... Oh, why does no one ever listen to me!?
FR: Je savais que ce n'était pas une bonne idée ! Un manoir hanté...! Oh, pourquoi personne ne m'écoute jamais ?!
OUPS: I knew this was a terrible idea! Haunted manors and the like... Oh, why does no one ever listen to me!?

JAP: Nice statue. But the expression seems kind of...pained.
FR: Jolie statue. Toutefois, on dirait presque qu'elle souffre...
OUPS: Nice statue. But the expression seems kind of...pained.

JAP: Y-y-yes... Come now! Brave faces! Onward and upward, eh?
FR: Euh, o-oui... Si j'avais un corps, elle me donnerait la chair de poule#!
OUPS: Y-y-yes... Come now! Brave faces! Onward and upward, eh?

JAP: You got all that from my footsteps?
FR: Tu as compris tout ça en m'écoutant marcher ?
OUPS: You got all that from my footsteps?

JAP: It's not hard, once you know how.
FR: Ce n'est pas très difficile, quand on sait comment.
OUPS: It's not hard, once you know how.

JAP: Then I suppose I should tell you about my friend Weiss.
FR: Je suppose que je devrais te présenter Weiss, mon compagnon.
OUPS: Then I suppose I should tell you about my friend Weiss.

JAP: I...I only heard one set of footsteps...
FR: Je... je n'ai entendu les pas que d'une personne...
OUPS: I...I only heard one set of footsteps...

JAP: Grimoire Weiss does not strut about like a common land mammal!
FR: Le Grimoire Weiss ne se pavane pas comme un vulgaire mammifère terrestre !
OUPS: Grimoire Weiss does not strut about like a common land mammal!

JAP: Eek!
FR: Ah#!
OUPS: Eek!

JAP: But enough of this introductory chatter! Let us hear your tale!
FR: Maintenant que nous nous sommes présentés, dis-nous, qui es-tu ?
OUPS: But enough of this introductory chatter! Let us hear your tale!

JAP: My name is Emil. I'm the master of this manor.
FR: Je m'appelle émile. Ce manoir m'appartient.
OUPS: My name is Emil. I'm the master of this manor.

JAP: You the kid who sent a letter to my sister?
FR: C'est toi qui as envoyé une lettre à ma fille ?
OUPS: You the kid who sent a letter to my sister?

JAP: ...Letter? I don't know anything about a letter.
FR: ... Une lettre ? Je ne sais pas de quoi vous parlez.
OUPS: ...Letter? I don't know anything about a letter.

JAP: No, of course not. Such a thing would be far too simple.
FR: Bien sûr que non, ce serait beaucoup trop facile.
OUPS: No, of course not. Such a thing would be far too simple.

JAP: No! Stay back!
FR: Non ! N'approchez pas !
OUPS: No! Stay back!

JAP: Huh?
FR: Hein ?
OUPS: Huh?

JAP: I'm sorry. It's my eyes. Anything I look at gets turned to stone.
FR: Je suis désolé. Mes yeux... Tout ce que je regarde se transforme en pierre.
OUPS: I'm sorry. It's my eyes. Anything I look at gets turned to stone.

JAP: That's why I live with this blindfold.
FR: C'est pourquoi je dois porter ce bandeau.
OUPS: That's why I live with this blindfold.

JAP: What a remarkable skill! I've never heard of such a thing.
FR: Quel talent remarquable ! Je n'ai jamais entendu parler d'un tel pouvoir !
OUPS: What a remarkable skill! I've never heard of such a thing.

JAP: Anyway, um...my butler might know more about the letter you received.
FR: Eh bien... Euh... Mon majordome en saura peut-être plus au sujet de la lettre que vous avez reçue.
OUPS: Anyway, um...my butler might know more about the letter you received.

JAP: My key can unlock any door in the manor, so if you want to follow me...
FR: Ma clef peut ouvrir toutes les portes du manoir, alors vous n'avez qu'à me suivre.
OUPS: My key can unlock any door in the manor, so if you want to follow me...

JAP: That's all right. We can get around on our own.
FR: Ne t'en fais pas. Tu n'as pas besoin de nous accompagner.
OUPS: That's all right. We can get around on our own.

JAP: Oh! Well...um, okay. Here's the key.
FR: Oh ! Euh, d'accord. Voici la clef.
OUPS: Oh! Well...um, okay. Here's the key.

JAP: The butler's quarters are at the far end of the manor.
FR: Le logement de mon majordome est situé à l'arrière du manoir.
OUPS: The butler's quarters are at the far end of the manor.

JAP: Let me give you a map. It's a big place, and I don't want you to get lost.
FR: Tenez, voici le plan de ma demeure. Je ne voudrais pas que vous vous perdiez en chemin.
OUPS: Let me give you a map. It's a big place, and I don't want you to get lost.

JAP: We aren't done talking to him.
FR: Nous n'avons pas terminé notre conversation.
OUPS: We aren't done talking to him.

JAP: The butler's quarters are at the far end of the manor.
FR: Le logement de mon majordome est situé à l'arrière du manoir.
OUPS: The butler's quarters are at the far end of the manor.

JAP: What's that?
FR: Qu'est-ce que c'est#?
OUPS: What's that?

JAP: A butler... Or at least a remarkable likeness of one.
FR: Le majordome... Ou du moins quelque chose qui y ressemble beaucoup.
OUPS: A butler... Or at least a remarkable likeness of one.

JAP: Ah-ha! I KNEW this was a trap! Curse my brilliant intuition.
FR: Ah ha ! Je savais bien que c'était un piège ! Maudite soit mon intuition géniale...
OUPS: Ah-ha! I KNEW this was a trap! Curse my brilliant intuition.

JAP: Whoa.
FR: Ah#!
OUPS: Whoa.

JAP: Is that...another one?
FR: Est-ce... un autre...?
OUPS: Is that...another one?

JAP: Whooooaaahh!
FR: Ooooh !
OUPS: Whooooaaahh!

JAP: Yaaaaahhh!
FR: Aaaah !
OUPS: Yaaaaahhh!

JAP: Gah! It moves!
FR: Ah, il a bougé !
OUPS: Gah! It moves!

JAP: Wh-what's the matter?
FR: Que... que se passe-t-il ?
OUPS: Wh-what's the matter?

JAP: Sir?
FR: Monsieur ?
OUPS: Sir?

JAP: Th-th-th-this...!
FR: Ce... c'est...!
OUPS: Th-th-th-this...!

JAP: Yes, this is my butler. He helps me out around the manor.
FR: Voici mon majordome. Il m'aide à gérer le manoir.
OUPS: Yes, this is my butler. He helps me out around the manor.

JAP: He's a good man at heart, but a bit...inflexible. Almost like a statue.
FR: C'est un homme bon, mais il est un peu rigide. On pourrait même dire que c'est un homme de bronze.
OUPS: He's a good man at heart, but a bit...inflexible. Almost like a statue.

JAP: Yes, and I do apologize for that, Master Emil.
FR: Oui, pardonnez-moi, Monsieur émile.
OUPS: Yes, and I do apologize for that, Master Emil.

JAP: Hmph! I doubt he's even human.
FR: Pfft ! Je doute qu'il soit humain.
OUPS: Hmph! I doubt he's even human.

JAP: Look, someone sent a letter to my sister.
FR: écoutez, quelqu'un a envoyé une lettre à ma fille.
OUPS: Look, someone sent a letter to my sister.

JAP: Mmmm, yes. I wrote the letter. Please forgive my impertinence in sending it.
FR: Hum, oui, c'est moi qui l'ai écrite. Veuillez excuser l'impertinence de cet envoi.
OUPS: Mmmm, yes. I wrote the letter. Please forgive my impertinence in sending it.

JAP: As you may know, Master Emil, deeply pained by his eyes, has shut himself away from
FR: Comme vous le savez probablement déjà, Monsieur émile s'est isolé du monde extérieur
OUPS: As you may know, Master Emil, deeply pained by his eyes, has shut himself away from

JAP: the world.
FR: à cause de ses yeux.
OUPS: the world.

JAP: He suffers greatly behind that blindfold, and I feel it is my duty to help however I can.
FR: Il souffre énormément derrière ce bandeau et il est de mon devoir de lui apporter toute l'aide dont je suis capable.
OUPS: He suffers greatly behind that blindfold, and I feel it is my duty to help however I can.

JAP: I heard tale of your courageous exploits, and so I sent a letter under Master Emil's name...
FR: J'ai entendu parler de vos exploits héroïques, alors je vous ai envoyé une lettre au nom de Monsieur émile...
OUPS: I heard tale of your courageous exploits, and so I sent a letter under Master Emil's name...

JAP: But I received a response from one Miss Yonah instead.
FR: Cependant, c'est une jeune fille dénommée Yonah qui m'a répondu.
OUPS: But I received a response from one Miss Yonah instead.

JAP: So you wrote the letter?
FR: Alors, c'est vous qui avez écrit la lettre#?
OUPS: So you wrote the letter?

JAP: I did, sir.
FR: Oui, monsieur.
OUPS: I did, sir.

JAP: My letter merely requested that you come to the manor. I meant no ill intent.
FR: Ma lettre ne vous demandait que de venir au manoir. Je n'avais pas de mauvaises intentions.
OUPS: My letter merely requested that you come to the manor. I meant no ill intent.

JAP: I believe Yonah saw the exchange somewhat differently.
FR: Yonah n'a pas interprété votre correspondance de cette façon.
OUPS: I believe Yonah saw the exchange somewhat differently.

JAP: She's just a kid. She probably didn't understand what was going on.
FR: Elle est encore bien jeune. Elle n'a pas dû comprendre ce qui se passait.
OUPS: She's just a kid. She probably didn't understand what was going on.

JAP: Regardless, I am quite pleased to see you here. Long have I dreamed of the day when we could cure Master Emil's eyes.
FR: Quoi qu'il en soit, je suis heureux que vous soyez venu. Je rêve de pouvoir guérir Monsieur émile depuis si longtemps.
OUPS: Regardless, I am quite pleased to see you here. Long have I dreamed of the day when we could cure Master Emil's eyes.

JAP: I think you want a doctor. I'm just a big guy who kills things.
FR: C'est d'un médecin dont vous avez besoin. Je ne suis qu'un type râblé qui tue des monstres.
OUPS: I think you want a doctor. I'm just a big guy who kills things.

JAP: Couldn't have said it any better myself! Well, off we go then—
FR: Je n'aurais pas pu mieux te décrire moi-même !
OUPS: Couldn't have said it any better myself! Well, off we go then—

JAP: Please! We are so close! The cure for Master Emil's condition is located in this very manor!
FR: Bien, partons !
OUPS: Please! We are so close! The cure for Master Emil's condition is located in this very manor!

JAP: So why don't you just go get it?
FR: Je vous en supplie ! Nous y sommes presque ! Le remède qui guérira Monsieur émile est dans ce manoir !
OUPS: So why don't you just go get it?

JAP: The location of the cure has become a den for those abominable Shades,
FR: Alors, pourquoi ne pas simplement aller le chercher ?
OUPS: The location of the cure has become a den for those abominable Shades,

JAP: and I lack the skill to combat them.
FR: Il se trouve dans un endroit infesté par ces horribles Ombres et je ne possède pas les capacités nécessaires pour les combattre.
OUPS: and I lack the skill to combat them.

JAP: I beg of you: Defeat these Shades and restore Master Emil's sight!
FR: Je vous en conjure, éliminez ces Ombres et rendez la vue à Monsieur émile !
OUPS: I beg of you: Defeat these Shades and restore Master Emil's sight!
