JAP: You know this is an impossible task! Why would you ask it of our guests?
FR: Tu sais pourtant qu'il s'agit d'une tâche impossible ! Pourquoi demander à nos invités de l'entreprendre ?
OUPS: You know this is an impossible task! Why would you ask it of our guests?

JAP: Well, we've no more time to waste—
FR: Bien, nous n'avons pas plus de temps à perdre...
OUPS: Well, we've no more time to waste—

JAP: We'll do it.
FR: Nous acceptons.
OUPS: We'll do it.

JAP: ...We will?
FR: ... Ah bon#?
OUPS: ...We will?

JAP: The more Shades we kill, the better Yonah's chances. Plus, we have to find Kainé anyway.
FR: Plus nous tuons d'Ombres, plus Yonah a de chances de survivre. De toute façon, nous devons retrouver Kainé.
OUPS: The more Shades we kill, the better Yonah's chances. Plus, we have to find Kainé anyway.

JAP: A thousand thank-yous! I owe you a debt that can never be repaid.
FR: Mille mercis#! Je serai toujours votre débiteur#!
OUPS: A thousand thank-yous! I owe you a debt that can never be repaid.

JAP: A thousand thanks to all of you.
FR: Mille mercis !
OUPS: A thousand thanks to all of you.

JAP: Oh no! This passage is written in some kind of code.
FR: Oh, non ! Ce passage est écrit en code.
OUPS: Oh no! This passage is written in some kind of code.

JAP: We went through all this trouble to find it, and now...
FR: Nous nous sommes donné tant de mal pour le trouver, et maintenant...
OUPS: We went through all this trouble to find it, and now...

JAP: Oh, look. Jeeves is back.
FR: Oh, regardez. Revoilà le fidèle majordome.
OUPS: Oh, look. Jeeves is back.

JAP: Please allow me to handle this, Master Emil.
FR: Je vous en prie, laissez-moi m'en charger, Monsieur émile.
OUPS: Please allow me to handle this, Master Emil.

JAP: I shall put all of my efforts into deconstructing this cipher!
FR: Je m'appliquerai à déchiffrer ce code !
OUPS: I shall put all of my efforts into deconstructing this cipher!

JAP: No matter how long it takes, I will not fail!
FR: Je continuerai jusqu'à ce que je réussisse, quoi qu'il arrive !
OUPS: No matter how long it takes, I will not fail!

JAP: Sebastian...
FR: Sébastien...
OUPS: Sebastian...

JAP: Ah! So the servant has a name after all!
FR: Ah ! Le serviteur a un nom après tout !
OUPS: Ah! So the servant has a name after all!

JAP: Kainé!
FR: Kainé !
OUPS: Kainé!

JAP: Kainé, I promise I'll never give up!  But you can't give up either!
FR: Kainé, je n'abandonnerai jamais, je te le promets ! Mais tu ne dois pas renoncer toi non plus#!
OUPS: Kainé, I promise I'll never give up!  But you can't give up either!

JAP: Well, we're off.
FR: Bien, partons.
OUPS: Well, we're off.

JAP: Bye!
FR: Au revoir !
OUPS: Bye!

JAP: Listen. Yonah's sick, and she doesn't have a lot of friends. If you could send more letters, I'm sure she'd appreciate it.
FR: écoutez, Yonah est malade et elle n'a pas beaucoup d'amis. Je suis certain qu'elle serait ravie de recevoir d'autres lettres de son correspondant...
OUPS: Listen. Yonah's sick, and she doesn't have a lot of friends. If you could send more letters, I'm sure she'd appreciate it.

JAP: I would be delighted, sir.
FR: Je le ferai volontiers.
OUPS: I would be delighted, sir.

JAP: Bye, everyone! Thank you!
FR: Au revoir ! Merci !
OUPS: Bye, everyone! Thank you!

JAP: Hang in there. Next time we meet, perhaps I'll be able to look you in the eye.
FR: Bon courage. Je pourrai peut-être te regarder dans les yeux lors de notre prochaine rencontre.
OUPS: Hang in there. Next time we meet, perhaps I'll be able to look you in the eye.

JAP: Oh, you're back!
FR: Oh, vous êtes revenus !
OUPS: Oh, you're back!

JAP: How's it going?
FR: Comment vas-tu ?
OUPS: How's it going?

JAP: It's weird. I wake up every day just happy to be alive. I've never felt like this before!
FR: C'est étrange. Je me réveille chaque matin heureux d'être en vie. Je ne me suis jamais senti ainsi !
OUPS: It's weird. I wake up every day just happy to be alive. I've never felt like this before!

JAP: Deciphering the petrification cure is hard work, but it's kinda fun, too!
FR: Déchiffrer le remède contre la pétrification est difficile, mais c'est aussi parfois amusant !
OUPS: Deciphering the petrification cure is hard work, but it's kinda fun, too!

JAP: Oh, it does this old tome good to hear that! Soon you'll be living life to the fullest!
FR: Oh, ce vieux tome est heureux de l'entendre ! Tu auras bientôt une vie bien remplie !
OUPS: Oh, it does this old tome good to hear that! Soon you'll be living life to the fullest!

JAP: ...So this is life, huh?
FR: ... Alors, c'est ça « vivre » ?
OUPS: ...So this is life, huh?

JAP: You look good, kid. Right, Kainé?
FR: Tu as bonne mine, petit. N'est-ce pas, Kainé ?
OUPS: You look good, kid. Right, Kainé?

JAP: Yeah, he's really taken off the diapers.
FR: Ouaip, il s'est débarrassé de sa couche.
OUPS: Yeah, he's really taken off the diapers.

JAP: H-hey! I don't wear diapers! Don't say things like that!
FR: Hé ! Je ne porte pas de couche ! Ne dis pas des choses pareilles !
OUPS: H-hey! I don't wear diapers! Don't say things like that!

JAP: Yonah, come. You need your rest.
FR: Allez, Yonah. Tu dois te reposer.
OUPS: Yonah, come. You need your rest.

JAP: I'm sorry.
FR: Je suis désolée.
OUPS: I'm sorry.

JAP: Popola, her cough is getting worse.
FR: Popola, sa toux a empiré.
OUPS: Popola, her cough is getting worse.

JAP: Oh, that's not good.
FR: Oh, c'est inquiétant.
OUPS: Oh, that's not good.

JAP: I need more medicine. Please.
FR: S'il te plaît, j'ai encore besoin de médicaments.
OUPS: I need more medicine. Please.

JAP: The thing is...I actually just ran out.
FR: Malheureusement, je n'en ai plus.
OUPS: The thing is...I actually just ran out.

JAP: I hate to ask this, but can you get me some vapor moss?
FR: Pourrais-tu aller ramasser de la mousse vaporeuse pour moi ?
OUPS: I hate to ask this, but can you get me some vapor moss?

JAP: You'll find it growing near the southern gate.
FR: Elle pousse près de la porte du sud.
OUPS: You'll find it growing near the southern gate.

JAP: You said vapor moss, right?
FR: De la mousse vaporeuse, c'est ça ?
OUPS: You said vapor moss, right?

JAP: I'll be right back.
FR: Je reviens tout de suite.
OUPS: I'll be right back.

JAP: *Huff...huff...huff...*
FR: Ooh...
OUPS: *Huff...huff...huff...*

JAP: Emil!?
FR: émile ?!
OUPS: Emil!?

JAP: What is it!? What happened!?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il ?! Que s'est-il passé ?!
OUPS: What is it!? What happened!?

JAP: H-hurry...
FR: Vi-vite...
OUPS: H-hurry...

JAP: I hate to ask this, but can you get me some vapor moss?
FR: Pourrais-tu aller ramasser de la mousse vaporeuse pour moi ?
OUPS: I hate to ask this, but can you get me some vapor moss?

JAP: You'll find vapor moss growing near the southern gate.
FR: La mousse vaporeuse pousse près de la porte du sud.
OUPS: You'll find vapor moss growing near the southern gate.

JAP: I'm sorry I cough all the time, Brother.
FR: Je suis désolée de tousser tout le temps, papa.
OUPS: I'm sorry I cough all the time, Brother.

JAP: He doesn't appear injured. I think it's just fatigue.
FR: Il n'a pas l'air blessé. Je crois que ce n'est que de la fatigue.
OUPS: He doesn't appear injured. I think it's just fatigue.

JAP: I can't imagine how hard it is to run all this way without sight.
FR: Je n'arrive pas à imaginer à quel point ce fut difficile pour un aveugle comme lui de parvenir jusqu'ici.
OUPS: I can't imagine how hard it is to run all this way without sight.

JAP: Uuuugh...
FR: Ooooh...
OUPS: Uuuugh...

JAP: Are you all right, Emil?
FR: Ça va, émile ?
OUPS: Are you all right, Emil?

JAP: I can...see it.
FR: Je... le vois.
OUPS: I can...see it.

JAP: Enough. Don't talk.
FR: Arrête, ne parle pas.
OUPS: Enough. Don't talk.

JAP: The air... It's vibrating...
FR: L'air... Il vibre...
OUPS: The air... It's vibrating...

JAP: I can feel it behind my eyes...
FR: Je le sens derrière mes yeux...
OUPS: I can feel it behind my eyes...

JAP: So much pressure... Oh god, there's so many of them.
FR: Tant de pression... Oh, elles sont si nombreuses.
OUPS: So much pressure... Oh god, there's so many of them.

JAP: So many what?
FR: De quoi parles-tu ?
OUPS: So many what?

JAP: Get out. Get out of the village. ...The Shades are coming.
FR: Fuyez. Sortez du village... Les Ombres arrivent.
OUPS: Get out. Get out of the village. ...The Shades are coming.

JAP: They're here!
FR: Dehors !
OUPS: They're here!

JAP: Outside! Now!
FR: Tout de suite !
OUPS: Outside! Now!

JAP: The hell's going on!?
FR: Mais qu'est-ce qui se passe ?!
OUPS: The hell's going on!?

JAP: No time! Get everyone into the library!
FR: Pas de temps à perdre ! Rassemble tous les villageois dans la bibliothèque !
OUPS: No time! Get everyone into the library!

JAP: Someone make sure Yonah's safe!
FR: Que quelqu'un s'occupe de Yonah !
OUPS: Someone make sure Yonah's safe!

JAP: Don't worry! I'll go and get her!
FR: Ne t'inquiète pas, je vais aller la chercher !
OUPS: Don't worry! I'll go and get her!

JAP: Just don't get yourself killed, all right?
FR: Sois prudent, d'accord ?
OUPS: Just don't get yourself killed, all right?

JAP: Go, Devola. Hurry!
FR: Allons, Devola, dépêche-toi !
OUPS: Go, Devola. Hurry!

JAP: Don't worry! I'll go and get her!
FR: Ne t'inquiète pas, je vais aller la chercher !
OUPS: Don't worry! I'll go and get her!

JAP: Just don't get yourself killed, all right?
FR: Sois prudent, d'accord ?
OUPS: Just don't get yourself killed, all right?

JAP: Go, Devola. Hurry!
FR: Allons, Devola, dépêche-toi !
OUPS: Go, Devola. Hurry!

JAP: Shit!
FR: Bordel de merde !
OUPS: Shit!

JAP: No!
FR: Aaah !
OUPS: No!

JAP: Hold on, Yonah! I'm coming!
FR: Tiens bon, Yonah ! J'arrive !
OUPS: Hold on, Yonah! I'm coming!

JAP: <LIST=1373>Petrify Kainé and seal away the Shade.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1373>Pétrifier Kainé et sceller l'Ombre.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1373>Petrify Kainé and seal away the Shade.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1374>Do nothing and be annihilated.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1374>Ne rien faire et être anéantis.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1374>Do nothing and be annihilated.</LIST>

JAP: Goddammit! We don't have a choice!
FR: Bordel de merde ! On a pas le choix !
OUPS: Goddammit! We don't have a choice!

JAP: I don't have time for sightseeing.
FR: Ce n'est pas le moment d'errer sans but.
OUPS: I don't have time for sightseeing.

JAP: I don't need to go out quite yet.
FR: Je n'ai pas besoin de sortir du village.
OUPS: I don't need to go out quite yet.

JAP: She couldn't have left the village...
FR: Elle ne pourrait pas avoir quitté le village...
OUPS: She couldn't have left the village...

JAP: I think Popola said to head east...
FR: Je crois que Popola a dit d'aller vers l'est...
OUPS: I think Popola said to head east...

JAP: I'd better look around town some more.
FR: Je devrais fouiller la ville.
OUPS: I'd better look around town some more.

JAP: I need to gather more info from the villagers.
FR: Je dois interroger les villageois et obtenir plus d'informations.
OUPS: I need to gather more info from the villagers.

JAP: I need to kill all the Shades first.
FR: Je dois d'abord me débarrasser des Ombres.
OUPS: I need to kill all the Shades first.

JAP: I can't get in yet...
FR: Je ne peux pas encore y entrer.
OUPS: I can't get in yet...

JAP: This place is lousy with Shades. There's got to be a Sealed Verse nearby.
FR: Cet endroit fourmille d'Ombres. Il doit y avoir un vers scellé dans les environs.
OUPS: This place is lousy with Shades. There's got to be a Sealed Verse nearby.

JAP: This isn't where I need to be going.
FR: Ce n'est pas l'endroit où je dois aller.
OUPS: This isn't where I need to be going.

JAP: I don't think you can venture in here again.
FR: Je ne crois pas que tu puisses pénétrer de nouveau en cet endroit.
OUPS: I don't think you can venture in here again.

JAP: ......I hear a voice.
FR: ... J'entends une voix.
OUPS: ......I hear a voice.

JAP: I squint and see a boy standing before me. His hair is silver, his skin is pale, and he stares up at me with hard, glassy eyes.
FR: Je me retourne et j'aperçois un garçon aux cheveux argentés près de moi. Son visage pâle et son regard morne sont dénués de toute expression.
OUPS: I squint and see a boy standing before me. His hair is silver, his skin is pale, and he stares up at me with hard, glassy eyes.

JAP: Soon his lips begin to move, but no sound comes out. What is he saying? I can't hear him. I can't hear him. I can't hear him I can't hear him I can't I can't I can't
FR: Ses lèvres se mettent soudain à remuer, mais aucun son ne s'en échappe. Que dit-il#? Je ne l'entends pas. Je ne l'entends pas. Je ne l'entends pas. Je ne l'entends pas.
OUPS: Soon his lips begin to move, but no sound comes out. What is he saying? I can't hear him. I can't hear him. I can't hear him I can't hear him I can't I can't I can't

JAP: I try to leave, but something about the boy holds my gaze. I watch his face, expressionless, as his lips slowly flutter.
FR: Je tente de partir. Cependant, je n'arrive pas à quitter le garçon des yeux. J'examine son visage placide et le lent mouvement de ses lèvres.
OUPS: I try to leave, but something about the boy holds my gaze. I watch his face, expressionless, as his lips slowly flutter.

JAP: What is he trying to say?
FR: Qu'essaie-t-il de me dire#?
OUPS: What is he trying to say?

JAP: Wait. It's a phrase. I can almost make it out. It starts with an "s"... Then there's an "e"...
FR: ...#Un instant, ce sont deux mots distincts. Je peux presque les comprendre. Le premier commence par «#v#» et le deuxième par «#s#»...
OUPS: Wait. It's a phrase. I can almost make it out. It starts with an "s"... Then there's an "e"...

JAP: I can almost see it now. The letters begin to fall together, one after the other, faster and faster.
FR: J'y suis presque. Les lettres s'alignent les unes après les autres, de plus en plus rapidment...
OUPS: I can almost see it now. The letters begin to fall together, one after the other, faster and faster.

JAP: S-E-A-L-E-D V-E-R-S-E
FR: V<WAIT=0.3>-E<WAIT=0.3>-R<WAIT=0.3>-S<WAIT=0.5> S<WAIT=0.3>-C<WAIT=0.3>-E<WAIT=0.3>-L<WAIT=0.3>-L<WAIT=0.3>-é
OUPS: S-E-A-L-E-D V-E-R-S-E

JAP: Oh my god. It's a Sealed Verse. The thing I am looking for, the key to saving Yonah. I stare at the boy with renewed ferocity, trying desperately to make out his next word.
FR: Un vers scellé. Ce que je cherche, ce qui me permettra de sauver ma fille... Je dévore le garçon du regard, essayant désespérément de déchiffrer le prochain mot.
OUPS: Oh my god. It's a Sealed Verse. The thing I am looking for, the key to saving Yonah. I stare at the boy with renewed ferocity, trying desperately to make out his next word.

JAP: D-R-E-A-M
FR: R<WAIT=0.3>-Ê<WAIT=0.3>-V<WAIT=0.3>-E
OUPS: D-R-E-A-M

JAP: Dream? What? What the hell does that mean?
FR: Un rêve#? Qu'est-ce que ça peut bien vouloir dire#?
OUPS: Dream? What? What the hell does that mean?

JAP: The lips move again, faster now.
FR: Ses lèvres bougent de nouveau, plus rapidement... Je n'arrive plus à les suivre. Bon sang#! Je ne comprends pas#!
OUPS: The lips move again, faster now.

JAP: I can't follow them. Dammit! I can't make it out!
FR: Je veux crier. Je veux démolir les murs invisibles qui m'entourent. Toutefois, je me force à me calmer. Je peux le faire. Pour Yonah. Pour elle. Lentement, si lentement, je parviens à comprendre les lettres des derniers mots.
OUPS: I can't follow them. Dammit! I can't make it out!

JAP: I want to scream. I want to tear the walls down around me. But instead, I force myself to be calm. I can do this. I can do it for Yonah. Slowly, ever so slowly, I parse out the letters that make up his final words...
OUPS: I want to scream. I want to tear the walls down around me. But instead, I force myself to be calm. I can do this. I can do it for Yonah. Slowly, ever so slowly, I parse out the letters that make up his final words...

JAP: F-O-R-E-S-T <WAIT=0.5>O-F <WAIT=0.5>M-Y-T-H
FR: F<WAIT=0.3>-O<WAIT=0.3>-R<WAIT=0.3>-Ê<WAIT=0.3>-T <WAIT=0.5>D<WAIT=0.3>-E<WAIT=0.3>-S <WAIT=0.5>L<WAIT=0.3>-é<WAIT=0.3>-G<WAIT=0.3>-E<WAIT=0.3>-N<WAIT=0.3>-D<WAIT=0.3>-E<WAIT=0.3>-S
OUPS: F-O-R-E-S-T <WAIT=0.5>O-F <WAIT=0.5>M-Y-T-H

JAP: Ah, good! Just the man I needed!
FR: Ah, justement l'homme dont j'avais besoin#!
OUPS: Ah, good! Just the man I needed!

JAP: Could you gather two medicinal herbs from the northern plains for me?<PAGE> I've been exhausted lately and I need a boost.
FR: Pourrais-tu aller cueillir deux herbes médicinales pour moi#? Elles sauraient alléger la fatigue qui m'accable depuis quelques jours.
OUPS: Could you gather two medicinal herbs from the northern plains for me?<PAGE> I've been exhausted lately and I need a boost.

JAP: They usually grow in patches of grass or by the base of trees. I don't think they'll be too hard to find.
FR: Elles poussent habituellement dans des touffes d'herbe ou au pied des arbres. Tu devrais pouvoir en trouver sans problème.
OUPS: They usually grow in patches of grass or by the base of trees. I don't think they'll be too hard to find.

JAP: Two medicinal herbs? You got it. Just take it easy until I get back.
FR: Deux herbes médicinales, c'est ça#? Entendu. Essaie de te reposer jusqu'à mon retour.
OUPS: Two medicinal herbs? You got it. Just take it easy until I get back.

JAP: Thanks for securing those herbs for me. I must be getting old if I need this stuff!
FR: Ah, des herbes médicinales#! Merci. J'en utilise beaucoup ces temps-ci. Je dois me faire vieille#!
OUPS: Thanks for securing those herbs for me. I must be getting old if I need this stuff!

JAP: Herbs usually grow in thick grass or by trees. I wouldn't think they'd be too hard to find.
FR: Les herbes médicinales poussent habituellement dans des touffes d'herbe ou au pied des arbres. Il n'est pas très difficile d'en trouver.
OUPS: Herbs usually grow in thick grass or by trees. I wouldn't think they'd be too hard to find.

JAP: Excuse me! Hey, can I ask you a favor?<PAGE>I'm currently on duty, so I need someone to relay a message for me.
FR: Excuse-moi#! Pourrais-tu me rendre un service#?<PAGE>Pourrais-tu transmettre un message de ma part#? Je ne peux pas quitter mon poste, vois-tu...
OUPS: Excuse me! Hey, can I ask you a favor?<PAGE>I'm currently on duty, so I need someone to relay a message for me.

JAP: I ordered some training weapons from the blacksmith's wife, but they still haven't arrived. Can you go to the shopping district and ask her to send them over?
FR: J'ai commandé des armes d'entraînement, mais je ne les ai toujours pas reçues. Pourrais-tu aller demander à la femme de l'armurier qu'elle me les envoie#?
OUPS: I ordered some training weapons from the blacksmith's wife, but they still haven't arrived. Can you go to the shopping district and ask her to send them over?

JAP: Ah, good. Be sure to talk to the blacksmith's wife for me, then.
FR: Ah, merci. Transmets mon message à la femme de l'armurier, d'accord#?
OUPS: Ah, good. Be sure to talk to the blacksmith's wife for me, then.

JAP: The guard at the northern gate says he ordered some weapons from you. Any idea where they are?
FR: Le garde de la porte du nord dit qu'il n'a toujours pas reçu les armes qu'il avait commandées. Sont-elles prêtes#?
OUPS: The guard at the northern gate says he ordered some weapons from you. Any idea where they are?

JAP: The guard at the northern gate? ...Oh, you mean the one that always smells so nice!<PAGE>Now if I could just take his scent and match it with the body of that guard at the eastern gate... Graaawl!<PAGE>...Huh? Oh, right! The weapons! Sorry, I was daydreaming there. Yes, I'll deliver them as soon as I can.
FR: Le garde de la porte du nord...? Oh, celui qui sent toujours si bon#! Ah, s'il possédait aussi le corps musclé du garde de la porte de l'est, je ne pourrais pas lui résister...!<PAGE>... Hein#? Oh, euh, oui, les armes#! Désolée, je rêvassais. Je vais les lui livrer dès que possible.
OUPS: The guard at the northern gate? ...Oh, you mean the one that always smells so nice!<PAGE>Now if I could just take his scent and match it with the body of that guard at the eastern gate... Graaawl!<PAGE>...Huh? Oh, right! The weapons! Sorry, I was daydreaming there. Yes, I'll deliver them as soon as I can.

JAP: Here's a bit of a payment for you.
FR: Tiens, c'est pour te remercier.
OUPS: Here's a bit of a payment for you.

JAP: Did you ask the blacksmith's wife to send the things I asked for yet?
FR: As-tu demandé à la femme de l'armurier qu'elle m'envoie mes armes#?
OUPS: Did you ask the blacksmith's wife to send the things I asked for yet?

JAP: Hey, do you have a second?<PAGE>I owe a man a favor, but I'm too busy right now. Can you go over there and help him out?
FR: Dis, tu as une minute#?<PAGE>J'ai promis à quelqu'un de lui rendre service, mais je suis trop occupée actuellement. Pourrais-tu aller lui donner un coup de main#?
OUPS: Hey, do you have a second?<PAGE>I owe a man a favor, but I'm too busy right now. Can you go over there and help him out?

JAP: Sure.
FR: Bien sûr.
OUPS: Sure.

JAP: Oh, thank you. It's the man who runs the item shop in the shopping district. He's a really nice guy, so just walk up and tell him you're there for me.
FR: Merci. C'est l'apothicaire du marché. Il est très aimable. Tu n'as qu'à lui dire que je t'envoie.
OUPS: Oh, thank you. It's the man who runs the item shop in the shopping district. He's a really nice guy, so just walk up and tell him you're there for me.

JAP: Remember, it's the man who runs the item shop in the shopping district. Just walk up and tell him you're there for me.
FR: N'oublie pas, c'est l'apothicaire du marché. Dis-lui que je t'envoie.
OUPS: Remember, it's the man who runs the item shop in the shopping district. Just walk up and tell him you're there for me.

JAP: Are you all right? You don't look too happy.
FR: Vous avez besoin d'aide#?
OUPS: Are you all right? You don't look too happy.

JAP: Yeah, I'm in a bit of a pickle. Listen, you know about the chickens we keep in the village, right?
FR: Ouaip#! Tu veux me donner un coup de main#? Bah, j'imagine que tu feras l'affaire.<PAGE>Tu sais que nous élevons des poules dans le village, n'est-ce pas#?
OUPS: Yeah, I'm in a bit of a pickle. Listen, you know about the chickens we keep in the village, right?

JAP: Lately their eggs have been disappearing. At first I thought there was a thief, but now I think the hens are just hiding them.<PAGE>I guess I can't blame 'em, but the village really needs those eggs!
FR: Eh bien, ces derniers temps, leurs œufs disparaissent#! D'abord, je pensais que c'était la faute d'un voleur, mais maintenant je crois plutôt que ce sont les poules qui les cachent.<PAGE>On ne peut pas vraiment leur en vouloir, mais le village a vraiment besoin de leurs œufs#!
OUPS: Lately their eggs have been disappearing. At first I thought there was a thief, but now I think the hens are just hiding them.<PAGE>I guess I can't blame 'em, but the village really needs those eggs!

JAP: I need you to find the hiding spots and bring me an egg. That work for you?
FR: J'aimerais que tu trouves leur cachette et que tu me rapportes un œuf. Penses-tu pouvoir m'aider#?
OUPS: I need you to find the hiding spots and bring me an egg. That work for you?

JAP: You're looking for a chicken egg? I saw one hidden in the shadows once!
FR: Tu cherches un œuf de poule#? L'autre jour, j'en ai vu un, caché à l'ombre#!
OUPS: You're looking for a chicken egg? I saw one hidden in the shadows once!

JAP: There are shadows everywhere. That doesn't really narrow it down.
FR: Il y a de l'ombre partout. Ça ne m'aide pas beaucoup...
OUPS: There are shadows everywhere. That doesn't really narrow it down.

JAP: Hidin' eggs, eh? Heh heh! I never woulda thunk it!<PAGE>Well, I know them chickens like to hang around the fountain by the library. Maybe you should start there.
FR: Les poules cachent leurs œufs#? Ha, ha, ha#! Qui l'eût cru#!<PAGE>Hum, je sais que les poules aiment se promener près de la fontaine devant la bibliothèque. Ce pourrait être un bon point de départ.
OUPS: Hidin' eggs, eh? Heh heh! I never woulda thunk it!<PAGE>Well, I know them chickens like to hang around the fountain by the library. Maybe you should start there.

JAP: The fountain, huh? Yeah, I suppose it's worth a look. Thanks.
FR: La fontaine...? Hum, je devrais peut-être y jeter un coup d'œil. Merci#!
OUPS: The fountain, huh? Yeah, I suppose it's worth a look. Thanks.

JAP: Look at that. ...I can't believe chickens went to all this trouble.
FR: Eh bien#! Je n'arrive pas à croire que des poules puissent se donner tant de mal...!
OUPS: Look at that. ...I can't believe chickens went to all this trouble.

JAP: I found an egg.
FR: J'ai trouvé un œuf.
OUPS: I found an egg.

JAP: Oh, that's great!
FR: Oh, merveilleux#!
OUPS: Oh, that's great!

JAP: It was behind the broken wall by the fountain. I guess the chickens like to hide 'em in out-of-the-way places.
FR: Il était derrière un des pilliers de l'arche en ruine près de la fontaine devant la bibliothèque.<PAGE>Je suppose que les poules aiment les dissimuler dans des endroits à l'écart.
OUPS: It was behind the broken wall by the fountain. I guess the chickens like to hide 'em in out-of-the-way places.

JAP: Well, then that's the first place I'll look next time! Here's your payment. Thanks again!
FR: La prochaine fois, j'irai d'abord vérifier leur cachette#! Voici ta récompense. Merci encore#!
OUPS: Well, then that's the first place I'll look next time! Here's your payment. Thanks again!

JAP: Retrieving the eggs used to be a cinch... I guess the mother hen's fed up.<PAGE>Still, I can't believe I've been outsmarted by a hen! I'm never gonna live this down.
FR: Avant, je pouvais récupérer les œufs si facilement...! Mais je suppose que les poules en avaient assez.<PAGE>Elles se sont montrées plus malignes que moi#! Quelle honte...
OUPS: Retrieving the eggs used to be a cinch... I guess the mother hen's fed up.<PAGE>Still, I can't believe I've been outsmarted by a hen! I'm never gonna live this down.

JAP: I suppose children are as important to animals as they are to men.
FR: J'imagine que les poules tiennent à leur progéniture autant que nous.
OUPS: I suppose children are as important to animals as they are to men.

JAP: Keeping livestock isn't as easy as it used to be, that's for sure...
FR: Il n'est pas facile d'élever des animaux de nos jours.
OUPS: Keeping livestock isn't as easy as it used to be, that's for sure...

JAP: Ah, you're just who I needed! Could I ask you to handle some work for me?
FR: Ah, justement l'homme dont j'avais besoin#! Pourrais-je te demander un service#?
OUPS: Ah, you're just who I needed! Could I ask you to handle some work for me?

JAP: Sure. Go ahead.
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: Sure. Go ahead.

JAP: My children want to eat mutton every night, and I keep running out. And I certainly don't have time to hunt a bunch of sheep!
FR: Mes enfants veulent manger du mouton chaque soir, mais je n'en ai pas assez#! Je n'ai pas le temps d'aller à la chasse non plus#!
OUPS: My children want to eat mutton every night, and I keep running out. And I certainly don't have time to hunt a bunch of sheep!

JAP: Look, if you can get me ten pieces of mutton, I'll pay you higher than market value. How's that sound?
FR: écoute, si tu me rapportes dix gigots de mouton, je te paierai au prix fort. Qu'en dis-tu#?
OUPS: Look, if you can get me ten pieces of mutton, I'll pay you higher than market value. How's that sound?

JAP: Sounds like a deal.
FR: J'accepte.
OUPS: Sounds like a deal.

JAP: Here's your mutton.
FR: Voilà votre mouton.
OUPS: Here's your mutton.

JAP: Oh, thank you! I swear, these children of mine are going to eat me out of house and home.<PAGE>And remember, if you collect more, I'll buy it!
FR: Oh, merci beaucoup#! Mes enfants ont des appétits d'ogre#!<PAGE>N'oublie pas, j'achèterai tout le mouton que tu as#!
OUPS: Oh, thank you! I swear, these children of mine are going to eat me out of house and home.<PAGE>And remember, if you collect more, I'll buy it!

JAP: Please get that mutton. My kids are driving me crazy!
FR: Je t'en prie, apporte-moi du mouton#! Mes enfants vont me rendre folle#!
OUPS: Please get that mutton. My kids are driving me crazy!

JAP: Oh, hello! What perfect timing! Can I ask you to go buy something for me?
FR: Oh, bonjour#! Tu tombes pile. J'aimerais que tu te procures quelque chose pour moi.
OUPS: Oh, hello! What perfect timing! Can I ask you to go buy something for me?

JAP: Sure. What do you need?
FR: De quoi s'agit-il#?
OUPS: Sure. What do you need?

JAP: I need three tulip bulbs. They only sell them in Seafront, so it'll be a bit of a hike.
FR: J'ai besoin de trois bulbes de tulipe et on n'en vend qu'à Littoral. Je sais que ce n'est pas tout près, mais...
OUPS: I need three tulip bulbs. They only sell them in Seafront, so it'll be a bit of a hike.

JAP: Here's the tulip bulbs. You gonna start a garden or something?
FR: Voici les bulbes de tulipe dont vous aviez besoin. Vous allez les planter dans votre jardin, c'est ça#?
OUPS: Here's the tulip bulbs. You gonna start a garden or something?

JAP: Oh, no. I just eat them.
FR: Oh non. Je vais les manger.
OUPS: Oh, no. I just eat them.

JAP: Boil 'em, crush 'em up, throw a little salt and pepper on there... Delicious! Lemme know next time you're hungry and I'll whip some up.
FR: Je fais bouillir les bulbes, puis je les écrase avec un peu de sel et de poivre... Ils sont délicieux#! La prochaine fois que tu as un petit creux, fais-moi signe#! J'en préparerai exprès pour toi.
OUPS: Boil 'em, crush 'em up, throw a little salt and pepper on there... Delicious! Lemme know next time you're hungry and I'll whip some up.

JAP: You'd be surprised how tasty flower bulbs can be, you know.
FR: C'est sans doute difficile à croire, mais certains bulbes de fleurs sont tout à fait savoureux#!
OUPS: You'd be surprised how tasty flower bulbs can be, you know.

JAP: Hey there. You mind giving me a hand with this?
FR: Bonjour#! Que dirais-tu de me donner un coup de main#?
OUPS: Hey there. You mind giving me a hand with this?

JAP: Sure. What's up?
FR: Pourquoi pas#? Comment puis-je vous être utile#?
OUPS: Sure. What's up?

JAP: Popola asked me to organize her bookshelves, but it's kind of a big job. I'm hoping you can take care of a few of them.
FR: Popola m'a demandé de mettre de l'ordre dans la bibliothèque, mais il y a tant de livres...! Pourrais-tu en ranger quelques-uns pour moi#?
OUPS: Popola asked me to organize her bookshelves, but it's kind of a big job. I'm hoping you can take care of a few of them.

JAP: Here. This book goes in the second shelf from the left on the east side of the second floor.
FR: Tiens, ce livre est censé être sur la deuxième étagère à partir de la gauche sur le mur est du premier étage.
OUPS: Here. This book goes in the second shelf from the left on the east side of the second floor.

JAP: That should do it.
FR: Et voilà.
OUPS: That should do it.

JAP: Take that book to the second shelf from the left on the east side of the second floor.
FR: Range le livre sur la deuxième étagère à partir de la gauche sur le mur est du premier étage.
OUPS: Take that book to the second shelf from the left on the east side of the second floor.

JAP: I'm done with the first book.
FR: J'ai rangé le livre.
OUPS: I'm done with the first book.

JAP: Thank you. Now take this book to the third shelf from the right on the south side of the first floor.
FR: Merci. Maintenant, va ranger celui-ci sur la troisième étagère à partir de la droite sur le mur sud du rez-de-chaussée.
OUPS: Thank you. Now take this book to the third shelf from the right on the south side of the first floor.

JAP: Here we are.
FR: Et voilà.
OUPS: Here we are.

JAP: Take that book to the third shelf from the right on the south side of the first floor.
FR: Ce livre va sur la troisième étagère à partir de la droite sur le mur sud du rez-de-chaussée.
OUPS: Take that book to the third shelf from the right on the south side of the first floor.

JAP: I'm done with the second book.
FR: J'ai rangé l'autre livre.
OUPS: I'm done with the second book.

JAP: Oh, wow. That's a huge load off my mind. It's always nice to meet someone else who appreciates the value of a good book, you know?<PAGE>Anyway, here's your reward.
FR: Ouah, merci#! C'est un poids en moins. Il est toujours agréable de rencontrer quelqu'un qui sait reconnaître la valeur d'un bon livre.<PAGE>Tiens, c'est pour toi.
OUPS: Oh, wow. That's a huge load off my mind. It's always nice to meet someone else who appreciates the value of a good book, you know?<PAGE>Anyway, here's your reward.

JAP: Trying to keep all of these books organized is a task in itself.
FR: Mettre de l'ordre dans la bibliothèque est une tâche presque impossible#!
OUPS: Trying to keep all of these books organized is a task in itself.

JAP: Hey, you got a moment? Because I've got some work for you.
FR: Dis, as-tu une minute à m'accorder#? J'ai du travail pour toi.
OUPS: Hey, you got a moment? Because I've got some work for you.

JAP: I'm pretty busy right now. But if you're paying, I'm listening.
FR: Je suis occupé, mais si le salaire en vaut la peine, je suis votre homme.
OUPS: I'm pretty busy right now. But if you're paying, I'm listening.

JAP: Fair enough. Listen, my grandmother is running low on medicine, and I need you to gather some ingredients.
FR: Très bien. Ma grand-mère sera bientôt à court de médicaments et il me faut certains ingrédients pour en préparer d'autres.
OUPS: Fair enough. Listen, my grandmother is running low on medicine, and I need you to gather some ingredients.

JAP: I need three medicinal herbs, three berries, and three royal ferns.<PAGE>You may have to leave the village to find some of it, so I hope it's not too much of a bother.
FR: J'ai besoin de trois herbes médicinales, trois noix et trois osmondes.<PAGE>Tu devras peut-être sortir du village pour en trouver... J'espère que ça ne te dérange pas trop.
OUPS: I need three medicinal herbs, three berries, and three royal ferns.<PAGE>You may have to leave the village to find some of it, so I hope it's not too much of a bother.

JAP: Okay. Tell your grandmother to hang in there until I get back.
FR: Je m'en occupe. Prenez soin de votre grand-mère jusqu'à mon retour.
OUPS: Okay. Tell your grandmother to hang in there until I get back.

JAP: I've got your ingredients.
FR: J'ai trouvé les ingrédients dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I've got your ingredients.

JAP: Ah, perfect! Now I just mix them up like so, aaaand...presto! Grandma's Old-Timey Digestive Elixir!
FR: Ah, parfait#! Et maintenant, je n'ai qu'à les mélanger et voilà#! Un digestif du bon vieux temps pour mamie#!
OUPS: Ah, perfect! Now I just mix them up like so, aaaand...presto! Grandma's Old-Timey Digestive Elixir!

JAP: Since you've already been such a help, could you deliver this to my grandmother? She's at the fountain by the library.
FR: Dis, puisque tu es si obligeant, pourrais-tu l'apporter à ma grand-mère#? Elle est près de la fontaine devant la bibliothèque.
OUPS: Since you've already been such a help, could you deliver this to my grandmother? She's at the fountain by the library.

JAP: Okay. I'll get it to her as soon as I can.
FR: Je m'en occupe.
OUPS: Okay. I'll get it to her as soon as I can.

JAP: I need three medicinal herbs, three berries, and three royal ferns.<PAGE>You may have to leave the village to find some of it, so I hope it's not too much of a bother.
FR: J'ai besoin de trois herbes médicinales, trois noix et trois osmondes. Tu devras peut-être sortir du village pour en trouver... J'espère que ça ne te dérange pas trop.
OUPS: I need three medicinal herbs, three berries, and three royal ferns.<PAGE>You may have to leave the village to find some of it, so I hope it's not too much of a bother.

JAP: Ma'am? I've got something for you.
FR: Excusez-moi, madame. J'ai quelque chose pour vous.
OUPS: Ma'am? I've got something for you.

JAP: Oh, what a nice young man! Now I can walk without pain.
FR: Oh, comme tu es aimable, jeune homme#! Désormais, je pourrai marcher sans me courber de douleur.
OUPS: Oh, what a nice young man! Now I can walk without pain.

JAP: Oh, sorry. I thought this was for digestion.
FR: Euh, je croyais que c'était un digestif.
OUPS: Oh, sorry. I thought this was for digestion.

JAP: Oh, it is. See, sometimes I eat so much that it hurts to walk.<PAGE>Anyway, here's a small token of my appreciation, young man.
FR: Oh, c'est exact. Vois-tu, parfois je mange tant que je n'arrive plus à marcher.<PAGE>J'aimerais t'offrir ceci en guise de récompense, jeune homme.
OUPS: Oh, it is. See, sometimes I eat so much that it hurts to walk.<PAGE>Anyway, here's a small token of my appreciation, young man.

JAP: She's at the fountain by the library. Thanks in advance.
FR: Ma grand-mère devrait être près de la fontaine devant la bibliothèque. Merci d'avance.
OUPS: She's at the fountain by the library. Thanks in advance.

JAP: Oh, I forgot! I was going to ask you to get some fertilizer as well.
FR: Oh, <NIER>#! J'ai oublié de te demander de me rapporter de l'engrais#!
OUPS: Oh, I forgot! I was going to ask you to get some fertilizer as well.

JAP: Next time you're in Seafront, can you pick up three bounty fertilizers for me?
FR: La prochaine fois que tu passeras par Littoral, achète-moi trois sacs d'engrais de récolte, d'accord#?
OUPS: Next time you're in Seafront, can you pick up three bounty fertilizers for me?

JAP: No problem.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: No problem.

JAP: Here's your fertilizers.
FR: Voici votre engrais.
OUPS: Here's your fertilizers.

JAP: Oh, thanks. Sorry to make you go all that way. Here's money for the materials, and a little extra for your trouble.
FR: Oh, merci#! C'est gentil d'être allé si loin pour en trouver. Tiens, c'est pour l'engrais et tout le mal que tu t'es donné.
OUPS: Oh, thanks. Sorry to make you go all that way. Here's money for the materials, and a little extra for your trouble.

JAP: And here! Take a bulb and a pack of fertilizer. You'll be amazed at how fast these things grow!
FR: Et accepte aussi ce bulbe et ce sac d'engrais. Tu seras stupéfait de voir à quel point ces plantes poussent rapidement.
OUPS: And here! Take a bulb and a pack of fertilizer. You'll be amazed at how fast these things grow!

JAP: Don't forget about that fertilizer, okay?
FR: N'oublie surtout pas l'engrais, hein#?
OUPS: Don't forget about that fertilizer, okay?

JAP: Flower bulbs are great to eat, and the flowers they make are beautiful to look at! Talk about versatile!
FR: Les bulbes sont comestibles et produisent de jolies fleurs#! Ils sont si polyvalents#!
OUPS: Flower bulbs are great to eat, and the flowers they make are beautiful to look at! Talk about versatile!

JAP: Hey, Brother? I think I want to try making stew. Do we have any venison or wheat?
FR: Dis, papa... Je veux essayer de préparer un ragoût. Pourrais-tu acheter de la viande de cerf et du blé#?
OUPS: Hey, Brother? I think I want to try making stew. Do we have any venison or wheat?

JAP: A deer...wheat...stew? Um, that sounds...that sounds nice, Yonah.
FR: Un ragoût de blé... et de cerf#? Hum, ça semble... délicieux, Yonah.
OUPS: A deer...wheat...stew? Um, that sounds...that sounds nice, Yonah.

JAP: (Get ready, stomach. This is gonna be rough...)
FR: (Mon estomac va en souffrir...)
OUPS: (Get ready, stomach. This is gonna be rough...)

JAP: Okay, Yonah. Let me see if I can track down your ingredients.
FR: D'accord, Yonah. Je vais me procurer les ingrédients dont tu as besoin.
OUPS: Okay, Yonah. Let me see if I can track down your ingredients.

JAP: Really? Oh, thanks, Brother! I think you're really going to like it.
FR: Vraiment#? Oh, merci papa#! Tu vas adorer, promis#!
OUPS: Really? Oh, thanks, Brother! I think you're really going to like it.

JAP: I got your ingredients, Yonah.
FR: J'ai trouvé tes ingrédients, Yonah.
OUPS: I got your ingredients, Yonah.

JAP: Thanks, Brother! Hold on, I'm gonna start cooking right away!
FR: Merci, papa#! Je vais préparer mon ragoût tout de suite#!
OUPS: Thanks, Brother! Hold on, I'm gonna start cooking right away!

JAP: Yonah, wait—
FR: Yonah, attends...
OUPS: Yonah, wait—

JAP: <LIST=1445>Remind her not to burn it.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1445>«#Ne brûle pas le ragoût#!#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1445>Remind her not to burn it.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1446>Remind her to cut the meat into small pieces.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1446>«#Coupe la viande en dés#!#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1446>Remind her to cut the meat into small pieces.</LIST>

JAP: Daaaad! Come on! I wouldn't forget something like that!
FR: Oh, voyons papa#! Je ne ferais jamais une chose pareille#!
OUPS: Daaaad! Come on! I wouldn't forget something like that!

JAP: (The ingredients are recognizable, but...)<PAGE>(Oh, gods. That meat looks almost raw.)
FR: (Je reconnais les ingrédients, mais... la viande est toujours crue.)
OUPS: (The ingredients are recognizable, but...)<PAGE>(Oh, gods. That meat looks almost raw.)

JAP: Brother? Aren't you hungry?
FR: Papa#? Tu n'as pas faim#?
OUPS: Brother? Aren't you hungry?

JAP: Uh...I sure am, Yonah! And boy, it smells...delicious...
FR: Euh... je suis affamé, ma chérie#! Et quelle odeur... délicieuse...!
OUPS: Uh...I sure am, Yonah! And boy, it smells...delicious...

JAP: (This tastes like the floor of a cave. ...I think I'm going to be sick.)
FR: (On dirait qu'elle a fait bouillir mes sandales... Je crois que je vais être malade.)
OUPS: (This tastes like the floor of a cave. ...I think I'm going to be sick.)

JAP: Okay, Brother!
FR: D'accord, papa.
OUPS: Okay, Brother!

JAP: (This stew smells like I pissed on a campfire. Is the meat even in here? ...And what are those black chunks?)
FR: (Ce ragoût a une odeur d'urine brûlée. Y a-t-il vraiment de la viande quelque part dans cette pâtée#? Et que peuvent bien être ces morceaux noirs qui flottent à la surface...?)
OUPS: (This stew smells like I pissed on a campfire. Is the meat even in here? ...And what are those black chunks?)

JAP: Brother? Aren't you hungry?
FR: Papa#? Tu n'as pas faim#?
OUPS: Brother? Aren't you hungry?

JAP: Uh...I sure am, Yonah! And boy, it smells...really...amazing...
FR: Euh... je suis affamé, ma chérie#! Et quelle odeur... appétissante...!
OUPS: Uh...I sure am, Yonah! And boy, it smells...really...amazing...

JAP: (Oh gods, it tastes like death. ...I think I'm going to be sick.)
FR: (Oh, je n'ai jamais rien avalé de plus infect. Je sens que je vais être malade...)
OUPS: (Oh gods, it tastes like death. ...I think I'm going to be sick.)

JAP: I'm ready to make that stew anytime, Brother.
FR: Je peux préparer du ragoût quand tu veux, papa#!
OUPS: I'm ready to make that stew anytime, Brother.

JAP: Hey, do you have time for a little side job?
FR: Dis, j'ai du boulot pour toi, ça t'intéresse#?
OUPS: Hey, do you have time for a little side job?

JAP: I'll make the time. What's going on?
FR: Peut-être, qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: I'll make the time. What's going on?

JAP: I was hoping you could go to The Aerie and get an eagle egg for me.
FR: J'aimerais que tu me rapportes un œuf d'aigle de l'Aire.
OUPS: I was hoping you could go to The Aerie and get an eagle egg for me.

JAP: Oh ho! It sounds as if someone is brewing up another batch of medicine for an ailing relation.
FR: Hum#! Comptez-vous préparer un autre remède pour votre grand-mère#?
OUPS: Oh ho! It sounds as if someone is brewing up another batch of medicine for an ailing relation.

JAP: I sure am! You're pretty smart, Weissy!
FR: Mais oui#! Ah, tu es si intelligent, Weissounet#!
OUPS: I sure am! You're pretty smart, Weissy!

JAP: Weiss...y?
FR: Weiss... ounet#?
OUPS: Weiss...y?

JAP: Apparently you can find eagle eggs up in high places, where the wind blows. That's what I hear, anyway. You up for it?
FR: On dit qu'on peut trouver des œufs d'aigle dans les hauteurs, là où il vente beaucoup. Alors, qu'en dis-tu#?
OUPS: Apparently you can find eagle eggs up in high places, where the wind blows. That's what I hear, anyway. You up for it?

JAP: Come on, Weissy. Let's get moving.
FR: Allons-y, Weissounet.
OUPS: Come on, Weissy. Let's get moving.

JAP: I got your eagle egg.
FR: J'ai trouvé un œuf d'aigle.
OUPS: I got your eagle egg.

JAP: Wow! Thank you! Give me a moment here.
FR: Oh, merci#! Laisse-moi rassembler les autres ingrédients...
OUPS: Wow! Thank you! Give me a moment here.

JAP: And here we go! Could you bring this to my grandmother for me? She'll probably be near the fountain in front of the library.
FR: Et voilà#! J'ai terminé#!<PAGE>Pourrais-tu aller le porter à ma grand-mère#? Elle devrait toujours être près de la fontaine devant la bibliothèque.
OUPS: And here we go! Could you bring this to my grandmother for me? She'll probably be near the fountain in front of the library.

JAP: Sure.
FR: D'accord.
OUPS: Sure.

JAP: Apparently you can find eagle eggs up in high places, where the wind blows.<PAGE>Oh, and I know that you can sell them for a lot of money, but please don't! My grandmother will be very ill without her medicine.
FR: On dit qu'on peut trouver des œufs d'aigle dans les hauteurs, là où il vente beaucoup.<PAGE>Oh, et je sais que tu pourrais le vendre pour une fortune, mais je t'en supplie, ne le fais pas#! Ma grand-mère est si malade#!
OUPS: Apparently you can find eagle eggs up in high places, where the wind blows.<PAGE>Oh, and I know that you can sell them for a lot of money, but please don't! My grandmother will be very ill without her medicine.

JAP: Ma'am? I've got more medicine for you.
FR: Excusez-moi, madame. J'ai un élixir pour vous.
OUPS: Ma'am? I've got more medicine for you.

JAP: Oh, it's the nice young man again! Thank heavens you arrived!<PAGE>My bloating is just out of control today! And you wouldn't believe the bunions that are starting to form on my—
FR: Oh, c'est ce gentil jeune homme#! Je suis si heureuse de te voir#!<PAGE>Je me sens si ballonnée aujourd'hui#! Et que dire de ces cors qui se sont formés sur mes...
OUPS: Oh, it's the nice young man again! Thank heavens you arrived!<PAGE>My bloating is just out of control today! And you wouldn't believe the bunions that are starting to form on my—

JAP: Whoa, hey, look at the time. Gotta go. You take care of yourself, all right?
FR: Ah, euh, je suis pressé... N'oubliez pas de boire votre élixir, d'accord#?
OUPS: Whoa, hey, look at the time. Gotta go. You take care of yourself, all right?

JAP: You've really been helping me out lately. Here's a little something for you.
FR: Tu m'as beaucoup aidée ces derniers temps. J'aimerais t'offrir ceci.
OUPS: You've really been helping me out lately. Here's a little something for you.

JAP: My grandmother is by the fountain. Thanks in advance.
FR: Ma grand-mère est près de la fontaine devant la bibliothèque. Merci d'avance#!
OUPS: My grandmother is by the fountain. Thanks in advance.

JAP: Hey, do you have time for a delivery? A friend of mine just helped me out, and I want to give him something special.<PAGE>Can you take this parcel to The Aerie?
FR: Dis, j'aimerais envoyer un cadeau spécial à un de mes amis. Aurais-tu le temps de faire une livraison#?<PAGE>Pourrais-tu apporter ce colis à mon ami de l'Aire#?
OUPS: Hey, do you have time for a delivery? A friend of mine just helped me out, and I want to give him something special.<PAGE>Can you take this parcel to The Aerie?

JAP: Sure. I could use the work.
FR: Bien sûr, je suis toujours à la recherche de travail.
OUPS: Sure. I could use the work.

JAP: Oh, and this is REALLY fragile, so you need to be careful, okay? Don't go jumping around or get knocked over or anything like that.
FR: Oh, et en passant, il est très, très fragile, alors sois prudent, d'accord#? évite les vibrations et surtout, ne le laisse pas tomber#!
OUPS: Oh, and this is REALLY fragile, so you need to be careful, okay? Don't go jumping around or get knocked over or anything like that.

JAP: You'll need to take it to the chief's house in The Aerie. It's the gold house at the highest point in the village.
FR: Tu devras livrer le colis à la maison du chef de l'Aire, au sommet du village. Elle est rayée.
OUPS: You'll need to take it to the chief's house in The Aerie. It's the gold house at the highest point in the village.

JAP: Hey, I got a present for you.
FR: J'ai un cadeau pour vous.
OUPS: Hey, I got a present for you.

JAP: ...For me? ...Yes. ...All right. ...Now leave it and go!
FR: ... Pour moi#?
OUPS: ...For me? ...Yes. ...All right. ...Now leave it and go!

JAP: ...This town makes me crazy. <PAGE>Well, I guess I should go tell the client that his present arrived in one piece.
FR: ...#Oh. Bien. Donnez-le-moi et partez#!
OUPS: ...This town makes me crazy. <PAGE>Well, I guess I should go tell the client that his present arrived in one piece.

JAP: Hey, I got a present for you.
FR: (... Ce village va me rendre fou.)<PAGE>Bon, je devrais aller avertir le garde que son ami a bien reçu son cadeau.
OUPS: Hey, I got a present for you.

JAP: Broken! It's broken! Go away!
FR: J'ai un cadeau pour vous.
OUPS: Broken! It's broken! Go away!

JAP: ...Ah, hell. I'd better go tell the client the bad news.
FR: Cassé#! Il est cassé#! Sortez d'ici#!
OUPS: ...Ah, hell. I'd better go tell the client the bad news.

JAP: I'm sorry, but it looks like your gift was damaged during the delivery.
FR: Mince... Je devrais aller annoncer la mauvaise nouvelle au garde.
OUPS: I'm sorry, but it looks like your gift was damaged during the delivery.

JAP: Yeah, I thought that might happen. ...I should have bought the guy a nice steel rod or something. <PAGE>Anyway, I've got another one here, so maybe you could try the delivery again?
FR: Je suis désolé. On dirait que votre cadeau a été endommagé en cours de route. Ah, je me doutais bien que ça se produirait. J'aurais dû lui offrir une belle tige d'acier ou quelque chose du genre.<PAGE>Ce n'est pas grave. J'ai un autre cadeau identique pour lui. Pourrais-tu réessayer#?
OUPS: Yeah, I thought that might happen. ...I should have bought the guy a nice steel rod or something. <PAGE>Anyway, I've got another one here, so maybe you could try the delivery again?

JAP: Good luck! Just come back if that one breaks, all right?
FR: Bonne chance#! Reviens me voir si tu casses aussi ce cadeau.
OUPS: Good luck! Just come back if that one breaks, all right?

JAP: We delivered the goods. Your friend is a real charmer.
FR: Nous avons donné votre cadeau à votre ami. Il est vraiment sympathique...!
OUPS: We delivered the goods. Your friend is a real charmer.

JAP: Thanks! I appreciate it.
FR: Merci encore pour ton aide#!
OUPS: Thanks! I appreciate it.

JAP: Yeah, he can be a real pain to strangers, but he's a good guy at heart.
FR: Il n'aime pas les étrangers, mais il a un cœur d'or.
OUPS: Yeah, he can be a real pain to strangers, but he's a good guy at heart.

JAP: Anyway, I've got a little something for you.
FR: Tiens, c'est pour te remercier.
OUPS: Anyway, I've got a little something for you.

JAP: Excuse me, but I need some help.<PAGE>I have to deliver a large serving tray to the town of Seafront.
FR: Pardonne-moi, jeune homme. Pourrais-tu m'aider#? Je désire envoyer un grand plat à quelqu'un de Littoral.
OUPS: Excuse me, but I need some help.<PAGE>I have to deliver a large serving tray to the town of Seafront.

JAP: I can do that. Where's it need to go?
FR: Je peux m'en occuper. Où devrais-je le livrer#?
OUPS: I can do that. Where's it need to go?

JAP: Oh, wonderful. Just take it to the tavern. And make sure not to jump around or fall over or anything! The tray is very fragile.
FR: Oh, merveilleux#! Tu n'as qu'à l'apporter à la taverne. Et fais bien attention de ne pas le laisser tomber#! Ce plat est très fragile#!
OUPS: Oh, wonderful. Just take it to the tavern. And make sure not to jump around or fall over or anything! The tray is very fragile.

JAP: Hey. An old man in my village asked me to deliver this to you.
FR: Bonjour. Un vieil homme de mon village m'a demandé de vous apporter ce plat.
OUPS: Hey. An old man in my village asked me to deliver this to you.

JAP: Oh, wonderful! This will make my life a lot easier. Thanks so much.
FR: Ah, formidable#! Il me sera très utile#! Merci beaucoup#!
OUPS: Oh, wonderful! This will make my life a lot easier. Thanks so much.

JAP: It's definitely less stressful when I'm delivering things that don't break.<PAGE>Oh, well. Guess I'd better tell the old guy that it arrived safely.
FR: Transporter des objets fragiles est vraiment éprouvant.<PAGE>Bon, je devrais aller dire au vieil homme que tout s'est bien passé.
OUPS: It's definitely less stressful when I'm delivering things that don't break.<PAGE>Oh, well. Guess I'd better tell the old guy that it arrived safely.

JAP: Hey. An old man in my village asked me to deliver this to you.
FR: Bonjour. Un vieil homme de mon village m'a demandé de vous apporter ce plat.
OUPS: Hey. An old man in my village asked me to deliver this to you.

JAP: Oh, how wonder... Hey! This is broken! What are you trying to pull here!?
FR: Ah, formi... Dites donc#! Il est cassé, ce plat#! Qu'est-ce que c'est que cette histoire#?!
OUPS: Oh, how wonder... Hey! This is broken! What are you trying to pull here!?

JAP: It is? Ah, crap. Guess I'd better go tell the client.
FR: Il est cassé#? Mince... Je devrais aller le dire au vieil homme.
OUPS: It is? Ah, crap. Guess I'd better go tell the client.

JAP: Hey, there's a problem. That item of yours broke on the way to Seafront.
FR: Malheureusement, votre plat a été endommagé en cours de route.
OUPS: Hey, there's a problem. That item of yours broke on the way to Seafront.

JAP: Oh, that's too bad. <PAGE>Well, I have another one, so maybe you can try again?
FR: Oh, quel dommage#!<PAGE>Eh bien, j'en ai justement un autre. Pourrais-tu réessayer#?
OUPS: Oh, that's too bad. <PAGE>Well, I have another one, so maybe you can try again?

JAP: Make sure it doesn't break!
FR: Essaie de ne pas le casser, cette fois#!
OUPS: Make sure it doesn't break!

JAP: I delivered the tray.
FR: J'ai livré le plat, comme vous me l'aviez demandé.
OUPS: I delivered the tray.

JAP: Ah, it's good to see a man of his word. Here's your payment.
FR: Ah, je savais que tu étais un homme digne de confiance#! Voici ta récompense.
OUPS: Ah, it's good to see a man of his word. Here's your payment.

JAP: So ya went and caught the fish, did ya?
FR: Alors, t'as attrapé le poisson-shaman dont t'avais besoin, c'est ça#?
OUPS: So ya went and caught the fish, did ya?

JAP: Well, since yer so insistent, I suppose I better reveal one'a my fishin' secrets.
FR: Eh bien, puisque t'insistes tant, je suppose que je devrais te révéler une de mes techniques de pêche.
OUPS: Well, since yer so insistent, I suppose I better reveal one'a my fishin' secrets.

JAP: I wasn't insisting that you—
FR: Je ne vous ai rien demandé...
OUPS: I wasn't insisting that you—

JAP: Oh, fine! Twist my arm some more, why don't ya?<PAGE>Well, if you can catch ten sardines, I'll reveal one of my most closely-guarded secrets.
FR: Oh, d'accord, d'accord#! Mais tu me forces la main#!<PAGE>Si t'arrives à attraper dix sardines, je te révélerai une de mes techniques les plus secrètes.
OUPS: Oh, fine! Twist my arm some more, why don't ya?<PAGE>Well, if you can catch ten sardines, I'll reveal one of my most closely-guarded secrets.

JAP: Hey, old timer. I got the fish you wanted.
FR: Hé, vieil homme. J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous m'aviez demandés.
OUPS: Hey, old timer. I got the fish you wanted.

JAP: So ya did, so ya did. Well then, here's a piece of advice for ya...
FR: Oui, oui, je vois. Eh bien, je vais te donner un bon conseil...
OUPS: So ya did, so ya did. Well then, here's a piece of advice for ya...

JAP: Well? Have your fishing fortunes improved?
FR: Eh bien#? T'es-tu amélioré#?
OUPS: Well? Have your fishing fortunes improved?

JAP: I guess. But anyone could get better if they did nothing but fish for two days in a row.
FR: Oui, mais n'importe qui pourrait le faire en pêchant sans arrêt pendant deux jours de suite.
OUPS: I guess. But anyone could get better if they did nothing but fish for two days in a row.

JAP: Go! Catch me ten sardines, and be quick about it!
FR: Va m'attraper dix sardines, et que ça saute#!
OUPS: Go! Catch me ten sardines, and be quick about it!

JAP: Hello again. I have another fishing assignment for you.
FR: Te revoilà. J'ai une autre tâche pour toi.
OUPS: Hello again. I have another fishing assignment for you.

JAP: Hold on. I don't think I agreed to—
FR: Un instant, je n'ai jamais accepté de...
OUPS: Hold on. I don't think I agreed to—

JAP: You're so insistent! It really is too much!<PAGE>Well, your next task is to catch seven blowfish! If you can do that, I'll part with another of my invaluable lessons.
FR: Quel acharnement#! C'en est trop#!<PAGE>Eh bien, ta nouvelle tâche est d'attraper sept poissons-globes#! Si tu arrives à le faire, je t'offrirai un autre de mes précieux conseils.
OUPS: You're so insistent! It really is too much!<PAGE>Well, your next task is to catch seven blowfish! If you can do that, I'll part with another of my invaluable lessons.

JAP: I got your fish.
FR: J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous vouliez.
OUPS: I got your fish.

JAP: Mmmm... There's nothing like a good blowfish soup, let me tell you.
FR: Hum... Y a rien de plus délicieux qu'une soupe de poisson-globe, crois-moi#!
OUPS: Mmmm... There's nothing like a good blowfish soup, let me tell you.

JAP: Well, as promised, here's your next secret. And this one won't take me two days to pass down! Heh heh heh!
FR: Eh bien, comme promis, voici une autre technique secrète. Et cette fois, je te la transmettrai en moins de deux jours#! Hé, hé, hé#!
OUPS: Well, as promised, here's your next secret. And this one won't take me two days to pass down! Heh heh heh!

JAP: By the way, what are you doing with all these fish, old timer?
FR: Au fait, que faites-vous de tous ces poissons#?
OUPS: By the way, what are you doing with all these fish, old timer?

JAP: Eh? I'm eating them! What else would you do with such tasty morsels?
FR: Hein#? Je les mange, pardi#! Qu'est-ce que je pourrais bien en faire d'autre#?
OUPS: Eh? I'm eating them! What else would you do with such tasty morsels?

JAP: Did you catch seven blowfish for me?
FR: As-tu attrapé sept poissons-globes#?
OUPS: Did you catch seven blowfish for me?

JAP: ...Eh? Oh, right. The next assignment. Go and catch me seven rainbow trout, would ya?
FR: ... Hein#? Ah oui, ta prochaine tâche. Attrape-moi sept truites arc-en-ciel#!
OUPS: ...Eh? Oh, right. The next assignment. Go and catch me seven rainbow trout, would ya?

JAP: Gah, another assignment? Though you are doubtless a true man of the sea, I fail to comprehend how you can possibly consume all the fish we are bringing your way.
FR: Encore une tâche#?!<PAGE>Vous êtes un véritable homme de mer, cela ne fait aucun doute, mais je n'arrive pas à croire que vous puissiez vraiment avaler tout le poisson que nous vous apportons.
OUPS: Gah, another assignment? Though you are doubtless a true man of the sea, I fail to comprehend how you can possibly consume all the fish we are bringing your way.

JAP: What I don't eat I sell. But I can eat a lot! Heh heh heh!<PAGE>Now get moving, greenhorn! Them fish won't catch 'emselves!
FR: Je vends ce que je mange pas, mais j'ai un appétit de loup#! Hé, hé, hé#!<PAGE>Allez, qu'est-ce t'attends, marin d'eau douce#? Les poissons mordront pas à l'hameçon tout seuls#!
OUPS: What I don't eat I sell. But I can eat a lot! Heh heh heh!<PAGE>Now get moving, greenhorn! Them fish won't catch 'emselves!

JAP: I've got the fish.
FR: J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous vouliez.
OUPS: I've got the fish.

JAP: Well scratch my back and call me Sally! Them's some rainbow trout, all right! Yer gettin' better, young one!
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru#! C'est bien de la truite arc-en-ciel#! Tu t'es amélioré, jeunot#!
OUPS: Well scratch my back and call me Sally! Them's some rainbow trout, all right! Yer gettin' better, young one!

JAP: Right! Time for me to teach ya some new pearls'a wisdom. Let's head over to the harbor there.
FR: Bien#! Le moment est venu de partager d'autres trésors de sagesse. Allons sur le quai.
OUPS: Right! Time for me to teach ya some new pearls'a wisdom. Let's head over to the harbor there.

JAP: Fine work, son, fine work. Yer a true man of the sea now, and no denyin'.
FR: Bon travail, jeunot. T'es désormais un homme de mer, toi aussi.
OUPS: Fine work, son, fine work. Yer a true man of the sea now, and no denyin'.

JAP: *Huff... Puff...* I can't...believe...you made me work...on a fishing boat... I oughta...cut you in half...
FR: Aaah... Ooooh... Je n'arrive... pas à croire... que vous m'ayez... forcé à travailler... sur un bateau de pêche... Je devrais... vous pourfendre de mon épée...
OUPS: *Huff... Puff...* I can't...believe...you made me work...on a fishing boat... I oughta...cut you in half...

JAP: The old man is more fearsome than we thought.
FR: Ce vieil homme est plus redoutable que nous ne le pensions.
OUPS: The old man is more fearsome than we thought.

JAP: Right-o! I'll be expectin' my seven rainbow trout, then!
FR: Très bien#! J'ai hâte de déguster mes sept truites arc-en-ciel#!
OUPS: Right-o! I'll be expectin' my seven rainbow trout, then!

JAP: Listen, I'm sorry 'bout that whole fishin' boat thing earlier, but I thought it the best way to teach ya! ...And it worked, yeah?
FR: écoute, je suis désolé de t'avoir forcé à travailler sur un bateau de pêche, mais c'était vraiment la meilleure façon de t'apprendre mes techniques. T'en es la preuve#!
OUPS: Listen, I'm sorry 'bout that whole fishin' boat thing earlier, but I thought it the best way to teach ya! ...And it worked, yeah?

JAP: This time I got a hankerin' for five bream. Catch 'em, and I'll teach ya one'a my most secret techniques!
FR: Cette fois, j'ai envie de daurade. Si t'en attrapes cinq, je t'enseignerai une de mes techniques les plus secrètes#!
OUPS: This time I got a hankerin' for five bream. Catch 'em, and I'll teach ya one'a my most secret techniques!

JAP: Here's your fish.
FR: J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous vouliez.
OUPS: Here's your fish.

JAP: Well, swab the deck and call me Ishmael! I knew ya could do it! Hand 'em over, whippersnapper!
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru#! Je savais que t'en serais capable#! Allez, donne-les-moi, jeunot#!
OUPS: Well, swab the deck and call me Ishmael! I knew ya could do it! Hand 'em over, whippersnapper!

JAP: I think these are worth more on the open market than the rainbow trout I caught earlier...
FR: Je crois que ces poissons valent plus que les truites arc-en-ciel que j'ai attrapées la dernière fois...
OUPS: I think these are worth more on the open market than the rainbow trout I caught earlier...

JAP: Worth ain't squat! It's whatcha learn from the catchin' that matters!<PAGE>Now stop all this fool talk 'bout yer wallet and get to practicin'!
FR: Elles valent rien du tout#! C'est ce que t'as appris qui compte#!<PAGE>Arrête de penser seulement à ta bourse et entraîne-toi#!
OUPS: Worth ain't squat! It's whatcha learn from the catchin' that matters!<PAGE>Now stop all this fool talk 'bout yer wallet and get to practicin'!

JAP: *Huff huff* Hey...old timer... What does...200 sit-ups...have to do...with fishing...?
FR: Ouf... Ouf... Dites... qu'est-ce que... 200 tractions... peuvent bien avoir à faire... avec la pêche...?
OUPS: *Huff huff* Hey...old timer... What does...200 sit-ups...have to do...with fishing...?

JAP: Ya won't be catchin' anything with those scrawny arms. We got to buff 'em up!
FR: Tu pourras rien attraper avec des bras aussi frêles#! Il faut les renforcer#!
OUPS: Ya won't be catchin' anything with those scrawny arms. We got to buff 'em up!

JAP: Off you go! I want to see five bream!<PAGE>And don't start poutin', or a seagull's gonna walk on yer lip!
FR: Ouste#! Je veux cinq daurades#! Et fais pas la moue comme une fillette, les mouettes pourraient venir s'y poser#!
OUPS: Off you go! I want to see five bream!<PAGE>And don't start poutin', or a seagull's gonna walk on yer lip!

JAP: Today's assignment is five black bass! Go and give it everything ya got, rookie!
FR: Aujourd'hui, ta tâche est de pêcher cinq perches noires#! Fais de ton mieux#!
OUPS: Today's assignment is five black bass! Go and give it everything ya got, rookie!

JAP: I trust that you are not abusing our labors for the purpose of easy profit, old man?
FR: J'espère que vous n'abusez pas de nos efforts afin de faire des profits, vieillard#!
OUPS: I trust that you are not abusing our labors for the purpose of easy profit, old man?

JAP: Oh, and would a little compensation be a bad thing? I'm teachin' invaluable techniques here, ya floating magazine!
FR: Oh, tu refuserais de me payer ce à quoi j'ai droit#? Je lui enseigne pourtant des techniques inestimables, espèce de brochure volante#!
OUPS: Oh, and would a little compensation be a bad thing? I'm teachin' invaluable techniques here, ya floating magazine!

JAP: Lies! It is clear that money is your ultimate goal.<PAGE>And I am NOT to be referred to as a magazine!
FR: Vous mentez#! Votre but est manifestement de vous enrichir.<PAGE>...#Et je ne suis pas une brochure#!
OUPS: Lies! It is clear that money is your ultimate goal.<PAGE>And I am NOT to be referred to as a magazine!

JAP: I caught the fish, old timer.
FR: J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous vouliez.
OUPS: I caught the fish, old timer.

JAP: Well, raise the mainsail and call me Cletus! That's some nice work, youngster.<PAGE>Keep it up, and ya just might have a chance of catching...The Fish.
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru#! Bon travail, petit#!<PAGE>Si tu continues ainsi, tu pourras peut-être attraper... le Poisson.
OUPS: Well, raise the mainsail and call me Cletus! That's some nice work, youngster.<PAGE>Keep it up, and ya just might have a chance of catching...The Fish.

JAP: Which fish?
FR: Quel poisson#?
OUPS: Which fish?

JAP: Never ya mind! Time ain't right yet. Now lemme show ya the next technique...
FR: C'est pas important#! Le moment est pas encore venu. Laisse-moi te montrer une autre technique...
OUPS: Never ya mind! Time ain't right yet. Now lemme show ya the next technique...

JAP: Yer on a whole different level now, ya wee minnow! Don't ya agree?
FR: Tu maîtrises de plus en plus l'art de la pêche, jeunot#! Tu trouves pas#?
OUPS: Yer on a whole different level now, ya wee minnow! Don't ya agree?

JAP: No, I've certainly improved. I just don't understand why you wouldn't tell me so unless I bought you drinks in the local tavern.
FR: Je ne peux pas nier que je me suis amélioré. Cependant, je ne comprends pas pourquoi vous l'affirmez sans que je ne vous aie payé un verre à la taverne.
OUPS: No, I've certainly improved. I just don't understand why you wouldn't tell me so unless I bought you drinks in the local tavern.

JAP: Quit frettin'! You'll go bald.
FR: Arrête de t'inquiéter pour rien#! Ça rend chauve#!
OUPS: Quit frettin'! You'll go bald.

JAP: Do ya have my five black bass?
FR: M'as-tu apporté cinq perches noires#?
OUPS: Do ya have my five black bass?

JAP: Hey! You ever heard Devola and Popola sing?
FR: Dis, as-tu déjà entendu Devola et Popola chanter#?
OUPS: Hey! You ever heard Devola and Popola sing?

JAP: Sure. Devola sings here all the time.
FR: Bien sûr. Devola chante ici tous les jours.
OUPS: Sure. Devola sings here all the time.

JAP: I ain't talkin' about that! I'm talkin' about the two of 'em singin' TOGETHER!
FR: Ce n'est pas ce que je voulais dire#! Les as-tu déjà entendues chanter ensemble#?
OUPS: I ain't talkin' about that! I'm talkin' about the two of 'em singin' TOGETHER!

JAP: Uh...no. I've never seen that.
FR: Euh, non... Jamais.
OUPS: Uh...no. I've never seen that.

JAP: They used to come here and sing all the time, but now they're so busy...<PAGE>Hey! You oughta get 'em to come back and sing for us!
FR: Elles venaient chanter ici tout le temps avant, mais maintenant, elles sont toujours trop occupées...<PAGE>Hé, pourquoi ne leur demandes-tu pas de venir chanter pour nous#?
OUPS: They used to come here and sing all the time, but now they're so busy...<PAGE>Hey! You oughta get 'em to come back and sing for us!

JAP: Well, I suppose I am kind of curious...
FR: C'est vrai que je serais curieux de les entendre...
OUPS: Well, I suppose I am kind of curious...

JAP: Can I ask you a favor, Devola?
FR: Puis-je te demander une faveur, Devola#?
OUPS: Can I ask you a favor, Devola?

JAP: You're asking ME for a favor? Well, now I've heard everything!
FR: Quelle faveur pourrais-je bien t'accorder#?
OUPS: You're asking ME for a favor? Well, now I've heard everything!

JAP: I heard you and Popola used to sing at the tavern. I never got a chance to hear it, so...
FR: On m'a dit qu'autrefois tu chantais ici avec Popola. Je ne vous ai jamais entendues chanter ensemble, alors...
OUPS: I heard you and Popola used to sing at the tavern. I never got a chance to hear it, so...

JAP: Wait. You want to hear us sing? Ah ha ha!<PAGE>Well, Popola's been swamped lately, so I haven't sung with her in forever.
FR: Quoi, tu veux nous entendre chanter#? Ha, ha, ha#!<PAGE>Je n'ai pas chanté avec Popola depuis des lustres#! Elle est si occupée ces derniers temps.
OUPS: Wait. You want to hear us sing? Ah ha ha!<PAGE>Well, Popola's been swamped lately, so I haven't sung with her in forever.

JAP: But if she's up for it, I'm willing.
FR: Eh bien, si elle est prête à le faire, je suis d'accord.
OUPS: But if she's up for it, I'm willing.

JAP: I'm kinda busy myself, though, so you'll have to ask her for me.
FR: Cependant, je suis plutôt occupée moi aussi, alors tu devras le lui demander toi-même.
OUPS: I'm kinda busy myself, though, so you'll have to ask her for me.

JAP: Can I ask you a favor, Popola?
FR: J'ai une faveur à te demander, Popola.
OUPS: Can I ask you a favor, Popola?

JAP: Sure, what is it?
FR: Je t'écoute.
OUPS: Sure, what is it?

JAP: I heard you and Devola used to sing at the tavern, and I was wondering—
FR: J'ai entendu dire qu'autrefois tu chantais à la taverne avec Devola et...
OUPS: I heard you and Devola used to sing at the tavern, and I was wondering—

JAP: Oh my goodness! We haven't done that in a long time, and I don't...<PAGE>No, I'm sorry. I just don't think I can do it.
FR: Juste ciel#! Il y a très longtemps que je n'ai pas fait une chose pareille.<PAGE>Non, je suis désolée, je ne crois pas pouvoir t'accorder cette faveur.
OUPS: Oh my goodness! We haven't done that in a long time, and I don't...<PAGE>No, I'm sorry. I just don't think I can do it.

JAP: Why not?
FR: Pourquoi#?
OUPS: Why not?

JAP: Well, I need a certain drink before I can sing in public.<PAGE>...I'm a little shy, if you know what I mean.
FR: Eh bien, avant de pouvoir chanter en public, je dois boire une certaine boisson.<PAGE>... Je n'ai pas le courage de le faire, sinon.
OUPS: Well, I need a certain drink before I can sing in public.<PAGE>...I'm a little shy, if you know what I mean.

JAP: It's a tavern, Popola. I'm sure they'll have it.
FR: C'est une taverne, Popola. Je suis certain qu'ils te serviront ce que tu voudras.
OUPS: It's a tavern, Popola. I'm sure they'll have it.

JAP: Actually, they don't have this drink anymore.<PAGE>But they used to order it from the tavern in Seafront, so maybe you could ask there.
FR: À vrai dire, c'est une boisson rare.<PAGE>Ils en commandaient de la taverne de Littoral, alors tu devrais te renseigner auprès du tavernier.
OUPS: Actually, they don't have this drink anymore.<PAGE>But they used to order it from the tavern in Seafront, so maybe you could ask there.

JAP: Have you tracked down that drink?
FR: Alors, est-ce que la taverne de Littoral sert encore ma boisson spéciale#?
OUPS: Have you tracked down that drink?

JAP: Hey, barkeep. You know anything about a drink Popola used to like? I need to get my hands on one.
FR: Bonjour. Servez-vous toujours la boisson préférée de Popola#? J'essaie d'en trouver quelques bouteilles.
OUPS: Hey, barkeep. You know anything about a drink Popola used to like? I need to get my hands on one.

JAP: Popola, eh? Yeah, I know the drink. Sadly, I don't have the ingredients on hand. It's a bit of a special brew.
FR: Popola#? Oui, je sais de quelle boisson il s'agit. Malheureusement, je n'ai pas les ingrédients nécessaires. C'est un breuvage spécial, voyez-vous.
OUPS: Popola, eh? Yeah, I know the drink. Sadly, I don't have the ingredients on hand. It's a bit of a special brew.

JAP: That's too bad.
FR: C'est dommage.
OUPS: That's too bad.

JAP: Now, if you wanted to go fetch me some of those ingredients, I'd be happy to whip one up for ya, on the house.
FR: Si vous arrivez à vous procurer les ingrédients, je me ferai un plaisir de le préparer. Je le ferai même aux frais de la maison#!
OUPS: Now, if you wanted to go fetch me some of those ingredients, I'd be happy to whip one up for ya, on the house.

JAP: Fair enough. What do you need?
FR: Entendu. De quoi avez-vous besoin#?
OUPS: Fair enough. What do you need?

JAP: I need five lizard tails and five mouse tails.
FR: Cinq queues de lézard et cinq queues de souris.
OUPS: I need five lizard tails and five mouse tails.

JAP: What, seriously?
FR: Vous êtes sérieux#?
OUPS: What, seriously?

JAP: Hey, I know it sounds crazy, but those are the ingredients.
FR: Je sais que c'est étrange, mais ce sont les ingrédients.
OUPS: Hey, I know it sounds crazy, but those are the ingredients.

JAP: Well, if you say so...
FR: Si vous le dites...
OUPS: Well, if you say so...

JAP: I need five lizard tails and five mouse tails.
FR: J'ai besoin de cinq queues de lézard et cinq queues de souris.
OUPS: I need five lizard tails and five mouse tails.

JAP: Here's your ingredients. ...Although I can't imagine how this would make a decent drink.
FR: Voici les ingrédients dont vous aviez besoin.<PAGE>... Je n'arrive toujours pas à croire que vous pourrez en faire quelque chose de buvable.
OUPS: Here's your ingredients. ...Although I can't imagine how this would make a decent drink.

JAP: Popola's the only one in town with the guts to drink it. Even my regulars won't touch the stuff.
FR: Popola est la seule qui a le cran de l'avaler. Même mes clients les plus ivres n'oseraient pas y toucher.
OUPS: Popola's the only one in town with the guts to drink it. Even my regulars won't touch the stuff.

JAP: Could you tell Popola that I'll have her drink sent to the village once it's done?
FR: Pourriez-vous avertir Popola que j'enverrai sa boisson à la taverne de votre village quand elle sera prête#?
OUPS: Could you tell Popola that I'll have her drink sent to the village once it's done?

JAP: Got it.
FR: J'y vais de ce pas.
OUPS: Got it.

JAP: Hey, Popola. The tavern's got your drink.
FR: Le tavernière devrait avoir reçu ta boisson préférée, Popola.
OUPS: Hey, Popola. The tavern's got your drink.

JAP: Oh, that's great! Let me get Devola and then we'll head for the tavern.
FR: Oh, formidable#! Allons rejoindre Devola#!
OUPS: Oh, that's great! Let me get Devola and then we'll head for the tavern.

JAP: [Play song]
FR: [Chanson]
OUPS: [Play song]

JAP: ...Kinda gets you right here, doesn't it?
FR: ... Cette chanson est très touchante, n'est-ce pas#?
OUPS: ...Kinda gets you right here, doesn't it?

JAP: It sure does! Funny how she can't sing it unless she has that crazy drink, huh?
FR: Oui#! C'est tout de même bizarre que Popola ne puisse pas chanter sans boire cette boisson, hein#?
OUPS: It sure does! Funny how she can't sing it unless she has that crazy drink, huh?

JAP: Hey. You there. Have you seen my Max around?
FR: Dis-moi, jeune homme, aurais-tu vu mon petit Max par hasard#?
OUPS: Hey. You there. Have you seen my Max around?

JAP: Sorry. I don't know a Max.
FR: Je suis désolé. Je ne connais personne de ce nom.
OUPS: Sorry. I don't know a Max.

JAP: Max is my dog. He's been missing since yesterday.
FR: Max est mon chien. Il a disparu hier.
OUPS: Max is my dog. He's been missing since yesterday.

JAP: Oh. I see. Um...any idea where he went?
FR: Oh. Je vois. Hum... Savez-vous où il pourrait être#?
OUPS: Oh. I see. Um...any idea where he went?

JAP: He usually likes to run around the northern plains. Most of the time he just comes and goes, but I haven't seen him in over 24 hours.
FR: Il aime se promener dans la plaine septentrionale. Habituellement, il revient toujours à la maison, mais je ne l'ai pas vu depuis hier.
OUPS: He usually likes to run around the northern plains. Most of the time he just comes and goes, but I haven't seen him in over 24 hours.

JAP: Well, if I find him, I'll make sure to bring him back.
FR: Si je l'aperçois, je vous le ramènerai.
OUPS: Well, if I find him, I'll make sure to bring him back.

JAP: Th-thank you... Oooh...
FR: Mer-merci... Oooh...
OUPS: Th-thank you... Oooh...

JAP: Hmm? Something wrong there?
FR: Hum#? Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: Hmm? Something wrong there?

JAP: Oh, it's nothing. Just...just a little choked up about my dog is all.
FR: Oh, ce n'est rien. Je... je suis inquiet pour mon chien, c'est tout.
OUPS: Oh, it's nothing. Just...just a little choked up about my dog is all.

JAP: Okay. Well try not to worry, all right? I'll do what I can.
FR: D'accord. Ne vous en faites pas trop. Je ferai de mon mieux pour le trouver.
OUPS: Okay. Well try not to worry, all right? I'll do what I can.

JAP: Please find my Max!
FR: Je t'en prie, retrouve Max#!
OUPS: Please find my Max!

JAP: It's the missing dog. ...That old man is going to be pretty upset.
FR: C'est le chien qui a disparu. Le vieil homme aura le cœur brisé.
OUPS: It's the missing dog. ...That old man is going to be pretty upset.

JAP: Hey, wait. I think the dog has something in his mouth.
FR: Attends... Je crois qu'il y a quelque chose dans sa gueule.
OUPS: Hey, wait. I think the dog has something in his mouth.

JAP: ...It's some kind of leaf.
FR: ... On dirait des herbes.
OUPS: ...It's some kind of leaf.

JAP: This is a rather dangerous location for leaf hunting. I wager this decision cost the animal its life.
FR: C'est un endroit plutôt dangereux pour en cueillir. Le pauvre animal aura sacrifié sa vie pour l'atteindre.
OUPS: This is a rather dangerous location for leaf hunting. I wager this decision cost the animal its life.

JAP: Well, the least we can do is bring the leaf back to the old man.
FR: Nous devrions les rapporter au vieil homme. C'est la moindre des choses.
OUPS: Well, the least we can do is bring the leaf back to the old man.

JAP: Where's the old man that lives here?
FR: Où est le vieil homme qui habite ici#?
OUPS: Where's the old man that lives here?

JAP: You mean Granddad? He passed away... His heart finally gave out on him.
FR: Tu veux dire papi#? Il est mort... Son cœur était malade, tu sais...
OUPS: You mean Granddad? He passed away... His heart finally gave out on him.

JAP: Huh. Looks like he went with his best friend after all.
FR: On dirait qu'il est allé rejoindre son meilleur ami.
OUPS: Huh. Looks like he went with his best friend after all.

JAP: Oh, hold on a second. His dog had this leaf in his mouth when we found him.
FR: Oh, j'oubliais#! Son chien avait ces herbes dans sa gueule quand nous l'avons trouvé.
OUPS: Oh, hold on a second. His dog had this leaf in his mouth when we found him.

JAP: That's the herb Granddad used for his heart medication. Max must have been fetching it for him.
FR: Ce sont les herbes qui étaient utilisées pour préparer les médicaments de papi. Max allait en cueillir pour lui.
OUPS: That's the herb Granddad used for his heart medication. Max must have been fetching it for him.

JAP: ...Well, I suppose I owe you a great deal. I can't give you much, but I hope you'll accept this.
FR: ... Je te remercie d'avoir trouvé Max. Je sais que ce n'est pas grand-chose, mais j'aimerais que tu l'acceptes.
OUPS: ...Well, I suppose I owe you a great deal. I can't give you much, but I hope you'll accept this.

JAP: *Sniff* I'm sure gonna miss 'em...
FR: Papi et Max vont vraiment me manquer...
OUPS: *Sniff* I'm sure gonna miss 'em...
