JAP: Damn. I still don't have enough inventory...
FR: Zut, mes stocks ne sont toujours pas suffisants...
OUPS: Damn. I still don't have enough inventory...

JAP: What's the problem?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What's the problem?

JAP: Well, I'm trying to get into the trading business, so I'm stocking up on the essentials.
FR: Eh bien, je veux devenir négociant, alors j'essaie de m'approvisionner en marchandises de base.
OUPS: Well, I'm trying to get into the trading business, so I'm stocking up on the essentials.

JAP: Is this some kind of import-export thing where you sell local products to faraway lands?
FR: Vous comptez importer des produits exotiques et exporter les produits locaux, c'est ça#?
OUPS: Is this some kind of import-export thing where you sell local products to faraway lands?

JAP: Not products so much as raw materials. With every nation running out of the basics, I figure that's the way to make a killing!
FR: Je veux plutôt me spécialiser dans le commerce des matières premières. Elles se vendent toujours bien partout, alors je suis certain de faire un profit#!
OUPS: Not products so much as raw materials. With every nation running out of the basics, I figure that's the way to make a killing!

JAP: But right now I don't have a source for materials, and it's driving me crazy!
FR: Mais je ne sais pas où me les procurer, c'est tellement frustrant#!
OUPS: But right now I don't have a source for materials, and it's driving me crazy!

JAP: I just need to make one trade. Then I can use that money to fund an expedition, and I'll be set for life!<PAGE>But right now I don't have anything to trade. It's a real...whatcha call it? Conundrum.
FR: Si seulement je pouvais obtenir une commande importante#!<PAGE>Je pourrais ensuite utiliser mes profits pour financer une expédition d'approvisionnement et je n'aurai plus jamais de soucis d'argent#!<PAGE>Mais pour l'instant, je n'ai rien à vendre. C'est un, comment dire... un cercle vicieux#!
OUPS: I just need to make one trade. Then I can use that money to fund an expedition, and I'll be set for life!<PAGE>But right now I don't have anything to trade. It's a real...whatcha call it? Conundrum.

JAP: I could get materials for you.
FR: Je pourrais trouver les matériaux pour vous.
OUPS: I could get materials for you.

JAP: Seriously? Well, that would save my bacon!
FR: Vraiment#? Ça me tirerait du pétrin#!
OUPS: Seriously? Well, that would save my bacon!

JAP: What do you need?
FR: De quoi avez-vous besoin au juste#?
OUPS: What do you need?

JAP: It's a pretty big list, so you might want to write it down in that floating notebook of yours. Okay, let's see...
FR: La liste est plutôt longue, alors vous devriez peut-être la noter dans votre calepin volant. Voyons voir...
OUPS: It's a pretty big list, so you might want to write it down in that floating notebook of yours. Okay, let's see...

JAP: I need ten bundles of wool, five lumps of natural rubber, and ten goat hides.
FR: J'ai besoin de dix pelotes de laine, cinq morceaux de caoutchouc et dix peaux de chèvre.
OUPS: I need ten bundles of wool, five lumps of natural rubber, and ten goat hides.

JAP: Those aren't very common. I hope you aren't in a hurry.
FR: Ce ne sont pas des objets faciles à trouver. J'espère que vous n'êtes pas pressé.
OUPS: Those aren't very common. I hope you aren't in a hurry.

JAP: Oh no. Take your time. That'll give me time to set up shop and fill out forms and the like.
FR: Oh non. Prenez votre temps. J'en profiterai pour établir mon magasin et remplir la paperasse nécessaire.
OUPS: Oh no. Take your time. That'll give me time to set up shop and fill out forms and the like.

JAP: Sooo...think you can get it all?
FR: Alors, pensez-vous pouvoir trouver tout ce dont j'ai besoin#?
OUPS: Sooo...think you can get it all?

JAP: I've got your materials.
FR: J'ai les matériaux dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I've got your materials.

JAP: Your timing is...um...what's the word? Impeccable.<PAGE>Yeah, because they're just about to launch the trading vessel.
FR: Vous arrivez, comment dire... pile#! Le cargo va bientôt appareiller.
OUPS: Your timing is...um...what's the word? Impeccable.<PAGE>Yeah, because they're just about to launch the trading vessel.

JAP: As soon as your cargo is on the ship, I can pay you. But if you wanna help load it, I can throw in a little extra!
FR: Je vous rembourserai dès que les marchandises seront à bord. Et si vous m'aidez à faire le chargement, je vous donnerai même un petit supplément#!
OUPS: As soon as your cargo is on the ship, I can pay you. But if you wanna help load it, I can throw in a little extra!

JAP: Sounds like a plan.
FR: Ça me va.
OUPS: Sounds like a plan.

JAP: ...This is a mess.
FR: ... Je ne pensais pas qu'il y en aurait autant.
OUPS: ...This is a mess.

JAP: Yeah, they're loading cargo from all sorts of traders into this ship.<PAGE>It's kind of like...um...you know? Egalitarianism.
FR: Oui, je sais, ce bateau transportera la cargaison de plusieurs marchands. Nous, comment dire... partageons les frais de port.
OUPS: Yeah, they're loading cargo from all sorts of traders into this ship.<PAGE>It's kind of like...um...you know? Egalitarianism.

JAP: I don't understand half the things you say.<PAGE>Anyway, maybe I can organize this.
FR: Je ne suis pas sûr de bien comprendre, mais peu importe. Que dois-je faire#?
OUPS: I don't understand half the things you say.<PAGE>Anyway, maybe I can organize this.

JAP: If you carry the cargo to the front of the ship, the crew can bring it inside for us.
FR: Apportez les marchandises près de la passerelle d'embarquement du bateau et l'équipage s'occupera de faire le chargement.
OUPS: If you carry the cargo to the front of the ship, the crew can bring it inside for us.

JAP: So just carry it over there, then?
FR: Alors, je n'ai qu'à les apporter là-bas#?
OUPS: So just carry it over there, then?

JAP: Okay. All done.
FR: J'ai terminé.
OUPS: Okay. All done.

JAP: You're fantastic. Now we just have to wait for the ship to leave.
FR: Parfait#! Et maintenant, nous n'avons plus qu'à attendre que le cargo lève l'ancre.
OUPS: You're fantastic. Now we just have to wait for the ship to leave.

JAP: You mind if I pay you after the trade is complete? I can give you more money that way.<PAGE>And then everything will be...you know. Awesome.
FR: Dites, ça vous dérange d'attendre que j'aie rempli cette commande avant de recevoir votre récompense#? Je pourrais vous payer plus à ce moment-là.<PAGE>Ce serait, comment dire... génial.
OUPS: You mind if I pay you after the trade is complete? I can give you more money that way.<PAGE>And then everything will be...you know. Awesome.

JAP: ...That's not the word I was expecting you to say. But sure. I can wait.
FR: Ce n'est pas le mot que j'aurais utilisé, mais d'accord. Je peux attendre.
OUPS: ...That's not the word I was expecting you to say. But sure. I can wait.

JAP: Thanks. Boy, the launch day can't come soon enough!
FR: Merci#! Ah, j'ai si hâte de prendre la mer.
OUPS: Thanks. Boy, the launch day can't come soon enough!

JAP: Boy, the launch day can't come soon enough!
FR: Ah, j'ai si hâte de prendre la mer.
OUPS: Boy, the launch day can't come soon enough!

JAP: Hey, how'd the trade go?
FR: Alors, comment s'est passé votre voyage#?
OUPS: Hey, how'd the trade go?

JAP: Oh, it went...um...fine. It was fine.
FR: Oh, euh... Très bien, très bien.
OUPS: Oh, it went...um...fine. It was fine.

JAP: You don't look happy.
FR: Vous n'avez pas l'air heureux.
OUPS: You don't look happy.

JAP: Yeah, well, I didn't realize this until I got on the boat, but apparently I get seasick.<PAGE>...Horribly, violently seasick.
FR: Je ne me suis rendu compte qu'une fois à bord que je souffre du mal de mer#!<PAGE>C'était horrible#!
OUPS: Yeah, well, I didn't realize this until I got on the boat, but apparently I get seasick.<PAGE>...Horribly, violently seasick.

JAP: The smell in my cabin was just unspeakable. I had no idea one guy could create that much...um...you know?
FR: L'odeur de ma cabine était insupportable. Jamais je n'aurais cru qu'un homme pouvait autant, comment dire...
OUPS: The smell in my cabin was just unspeakable. I had no idea one guy could create that much...um...you know?

JAP: Barf?
FR: Vomir#?
OUPS: Barf?

JAP: I want to stay in the trading business, but I don't think that's possible if I can't sail.
FR: Je veux toujours être négociant, mais je ne crois pas pouvoir y arriver si je ne peux pas naviguer.
OUPS: I want to stay in the trading business, but I don't think that's possible if I can't sail.

JAP: Anyway, here's your payment. Thanks again.
FR: M'enfin. Voici votre paiement. Merci encore.
OUPS: Anyway, here's your payment. Thanks again.

JAP: Thanks. And, uh...good luck?
FR: De rien. Et, euh... bon courage#?
OUPS: Thanks. And, uh...good luck?

JAP: I never imagined my dreams would be dashed quite like this. What a bummer.
FR: Je ne pensais pas que mon rêve serait anéanti ainsi. Quelle poisse#!
OUPS: I never imagined my dreams would be dashed quite like this. What a bummer.

JAP: I never imagined my dreams would be dashed quite like this. What a bummer.
FR: Je ne pensais pas que mon rêve serait anéanti ainsi. Quelle poisse#!
OUPS: I never imagined my dreams would be dashed quite like this. What a bummer.

JAP: Hey, Brother? Could you pick something up for me?
FR: Dis, papa, j'ai besoin de quelque chose...
OUPS: Hey, Brother? Could you pick something up for me?

JAP: Sure. What do you want?
FR: De quoi s'agit-il#?
OUPS: Sure. What do you want?

JAP: Um...a melon.
FR: Euh... un melon.
OUPS: Um...a melon.

JAP: A melon? Sure.
FR: Un melon#? Je m'en occupe.
OUPS: A melon? Sure.

JAP: Can you get a melon for me, Brother?
FR: Pourrais-tu m'apporter un melon, papa#?
OUPS: Can you get a melon for me, Brother?

JAP: I got your melon, Yonah.
FR: J'ai le melon que tu voulais, Yonah.
OUPS: I got your melon, Yonah.

JAP: Thanks, Brother!
FR: Merci, papa#!
OUPS: Thanks, Brother!

JAP: If there's anything else you want, just let me know.
FR: Si tu veux autre chose, tu n'as qu'à me le demander, d'accord ma chérie#?
OUPS: If there's anything else you want, just let me know.

JAP: Well, since you offered... Would you mind getting me a watermelon?
FR: Eh bien, puisque tu insistes... Pourrais-tu m'apporter une pastèque#?
OUPS: Well, since you offered... Would you mind getting me a watermelon?

JAP: A watermelon? You got it.
FR: Une pastèque#? Mais bien sûr.
OUPS: A watermelon? You got it.

JAP: Can you get a watermelon for me, Brother?
FR: Pourrais-tu m'apporter une pastèque, papa#?
OUPS: Can you get a watermelon for me, Brother?

JAP: I got your watermelon.
FR: J'ai la pastèque que tu voulais, Yonah.
OUPS: I got your watermelon.

JAP: Thanks, Brother!
FR: Merci, papa#!
OUPS: Thanks, Brother!

JAP: Anything else you need?
FR: Veux-tu autre chose#?
OUPS: Anything else you need?

JAP: I need a pumpkin!
FR: J'aimerais un potiron#!
OUPS: I need a pumpkin!

JAP: A pumpkin? Sure, why not?
FR: Un potiron#? Pourquoi pas#!
OUPS: A pumpkin? Sure, why not?

JAP: Did you find my pumpkin yet, Brother?
FR: Alors, as-tu trouvé un potiron, papa#?
OUPS: Did you find my pumpkin yet, Brother?

JAP: I got your pumpkin, Yonah.
FR: J'ai le potiron que tu voulais, Yonah.
OUPS: I got your pumpkin, Yonah.

JAP: Thanks, Brother!
FR: Merci, papa#!
OUPS: Thanks, Brother!

JAP: I've been getting you lots of food lately, Yonah. What are you planning?
FR: Je t'ai apporté beaucoup de nourriture ces derniers temps, Yonah. Qu'est-ce que tu mijotes#?
OUPS: I've been getting you lots of food lately, Yonah. What are you planning?

JAP: It's a secret! Just wait a little longer, okay?
FR: C'est un secret#! Attends encore un peu, d'accord#?
OUPS: It's a secret! Just wait a little longer, okay?

JAP: Yonah...?
FR: Hum...?
OUPS: Yonah...?

JAP: Ta-daaaah! Here you go, Brother! I made it all by myself!
FR: Voilà#! Regarde, papa, je l'ai fait moi-même#!
OUPS: Ta-daaaah! Here you go, Brother! I made it all by myself!

JAP: ...Is this a cake?
FR: Est-ce un gâteau...?
OUPS: ...Is this a cake?

JAP: Yep! Popola taught me how to bake one!
FR: Oui#! Popola m'a appris la recette#!
OUPS: Yep! Popola taught me how to bake one!

JAP: This is the big secret, Brother! It's why I needed all that fruit.
FR: C'était ça, mon secret#! C'est pour cette raison que j'avais besoin de ces ingrédients#!
OUPS: This is the big secret, Brother! It's why I needed all that fruit.

JAP: Well, um...thanks, Yonah. This is really something.
FR: Euh... merci, Yonah. Je ne sais pas quoi dire.
OUPS: Well, um...thanks, Yonah. This is really something.

JAP: Come on! Try it, try it!
FR: Allez#! Goûte#!
OUPS: Come on! Try it, try it!

JAP: Oh, I'm not all that hungry, so I... Well, all right.<PAGE>Um...hmm... Yeah. This is really good...
FR: Oh, je n'ai pas vraiment faim...<PAGE>Bon, d'accord, juste un petit morceau, alors.<PAGE>Hum... Oui. C'est délicieux...
OUPS: Oh, I'm not all that hungry, so I... Well, all right.<PAGE>Um...hmm... Yeah. This is really good...

JAP: Oh, yay! You work so hard for me, so I wanted to give you something back.
FR: Youpi#! Tu travailles si dur pour moi... Je voulais trouver un moyen de te remercier#!
OUPS: Oh, yay! You work so hard for me, so I wanted to give you something back.

JAP: Uh, yes. Yes. This is great, Yonah. Thank you.
FR: Ah, c'est gentil, Yonah. Merci beaucoup.
OUPS: Uh, yes. Yes. This is great, Yonah. Thank you.

JAP: Thanks! I made, like, seven cakes, so there's tons of leftovers.
FR: De rien#! J'ai fait sept gâteaux, alors tu peux en manger autant que tu veux#!
OUPS: Thanks! I made, like, seven cakes, so there's tons of leftovers.

JAP: Being older brother can be a trying experience.
FR: Avoir des enfants n'est pas toujours facile.
OUPS: Being older brother can be a trying experience.

JAP: Yeah...
FR: À qui le dis-tu...
OUPS: Yeah...

JAP: You seem to be in good spirits.
FR: Vous semblez être de bonne humeur.
OUPS: You seem to be in good spirits.

JAP: Oh, I am! My new flower shop is already far more successful than I ever dreamed!
FR: Et avec raison#! Je vends plus de fleurs que je n'aurais jamais pu l'imaginer#!
OUPS: Oh, I am! My new flower shop is already far more successful than I ever dreamed!

JAP: Really? Well, great!
FR: Vraiment#? Félicitations#!
OUPS: Really? Well, great!

JAP: I was in trouble before, but I think I've got a good foundation here.
FR: J'ai eu des coups durs, mais je crois que j'ai enfin trouvé un endroit où je peux me fixer.
OUPS: I was in trouble before, but I think I've got a good foundation here.

JAP: I was just thinking of sending a letter to my girlfriend in The Aerie. I've put her through a lot, but now I'm ready to start a new and better life.
FR: J'ai écrit une lettre à ma petite amie qui habite l'Aire pour lui annoncer la nouvelle. Elle a enduré beaucoup à cause de moi, mais désormais, ma vie sera plus stable.
OUPS: I was just thinking of sending a letter to my girlfriend in The Aerie. I've put her through a lot, but now I'm ready to start a new and better life.

JAP: I just haven't found the time to track down the postman yet...
FR: Il ne me reste plus qu'à trouver le postier.
OUPS: I just haven't found the time to track down the postman yet...

JAP: Do you want me to deliver the letter for you?
FR: Voulez-vous que je lui apporte directement votre lettre#?
OUPS: Do you want me to deliver the letter for you?

JAP: Oh, really? Are you sure?
FR: Vous feriez ça pour moi#?
OUPS: Oh, really? Are you sure?

JAP: Oh, he's sure. Believe me, this man loves nothing more than meddling in other people's affairs.
FR: Mais bien sûr#! Cet homme adore s'ingérer dans les affaires des autres, croyez-moi#!
OUPS: Oh, he's sure. Believe me, this man loves nothing more than meddling in other people's affairs.

JAP: Huh. That's kinda creepy.<PAGE>But whatever! My girlfriend lives near the chief's house. Give her this freesia with the letter, okay?
FR: Hum. C'est un peu étrange.<PAGE>Mais peu importe#! Tenez, ma petite amie habite une des maisons près de celle du chef du village. Donnez-lui ce freesia avec ma lettre, d'accord#?
OUPS: Huh. That's kinda creepy.<PAGE>But whatever! My girlfriend lives near the chief's house. Give her this freesia with the letter, okay?

JAP: My girlfriend lives near the chief's house. Give her this freesia with the letter, okay?
FR: Ma petite amie habite près de la maison du chef du village. Donnez-lui ce freesia avec ma lettre, d'accord#?
OUPS: My girlfriend lives near the chief's house. Give her this freesia with the letter, okay?

JAP: This must be the place the florist was talking about.
FR: Ce doit être l'endroit dont parlait le marchand de fleurs.
OUPS: This must be the place the florist was talking about.

JAP: ...You think she stepped out?
FR: ... Crois-tu que sa petite amie est sortie faire des courses#?
OUPS: ...You think she stepped out?

JAP: Perhaps she moved. It doesn't look like this house has been occupied for some time.
FR: Elle a peut-être déménagé. On dirait qu'il y a longtemps que personne n'habite plus ici.
OUPS: Perhaps she moved. It doesn't look like this house has been occupied for some time.

JAP: Well, no point hanging around. We'd better go back to town.
FR: Eh bien, il ne servirait à rien de nous attarder. Retournons à Littoral.
OUPS: Well, no point hanging around. We'd better go back to town.

JAP: So? Did she get the letter?
FR: Alors#? Avez-vous donné ma lettre à ma petite amie#?
OUPS: So? Did she get the letter?

JAP: I'm sorry, but the home was empty.
FR: Sa maison était abandonnée. Je suis désolé.
OUPS: I'm sorry, but the home was empty.

JAP: On our way back, we were attacked by a Shade that dropped this...
FR: En partant, une Ombre nous a attaqués et a laissé tomber ceci...
OUPS: On our way back, we were attacked by a Shade that dropped this...

JAP: It's a...it's a freesia.
FR: Un... freesia...
OUPS: It's a...it's a freesia.

JAP: So you think...
FR: Alors, vous croyez que...
OUPS: So you think...

JAP: No. She's alive. I know it. And I'm going to keep living my life for her.
FR: Non. Elle est vivante. Je le sais. Et je vais continuer de vivre pour elle.
OUPS: No. She's alive. I know it. And I'm going to keep living my life for her.

JAP: You are?
FR: Ah bon#?
OUPS: You are?

JAP: I'll stay here and keep the business going. After all, she could come back at any time.
FR: Je vais rester ici et continuer de vendre mes fleurs. Qui sait, elle pourrait revenir à tout moment...
OUPS: I'll stay here and keep the business going. After all, she could come back at any time.

JAP: I'll stay here and keep the business going. After all, she could come back at any time.
FR: Je vais rester ici et continuer de vendre mes fleurs. Qui sait, ma petite amie pourrait revenir à tout moment...
OUPS: I'll stay here and keep the business going. After all, she could come back at any time.

JAP: You look pretty beat up there. What's the problem?
FR: Ça n'a pas l'air d'aller. Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: You look pretty beat up there. What's the problem?

JAP: Well, we serve a very popular dish, but I'm having a lot of trouble finding the ingredients.
FR: Eh bien, je n'arrive pas à me procurer les ingrédients nécessaires pour préparer ma spécialité.
OUPS: Well, we serve a very popular dish, but I'm having a lot of trouble finding the ingredients.

JAP: If we don't find some soon, my business is gonna go under.
FR: Si je n'en trouve pas bientôt, je vais faire faillite#!
OUPS: If we don't find some soon, my business is gonna go under.

JAP: What's the dish?
FR: De quel plat s'agit-il#?
OUPS: What's the dish?

JAP: It's a fragrant herbal pasta with salt-crusted sardines.
FR: Ce sont des sardines grillées accompagnées de pâtes aux fines herbes.
OUPS: It's a fragrant herbal pasta with salt-crusted sardines.

JAP: To make it, I need ten medicinal herbs, ten bags of wheat, and ten sardines.<PAGE>If you can find all that, I'll make it worth your while.
FR: Pour le préparer, j'ai besoin de dix herbes médicinales, dix sacs de blé et dix sardines.<PAGE>Si vous arrivez à vous procurer ces ingrédients pour moi, je vous rembourserai amplement.
OUPS: To make it, I need ten medicinal herbs, ten bags of wheat, and ten sardines.<PAGE>If you can find all that, I'll make it worth your while.

JAP: I found your ingredients. Sorry for the delay.
FR: J'ai les ingrédients dont vous aviez besoin. Je suis désolé d'avoir mis tant de temps à les trouver.
OUPS: I found your ingredients. Sorry for the delay.

JAP: Oh, those fishermen are going to be so appreciative! Let me get your payment...
FR: Oh, les pêcheurs seront ravis#! Laissez-moi vous rembourser...
OUPS: Oh, those fishermen are going to be so appreciative! Let me get your payment...

JAP: You want some dinner before you go? It's on the house!
FR: Et que diriez-vous d'un dîner aux frais de la maison#?
OUPS: You want some dinner before you go? It's on the house!

JAP: Thanks, but I'm in a bit of a hurry. Maybe next time.
FR: Merci, mais je dois partir. Peut-être la prochaine fois.
OUPS: Thanks, but I'm in a bit of a hurry. Maybe next time.

JAP: To make it, I need ten medicinal herbs, ten bags of wheat, and ten sardines.<PAGE>If you can find all that, I'll make it worth your while.
FR: Pour préparer ma spécialité, j'ai besoin de dix herbes médicinales, dix sacs de blé et dix sardines.<PAGE>Si vous arrivez à vous procurer ces ingrédients pour moi, je vous rembourserai amplement.
OUPS: To make it, I need ten medicinal herbs, ten bags of wheat, and ten sardines.<PAGE>If you can find all that, I'll make it worth your while.

JAP: Excuse me, but can I get your help?
FR: Pourriez-vous me donner un coup de main#?
OUPS: Excuse me, but can I get your help?

JAP: What is it?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What is it?

JAP: I need to come up with some new dishes, but I'm just flat out of ideas.
FR: J'aimerais ajouter de nouveaux plats à mon menu, mais je suis à court d'idées.
OUPS: I need to come up with some new dishes, but I'm just flat out of ideas.

JAP: You're a pretty well-traveled man, so if you run into anything interesting during your journeys, please let me know!
FR: Vous voyagez beaucoup, n'est-ce pas#? Si vous trouvez des recettes intéressantes lors de vos aventures, faites-moi signe, d'accord#?
OUPS: You're a pretty well-traveled man, so if you run into anything interesting during your journeys, please let me know!

JAP: Well, I'm not much of a cook, but if I find anything, I'll let you know.
FR: Je ne m'y connais pas vraiment en gastronomie, mais j'ouvrirai l'œil.
OUPS: Well, I'm not much of a cook, but if I find anything, I'll let you know.

JAP: Thanks much!
FR: Merci bien#!
OUPS: Thanks much!

JAP: I have no idea where to get recipe ideas. Maybe we can find a cookbook in the library.
FR: Je ne sais pas où je pourrais trouver des recettes. Hum... Il y aurait peut-être un livre de cuisine à la bibliothèque du village...
OUPS: I have no idea where to get recipe ideas. Maybe we can find a cookbook in the library.

JAP: Let me know if you think of anything!
FR: Faites-moi signe si vous trouvez des recettes#!
OUPS: Let me know if you think of anything!

JAP: Wait, is this a book of recipes?
FR: Une minute, est-ce un livre de cuisine#?
OUPS: Wait, is this a book of recipes?

JAP: Most of these seem to require rather exotic species of fish.
FR: La plupart de ces recettes mentionnent des poissons rares.
OUPS: Most of these seem to require rather exotic species of fish.

JAP: Yeah, I haven't even heard of some of these. Maybe the tavern chef will have a better idea.
FR: Tu as raison, je n'ai jamais entendu parler de certains d'entre eux. Le tavernier de Littoral les reconnaîtra peut-être.
OUPS: Yeah, I haven't even heard of some of these. Maybe the tavern chef will have a better idea.

JAP: I found this cookbook in the library.
FR: J'ai trouvé ce livre à la bibliothèque de mon village.
OUPS: I found this cookbook in the library.

JAP: Oh, wow! I haven't seen one of these in a long time! Hmmm...
FR: Oh, merveilleux#! Je n'ai pas feuilleté un nouveau livre de cuisine depuis des années#! Voyons voir...
OUPS: Oh, wow! I haven't seen one of these in a long time! Hmmm...

JAP: Shark? Really? Wow, this is some high-class cuisine. I've never even tried cooking something like this before.
FR: Du requin#? Vraiment#? Ouah#! C'est de la cuisine gastronomique. Je n'ai jamais essayé de préparer des mets aussi raffinés...
OUPS: Shark? Really? Wow, this is some high-class cuisine. I've never even tried cooking something like this before.

JAP: Hmmm... The shark fin fried rice sounds amazing! Think you could help me track it down?
FR: Hum... Le riz frit aux ailerons de requin a l'air savoureux#! Pourriez-vous m'aider à en trouver les ingrédients#?
OUPS: Hmmm... The shark fin fried rice sounds amazing! Think you could help me track it down?

JAP: ...You can eat shark fins?<PAGE>I mean, um...sure. I'd be happy to help.
FR: ... Les ailerons des requins sont comestibles...?<PAGE>Euh, oui... Bien sûr. Avec plaisir.
OUPS: ...You can eat shark fins?<PAGE>I mean, um...sure. I'd be happy to help.

JAP: Okay! Here's the shopping list!
FR: D'accord#! Voici ma liste#!
OUPS: Okay! Here's the shopping list!

JAP: Five sharks, five bags of rice, and five mushrooms. And thanks in advance.
FR: Il me faut cinq requins, cinq sacs de riz et cinq champignons. Merci d'avance#!
OUPS: Five sharks, five bags of rice, and five mushrooms. And thanks in advance.

JAP: I found your ingredients.
FR: J'ai trouvé les ingrédients dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I found your ingredients.

JAP: Fantastic! Let's see how this tastes!
FR: Fantastique#! J'ai hâte d'y goûter#!
OUPS: Fantastic! Let's see how this tastes!

JAP: Okay, here you are. Go ahead! Let me know what you think!
FR: Voilà, c'est prêt#! Allez, dites-moi ce que vous en pensez#!
OUPS: Okay, here you are. Go ahead! Let me know what you think!

JAP: Hmm... Hmmmm...
FR: Hum... Hum...
OUPS: Hmm... Hmmmm...

JAP: ...Well?
FR: ... Alors#?
OUPS: ...Well?

JAP: It's good, but I don't taste the shark fin at all. Wouldn't it be easier to just make regular fried rice?
FR: Ce n'est pas mauvais, mais je ne sens pas le goût des ailerons de requin. Un riz frit ordinaire ne ferait-il pas aussi bien l'affaire#?
OUPS: It's good, but I don't taste the shark fin at all. Wouldn't it be easier to just make regular fried rice?

JAP: That's funny. I was thinking the same thing. I don't think anyone would pay for all these fancy ingredients anyway.<PAGE>I guess I'll just experiment and see what I can come up with!
FR: C'est bizarre, c'est justement ce que je me disais. Bah, de toute façon, personne ne voudrait payer le prix de ces ingrédients de luxe.<PAGE>Je suppose qu'il ne me reste plus qu'à expérimenter#!
OUPS: That's funny. I was thinking the same thing. I don't think anyone would pay for all these fancy ingredients anyway.<PAGE>I guess I'll just experiment and see what I can come up with!

JAP: Five sharks, five bags of rice, and five mushrooms ought to do it. Many thanks!
FR: Il me faut cinq requins, cinq sacs de riz et cinq champignons. Merci encore#!
OUPS: Five sharks, five bags of rice, and five mushrooms ought to do it. Many thanks!

JAP: Hey, I heard that you can get into Facade, right?<PAGE>Well, I've got a thank-you gift I need delivered over there, so I'm hoping you can help me out.
FR: Hé, j'ai entendu dire que tu peux entrer dans Façade. C'est vrai#?<PAGE>Eh bien, j'aimerais envoyer un cadeau à un de ses habitants. Pourrais-tu m'aider#?
OUPS: Hey, I heard that you can get into Facade, right?<PAGE>Well, I've got a thank-you gift I need delivered over there, so I'm hoping you can help me out.

JAP: No problem.
FR: Bien sûr.
OUPS: No problem.

JAP: That's great! Oh, and it's kind of fragile, so don't jump around or get knocked over on the way. All right?
FR: Super#! Oh, il est fragile, alors ne le laisse surtout pas tomber, hein#?
OUPS: That's great! Oh, and it's kind of fragile, so don't jump around or get knocked over on the way. All right?

JAP: Just get that to the weapon shop in Facade. And thanks again!
FR: Donne-le à l'armurier de Façade. Merci encore#!
OUPS: Just get that to the weapon shop in Facade. And thanks again!

JAP: I've got a parcel for you.
FR: J'ai un colis pour vous.
OUPS: I've got a parcel for you.

JAP: (For me...? Oh, it's a thank-you gift from the traveler that visited earlier!)
FR: (Un colis pour moi...? Oh, c'est un cadeau du voyageur qui m'a rendu visite il y a quelques semaines#!)
OUPS: (For me...? Oh, it's a thank-you gift from the traveler that visited earlier!)

JAP: (What beautiful glassware! Thank you so much for bringing it all the way here.)
FR: (Quel magnifique vase en verre#! Merci de me l'avoir apporté#!)
OUPS: (What beautiful glassware! Thank you so much for bringing it all the way here.)

JAP: All right, I suppose I should report back to the client.
FR: Bon, je suppose que je devrais aller dire au garde que tout s'est bien passé.
OUPS: All right, I suppose I should report back to the client.

JAP: Hey. I was asked to deliver a parcel to you.
FR: Bonjour, on m'a demandé de vous apporter ce colis.
OUPS: Hey. I was asked to deliver a parcel to you.

JAP: (Oh, how nice...)<PAGE>(Wait, it's just a box full of broken glass!)
FR: (Oh, comme c'est gentil...)<PAGE>(Un instant, ce n'est qu'une boîte remplie de morceaux de verre#!)
OUPS: (Oh, how nice...)<PAGE>(Wait, it's just a box full of broken glass!)

JAP: Oh, damn. I'd better go tell the client.
FR: Mince... Je devrais aller annoncer la mauvaise nouvelle au garde.
OUPS: Oh, damn. I'd better go tell the client.

JAP: I'm sorry. It looks like your gift broke on the way.
FR: Je suis désolé. Votre cadeau a été abîmé en cours de route.
OUPS: I'm sorry. It looks like your gift broke on the way.

JAP: Oh. That sucks. <PAGE>...Well, I guess it can't be helped. I've got another one, if you want to try the delivery again.
FR: Oh, voilà qui est vraiment dommage.<PAGE>...#Mais bon, on n'y peut rien. J'ai un autre cadeau identique. Pourrais-tu réessayer#?
OUPS: Oh. That sucks. <PAGE>...Well, I guess it can't be helped. I've got another one, if you want to try the delivery again.

JAP: Thanks for taking the parcel. It's a long journey, so try to keep away from animals or monsters or whatever along the way.
FR: Merci d'avoir accepté de livrer ce colis. Essaie d'éviter les Ombres et les animaux sauvages au cours du trajet.
OUPS: Thanks for taking the parcel. It's a long journey, so try to keep away from animals or monsters or whatever along the way.

JAP: Your delivery is complete.
FR: J'ai remis votre cadeau à son destinataire, comme vous me l'aviez demandé.
OUPS: Your delivery is complete.

JAP: Thanks. Here's what I owe you.
FR: Je te remercie. Voici ta récompense.
OUPS: Thanks. Here's what I owe you.

JAP: (Oh, you're <NIER>, aren't you?)
FR: (Oh, vous êtes <NIER>, n'est-ce pas#?)
OUPS: (Oh, you're <NIER>, aren't you?)

JAP: Yeah. I heard you needed something. What's up?
FR: Oui, j'ai entendu dire que vous aviez besoin de mon aide. Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: Yeah. I heard you needed something. What's up?

JAP: (Rule 56,908 says that in order to strengthen community solidarity, we must interact with others on a regular basis.)
FR: (Selon la loi nº#56#908, nous devons régulièrement entretenir des relations avec autrui afin de développer la solidarité communautaire.)
OUPS: (Rule 56,908 says that in order to strengthen community solidarity, we must interact with others on a regular basis.)

JAP: (You've been spending a lot of time in our city lately. It might be nice to have you join in.)
FR: (Puisque vous avez passé beaucoup de temps dans notre ville dernièrement, je me suis dit qu'il serait bon que vous participiez vous aussi.)
OUPS: (You've been spending a lot of time in our city lately. It might be nice to have you join in.)

JAP: What do I need to do?
FR: Que dois-je faire#?
OUPS: What do I need to do?

JAP: (First, I will tell you who to speak to and what to say.)
FR: (D'abord, je vais vous dire à qui vous adresser et ce que vous devez dire.)
OUPS: (First, I will tell you who to speak to and what to say.)

JAP: (Once you deliver the message, you will receive another message that must be delivered. You must do this five times.)
FR: (Lorsque vous aurez transmis mon message, vous en recevrez un autre. Vous devez transmettre cinq messages.)
OUPS: (Once you deliver the message, you will receive another message that must be delivered. You must do this five times.)

JAP: (If you make a mistake, you must start over from the beginning.)
FR: (Si vous faites une erreur, il vous faudra recommencer du début.)
OUPS: (If you make a mistake, you must start over from the beginning.)

JAP: (The recipient knows what message you'll have, so don't try to cheat your way out of the obligation.)
FR: (Chaque destinataire sait quel message vous devez lui transmettre, alors n'essayez pas de tricher#!)
OUPS: (The recipient knows what message you'll have, so don't try to cheat your way out of the obligation.)

JAP: I fail to see the point in any of this.
FR: Je ne comprends pas l'utilité de ces échanges.
OUPS: I fail to see the point in any of this.

JAP: (I know it may seem odd, but it is a rule, and we must follow it, so...)
FR: (Je sais que cela peut paraître étrange, mais c'est la loi et nous devons tous suivre la loi.)
OUPS: (I know it may seem odd, but it is a rule, and we must follow it, so...)

JAP: Well, if it's a rule, I suppose we don't have a choice.
FR: Eh bien, si c'est la loi, nous n'avons pas vraiment le choix.
OUPS: Well, if it's a rule, I suppose we don't have a choice.

JAP: (Thank you. Here is the first message.)
FR: (Merci. Voici votre premier message.)
OUPS: (Thank you. Here is the first message.)

JAP: (The recipient is the person guarding the left side of the exit. The message is: "The Masked People respect their rules.")
FR: (Transmettez le message suivant au garde à la gauche de l'entrée de la ville#: «#Le peuple masqué est fier de ses lois.#»)
OUPS: (The recipient is the person guarding the left side of the exit. The message is: "The Masked People respect their rules.")

JAP: (I wish you good luck.)
FR: (Bonne chance.)
OUPS: (I wish you good luck.)

JAP: (You appear to have made a mistake. We will start again from the beginning.)
FR: (Il semblerait que vous avez fait une erreur. Recommençons du début.)
OUPS: (You appear to have made a mistake. We will start again from the beginning.)

JAP: (The first recipient is the person guarding the left side of the exit. Please tell him: "The Masked People respect their rules.")
FR: (Le premier destinataire est le garde à la gauche de l'entrée de la ville. Transmettez-lui ce message#: «#Le peuple masqué est fier de ses lois.#»)
OUPS: (The first recipient is the person guarding the left side of the exit. Please tell him: "The Masked People respect their rules.")

JAP: (I wish you good luck.)
FR: (Bonne chance.)
OUPS: (I wish you good luck.)

JAP: (I am sure you will figure out who the recipients are once you explore the city long enough.)
FR: (Je suis certain que vous découvrirez qui sont les destinataires en explorant la ville.)
OUPS: (I am sure you will figure out who the recipients are once you explore the city long enough.)

JAP: (You must start over again if you make a mistake, so choose wisely.)
FR: (N'oubliez pas, vous devrez recommencer du début si vous faites une erreur.)
OUPS: (You must start over again if you make a mistake, so choose wisely.)

JAP: Are you the first recipient?
FR: Êtes-vous le premier destinataire#?
OUPS: Are you the first recipient?

JAP: (I am. Your message, please.)
FR: (Oui. Quel est votre message#?)
OUPS: (I am. Your message, please.)

JAP: <LIST=1602>The Masked People respect their pride.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1602>«#Le peuple masqué est fier.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1602>The Masked People respect their pride.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1603>The Masked People respect their rules.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1603>«#Le peuple masqué est fier de ses lois.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1603>The Masked People respect their rules.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1604>The Masked People respect their wealth.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1604>«#Le peuple masqué est fier de sa richesse.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1604>The Masked People respect their wealth.</LIST>

JAP: (...I'm afraid that's the wrong message. Sorry, but you'll have to start over.)
FR: (... Ce n'est pas le bon message, désolé. Vous devrez recommencer du début.)
OUPS: (...I'm afraid that's the wrong message. Sorry, but you'll have to start over.)

JAP: (...Correct. Rules are the most precious thing we have. Now for your next message.)
FR: (... C'est exact. Nos lois sont notre fierté. Passons au message suivant.)
OUPS: (...Correct. Rules are the most precious thing we have. Now for your next message.)

JAP: (The recipient is the king's right-hand man. The message is: "The Men of the Mask work for the king.")
FR: (Transmettez le message suivant au garde à la gauche de l'entrée du palais#: «#Le peuple masqué est dévoué au roi.#»)
OUPS: (The recipient is the king's right-hand man. The message is: "The Men of the Mask work for the king.")

JAP: (...I'm afraid that's the wrong message. Sorry, but you'll have to start over.)
FR: (... Ce n'est pas le bon message, désolé. Vous devrez recommencer du début.)
OUPS: (...I'm afraid that's the wrong message. Sorry, but you'll have to start over.)

JAP: Are you the second recipient?
FR: Êtes-vous le deuxième destinataire#?
OUPS: Are you the second recipient?

JAP: (I am. Let me hear your message.)
FR: (Oui. Quel est votre message#?)
OUPS: (I am. Let me hear your message.)

JAP: <LIST=1605>The Men of the Mask work for the people.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1605>«#Le peuple masqué est dévoué à la vérité.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1605>The Men of the Mask work for the people.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1606>The Men of the Mask work for the city.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1606>«#Le peuple masqué est dévoué à sa patrie.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1606>The Men of the Mask work for the city.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1607>The Men of the Mask work for the king.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1607>«#Le peuple masqué est dévoué au roi.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1607>The Men of the Mask work for the king.</LIST>

JAP: (...Incorrect. You will have to try again.)
FR: (... Ce n'est pas le bon message. Vous devrez réessayer.)
OUPS: (...Incorrect. You will have to try again.)

JAP: (...Incorrect. You will have to try again.)
FR: (... Ce n'est pas le bon message. Vous devrez réessayer.)
OUPS: (...Incorrect. You will have to try again.)

JAP: (Correct. The Men of the Mask would give all in service of their king.)<PAGE>(Here is your next message.)
FR: (... C'est exact. Nous nous sacrifierions pour notre roi.)<PAGE>(Et maintenant, passons au message suivant.)
OUPS: (Correct. The Men of the Mask would give all in service of their king.)<PAGE>(Here is your next message.)

JAP: (The recipient is the person taking care of the children. The message is: "Child care can be difficult.")
FR: (Transmettez ce message à la personne qui prend soin des enfants#: «#élever des enfants est parfois difficile.#»)
OUPS: (The recipient is the person taking care of the children. The message is: "Child care can be difficult.")

JAP: Are you the third recipient?
FR: Êtes-vous le troisième destinataire#?
OUPS: Are you the third recipient?

JAP: (Yes, I am. May I hear your message?)
FR: (Oui, c'est moi. Quel est votre message#?)
OUPS: (Yes, I am. May I hear your message?)

JAP: <LIST=1608>Child care can be difficult.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1608>«#élever des enfants est parfois difficile.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1608>Child care can be difficult.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1609>Child care can be fun.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1609>«#élever des enfants est parfois amusant.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1609>Child care can be fun.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1610>Child care can be easy.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1610>«#élever des enfants est parfois facile.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1610>Child care can be easy.</LIST>

JAP: (...Correct. Now I will give you the next message.)
FR: (... C'est exact. Et maintenant, je vais vous donner le message suivant.)
OUPS: (...Correct. Now I will give you the next message.)

JAP: (The recipient is the southeastern guardian. The message is: "Only nobility may enter the treasury.")
FR: (Transmettez ce message au garde du sud-est#: «#Seuls les nobles peuvent entrer dans la trésorerie.#»)
OUPS: (The recipient is the southeastern guardian. The message is: "Only nobility may enter the treasury.")

JAP: (...I'm sorry, but that is incorrect. You will have to start over from the beginning.)
FR: (... Je suis désolée, mais ce n'est pas le bon message. Vous devrez recommencer du début.)
OUPS: (...I'm sorry, but that is incorrect. You will have to start over from the beginning.)

JAP: (...I'm sorry, but that is incorrect. You will have to start over from the beginning.)
FR: (... Je suis désolée, mais ce n'est pas le bon message. Vous devrez recommencer du début.)
OUPS: (...I'm sorry, but that is incorrect. You will have to start over from the beginning.)

JAP: Are you the fourth recipient?
FR: Êtes-vous le quatrième destinataire#?
OUPS: Are you the fourth recipient?

JAP: (I am. Give me your message.)
FR: (Oui. Quel est votre message#?)
OUPS: (I am. Give me your message.)

JAP: <LIST=1611>Only animals may enter the treasury.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1611>«#Seuls les animaux peuvent entrer dans la trésorerie.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1611>Only animals may enter the treasury.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1612>Only commoners may enter the treasury.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1612>«#Seuls les roturiers peuvent entrer dans la trésorerie.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1612>Only commoners may enter the treasury.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1613>Only nobility may enter the treasury.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1613>«#Seuls les nobles peuvent entrer dans la trésorerie.#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1613>Only nobility may enter the treasury.</LIST>

JAP: (...Wrong. However, the answer should be clear with a little thought. Better luck next time.)
FR: (... Vous avez tort. Même si vous aviez oublié le message, vous auriez dû pouvoir trouver la réponse en réfléchissant un peu. Soyez plus attentif la prochaine fois.)
OUPS: (...Wrong. However, the answer should be clear with a little thought. Better luck next time.)

JAP: (...Wrong. Even if you've forgotten the message, the answer should be clear with a little thought. Better luck next time.)
FR: (... Vous avez tort. Même si vous aviez oublié le message, vous auriez dû pouvoir trouver la réponse en réfléchissant un peu. Soyez plus attentif la prochaine fois.)
OUPS: (...Wrong. Even if you've forgotten the message, the answer should be clear with a little thought. Better luck next time.)

JAP: (...Right. The treasury houses the most precious objects of our people, and none but royalty has the right to touch them. Now, your final message.)
FR: (... C'est exact. La trésorerie renferme les objets les plus précieux de notre peuple et seuls les nobles ont le droit d'y pénétrer.)<PAGE>(Et maintenant, voici votre dernier message.)
OUPS: (...Right. The treasury houses the most precious objects of our people, and none but royalty has the right to touch them. Now, your final message.)

JAP: (The recipient is the long-winded person. The message is: "Quicksand.")
FR: (Transmettez ce message à la personne la plus prolixe de la ville#: «#Sables mouvants#».)
OUPS: (The recipient is the long-winded person. The message is: "Quicksand.")

JAP: Are you the fifth recipient?
FR: Êtes-vous le cinquième destinataire#?
OUPS: Are you the fifth recipient?

JAP: (Why yes, I am the fifth and final recipient! How fabulous that you have made it this far! Why, I'm astounded! Now state your message.)
FR: (Mais oui, c'est bien moi le cinquième et dernier destinataire#! C'est vraiment formidable que vous soyez parvenu jusqu'ici#!)<PAGE>(Comment avez-vous fait pour savoir que c'était moi#? J'en suis complètement bouche bée#!)<PAGE>(Alors, quel est votre message#?)
OUPS: (Why yes, I am the fifth and final recipient! How fabulous that you have made it this far! Why, I'm astounded! Now state your message.)

JAP: <LIST=1614>Shades</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1614>«#Ombres#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1614>Shades</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1615>Quicksand</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1615>«#Sables mouvants#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1615>Quicksand</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1616>History</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1616>«#Histoire#»</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1616>History</LIST>

JAP: (...Ah, too bad! You're wrong! But don't give up! The key to any successful research is to keep on trying! Just keep trying and trying and trying!)
FR: (... Ah, comme c'est dommage#! Ce n'est pas la bonne réponse#! Mais n'abandonnez pas#! À force de patience, on finit toujours par réussir#! Il faut persévérer#!)
OUPS: (...Ah, too bad! You're wrong! But don't give up! The key to any successful research is to keep on trying! Just keep trying and trying and trying!)

JAP: (...Correct! Amazing, my friend! It is true that quicksand shares a deep, intense relation with the message you have just given me.)<PAGE>(Why, once I remember when I was on vacation and got caught in quicksand...)
FR: (... Bravo#! Toutes mes félicitations, mon ami#! Il est vrai que les sables mouvants sont étroitement liés au message que vous venez de me transmettre.)<PAGE>(Je me souviens même qu'un jour, au cours d'un de mes voyages, je me suis retrouvé enlisé dans des sables mouvants...)
OUPS: (...Correct! Amazing, my friend! It is true that quicksand shares a deep, intense relation with the message you have just given me.)<PAGE>(Why, once I remember when I was on vacation and got caught in quicksand...)

JAP: He certainly enjoys listening to himself.
FR: C'est un véritable moulin à paroles, ma foi#!
OUPS: He certainly enjoys listening to himself.

JAP: (...Ah, too bad! You're wrong! But don't give up! The key to any successful research is to keep on trying! Just keep trying and trying and trying!)
FR: (... Ah, comme c'est dommage#! Ce n'est pas la bonne réponse#! Mais n'abandonnez pas#! À force de patience, on finit toujours par réussir#! Il faut persévérer#!)
OUPS: (...Ah, too bad! You're wrong! But don't give up! The key to any successful research is to keep on trying! Just keep trying and trying and trying!)

JAP: (You have passed your messages to five people. Now those of our city know a great deal more about you.)
FR: (Vous avez transmis un message à cinq personnes. Désormais, les habitants de notre ville vous connaissent mieux.)
OUPS: (You have passed your messages to five people. Now those of our city know a great deal more about you.)

JAP: (Here is your reward for completing the task.)
FR: (Voici votre récompense.)
OUPS: (Here is your reward for completing the task.)

JAP: Well, I'm glad that someone got something out of this.
FR: Je suis content d'avoir accompli quelque chose malgré tout.
OUPS: Well, I'm glad that someone got something out of this.

JAP: This town is beyond my comprehension.
FR: Je n'arriverai jamais à comprendre cette ville.
OUPS: This town is beyond my comprehension.

JAP: (Would you lend an ear to my problems, traveler?)
FR: (Auriez-vous quelques minutes à m'accorder, voyageur#?)
OUPS: (Would you lend an ear to my problems, traveler?)

JAP: Sure.
FR: Mais bien sûr.
OUPS: Sure.

JAP: (My sister's birthday is coming up, and I want to cook her something special...)
FR: (L'anniversaire de ma fille arrive à grands pas et je veux préparer un plat spécial en son honneur.)
OUPS: (My sister's birthday is coming up, and I want to cook her something special...)

JAP: (But Rule 8,614 states that parents cannot purchase food for their children's birthday feasts. Would you be willing to help me?)
FR: (Cependant, la loi nº#8614 dit que les parents ne peuvent pas acheter eux-mêmes de nourriture pour l'anniversaire de leur enfant. Pourriez-vous m'aider#?)
OUPS: (But Rule 8,614 states that parents cannot purchase food for their children's birthday feasts. Would you be willing to help me?)

JAP: If it's for your sister, I'd be more than willing to help.
FR: Pour votre fille, je le ferai volontiers.
OUPS: If it's for your sister, I'd be more than willing to help.

JAP: (Thank you very much.)
FR: (Merci beaucoup.)
OUPS: (Thank you very much.)

JAP: (I need you to bring me ten round, striped food objects.)
FR: (J'ai besoin de dix objets comestibles rayés.)
OUPS: (I need you to bring me ten round, striped food objects.)

JAP: Um...I think you'll need to be more specific.
FR: Euh... Pourriez-vous nous donner plus de détails#?
OUPS: Um...I think you'll need to be more specific.

JAP: (I'm sorry, but Rule 27,229 states that when sending someone on an errand, you cannot state the name of the item you want him to buy.)
FR: (Je suis désolé. La loi nº#27#229 m'empêche de spécifier le nom de l'ingrédient dont j'ai besoin.)
OUPS: (I'm sorry, but Rule 27,229 states that when sending someone on an errand, you cannot state the name of the item you want him to buy.)

JAP: Oh, come on!<PAGE>Fine, I'll do it. But don't expect too much.
FR: Oh, je n'arrive pas à y croire#!<PAGE>... D'accord, je vais essayer, mais à votre place, je ne compterais pas sur moi.
OUPS: Oh, come on!<PAGE>Fine, I'll do it. But don't expect too much.

JAP: Are these watermelons what you were looking for?
FR: Vouliez-vous des pastèques#?
OUPS: Are these watermelons what you were looking for?

JAP: (Yes! That's it! Thank you so much.)
FR: (Oui#! Vous avez bien deviné#! Merci beaucoup.)
OUPS: (Yes! That's it! Thank you so much.)

JAP: Good. I hope your sister enjoys the treat.
FR: Bien. J'espère que votre fille sera contente.
OUPS: Good. I hope your sister enjoys the treat.

JAP: (I'm sure this will make her very happy. I know it isn't much, but please, take this small reward.)
FR: (Oh, elle sera ravie, c'est certain#!)<PAGE>(Tenez, je sais que ce n'est pas grand-chose, mais...)
OUPS: (I'm sure this will make her very happy. I know it isn't much, but please, take this small reward.)

JAP: Is any of this what you were looking for?
FR: Est-ce que c'est ce que vous vouliez#?
OUPS: Is any of this what you were looking for?

JAP: (No, I'm sorry.)
FR: (Non, je suis désolée.)
OUPS: (No, I'm sorry.)

JAP: Great. ...Well, I guess I'll keep looking.
FR: Hum... Je continuerai de chercher, alors.
OUPS: Great. ...Well, I guess I'll keep looking.

JAP: Excuse me, but have you seen my son?
FR: Pardon, aurais-tu vu mon fils par hasard#?
OUPS: Excuse me, but have you seen my son?

JAP: I don't think so. Why, is something wrong?
FR: Je ne crois pas. Pourquoi#? Que s'est-il passé#?
OUPS: I don't think so. Why, is something wrong?

JAP: When I got home, I found a note from him that said he was leaving and not to look for him. What if he's left the village!?<PAGE>Oh, if something happens to my little angel, I'll just DIE!
FR: Quand je suis rentré, j'ai trouvé un message disant qu'il partait pour toujours et de ne pas le chercher. Et s'il avait quitté le village#?!<PAGE>Oh, si quelque chose arrive à mon petit ange, je ne survivrai pas#!
OUPS: When I got home, I found a note from him that said he was leaving and not to look for him. What if he's left the village!?<PAGE>Oh, if something happens to my little angel, I'll just DIE!

JAP: Please, you have to help me! I'll pay you whatever you want! <PAGE>My son shouldn't be too hard to spot. He wears a very odd hat. You can see it from a mile away.
FR: Je t'en supplie, aide-moi#! Je paierais n'importe quoi pour le retrouver#!<PAGE>Cela ne devrait pas être trop difficile puisqu'il porte un chapeau étrange. On peut le repérer facilement même dans une foule.
OUPS: Please, you have to help me! I'll pay you whatever you want! <PAGE>My son shouldn't be too hard to spot. He wears a very odd hat. You can see it from a mile away.

JAP: Okay. When I find him, I'll see if I can't convince him to come home.
FR: Entendu. J'essaierai de le convaincre de rentrer.
OUPS: Okay. When I find him, I'll see if I can't convince him to come home.

JAP: Please. Tell me right away if you find my little angel!
FR: Viens m'avertir dès que tu auras trouvé mon fils, je t'en conjure#!
OUPS: Please. Tell me right away if you find my little angel!

JAP: Hey. You the kid that ran away from home?
FR: Es-tu celui qui s'est enfui de chez ses parents#?
OUPS: Hey. You the kid that ran away from home?

JAP: Huh? Aw, man, how didja—
FR: Hein#? Mais comment vous avez fait pour le savoir#?!
OUPS: Huh? Aw, man, how didja—

JAP: I don't know why you left, but I think you should go back. Your family's sick with worry.
FR: Je ne sais pas pourquoi tu t'es enfui, mais tu devrais rentrer. Ta famille s'inquiète beaucoup à ton sujet.
OUPS: I don't know why you left, but I think you should go back. Your family's sick with worry.

JAP: No way! They want me to, like, take up the family business.<PAGE>And I ain't doin' it, man! I'm a rebel!
FR: Jamais#! Ils veulent me forcer à être leur héritier#!<PAGE>Je refuse#! Je suis un rebelle#!
OUPS: No way! They want me to, like, take up the family business.<PAGE>And I ain't doin' it, man! I'm a rebel!

JAP: Yes, we can see that.<PAGE>Well, perhaps you should let your family know that you are alive and well, and also explain to them why you left.
FR: Oui, nous pouvons le constater.<PAGE>Eh bien, tu devrais peut-être tout de même les informer que tu es toujours en vie et leur expliquer la raison de ta fuite.
OUPS: Yes, we can see that.<PAGE>Well, perhaps you should let your family know that you are alive and well, and also explain to them why you left.

JAP: Aw, man, people always gotta hassle me!<PAGE>Yeah, all right. I'll do it. But first you gotta do something for ME, man!
FR: Ah, pourquoi on peut pas me laisser tranquille à la fin#?!<PAGE>D'accord, d'accord, je leur dirai. Mais d'abord, je veux que vous fassiez quelque chose pour moi#!
OUPS: Aw, man, people always gotta hassle me!<PAGE>Yeah, all right. I'll do it. But first you gotta do something for ME, man!

JAP: There's this guy that's been helping me since I got here. The man who runs the tavern.<PAGE>Anyway, I wanna give 'im something nice.
FR: Il y a quelqu'un qui m'aide un peu depuis que je me suis enfui. Vous savez, le tavernier#? J'aimerais lui offrir quelque chose.
OUPS: There's this guy that's been helping me since I got here. The man who runs the tavern.<PAGE>Anyway, I wanna give 'im something nice.

JAP: I was thinking I could, like, cook dinner or something? But I don't have any ingredients or whatever, so...yeah.
FR: Je pourrais lui préparer à dîner, par exemple. Mais j'ai pas les ingrédients nécessaires, alors...
OUPS: I was thinking I could, like, cook dinner or something? But I don't have any ingredients or whatever, so...yeah.

JAP: Oh, for hell's sakes. ...Fine. What do you need?
FR: Oh, pour l'amour de... *soupir*<PAGE>De quoi as-tu besoin#?
OUPS: Oh, for hell's sakes. ...Fine. What do you need?

JAP: This guy, man, he don't eat nothing but fish. All the time, every day, fish, fish, fish. So I was thinking he might, like, wanna try eating meat or whatever?
FR: Ce mec-là, il mange que du poisson. Matin, midi, soir#: poisson, poisson, poisson.<PAGE>Alors, je pensais lui offrir de la viande ou quelque chose du genre. Ça serait différent.
OUPS: This guy, man, he don't eat nothing but fish. All the time, every day, fish, fish, fish. So I was thinking he might, like, wanna try eating meat or whatever?

JAP: So could you get me, like, five pieces of mutton and three pieces of goat meat?<PAGE>I can find the pans and spoons and stuff, so just bring the meat to his place whenever, man.
FR: J'aurais besoin, disons, de cinq gigots de mouton et trois de chèvre.<PAGE>Je peux trouver des casseroles et de la vaisselle quelque part, alors vous avez qu'à apporter la viande à la taverne.
OUPS: So could you get me, like, five pieces of mutton and three pieces of goat meat?<PAGE>I can find the pans and spoons and stuff, so just bring the meat to his place whenever, man.

JAP: Hang on. I'll have your stuff before too long.
FR: Patience#! Je vous apporterai bientôt ce dont vous avez besoin.
OUPS: Hang on. I'll have your stuff before too long.

JAP: My "stuff"? And what stuff would this be...?
FR: Ce dont j'ai besoin...? De quoi parlez-vous donc#?
OUPS: My "stuff"? And what stuff would this be...?

JAP: Hey. You the guy that's taking care of that runaway?
FR: Bonjour. C'est vous qui prenez soin du fugueur#?
OUPS: Hey. You the guy that's taking care of that runaway?

JAP: ...Runaway? What are you talking about?
FR: ... Un fugueur#? Mais qu'est-ce que vous racontez#?
OUPS: ...Runaway? What are you talking about?

JAP: It seems we've been bamboozled.
FR: Il semblerait que nous nous sommes faits avoir.
OUPS: It seems we've been bamboozled.

JAP: Goddammit, when I find that stupid kid...<PAGE>Well, I guess we can tell his parents he's alive, at least.
FR: Bon sang#! Quand je vais le trouver...<PAGE>Nous pouvons au moins dire à ses parents qu'il est toujours vivant.
OUPS: Goddammit, when I find that stupid kid...<PAGE>Well, I guess we can tell his parents he's alive, at least.

JAP: Your son come back yet?
FR: Est-ce que votre fils est rentré#?
OUPS: Your son come back yet?

JAP: No, I haven't seen him. Oh, my poor little angel! Where could he be!?
FR: Non, je ne l'ai pas vu. Oh, mon pauvre petit ange#! Où peut-il bien être#?!
OUPS: No, I haven't seen him. Oh, my poor little angel! Where could he be!?

JAP: He's in Seafront. Well, he was, until he ran away again.
FR: Il est à Littoral. Du moins, il l'était avant de s'enfuir de nouveau.
OUPS: He's in Seafront. Well, he was, until he ran away again.

JAP: Oh, dear. Did he tell you an elaborate story and then ask for help?
FR: Oh non#! T'a-t-il raconté une histoire à dormir debout pour te demander ton aide#?
OUPS: Oh, dear. Did he tell you an elaborate story and then ask for help?

JAP: My little angel is a bit of a...well, he's a dirty liar. I probably should have mentioned that.
FR: Mon petit ange est un... euh, menteur éhonté. J'aurais dû t'en avertir.
OUPS: My little angel is a bit of a...well, he's a dirty liar. I probably should have mentioned that.

JAP: Little bastard sent us on a wild goose chase and then gave us the slip.
FR: Le petit vaurien nous a fait courir partout pour rien pour mieux nous fausser compagnie.
OUPS: Little bastard sent us on a wild goose chase and then gave us the slip.

JAP: Since I cannot imagine you letting this go, perhaps we should return to Seafront. There may still be a lead or two left to pursue.
FR: Puisque je sais très bien qu'il te serait impossible d'oublier cette histoire, nous devrions retourner à Littoral.<PAGE>Nous y trouverons peut-être des indices qui nous aideront à retrouver le vaurien.
OUPS: Since I cannot imagine you letting this go, perhaps we should return to Seafront. There may still be a lead or two left to pursue.

JAP: I'm gonna put that kid in a headlock and drag him all the way back home.
FR: Je vais le ramener chez lui en le tirant par les oreilles#!
OUPS: I'm gonna put that kid in a headlock and drag him all the way back home.

JAP: Say, I hear you're looking for a runaway son?
FR: On raconte que vous êtes à la recherche d'un fugueur...
OUPS: Say, I hear you're looking for a runaway son?

JAP: Yeah, there was some strange kid asking people questions earlier. I think he was trying to learn how to get into Facade.
FR: Eh bien, l'autre jour, un jeune homme étrange posait toutes sortes de questions. Je crois qu'il voulait savoir comment entrer dans Façade.
OUPS: Yeah, there was some strange kid asking people questions earlier. I think he was trying to learn how to get into Facade.

JAP: Facade, huh? Well, he's not getting away from me this time.
FR: Hum, Façade#? Cette fois, il ne m'échappera pas#!
OUPS: Facade, huh? Well, he's not getting away from me this time.

JAP: (A man moved into that house the other day. He certainly wears a very strange hat...)
FR: (L'autre jour, un jeune homme au chapeau étrange a emménagé dans la maison là-bas.)
OUPS: (A man moved into that house the other day. He certainly wears a very strange hat...)

JAP: (Shockingly enough, he fits in perfectly. He even speaks our language and knows most of the rules!)
FR: (La chose la plus étonnante, c'est qu'il s'est parfaitement intégré à notre société. Il parle notre langue et connaît même la plupart des lois#!)
OUPS: (Shockingly enough, he fits in perfectly. He even speaks our language and knows most of the rules!)

JAP: (I hear the new outsider came here after fleeing a terrible home life.)
FR: (J'ai entendu dire que le jeune étranger est venu ici pour échapper à sa famille.)
OUPS: (I hear the new outsider came here after fleeing a terrible home life.)

JAP: Hey! You! You're coming with me.
FR: Hé#! Un instant#! Cette fois, je ne te laisserai pas t'enfuir#!
OUPS: Hey! You! You're coming with me.

JAP: Aw, man! Why you gotta be all, like, following me and stuff?
FR: Ah, c'est pas vrai#! Pourquoi vous me suivez comme ça#?
OUPS: Aw, man! Why you gotta be all, like, following me and stuff?

JAP: Fiiiine. Lemme just pack and then I'll...<PAGE>......<PAGE>OHMIGOSH! THERE'S A GIANT SHADE BEHIND YOU!
FR: Bon, d'accord, je vais rentrer. Laissez-moi faire mes bagages et...<PAGE>...<PAGE>ATTENTION#! IL Y A UNE OMBRE GéANTE DERRIèRE VOUS#!!
OUPS: Fiiiine. Lemme just pack and then I'll...<PAGE>......<PAGE>OHMIGOSH! THERE'S A GIANT SHADE BEHIND YOU!

JAP: Oh, are you kiddin' me!?
FR: Oh, il plaisante ou quoi#?!
OUPS: Oh, are you kiddin' me!?

JAP: He has doubtless fled the city, though he could not have gone much further than that.
FR: Il n'est probablement plus dans la ville, mais il ne peut pas être bien loin.
OUPS: He has doubtless fled the city, though he could not have gone much further than that.

JAP: Aw, maaaan! Again!? All right, fine. Lemme just...
FR: Ah, pas encore#! D'accord, d'accord, laissez-moi juste...
OUPS: Aw, maaaan! Again!? All right, fine. Lemme just...

JAP: I didn't think I'd actually run into wolves for real!
FR: Je pensais pas que je me ferais attaquer par des loups#!
OUPS: I didn't think I'd actually run into wolves for real!

JAP: Are you ready to go home yet?
FR: Es-tu prêt à rentrer maintenant#?
OUPS: Are you ready to go home yet?

JAP: Yeah, man. Hell, yeah! This adventure stuff is, like, way too scary for me. I'm gonna stick close to home and stuff.
FR: Ah pour ça, oui#! J'en ai assez de toutes ces aventures#! C'est beaucoup trop dangereux. À partir de maintenant, je vais rester sagement à la maison.
OUPS: Yeah, man. Hell, yeah! This adventure stuff is, like, way too scary for me. I'm gonna stick close to home and stuff.

JAP: Good. Now let's go tell the family.
FR: Bien. Allons avertir ta famille.
OUPS: Good. Now let's go tell the family.

JAP: ...Nobody's here.
FR: ... Il n'y a personne.
OUPS: ...Nobody's here.

JAP: I believe they left us a note.
FR: Je crois que le père du fugueur nous a laissé un message.
OUPS: I believe they left us a note.

JAP: Thanks to your help, our little angel has returned to take up the family business.
FR: «#Grâce à toi, mon petit ange est revenu et a accepté de remplir son rôle d'héritier.#»
OUPS: Thanks to your help, our little angel has returned to take up the family business.

JAP: We have decided to move to a new land to begin anew and thoroughly train him to carry on the family name.
FR: «#J'ai décidé de recommencer nos vies ailleurs afin de pouvoir lui inculquer les traditions familiales.#»
OUPS: We have decided to move to a new land to begin anew and thoroughly train him to carry on the family name.

JAP: Well, it's good to see them taking an interest in...<PAGE>Hey! They didn't pay me!
FR: Je suis heureux de voir qu'il a finalement...<PAGE>Un instant#! Il ne m'a jamais payé#!
OUPS: Well, it's good to see them taking an interest in...<PAGE>Hey! They didn't pay me!

JAP: Hey! Are you friends with the people who lived here!?
FR: Hé#! Es-tu un ami des gens qui habitaient ici#?!
OUPS: Hey! Are you friends with the people who lived here!?

JAP: No. Why?
FR: Non, pourquoi#?
OUPS: No. Why?

JAP: Because the goddamn bastards borrowed money from everyone in the village and skipped town!<PAGE>Apparently, their son ran away because he wanted to escape a life of crime, but then some idiot brought him back.
FR: Ces sales bandits ont emprunté de l'argent à tous les habitants du village avant de déguerpir#!<PAGE>Leur fils s'était enfui pour échapper à sa famille d'escrocs, mais apparemment un imbécile l'a convaincu de rentrer au bercail.
OUPS: Because the goddamn bastards borrowed money from everyone in the village and skipped town!<PAGE>Apparently, their son ran away because he wanted to escape a life of crime, but then some idiot brought him back.

JAP: ...This has been the worst job ever.
FR: ... C'est le pire boulot que j'aie jamais eu.
OUPS: ...This has been the worst job ever.

JAP: Perhaps we should just tally this up as an expensive life lesson and move on.
FR: On peut toujours tirer une leçon de ses erreurs... Tu auras beaucoup appris cette fois, voilà tout.
OUPS: Perhaps we should just tally this up as an expensive life lesson and move on.

JAP: I can find the pans and spoons and stuff, so just bring the meat to his place whenever, man.
FR: Je peux trouver des casseroles et de la vaisselle quelque part, alors vous avez qu'à apporter la viande à son magasin.
OUPS: I can find the pans and spoons and stuff, so just bring the meat to his place whenever, man.

JAP: Aha! So he's disguised himself as one of the Masked People. No wonder we lost his trail.
FR: Alors, il s'est déguisé en guerrier du masque#! Il n'est pas étonnant que nous ayons perdu sa trace.
OUPS: Aha! So he's disguised himself as one of the Masked People. No wonder we lost his trail.

JAP: He's gone through a hell of a lot of trouble trying to lose us. I can't wait to finally catch him.
FR: Il se donne beaucoup de mal pour nous semer. J'ai bien hâte de l'attraper.
OUPS: He's gone through a hell of a lot of trouble trying to lose us. I can't wait to finally catch him.

JAP: He's heading for the eastern road! We must catch him before he leaves the desert!
FR: Il se dirige sûrement vers la route de l'est#! Nous devons le rattraper avant qu'il ne sorte du désert#!
OUPS: He's heading for the eastern road! We must catch him before he leaves the desert!

JAP: (Hey, you wanna do a poor schlub a favor?)
FR: (Dites, pourriez-vous rendre service à un pauvre ballot#?)
OUPS: (Hey, you wanna do a poor schlub a favor?)

JAP: Wow. You sound pretty low there.
FR: Ça n'a vraiment pas l'air d'aller. Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: Wow. You sound pretty low there.

JAP: (I've been cheating on my wife, and she found out. Then she kicked me out of the house.)
FR: (Ma femme a découvert que je la trompais. Elle m'a mis à la rue.)
OUPS: (I've been cheating on my wife, and she found out. Then she kicked me out of the house.)

JAP: I hope you don't want sympathy from us!
FR: J'espère que vous ne vous attendez pas à ce que nous vous prenions en pitié#!
OUPS: I hope you don't want sympathy from us!

JAP: (No, no. I know I've been a selfish idiot. I just want her to take me back, so I was hoping to give her a present.)
FR: (Non, non, je sais bien que j'ai agi de manière infâme. Seulement, j'espérais qu'elle me pardonnerait si je lui offrais un cadeau.)
OUPS: (No, no. I know I've been a selfish idiot. I just want her to take me back, so I was hoping to give her a present.)

JAP: (I want to make her a coat from wolf hides, but I don't know where to find them.)
FR: (Je veux lui fabriquer un manteau de peaux de loup, mais je ne sais pas où en trouver.)
OUPS: (I want to make her a coat from wolf hides, but I don't know where to find them.)

JAP: So you want us to hunt some wolves for you?
FR: Alors, vous voulez que j'aille à la chasse au loup#?
OUPS: So you want us to hunt some wolves for you?

JAP: (That's the idea. Can I count on you?)
FR: (Oui, puis-je compter sur vous#?)
OUPS: (That's the idea. Can I count on you?)

JAP: I don't know why I'm helping you, but...all right. Family is important.
FR: Vous ne méritez pas que je vous aide, mais... d'accord. La famille, c'est important.
OUPS: I don't know why I'm helping you, but...all right. Family is important.

JAP: (Thank you. I just need ten wolf hides.)
FR: (Merci beaucoup. J'ai besoin de dix peaux de loup.)
OUPS: (Thank you. I just need ten wolf hides.)

JAP: I got your ten wolf hides.
FR: Voici vos dix peaux de loup.
OUPS: I got your ten wolf hides.

JAP: (I can't believe you'd help a scumbag like me.)<PAGE>(Anyway, thanks. Here's your reward.)
FR: (Je n'arrive pas à croire que vous ayez aidé un fumier comme moi.)<PAGE>(Merci encore. Voici votre récompense.)
OUPS: (I can't believe you'd help a scumbag like me.)<PAGE>(Anyway, thanks. Here's your reward.)

JAP: Do you think your wife will like the gift?
FR: Croyez-vous que votre femme appréciera votre cadeau#?
OUPS: Do you think your wife will like the gift?

JAP: (I don't know. Whenever I approach, she starts throwing things at me.)
FR: (Je ne sais pas. Quand je m'approche d'elle, elle me lance tout ce qu'elle a sous la main.)
OUPS: (I don't know. Whenever I approach, she starts throwing things at me.)

JAP: That's going to make it tough to give her the present.
FR: Il sera difficile de lui offrir quoi que ce soit dans de telles conditions.
OUPS: That's going to make it tough to give her the present.

JAP: (Could you... Listen, I know how lame this is, but could you maybe go talk to her for me? She's on the floor just above us.)
FR: (Pourriez-vous... écoutez, je sais que tout ça ne vous concerne pas, mais pourriez-vous aller lui parler#? Elle est tout en haut des escaliers.)
OUPS: (Could you... Listen, I know how lame this is, but could you maybe go talk to her for me? She's on the floor just above us.)

JAP: (I need ten wolf hides. ...And thanks.)
FR: (J'ai besoin de dix peaux de loup... Merci.)
OUPS: (I need ten wolf hides. ...And thanks.)

JAP: Um...ma'am? I'm here to talk to you about your husband.
FR: Euh, madame...? Je suis venu vous parler de votre mari.
OUPS: Um...ma'am? I'm here to talk to you about your husband.

JAP: (That son of a bitch! I bet he sent you here with some pathetic apology gift, didn't he!?)
FR: (Ce salaud#! Je parie qu'il vous a envoyé ici avec un cadeau minable pour me dire qu'il était désolé#!)
OUPS: (That son of a bitch! I bet he sent you here with some pathetic apology gift, didn't he!?)

JAP: Urgh...that obvious, huh?
FR: Ah... Vous vous y attendiez#?
OUPS: Urgh...that obvious, huh?

JAP: (Ha! That man's worthless. And those other women of his are just toying with him.)
FR: (Pfft#! Ce n'est qu'un bon à rien#! Il ne se rend même pas compte que ses maîtresses se jouent de lui.)
OUPS: (Ha! That man's worthless. And those other women of his are just toying with him.)

JAP: (Men are so stupid. They know they're going to get caught, but they try to sneak around and get something on the side anyway.)
FR: (Les hommes sont tous des idiots. Ils essaient toujours de faire de nouvelles conquêtes même s'ils savent très bien qu'ils se feront tôt ou tard prendre en flagrant délit.)
OUPS: (Men are so stupid. They know they're going to get caught, but they try to sneak around and get something on the side anyway.)

JAP: (He shouldn't have gotten you involved. He'll be hearing from me about this, I promise you!)
FR: (Il n'aurait pas dû vous mêler à notre querelle. Il va en entendre parler, je peux vous l'assurer#!)
OUPS: (He shouldn't have gotten you involved. He'll be hearing from me about this, I promise you!)

JAP: (I managed to patch things up...more or less.)<PAGE>(Anyway, thank you. I couldn't have done it without your help.)
FR: (Je me suis réconcilié avec ma femme... bah, plus ou moins.)<PAGE>(Merci encore, je n'aurais pas réussi sans votre aide.)
OUPS: (I managed to patch things up...more or less.)<PAGE>(Anyway, thank you. I couldn't have done it without your help.)

JAP: She's a good woman. Stop taking her for granted.
FR: Vous n'appréciez pas votre femme à sa juste valeur.
OUPS: She's a good woman. Stop taking her for granted.

JAP: (Oh, I won't, I swear! I'm even going to stop going to the tavern!)<PAGE>(...As much as I used to.)<PAGE>(Maybe just twice a week or so!)
FR: (Oh, je sais#! Mais tout va changer désormais#! Et je n'irai plus à la taverne#!)<PAGE>(... Du moins, plus aussi souvent qui j'y allais avant.)<PAGE>(Peut-être juste deux ou trois fois par semaine et c'est tout#!)
OUPS: (Oh, I won't, I swear! I'm even going to stop going to the tavern!)<PAGE>(...As much as I used to.)<PAGE>(Maybe just twice a week or so!)

JAP: (My wife is on the floor above us. Can you please talk some sense into her?)
FR: (Ma femme est en haut des escaliers, là-bas. Pourriez-vous aller lui faire entendre raison#?)
OUPS: (My wife is on the floor above us. Can you please talk some sense into her?)

JAP: (Doesn't she ever get sick of eating the same thing all the time?)<PAGE>(...Ah! Wait! Forget I said that!)
FR: (Bleuh... Ça ne la dérange pas de toujours manger la même chose#?)<PAGE>(Ah...! Euh, oubliez ça#!)
OUPS: (Doesn't she ever get sick of eating the same thing all the time?)<PAGE>(...Ah! Wait! Forget I said that!)

JAP: (You know the worst part? He's a good husband when he isn't cheating on me.)<PAGE>(His unfaithfulness is like a disease that won't go away.)
FR: (Le pire, c'est qu'il est un bon mari quand il ne court pas les jupons.)<PAGE>(Toutefois, son infidélité est comme une maladie incurable...)
OUPS: (You know the worst part? He's a good husband when he isn't cheating on me.)<PAGE>(His unfaithfulness is like a disease that won't go away.)

JAP: Hey! You gotta help me out here, you just gotta! I'm having serious girl trouble!
FR: Aidez-moi#! S'il vous plaît, aidez-moi#! Je suis dans le pétrin#! C'est à cause de cette fille, voyez-vous...
OUPS: Hey! You gotta help me out here, you just gotta! I'm having serious girl trouble!

JAP: See, there's this girl that I'm pretty wild for, so I asked her out. But she won't even consider it unless I take her to a really nice restaurant.
FR: Elle me plaît, alors je l'ai invitée à dîner, mais elle dit qu'elle n'acceptera que si je l'emmène dans un restaurant chic.
OUPS: See, there's this girl that I'm pretty wild for, so I asked her out. But she won't even consider it unless I take her to a really nice restaurant.

JAP: That seems rather selfish of her.
FR: Cela semble plutôt exigeant.
OUPS: That seems rather selfish of her.

JAP: No, no! It's not like that! She's just a girl who appreciates the finer things in life. First class all the way, right? You know the type!
FR: Non, non#! Pas du tout#! Elle a simplement des goûts raffinés. Elle est habituée à vivre dans le luxe, voyez-vous...
OUPS: No, no! It's not like that! She's just a girl who appreciates the finer things in life. First class all the way, right? You know the type!

JAP: Oh, I know the type...
FR: Oh, je vois très bien.
OUPS: Oh, I know the type...

JAP: Hey, guess what!? I went shopping with my girl a little while back!
FR: Hé, vous ne devinerez jamais ce qui m'est arrivé#! L'autre jour, je faisais les magasins avec mon amie et...
OUPS: Hey, guess what!? I went shopping with my girl a little while back!

JAP: You mean the girl who won't date you unless you take her to fancy restaurants?
FR: Celle qui ne veut aller que dans les restaurants chics#?
OUPS: You mean the girl who won't date you unless you take her to fancy restaurants?

JAP: Yeah, that's her. Anyway, there was this really amazing piece of jewelry on sale, so I bought it for her. I thought she'd be pretty impressed...
FR: Oui, c'est ça. Eh bien, j'ai aperçu un bijou magnifique en solde alors je le lui ai offert. Je croyais qu'il lui plairait, mais…
OUPS: Yeah, that's her. Anyway, there was this really amazing piece of jewelry on sale, so I bought it for her. I thought she'd be pretty impressed...

JAP: But she refused to take it! She said that only commoners wear jewelry that was on sale!
FR: Elle n'a pas voulu l'accepter#! Elle a dit que seuls les pauvres portent des bijoux qui étaient en solde#!
OUPS: But she refused to take it! She said that only commoners wear jewelry that was on sale!

JAP: She sounds like a real class act.
FR: Elle a l'air tout à fait charmante.
OUPS: She sounds like a real class act.

JAP: Oh, she is! I should have known better than to try and impress her with such shabby flim-flam.
FR: Oh, elle l'est#! J'aurais pourtant dû savoir que je ne pourrais pas la séduire avec de la pacotille...
OUPS: Oh, she is! I should have known better than to try and impress her with such shabby flim-flam.

JAP: Next time, I'll ask the merchant to double the price! That's SURE to impress her, right?
FR: La prochaine fois, je demanderai au marchand de doubler le prix#! Ça l'impressionnera à coup sûr#!
OUPS: Next time, I'll ask the merchant to double the price! That's SURE to impress her, right?

JAP: Are you certain this woman even cares for you?
FR: Êtes-vous certain qu'elle s'intéresse à vous#?
OUPS: Are you certain this woman even cares for you?

JAP: Of course she does!
FR: Mais bien sûr#!
OUPS: Of course she does!

JAP: You humans certainly have complex and exhausting mating rituals.
FR: Tout cela me semble bien épuisant. Les humains se courtisent-ils tous de façon aussi complexe#?
OUPS: You humans certainly have complex and exhausting mating rituals.

JAP: Hey, hey! I heard you can get inside Facade, right?
FR: Hé#! J'ai entendu dire que vous pouvez entrer dans Façade. C'est vrai#?
OUPS: Hey, hey! I heard you can get inside Facade, right?

JAP: Yeah, but I don't really want to—
FR: Oui, mais je n'ai pas vraiment...
OUPS: Yeah, but I don't really want to—

JAP: Oh, perfect! Listen, there's something there that you HAVE to get for me!
FR: Oh, parfait#! Pourriez-vous me rendre un service#? C'est très important#!
OUPS: Oh, perfect! Listen, there's something there that you HAVE to get for me!

JAP: My girl wants a new accessory, but it has to be made from this really rare metal that they carry in Facade's strange-thing store.
FR: Mon amie veut un bijou, mais il faut qu'il soit fait d'un minerai très rare qui est vendu dans le magasin de curiosités de Façade.
OUPS: My girl wants a new accessory, but it has to be made from this really rare metal that they carry in Facade's strange-thing store.

JAP: So next time you're there, could you buy some for me? I think it's called fluorite. Please!?
FR: Alors, la prochaine fois que vous y serez, pourriez-vous m'en acheter#? C'est de la fluorine, si je me souviens bien. Je vous en supplie#!
OUPS: So next time you're there, could you buy some for me? I think it's called fluorite. Please!?

JAP: ...Your funeral, pal.
FR: ... Si vous insistez.
OUPS: ...Your funeral, pal.

JAP: Oh, thank you! This is fantastic!
FR: Oh, merveilleux#! Merci beaucoup#!
OUPS: Oh, thank you! This is fantastic!

JAP: Man, my girl is gonna freak out when she sees that accessory!
FR: Oh, mon amie sera folle de joie quand elle verra mon cadeau#!
OUPS: Man, my girl is gonna freak out when she sees that accessory!

JAP: A girl that measures love by the price tag. Sounds like a real winner.
FR: Quelqu'un qui évalue l'affection des autres selon le prix de leurs cadeaux... Elle semble vraiment sympathique.
OUPS: A girl that measures love by the price tag. Sounds like a real winner.

JAP: Hey, you have any fluorite for sale?
FR: Dites, vendez-vous de la fluorine#?
OUPS: Hey, you have any fluorite for sale?

JAP: (I'm sorry, sir, but the mine that supplied us with that material has been exhausted.)
FR: (Je suis désolé. Le filon que nous exploitions est épuisé.)
OUPS: (I'm sorry, sir, but the mine that supplied us with that material has been exhausted.)

JAP: Oh.
FR: Oh.
OUPS: Oh.

JAP: (There is possibly some inside the Barren Temple. The rules, of course, forbid me from entering the temple, but if you were to go...)
FR: (Il serait peut-être possible d'en trouver dans le temple stérile. La loi m'interdit bien sûr d'y pénétrer, mais vous...)
