OUPS: (There is possibly some inside the Barren Temple. The rules, of course, forbid me from entering the temple, but if you were to go...)

JAP: Hell, I'm already in this thing up to my eyeballs. Might as well finish the job.
FR: Bah, je suis déjà enlisé jusqu'au cou. Autant continuer.
OUPS: Hell, I'm already in this thing up to my eyeballs. Might as well finish the job.

JAP: Here's the ore you wanted.
FR: Voici le minerai que vous vouliez.
OUPS: Here's the ore you wanted.

JAP: Oh, thank you! Now maybe my girl will let me hold her hand!
FR: Oh, merci beaucoup#! Maintenant, mon amie me permettra peut-être de lui tenir la main#!
OUPS: Oh, thank you! Now maybe my girl will let me hold her hand!

JAP: Here's the money for the material, and a little extra for your time!
FR: Laissez-moi vous rembourser#! J'ai inclus un petit supplément pour tout le mal que vous vous êtes donné.
OUPS: Here's the money for the material, and a little extra for your time!

JAP: Huh!? Hold on, this is way too much.
FR: Comment#?! Un instant, c'est beaucoup trop#!
OUPS: Huh!? Hold on, this is way too much.

JAP: Are you kidding? That's what fluorite costs you on the open market! I only threw in a few coins for your trouble.
FR: Mais non#! C'est bien le prix de la fluorine en vente libre. Je n'ai pas rajouté grand-chose.
OUPS: Are you kidding? That's what fluorite costs you on the open market! I only threw in a few coins for your trouble.

JAP: It's really that expensive?
FR: Est-ce vraiment si cher...?
OUPS: It's really that expensive?

JAP: Hey, I learned my lesson last time. From now on, it's nothing but the best for my girl!
FR: J'ai appris ma leçon. Pas de pacotille pour ma copine#!
OUPS: Hey, I learned my lesson last time. From now on, it's nothing but the best for my girl!

JAP: The human soul is an unfathomable thing indeed.
FR: Je ne comprendrai jamais les humains.
OUPS: The human soul is an unfathomable thing indeed.

JAP: Yeah. Even to me.
FR: Moi non plus.
OUPS: Yeah. Even to me.

JAP: I tell you, there isn't another girl out there as high-class as mine.
FR: Personne n'arrive à la cheville de mon amie#! Elle a la classe#!
OUPS: I tell you, there isn't another girl out there as high-class as mine.

JAP: (Hey! You! I need you to get my idiot son back here, pronto!)
FR: (Hé, vous#! Ramenez-moi mon idiot de fils et que ça chauffe#!)
OUPS: (Hey! You! I need you to get my idiot son back here, pronto!)

JAP: You always start conversations like that?
FR: Vous adressez-vous toujours aux passants ainsi#?
OUPS: You always start conversations like that?

JAP: (I'm sorry! ...I'm sorry. I'm just so angry and worried right now. Please forgive me.)
FR: (Ah, pardonnez-moi...! C'est que je suis si furieux et inquiet en ce moment...)
OUPS: (I'm sorry! ...I'm sorry. I'm just so angry and worried right now. Please forgive me.)

JAP: (You see, my son has gone into the desert by himself.)<PAGE>(He's trying to build a name for himself so he can become a true Man of the Mask, or what you outsiders call a soldier.)
FR: (Voyez-vous, mon fils est allé seul dans le désert.)<PAGE>(Il compte se tailler une réputation et devenir un véritable guerrier du masque, ce que les étrangers appellent un soldat, je suppose.)
OUPS: (You see, my son has gone into the desert by himself.)<PAGE>(He's trying to build a name for himself so he can become a true Man of the Mask, or what you outsiders call a soldier.)

JAP: He must be a reckless child indeed to venture into the desert alone.
FR: Il est bien imprudent de s'aventurer seul dans le désert.
OUPS: He must be a reckless child indeed to venture into the desert alone.

JAP: (I need someone to bring him back before he hurts himself. Could you please help me out?)
FR: (S'il vous plaît, ramenez-le-moi avant qu'il ne lui arrive quelque chose#!)
OUPS: (I need someone to bring him back before he hurts himself. Could you please help me out?)

JAP: I'll take care of it.
FR: Je m'en occupe.
OUPS: I'll take care of it.

JAP: (Oh, thank you so much!)
FR: (Oh, merci#! Merci#!)
OUPS: (Oh, thank you so much!)

JAP: (I need you to get my son back!)
FR: (Ramenez-moi mon fils#!)
OUPS: (I need you to get my son back!)

JAP: You the kid searching for fortune and glory?
FR: Es-tu le garçon qui cherche à obtenir gloire et fortune#?
OUPS: You the kid searching for fortune and glory?

JAP: (My dad sent you to take me back, didn't he?)
FR: (C'est mon père qui vous envoie, n'est-ce pas#?)
OUPS: (My dad sent you to take me back, didn't he?)

JAP: Yeah, and with good cause. This is a dangerous place.
FR: Oui et avec raison. Cet endroit est dangereux.
OUPS: Yeah, and with good cause. This is a dangerous place.

JAP: (No! I'm not leaving! I just found a wolves' den. If I go right now, I could take them all out and be a hero!)
FR: (Non#! Je ne rentrerai pas#! Je viens à peine de trouver une tanière de loups. Si je me débarrasse d'eux, je serai un héros#!)
OUPS: (No! I'm not leaving! I just found a wolves' den. If I go right now, I could take them all out and be a hero!)

JAP: That's not happening.
FR: Pas question.
OUPS: That's not happening.

JAP: (I can't be a Man of the Mask if I fear for my life! I shall slay these beasts for the sake of my homeland!)
FR: (Je ne pourrai jamais être un véritable guerrier du masque si j'ai peur de mourir#! J'éliminerai ces créatures au nom de ma patrie#!)
OUPS: (I can't be a Man of the Mask if I fear for my life! I shall slay these beasts for the sake of my homeland!)

JAP: Hey! Wait!
FR: Hé#! Attends#!
OUPS: Hey! Wait!

JAP: If he speaks the truth, then I fear the boy is in grave danger.
FR: S'il dit vrai, j'ai bien peur que ce garçon ne soit en grave danger.
OUPS: If he speaks the truth, then I fear the boy is in grave danger.

JAP: We'd better catch him before he reaches the den!
FR: Rattrapons-le avant qu'il n'atteigne la tanière#!
OUPS: We'd better catch him before he reaches the den!

JAP: (The wolves are defeated.)
FR: (J'ai réussi#!)
OUPS: (The wolves are defeated.)

JAP: Damn kid could have been killed. He doesn't look like he even understands the danger he was in.
FR: Il aurait pu se faire tuer. Il n'a pas l'air de se rendre compte du danger qui le menaçait.
OUPS: Damn kid could have been killed. He doesn't look like he even understands the danger he was in.

JAP: That is youth, I suppose.
FR: Il est jeune, je suppose.
OUPS: That is youth, I suppose.

JAP: Heh. To some degree I envy him.
FR: Pfft. Je l'envie peut-être un peu.
OUPS: Heh. To some degree I envy him.

JAP: (Oh, thank the gods! Do you know how much we worried about you, boy?)
FR: (Oh, les dieux soient loués#! Sais-tu à quel point je me suis inquiété, mon garçon#?!)
OUPS: (Oh, thank the gods! Do you know how much we worried about you, boy?)

JAP: Your son is a boy no longer. Though we urged him against it, he vanquished an entire den of wolves nearly by his lonesome.
FR: Votre fils n'est plus un garçon. Il est devenu un homme lorsqu'il a triomphé seul d'une meute de loups.
OUPS: Your son is a boy no longer. Though we urged him against it, he vanquished an entire den of wolves nearly by his lonesome.

JAP: (An...an entire den!?)
FR: (Une... meute entière#?!)
OUPS: (An...an entire den!?)

JAP: (Yeah! I found 'em all by myself and everything! Now the town won't have to worry as much about—)
FR: (Oui#! Et j'ai trouvé leur tanière moi-même#! Les habitants de la ville n'auront plus à...)
OUPS: (Yeah! I found 'em all by myself and everything! Now the town won't have to worry as much about—)

JAP: (You worthless idiot!)
FR: (Espèce d'abruti#!)
OUPS: (You worthless idiot!)

JAP: (B-but...)
FR: (Qu-quoi...?)
OUPS: (B-but...)

JAP: (Did you honestly think to defeat an entire pack of wolves by yourself!? I know these people did most of the work for you!)
FR: (Penses-tu vraiment que je vais croire que tu as vaincu une meute de loups sans l'aide de personne#?! Je parie que cet étranger a fait tout le travail pour toi#!)
OUPS: (Did you honestly think to defeat an entire pack of wolves by yourself!? I know these people did most of the work for you!)

JAP: (B-but...they would have killed other people...)
FR: (Ma-mais... les loups auraient pu attaquer la ville...)
OUPS: (B-but...they would have killed other people...)

JAP: (They would have done no such thing, because you could have come back here and warned us!)
FR: (Bien sûr que non, puisque tu serais revenu nous avertir#!)
OUPS: (They would have done no such thing, because you could have come back here and warned us!)

JAP: (Urgh...)
OUPS: (Urgh...)

JAP: (...Still, you did try to do right, and for this I am proud.)
FR: (... Mais bon, tu as essayé d'agir pour le bien et je suis fier de toi.)
OUPS: (...Still, you did try to do right, and for this I am proud.)

JAP: (F-Father?)
FR: (Père...?)
OUPS: (F-Father?)

JAP: (I will speak to the king's advisor. If he will have you, then I will give my blessing for you to become a Man of the Mask.)
FR: (J'irai m'adresser au conseiller du roi. S'il accepte, je te permets de devenir un véritable guerrier du masque.)
OUPS: (I will speak to the king's advisor. If he will have you, then I will give my blessing for you to become a Man of the Mask.)

JAP: (T-truly, Father!?)
FR: (Vrai-vraiment#?!)
OUPS: (T-truly, Father!?)

JAP: (But you must never do such a foolish thing again! A true soldier knows when he is outmanned. He knows it is not shameful to seek the aid of his fellows.)
FR: (Mais tu ne dois plus jamais faire de chose pareille, tu m'entends#? Un vrai guerrier accepte toujours de battre en retraite lorsque la situation le demande.)<PAGE>(Il sait qu'il n'est pas honteux de demander l'aide de ses compagnons.)
OUPS: (But you must never do such a foolish thing again! A true soldier knows when he is outmanned. He knows it is not shameful to seek the aid of his fellows.)

JAP: (Father, I swear to you: Someday I'm going to be as proud and wise as you are!)
FR: (Un jour, je serai un guerrier aussi noble que toi, je te le promets, père#!)
OUPS: (Father, I swear to you: Someday I'm going to be as proud and wise as you are!)

JAP: (And thanks to you as well, my friends. Here, this is for you.)
FR: (Mes sincères remerciements, mes amis. Tenez, j'aimerais vous offrir ceci.)
OUPS: (And thanks to you as well, my friends. Here, this is for you.)

JAP: (It'd be nice if he used his head a little more, but he's still my pride and joy.)
FR: (Même s'il est un peu trop téméraire, je suis fier de mon fils.)
OUPS: (It'd be nice if he used his head a little more, but he's still my pride and joy.)

JAP: (My father's finally accepted my dream! From this day forward, I will do whatever it takes to be a Man of the Mask!)
FR: (Mon père ne s'oppose plus à ma vocation#! Je m'entraînerai sans relâche jusqu'à ce que je devienne un guerrier du masque#!)
OUPS: (My father's finally accepted my dream! From this day forward, I will do whatever it takes to be a Man of the Mask!)

JAP: (My son visits the training grounds regularly now. He walks a hard path, but I trust he can see it to the end.)
FR: (Mon fils s'entraîne régulièrement désormais. Il travaille dur, mais il tiendra le coup, j'en suis certain.)
OUPS: (My son visits the training grounds regularly now. He walks a hard path, but I trust he can see it to the end.)

JAP: (Pardon me. Do you have a moment?)
FR: (Pardonnez-moi... Pourriez-vous m'accorder un instant#?)
OUPS: (Pardon me. Do you have a moment?)

JAP: What do you need?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What do you need?

JAP: (My daughter's been missing for a few days, and I was wondering if you heard anything.)
FR: (Ma fille a disparu il y a quelques jours. Le saviez-vous#?)
OUPS: (My daughter's been missing for a few days, and I was wondering if you heard anything.)

JAP: Can't say I did. Sorry.
FR: Non, je suis désolé.
OUPS: Can't say I did. Sorry.

JAP: But if something comes up, I'll be sure to let you know.
FR: Mais je vous avertirai si j'entends des rumeurs à son sujet.
OUPS: But if something comes up, I'll be sure to let you know.

JAP: Does the girl have any identifying marks or scars?
FR: Comment pourrions-nous reconnaître votre fille#?
OUPS: Does the girl have any identifying marks or scars?

FR: (Voyons voir...)

JAP: (Well, she's probably wearing her gold ring. It's a family heirloom that I gave to her a little while back, so I doubt she'd take it off.)
FR: (Elle porte probablement une bague en or. C'est un bien de famille, vous savez. Elle ne l'enlèverait jamais.)
OUPS: (Well, she's probably wearing her gold ring. It's a family heirloom that I gave to her a little while back, so I doubt she'd take it off.)

JAP: (Thank you very much...)
FR: (Je vous remercie...)
OUPS: (Thank you very much...)

JAP: (Where could that girl have gone...?)
FR: (Où peut-elle bien être passée...?)
OUPS: (Where could that girl have gone...?)

JAP: (So the girl's gone missing, has she? Hmm...)<PAGE>(Last time I saw her, she was hanging around with her boyfriend.)
FR: (Vous dites que la fille de mon amie a disparu#? Hum...)<PAGE>(La dernière fois que je l'ai aperçue, elle était avec son copain.)
OUPS: (So the girl's gone missing, has she? Hmm...)<PAGE>(Last time I saw her, she was hanging around with her boyfriend.)

JAP: (The missing girl? Yes, I saw her at the lowest level of our city just yesterday.)
FR: (La fille qui a disparu#? Oui, justement je l'ai vue hier sur le niveau inférieur.)
OUPS: (The missing girl? Yes, I saw her at the lowest level of our city just yesterday.)

JAP: (The missing girl? Let's see...)<PAGE>(Yes, I think she was shopping with someone in the strange-thing store.)
FR: (La jeune fille qui a disparu#? Voyons voir...)<PAGE>(Oui, je crois qu'elle est allée au magasin de curiosités avec quelqu'un.)
OUPS: (The missing girl? Let's see...)<PAGE>(Yes, I think she was shopping with someone in the strange-thing store.)

JAP: (The missing girl? ...No, sorry, I don't know.)<PAGE>(Why not ask her boyfriend? I think he's standing watch at the town entrance.)
FR: (La fille qui a disparu#? ...#Non, je ne sais pas où elle est.)<PAGE>(Pourquoi ne demandez-vous pas à son petit ami#? Je crois que c'est l'un des gardes à l'entrée de la ville.)
OUPS: (The missing girl? ...No, sorry, I don't know.)<PAGE>(Why not ask her boyfriend? I think he's standing watch at the town entrance.)

JAP: It looks like the missing girl was here with her boyfriend...
FR: Des témoins ont aperçu la jeune fille qui a disparu et son petit ami aux alentours...
OUPS: It looks like the missing girl was here with her boyfriend...

JAP: I say! Are these bloodstains?
FR: Regarde#! Seraient-ce des taches de sang#?
OUPS: I say! Are these bloodstains?

JAP: Yeah, and it looks like someone was trying to clean them up.
FR: Oui, et quelqu'un a essayé de les nettoyer.
OUPS: Yeah, and it looks like someone was trying to clean them up.

JAP: These can be no older than a few days at most. I fear that the missing girl may somehow figure into this yet.
FR: Elles ne datent pas de plus de quelques jours. J'ai l'impression que la jeune fille qui a disparu pourrait malheureusement y être liée.
OUPS: These can be no older than a few days at most. I fear that the missing girl may somehow figure into this yet.

JAP: Well, she was last seen with her boyfriend. Maybe we should ask him a few questions.
FR: Elle était avec son petit ami la dernière fois qu'on l'a aperçue. Nous devrions peut-être aller lui poser quelques questions.
OUPS: Well, she was last seen with her boyfriend. Maybe we should ask him a few questions.

JAP: At best he knows something. And at worst...
FR: Avec un peu de chance, il pourra nous aider, mais...
OUPS: At best he knows something. And at worst...

JAP: (Y-yes? Who are you?)
FR: (O-oui#? Qui êtes-vous#?)
OUPS: (Y-yes? Who are you?)

JAP: Your girlfriend is missing. Don't suppose you know anything about that, do you?
FR: Votre petite amie a disparu. Je suppose que vous êtes au courant...?
OUPS: Your girlfriend is missing. Don't suppose you know anything about that, do you?

JAP: You were the last one to see her before she vanished, right?
FR: Vous êtes la dernière personne à avoir été en contact avec elle, non#?
OUPS: You were the last one to see her before she vanished, right?

JAP: (I...I don't know what you're talking about.)
FR: (Je... je ne sais pas de quoi vous parlez.)
OUPS: (I...I don't know what you're talking about.)

JAP: You're her lover, right? Aren't you worried about her?
FR: Vous êtes pourtant son petit ami, n'est-ce pas#? Vous ne vous inquiétez pas à son sujet#?
OUPS: You're her lover, right? Aren't you worried about her?

JAP: (W-well... Yes! Yes, of course I am! What business is it of yours, outsider?)
FR: (Euh... Oui#! Oui, bien sûr#! En quoi cela vous regarde-t-il, étranger#?)
OUPS: (W-well... Yes! Yes, of course I am! What business is it of yours, outsider?)

JAP: Foul creature! We found bloodstains in the very area where the two of you were last seen!
FR: Scélérat#! Nous avons découvert des taches de sang à l'endroit où des témoins vous ont aperçus ensemble#!
OUPS: Foul creature! We found bloodstains in the very area where the two of you were last seen!

JAP: (Eeek!)
FR: (Aaah#!)
OUPS: (Eeek!)

JAP: You can hide nothing from Grimoire Weiss! Confess, O guilty one! Confess and unburden your soul!<PAGE>Confess, lest others who are not as forgiving as I discover your terrible secret!
FR: Vous ne pouvez rien cacher au Grimoire Weiss#! Avouez votre crime#! Confessez-vous et soulagez votre conscience#!<PAGE>Repentez-vous avant que quelqu'un de moins clément ne découvre votre terrible secret#!
OUPS: You can hide nothing from Grimoire Weiss! Confess, O guilty one! Confess and unburden your soul!<PAGE>Confess, lest others who are not as forgiving as I discover your terrible secret!

JAP: (No! It... She... It was an accident!)
FR: (Non#! Je... Elle... C'était un accident#!)
OUPS: (No! It... She... It was an accident!)

JAP: (We were arguing over something stupid and she pushed me, so I pushed her back...)
FR: (Nous nous disputions à propos d'un rien et elle m'a poussé, alors je l'ai poussée moi aussi...)
OUPS: (We were arguing over something stupid and she pushed me, so I pushed her back...)

JAP: (And then she must have slipped or something, because she fell and hit her head on the wall. Oh, gods, I didn't mean to hurt her! I loved her!)
FR: (Et ensuite, elle a perdu pied et s'est frappé la tête contre le mur. Je ne voulais pas lui faire de mal, je le jure#! Je l'aimais tant#!)
OUPS: (And then she must have slipped or something, because she fell and hit her head on the wall. Oh, gods, I didn't mean to hurt her! I loved her!)

JAP: Accident or not, what you did is a crime. And the family won't appreciate you trying to cover it up.
FR: Que ce soit un accident ou non, vous avez commis un crime. Ses parents seront furieux que vous ayez essayé de dissimuler la vérité.
OUPS: Accident or not, what you did is a crime. And the family won't appreciate you trying to cover it up.

JAP: (I knew I'd get caught. I knew I couldn't hide forever...)
FR: (Je me doutais bien que je me ferais attraper... Que je ne pourrais pas fuir pour toujours...)
OUPS: (I knew I'd get caught. I knew I couldn't hide forever...)

JAP: (I didn't know what to do, so I put the body in the sandspout well just outside the city.)
FR: (Je ne savais pas quoi faire, alors j'ai caché son corps dans le puits de sable à l'extérieur de la ville.)
OUPS: (I didn't know what to do, so I put the body in the sandspout well just outside the city.)

JAP: (That's all I can tell you. I'm so sorry.)
FR: (C'est tout ce que je peux vous dire. Je suis vraiment désolé.)
OUPS: (That's all I can tell you. I'm so sorry.)

JAP: We're going to check on the sandspout well. You stay put, understand?
FR: Nous allons examiner le puits de sable. Restez ici, vous m'entendez#?
OUPS: We're going to check on the sandspout well. You stay put, understand?

JAP: (*Sob*)
FR: Snif#!
OUPS: (*Sob*)

JAP: (*Sob*)
FR: Snif#!
OUPS: (*Sob*)

JAP: This must be the sandspout well.
FR: Ce doit être le puits de sable dont parlait le petit ami de la jeune fille qui a disparu.
OUPS: This must be the sandspout well.

JAP: This is hardly the most pleasant task you've ever signed us up for.
FR: Ce n'est vraiment pas la tâche la plus agréable qui soit.
OUPS: This is hardly the most pleasant task you've ever signed us up for.

JAP: ...I don't see a body.
FR: ... Je ne vois pas de corps.
OUPS: ...I don't see a body.

JAP: How peculiar. Do you think the young lad lied to us?
FR: étrange. Crois-tu que le jeune homme nous ait menti#?
OUPS: How peculiar. Do you think the young lad lied to us?

JAP: He confessed to a murder, right? Why would he lie about the body?
FR: Il a avoué avoir commis un meurtre. Pourquoi mentir maintenant#?
OUPS: He confessed to a murder, right? Why would he lie about the body?

JAP: I guess we should go tell the family...
FR: Je suppose que nous devrions aller annoncer la mauvaise nouvelle aux parents de la jeune fille...
OUPS: I guess we should go tell the family...

JAP: (Oh! Hello! My daughter's back!)
FR: (Oh#! Bonjour#! Ma fille est de retour#!)
OUPS: (Oh! Hello! My daughter's back!)

JAP: Listen, your daughter has been... Wait, she's what?
FR: écoutez, votre fille est... Hein#? Elle est quoi#?
OUPS: Listen, your daughter has been... Wait, she's what?

JAP: (My apologies for bothering you.)
FR: (Je suis désolée de vous avoir dérangé.)
OUPS: (My apologies for bothering you.)

JAP: But your boyfriend told us you were...
FR: Mais votre petit ami nous a dit que...
OUPS: But your boyfriend told us you were...

JAP: (By the gods!)
FR: (Grands dieux#!)
OUPS: (By the gods!)

JAP: (Y-you're alive! But how!?)
FR: (Tu-tu es vivante#! Comment est-ce possible#?!)
OUPS: (Y-you're alive! But how!?)

JAP: (What's going on? You're all acting like I died or something.)
FR: (Mais que se passe-t-il#? Pourquoi agis-tu comme si tu pensais que tu ne me reverrais plus jamais#?)
OUPS: (What's going on? You're all acting like I died or something.)

JAP: (Yes, you're acting terribly strange.)
FR: (Oui, tout cela est bien étrange#!)
OUPS: (Yes, you're acting terribly strange.)

JAP: (But...but back there! The well!)
FR: (Mais je... Le... le puits#!!)
OUPS: (But...but back there! The well!)

JAP: (What-EVER.)
FR: (Pfft#!)
OUPS: (What-EVER.)

JAP: ...I don't understand a single goddamn thing that's happening right now.
FR: ... Je ne comprends pas du tout ce qui s'est passé.
OUPS: ...I don't understand a single goddamn thing that's happening right now.

JAP: Could the man possibly have been deluding himself this entire time?
FR: Pourrait-il tout avoir imaginé#?
OUPS: Could the man possibly have been deluding himself this entire time?

JAP: (Well, our daughter is back with us, so all's well that ends well, as far as I'm concerned.)
FR: (Notre fille est saine et sauve, alors tout est bien qui finit bien#!)
OUPS: (Well, our daughter is back with us, so all's well that ends well, as far as I'm concerned.)

JAP: (Quite so. Here is a token of our gratitude for helping with the search.)
FR: (Certes#! Voici un petit quelque chose pour nous avoir aidé à la chercher.)
OUPS: (Quite so. Here is a token of our gratitude for helping with the search.)

JAP: (What-EVER.)
FR: (Pfft#!)
OUPS: (What-EVER.)

JAP: (Wh-what's going on here...?)
FR: (Que... que s'est-il passé...?)
OUPS: (Wh-what's going on here...?)

JAP: (Ah, what a relief to see her safe and sound!)
FR: (Ah, je suis si heureuse qu'elle n'ait rien#!)
OUPS: (Ah, what a relief to see her safe and sound!)

JAP: How's your boyfriend?
FR: Comment va votre petit ami#?
OUPS: How's your boyfriend?

JAP: (Boyfriend? I don't have a boyfriend.)
FR: (Quel petit ami#? Je n'ai pas de petit ami.)
OUPS: (Boyfriend? I don't have a boyfriend.)

JAP: But wait. Wait, didn't you...
FR: Mais, attendez... Vous n'êtes pas...?
OUPS: But wait. Wait, didn't you...

JAP: (Hee hee! You're really weird, even for an outsider.)
FR: (Ha, ha, ha#! Vous êtes bien étrange, même pour un étranger#!)
OUPS: (Hee hee! You're really weird, even for an outsider.)

JAP: Oh, thank the gods you're here! We've got trouble!
FR: Oh, les dieux soient loués#! Te voilà#! Nous avons des ennuis#!
OUPS: Oh, thank the gods you're here! We've got trouble!

JAP: What kind of trouble?
FR: Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: What kind of trouble?

JAP: There's a wild boar in the northern plains who's started attacking villagers.
FR: Un sanglier a attaqué des villageois sur la plaine septentrionale.
OUPS: There's a wild boar in the northern plains who's started attacking villagers.

JAP: The victims all made it back, but who knows if we'll be so lucky next time...
FR: Ils ne sont que blessés, mais sa prochaine victime n'aura peut-être pas autant de chance...
OUPS: The victims all made it back, but who knows if we'll be so lucky next time...

JAP: ...So you want me to go kill it?
FR: ... Alors, vous voulez que je l'abatte#?
OUPS: ...So you want me to go kill it?

JAP: Yes. And we'll be sure to pay you well.
FR: Oui, et nous te récompenserons largement.
OUPS: Yes. And we'll be sure to pay you well.

JAP: All right.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: All right.

JAP: Oh, and a word of advice: Once you kill it, make sure you take a boar tusk.
FR: Oh, et n'oublie pas de récupérer une défense de sanglier après l'avoir vaincu.
OUPS: Oh, and a word of advice: Once you kill it, make sure you take a boar tusk.

JAP: Let's just say it'll come in handy.
FR: Je suis certain qu'elle pourrait t'être utile.
OUPS: Let's just say it'll come in handy.

JAP: Hurry! Go kill that boar!
FR: Dépêche-toi d'aller tuer le sanglier#!
OUPS: Hurry! Go kill that boar!

JAP: You hunted down the boar? Oh, thank you!
FR: Tu as tué le sanglier#? Oh, je te remercie#!
OUPS: You hunted down the boar? Oh, thank you!

JAP: And it looks like you found a boar tusk, too!
FR: Et je vois que tu as aussi trouvé une défense de sanglier#!
OUPS: And it looks like you found a boar tusk, too!

JAP: They say that boars become tame around anyone who carries one.
FR: On dit que ceux qui en détiennent une peuvent apprivoiser les sangliers.
OUPS: They say that boars become tame around anyone who carries one.

JAP: Apparently, they'll even let you ride around on their backs!
FR: Tu pourrais même monter sur leur dos, à ce qu'il paraît#!
OUPS: Apparently, they'll even let you ride around on their backs!

JAP: That sounds like hokum to me, but if you're brave enough, you might as well give it a shot.
FR: À mon avis, ce ne sont que des balivernes, mais si tu en as le courage, tu devrais sans doute essayer.
OUPS: That sounds like hokum to me, but if you're brave enough, you might as well give it a shot.

JAP: Now we can walk the plains in peace again.
FR: Désormais, nous pourrons traverser la plaine en paix.
OUPS: Now we can walk the plains in peace again.

JAP: Ah! Just the man I was looking for.
FR: Ah, justement l'homme que je cherchais.
OUPS: Ah! Just the man I was looking for.

JAP: You need something?
FR: Vous avez besoin de quelque chose#?
OUPS: You need something?

JAP: Yes. See, I've got a letter for the lighthouse lady, and I was hoping you could deliver it.
FR: Oui. À vrai dire, j'ai reçu une autre lettre pour la vieille femme du phare et j'aimerais que vous la lui apportiez.
OUPS: Yes. See, I've got a letter for the lighthouse lady, and I was hoping you could deliver it.

JAP: The other postmen... Well, they can't really deal with her. She's a bit cranky.
FR: Les autres postiers refusent de traiter avec elle. Elle est un peu revêche, voyez-vous...
OUPS: The other postmen... Well, they can't really deal with her. She's a bit cranky.

JAP: You don't say!?
FR: Oh, vraiment#?!
OUPS: You don't say!?

JAP: I'd do it, but with my bad leg and all...
FR: Je le ferais moi-même, mais ma jambe n'est toujours pas guérie.
OUPS: I'd do it, but with my bad leg and all...

JAP: Anyway, sorry to keep bugging you, but can you help?
FR: Je suis vraiment désolé d'avoir à vous demander un autre service, mais pourriez-vous vous en charger#?
OUPS: Anyway, sorry to keep bugging you, but can you help?

JAP: Yeah, all right.
FR: D'accord.
OUPS: Yeah, all right.

JAP: The lady hardly ever leaves that lighthouse, so you should start there.<PAGE>And thank you.
FR: La vieille femme ne quitte presque jamais le phare, alors vous devriez pouvoir l'y trouver.<PAGE>Merci encore#!
OUPS: The lady hardly ever leaves that lighthouse, so you should start there.<PAGE>And thank you.

JAP: Oh, when will he return to my side...?
FR: Oh, quand reviendra-t-il...?
OUPS: Oh, when will he return to my side...?

JAP: Oh. You again!
FR: Oh. Encore vous#!
OUPS: Oh. You again!

JAP: You look to be in pain.
FR: Vous avez l'air souffrante.
OUPS: You look to be in pain.

JAP: You took so much time delivering the mail, my illness has gotten worse!
FR: Vous avez pris tant de temps à m'apporter mon courrier que ma maladie a empiré#!
OUPS: You took so much time delivering the mail, my illness has gotten worse!

JAP: I'm lucky I'm not dead!
FR: J'ai de la chance d'être toujours en vie#!
OUPS: I'm lucky I'm not dead!

JAP: You truly are a staggering creature.
FR: Tu n'es vraiment qu'une créature effrontée.
OUPS: You truly are a staggering creature.

JAP: Well, since you're here...I guess I should give you a little something.
FR: Eh bien, puisque vous êtes venus... Je suppose que je pourrais vous donner un petit quelque chose.
OUPS: Well, since you're here...I guess I should give you a little something.

JAP: ...I think this qualifies as a lot.
FR: ... Pour un petit quelque chose, c'est plutôt beaucoup.
OUPS: ...I think this qualifies as a lot.

JAP: It's fine! Just take it. Take it and go!
FR: Bah#! Acceptez votre récompense et partez#!
OUPS: It's fine! Just take it. Take it and go!

JAP: But bring the mail quicker next time! ...And I want to see a smile!
FR: Mais apportez-moi mon courrier plus vite la prochaine fois#! ... Et un sourire ne serait pas de refus#!
OUPS: But bring the mail quicker next time! ...And I want to see a smile!

JAP: Is there no end to this madness!?
FR: Cette quête ridicule est-elle sans fin#?
OUPS: Is there no end to this madness!?

JAP: But it's the first request I've made in ages! How dare you deny it!
FR: Mais je n'ai pas demandé de faveur à qui que ce soit depuis des lustres ! Comment osez-vous refuser de me l'accorder ?
OUPS: But it's the first request I've made in ages! How dare you deny it!

JAP: You can't leave! Who's going to tend the lighthouse!?
FR: Vous ne pouvez pas partir ! Qui s'occupera du phare ?!
OUPS: You can't leave! Who's going to tend the lighthouse!?

JAP: How much longer will you force me to toil here?
FR: Combien de temps encore me forcerez-vous à servir cette ville ?
OUPS: How much longer will you force me to toil here?

JAP: I must go see him! I need to board a ship as soon as possible!
FR: Je dois aller le rejoindre ! Je dois prendre la mer le plus tôt possible !
OUPS: I must go see him! I need to board a ship as soon as possible!

JAP: No way, lady. It's back to work for you! Now get going!
FR: Pas question. Retournez travailler ! Allez !
OUPS: No way, lady. It's back to work for you! Now get going!

JAP: What's going on?
FR: Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: What's going on?

JAP: There's no one else in town who knows how to keep the lighthouse burning.
FR: Cette vieille femme est la seule qui sait comment s'occuper du phare.
OUPS: There's no one else in town who knows how to keep the lighthouse burning.

JAP: We...we need her.
FR: Nous... nous avons besoin d'elle.
OUPS: We...we need her.

JAP: Sounds like a poor excuse to me.
FR: Cela me semble être une piètre excuse.
OUPS: Sounds like a poor excuse to me.

JAP: Would you mind talking some sense into her?
FR: Pourriez-vous essayer de lui faire entendre raison#?
OUPS: Would you mind talking some sense into her?

JAP: You're the only one she seems to listen to.
FR: Elle semble tenir compte de ce que vous dites.
OUPS: You're the only one she seems to listen to.

JAP: I suppose a visit is in order, yes?
FR: Je suppose que nous devrions aller lui rendre visite, hum#?
OUPS: I suppose a visit is in order, yes?

JAP: Hey, lady...?
FR: Madame...?
OUPS: Hey, lady...?

JAP: Oh, no.
FR: Oh, non.
OUPS: Oh, no.

JAP: As I feared. It's the Black Scrawl, and an advanced case at that.
FR: C'est ce que je craignais. La nécrose runique, et à un stade si avancé...!
OUPS: As I feared. It's the Black Scrawl, and an advanced case at that.

JAP: So that's her illness.
FR: Voilà donc la maladie dont elle souffre.
OUPS: So that's her illness.

JAP: Oh. You. I suppose you want to tell everyone about my illness, hmm? Well, don't!
FR: Oh, c'est vous. Je suppose que vous voulez dire à tout le monde que j'ai la nécrose runique#? Eh bien, je vous l'interdis#!
OUPS: Oh. You. I suppose you want to tell everyone about my illness, hmm? Well, don't!

JAP: I don't fear death! I've lived long enough, and I'm tired of it.
FR: Je n'ai pas peur de la mort#! J'ai vécu assez longtemps et je suis fatiguée.
OUPS: I don't fear death! I've lived long enough, and I'm tired of it.

JAP: ...And tired of being alone.
FR: ...#Et je ne supporte plus d'être seule.
OUPS: ...And tired of being alone.

JAP: But though I don't fear death, I do have one regret...
FR: Mais bien que la mort ne m'effraie pas, j'ai tout de même des regrets...
OUPS: But though I don't fear death, I do have one regret...

JAP: I wanted to see my love one last time.
FR: Je voulais revoir mon bien-aimé une dernière fois.
OUPS: I wanted to see my love one last time.

JAP: I've spent 50 years in the lighthouse, working and working for these people,
FR: J'ai passé 50 ans de ma vie dans ce phare, travaillant à longueur d'année pour les habitants de cette ville.
OUPS: I've spent 50 years in the lighthouse, working and working for these people,

JAP: and now they won't let me leave!
FR: Et maintenant, ils ne veulent pas me laisser partir#!
OUPS: and now they won't let me leave!

JAP: I just want to see him! I want to board the ship that will take me to him!
FR: Je veux juste le revoir#! Je veux monter à bord du bateau qui m'amènera à lui#!
OUPS: I just want to see him! I want to board the ship that will take me to him!

JAP: O, cruel world...
FR: Ô monde cruel...
OUPS: O, cruel world...

JAP: So it's a dying wish now, is it?
FR: Alors, c'est son ultime requête sur son lit de mort, c'est bien ça#?
OUPS: So it's a dying wish now, is it?

JAP: You know what I'm going to say.
FR: Tu sais ce que je vais dire.
OUPS: You know what I'm going to say.

JAP: Well, we've better things to do than stay here and operate a lighthouse!
FR: Eh bien, nous avons mieux à faire que de rester ici nous occuper du phare#!
OUPS: Well, we've better things to do than stay here and operate a lighthouse!

JAP: You'll have to convince the villagers to let her go.
FR: Tu devras convaincre les habitants de la laisser partir.
OUPS: You'll have to convince the villagers to let her go.

JAP: Let's start with the postman.
FR: Commençons par le postier.
OUPS: Let's start with the postman.

JAP: You need to reconsider the old woman's request.
FR: Vous devez accéder à la requête de la vieille femme du phare.
OUPS: You need to reconsider the old woman's request.

JAP: I do? I mean... Look, it's just not possible. We can't afford to lose her.
FR: Ah bon#? Euh... écoutez, c'est impossible. Nous ne pouvons pas la perdre.
OUPS: I do? I mean... Look, it's just not possible. We can't afford to lose her.

JAP: Death stalks this woman, postman! Would you truly deny her final request?
FR: Elle est à l'article de la mort#! Oseriez-vous vraiment refuser son ultime requête#?
OUPS: Death stalks this woman, postman! Would you truly deny her final request?

JAP: She's... Wait, she's dying?
FR: Elle... Quoi, elle est mourante#?
OUPS: She's... Wait, she's dying?

JAP: Yeah, and there isn't much time left. You need to let her go.
FR: Oui, son heure approche. Vous devez la laisser partir.
OUPS: Yeah, and there isn't much time left. You need to let her go.

JAP: Even so, I...I just... I can't. I'm sorry, but it's impossible.
FR: Même si c'est le cas, je... je ne peux tout simplement pas. Je suis désolé. C'est impossible.
OUPS: Even so, I...I just... I can't. I'm sorry, but it's impossible.

JAP: Are you kiddin' me?
FR: Vous plaisantez#?!
OUPS: Are you kiddin' me?

JAP: I...I have things to attend to. Come back tomorrow, please!
FR: Je... je suis occupé. Revenez demain#!
OUPS: I...I have things to attend to. Come back tomorrow, please!

JAP: Mmm... Methinks the postman is hiding a secret of his own.
FR: Hum... Son explication était bien évasive.
OUPS: Mmm... Methinks the postman is hiding a secret of his own.

JAP: I suggest we go back. I have a feeling we might discover something.
FR: Nous devrions retourner lui parler. Je crois qu'il nous cache quelque chose.
OUPS: I suggest we go back. I have a feeling we might discover something.

JAP: I can't believe she's going to die...
FR: Je n'arrive pas à croire qu'elle va mourir...
OUPS: I can't believe she's going to die...

JAP: I suppose there's no need for this now.
FR: Je suppose que tout ça ne sert plus à rien, désormais.
OUPS: I suppose there's no need for this now.

JAP: Ahem.
FR: Arhem.
OUPS: Ahem.

JAP: Hey! Wh-what are you doing there!?
FR: Hé, mais ! Q-que faites-vous là ?!
OUPS: Hey! Wh-what are you doing there!?

JAP: And just what are you doing?
FR: Que faisiez-vous#?
OUPS: And just what are you doing?

JAP: Work! Just...just some work.
FR: Je travaillais#! Je... je ne faisais que travailler.
OUPS: Work! Just...just some work.

JAP: I thought postmen delivered letters, not wrote them.
FR: À ce que je sache, un postier distribue les lettres, il ne les écrit pas.
OUPS: I thought postmen delivered letters, not wrote them.

JAP: I don't see how that's any of your business.
FR: Je ne vois pas en quoi ça vous concerne.
OUPS: I don't see how that's any of your business.

JAP: Well then, allow me to ask about something that is very much our business...
FR: Eh bien, discutons alors de ce qui nous concerne...
OUPS: Well then, allow me to ask about something that is very much our business...

JAP: Why are the old lady's letters, and only her letters, postmarked from this very office!?
FR: Pourquoi les lettres adressées à la vieille femme sont-elles les seules à porter le cachet de ce bureau de poste#?!
OUPS: Why are the old lady's letters, and only her letters, postmarked from this very office!?

JAP: Uh, well, because... Um...
FR: Euh, hum, c'est parce que… Euh…
OUPS: Uh, well, because... Um...

JAP: The other deliveries bore postmarks from locales far and wide.
FR: Les autres lettres portent des cachets de partout à travers le monde.
OUPS: The other deliveries bore postmarks from locales far and wide.

JAP: You got a point, Weiss?
FR: Où veux-tu en venir, Weiss#?
OUPS: You got a point, Weiss?

JAP: The woman was not receiving letters from a lover in some far-flung land...
FR: Cette femme ne reçoit pas de lettre de son bien-aimé à l'étranger...
OUPS: The woman was not receiving letters from a lover in some far-flung land...

JAP: They were penned by the hand of someone in this very town!
FR: Ces lettres sont écrites par un habitant de cette ville#!
OUPS: They were penned by the hand of someone in this very town!

JAP: Well...crap.
FR: Flûte#!
OUPS: Well...crap.

JAP: Go to the back room. There's something there you should see.
FR: Allez à l'arrière. Vous trouverez la réponse à vos questions.
OUPS: Go to the back room. There's something there you should see.

JAP: I see something.
FR: J'aperçois quelque chose.
OUPS: I see something.

JAP: Clear these packages out of the way.
FR: Déplace ces boîtes et fraie-toi un chemin.
OUPS: Clear these packages out of the way.

JAP: He could have put it in a more convenient spot...
FR: Il aurait pu le mettre dans un endroit plus accessible...
OUPS: He could have put it in a more convenient spot...

JAP: It must be something he wanted to keep hidden at all costs.
FR: Ce doit être quelque chose qu'il voulait à tout prix garder secret.
OUPS: It must be something he wanted to keep hidden at all costs.

JAP: The postman directed us to the back room. We had best take a look.
FR: Le postier nous a demandé d'aller à l'arrière. Nous devrions y jeter un coup d'œil.
OUPS: The postman directed us to the back room. We had best take a look.

JAP: They're...letters.
FR: Ce sont... des lettres.
OUPS: They're...letters.

JAP: Yes, and a rather sizeable bundle.
FR: Oui, une liasse plutôt volumineuse.
OUPS: Yes, and a rather sizeable bundle.

JAP: They were all written by the woman in the lighthouse.
FR: Elles ont toutes été écrites par la vieille femme du phare.
OUPS: They were all written by the woman in the lighthouse.

JAP: And you never thought to deliver them!?
FR: Et vous n'avez jamais cru bon de les distribuer ?!
OUPS: And you never thought to deliver them!?

JAP: I couldn't... Not anymore.
FR: Je ne pouvais pas... Plus maintenant.
OUPS: I couldn't... Not anymore.

JAP: It's a death notice. For her true love, I presume.
FR: Un avis de décès#! Celui de son bien-aimé, je présume#?
OUPS: It's a death notice. For her true love, I presume.

JAP: So if he's dead, who sent the woman all those letters?
FR: S'il est mort, qui envoyait toutes ces lettres à la vieille femme ?
OUPS: So if he's dead, who sent the woman all those letters?

JAP: Um... I did.
FR: Euh... moi.
OUPS: Um... I did.

JAP: What manner of cruel hoax is this!?
FR: Quelle sorte de farce cruelle est-ce donc ?!
OUPS: What manner of cruel hoax is this!?

JAP: It wasn't just me. It was the entire town.
FR: Je ne suis pas le seul à le faire. Toute la ville m'aide.
OUPS: It wasn't just me. It was the entire town.

JAP: So you're all in on it...
FR: Alors, tous les habitants sont au courant...
OUPS: So you're all in on it...

JAP: Those letters kept her going! They gave her hope!
FR: Ces lettres l'ont encouragée ! Elles lui ont donné de l'espoir !
OUPS: Those letters kept her going! They gave her hope!

JAP: She believed her love to be alive in a foreign land somewhere,
FR: Elle croit que son bien-aimé est en vie quelque part à l'étranger
OUPS: She believed her love to be alive in a foreign land somewhere,

JAP: and we couldn't bear to tell her otherwise.
FR: et nous n'avions pas le cœur de lui avouer le contraire.
OUPS: and we couldn't bear to tell her otherwise.

JAP: So we just kept the lie going.
FR: C'est pourquoi nous avons continué à lui mentir.
OUPS: So we just kept the lie going.

JAP: It started with my father some 50 years ago.
FR: Tout a commencé il y a environ 50 ans, avec mon père.
OUPS: It started with my father some 50 years ago.

JAP: No...
FR: Non...
OUPS: No...

JAP: Not her...
FR: Pas elle...
OUPS: Not her...

JAP: Will you continue your lie now?
FR: Allez-vous continuer à lui mentir ?
OUPS: Will you continue your lie now?

JAP: Yes. The truth can only cause her pain.
FR: Oui, la vérité ne lui apporterait que de la douleur.
OUPS: Yes. The truth can only cause her pain.

JAP: And what of her final request?
FR: Vous devez admettre que c'est une triste vérité.
OUPS: And what of her final request?

JAP: I don't know! How should I know!? I'm just a damn postman.
FR: Je n'en sais rien ! Comment pourrais-je le savoir ?! Je ne suis qu'un simple postier.
OUPS: I don't know! How should I know!? I'm just a damn postman.

JAP: I don't know what to do anymore...
FR: Je ne sais plus quoi faire.
OUPS: I don't know what to do anymore...

JAP: What's the best thing to do? ...What's the right thing?
FR: Que devrions-nous faire ? Quelle est la meilleure chose à faire ?
OUPS: What's the best thing to do? ...What's the right thing?

JAP: Here. I have a new letter. Take it.
FR: Tenez. J'ai une autre lettre.
OUPS: Here. I have a new letter. Take it.

JAP: It says that her love is coming, but that the journey will be long. ...It tells her to wait.
FR: Son bien-aimé lui dit qu'il vient la retrouver, mais que la route sera longue... Il lui demande de l'attendre.
OUPS: It says that her love is coming, but that the journey will be long. ...It tells her to wait.

JAP: You wish us to deliver another letter filled with lies?
FR: Vous voulez que nous lui apportions une autre lettre débordante de mensonges ?
OUPS: You wish us to deliver another letter filled with lies?

JAP: You uncovered our town's deepest secret like it was nothing.
FR: Vous avez découvert le plus grand secret de notre ville comme si c'était la chose la plus évidente qui soit.
OUPS: You uncovered our town's deepest secret like it was nothing.

JAP: I don't think that's an accident.
FR: Je ne crois pas que ce soit une coïncidence.
OUPS: I don't think that's an accident.

JAP: Look, I've told you what I think. Deliver the letter, or go tell her the truth.
FR: Je vous ai donné mon avis. Donnez-lui la lettre ou dites-lui la vérité.
OUPS: Look, I've told you what I think. Deliver the letter, or go tell her the truth.

JAP: It's up to you.
FR: À vous de choisir.
OUPS: It's up to you.

JAP: You! Do you have any further news from my love?
FR: Vous voilà ! Avez-vous des nouvelles de mon bien-aimé ?
OUPS: You! Do you have any further news from my love?

JAP: <LIST=1731>Give her the letter and perpetuate the lie.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1731>Remettre la lettre à la vieille femme et lui mentir.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1731>Give her the letter and perpetuate the lie.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1732>Tell her that her lover is dead.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1732>Dire à la vieille femme que son bien-aimé est mort.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1732>Tell her that her lover is dead.</LIST>

JAP: Oh, he's written me a letter!
FR: Oh, il m'a écrit une lettre !
OUPS: Oh, he's written me a letter!

JAP: Ah, wonderful, wonderful...
FR: Ah, merveilleux, merveilleux...
OUPS: Ah, wonderful, wonderful...

JAP: Perhaps we should leave you alone with your letter.
FR: Nous devrions peut-être vous laisser lire votre lettre.
OUPS: Perhaps we should leave you alone with your letter.

JAP: Oh, life is so wonderful...
FR: Oh, la vie est si merveilleuse...
OUPS: Oh, life is so wonderful...

JAP: And could you please thank that nice postman when you see him?
FR: Pourriez-vous remercier cet aimable postier quand vous le verrez ?
OUPS: And could you please thank that nice postman when you see him?

JAP: ...All right.
FR: ... D'accord.
OUPS: ...All right.

JAP: Everything's going to be okay...
FR: Tout ira bien...
OUPS: Everything's going to be okay...

JAP: Your love didn't write this letter.
FR: Ce n'est pas votre bien-aimé qui a écrit cette lettre.
OUPS: Your love didn't write this letter.

JAP: Oh, posh! It's his handwriting! And I recognize the stationary, too!
FR: Oh, balivernes ! C'est son écriture ! Et je reconnais même le papier !
OUPS: Oh, posh! It's his handwriting! And I recognize the stationary, too!

JAP: That which you recognize comes from the town's postman and his father.
FR: Ce sont l'écriture et le papier du postier et de son père.
OUPS: That which you recognize comes from the town's postman and his father.

JAP: Not from your beloved.
FR: Pas ceux de votre bien-aimé.
OUPS: Not from your beloved.

JAP: Are you saying those two idiots wrote all these letters? But...but why?
FR: Vous dites que ces deux idiots ont écrit toutes ces lettres ? Mais pourquoi...?
OUPS: Are you saying those two idiots wrote all these letters? But...but why?

JAP: Your lover perished long years ago, and they had not the heart to tell you.
FR: Votre bien-aimé a péri il y a très longtemps, mais ils n'ont jamais eu le courage de vous l'avouer.
OUPS: Your lover perished long years ago, and they had not the heart to tell you.

JAP: Thus, the charade.
FR: Donc, ils vous ont menti.
OUPS: Thus, the charade.

JAP: Oh...
FR: Oh...
OUPS: Oh...

JAP: Sorry.
FR: Je suis désolé.
OUPS: Sorry.

JAP: You don't have to apologize.
FR: Vous n'avez pas à vous excuser.
OUPS: You don't have to apologize.

JAP: To tell you the truth, part of me had suspected something like this.
FR: À vrai dire, une partie de moi s'en doutait un peu.
OUPS: To tell you the truth, part of me had suspected something like this.

JAP: But it's hard to hear a secret thought finally spoken aloud.
FR: Toutefois, il est difficile de l'entendre tout haut.
OUPS: But it's hard to hear a secret thought finally spoken aloud.

JAP: I...I think I should be alone for a while.
FR: Je... j'aimerais être seule un instant.
OUPS: I...I think I should be alone for a while.

JAP: But I want to ask you a favor.
FR: Mais avant, j'aurais une faveur à vous demander.
OUPS: But I want to ask you a favor.

JAP: You must forget we ever had this conversation.
FR: Oubliez que nous avons eu cette conversation.
OUPS: You must forget we ever had this conversation.

JAP: The entire town has worked on this story, and they did so to make me happy.
FR: Les habitants de la ville ont concocté cette histoire pour me rendre heureuse.
OUPS: The entire town has worked on this story, and they did so to make me happy.

JAP: I don't want their hard work to go to waste, so I will carry on as if I am none the wiser.
FR: Je ne voudrais pas que leurs efforts aient été vains, alors je vais faire comme si de rien n'était.
OUPS: I don't want their hard work to go to waste, so I will carry on as if I am none the wiser.

JAP: As you wish.
FR: Comme vous le désirez.
OUPS: As you wish.

JAP: Please tell the postman...thank you.
FR: Je vous en prie... Remerciez le postier de ma part.
OUPS: Please tell the postman...thank you.

JAP: We will.
FR: Ce sera fait.
OUPS: We will.

JAP: And thanks to you as well.
FR: Et merci à vous aussi.
OUPS: And thanks to you as well.

JAP: The woman from the lighthouse has passed.
FR: La vieille femme du phare est décédée.
OUPS: The woman from the lighthouse has passed.

JAP: We found her in her bed with a...a smile on her face.
FR: Nous l'avons trouvée morte dans son lit... souriante.
OUPS: We found her in her bed with a...a smile on her face.

JAP: So I guess you didn't tell her, huh?
FR: Alors, vous ne lui avez pas dit la vérité, hein ?
OUPS: So I guess you didn't tell her, huh?

JAP: Thank you. I think you did right.
FR: Merci. Je crois que vous avez fait le bon choix.
OUPS: Thank you. I think you did right.

JAP: Hard to believe she's gone. I always figured the old girl would outlive me...
FR: J'ai du mal à croire qu'elle n'est plus de ce monde. J'ai toujours pensé que je partirais avant elle...
OUPS: Hard to believe she's gone. I always figured the old girl would outlive me...

JAP: I hope our plan was right. I hope it made her happy in the end.
FR: J'espère que nous avons bien fait de lui mentir et qu'elle était heureuse en fin de compte.
OUPS: I hope our plan was right. I hope it made her happy in the end.

JAP: I can't believe the old lady is gone. ...Or that I actually miss her.
FR: Je ne peux pas croire que la vieille femme du phare n'est plus là... Ou même qu'elle me manque.
OUPS: I can't believe the old lady is gone. ...Or that I actually miss her.

JAP: She didn't ever find out about her love, did she?
FR: La vieille femme du phare n'a jamais su la vérité à propos de son bien-aimé, hein#?
OUPS: She didn't ever find out about her love, did she?

JAP: At least she's in a better place now.
FR: Au moins, la vieille femme du phare doit être heureuse là où elle est maintenant.
OUPS: At least she's in a better place now.

JAP: It's tough to raise a sister by yourself, but I know Yonah appreciates it.
FR: Il est difficile d'élever un enfant seul, n'est-ce pas#? Je suis certaine que Yonah apprécie vraiment tout ce que tu fais pour elle.
OUPS: It's tough to raise a sister by yourself, but I know Yonah appreciates it.

JAP: I sure wish I had a nice girl like Yonah in my family.
FR: J'aimerais bien avoir une petite-fille aussi charmante que Yonah#!
OUPS: I sure wish I had a nice girl like Yonah in my family.

JAP: Hey there! Are you looking for something in particular?
FR: Bonjour#! Besoin de quelque chose en particulier#?
OUPS: Hey there! Are you looking for something in particular?

JAP: Come back anytime.
FR: À bientôt#!
OUPS: Come back anytime.

JAP: Welcome! We got a few new things in stock if you want to take a look.
FR: Bienvenue#! Je viens tout juste de recevoir de nouvelles marchandises#! Pourquoi ne pas y jeter un coup d'œil#?
OUPS: Welcome! We got a few new things in stock if you want to take a look.

JAP: Thanks.
FR: À bientôt#!
OUPS: Thanks.

JAP: How about some seeds for planting? Everyone loves a new garden!
FR: Le jardinage, il n'y a rien de mieux#!
OUPS: How about some seeds for planting? Everyone loves a new garden!

JAP: Best of luck. Nobody can survive in this world without water and nature.
FR: Personne ne pourrait survivre sans la générosité de mère Nature#!
OUPS: Best of luck. Nobody can survive in this world without water and nature.

JAP: Heading north? Well, be careful up there! Some of the animals in the plains are getting restless.
FR: Tu te diriges vers le nord#? Sois prudent#! Les animaux sauvages sont plutôt agressifs ces derniers temps.
OUPS: Heading north? Well, be careful up there! Some of the animals in the plains are getting restless.

JAP: Beyond the southern plains lies Seafront, where you can find the tastiest fish in the world!<PAGE>I guess there's something good to be said for oceans, even if they are rising.
FR: Littoral est la ville située au-delà de la plaine méridionale. On peut y trouver le meilleur poisson au monde#!<PAGE>Je suppose que c'est un des avantages d'être situé tout près de la mer, même si le niveau de celle-ci monte toujours.
OUPS: Beyond the southern plains lies Seafront, where you can find the tastiest fish in the world!<PAGE>I guess there's something good to be said for oceans, even if they are rising.

JAP: You should quit working so hard and come have a drink with me.<PAGE>Come on! First round's on me!
FR: Allez#! Fais une pause et viens prendre un petit verre avec moi#! Je paierai la première tournée#!
OUPS: You should quit working so hard and come have a drink with me.<PAGE>Come on! First round's on me!

JAP: I'm not drinking! And I need to get home early, my sister is waiting.
FR: Désolé, je dois rentrer tôt pour m'occuper de ma fille.
OUPS: I'm not drinking! And I need to get home early, my sister is waiting.

JAP: That manor in the southern plains is getting creepier by the day. Of course, it's a relic from another time, so what do you expect?
FR: On dirait que le manoir de la plaine méridionale devient de plus en plus sinistre chaque jour...<PAGE>Bah, ce n'est pas étonnant puisqu'il s'agit d'un des vestiges d'une civilisation ancienne#!
OUPS: That manor in the southern plains is getting creepier by the day. Of course, it's a relic from another time, so what do you expect?

JAP: Leaving the village? Be careful!
FR: Tu comptes sortir du village#? Sois prudent#!
OUPS: Leaving the village? Be careful!

JAP: You know it.
FR: Je le suis toujours.
OUPS: You know it.

JAP: Shades dislike light, but it doesn't actually hurt them unless the light is really powerful.<PAGE>So even if it's sunny, watch yourself. All right?
FR: Les Ombres n'aiment pas la lumière, mais elle ne leur fait pas vraiment de mal à moins d'être très puissante.<PAGE>Sois sur tes gardes même lorsqu'il fait soleil, d'accord#?
OUPS: Shades dislike light, but it doesn't actually hurt them unless the light is really powerful.<PAGE>So even if it's sunny, watch yourself. All right?

JAP: Ah, it sure was nicer back in the day... We had more food to work with back then.
FR: Ah, la vie était si facile autrefois... Les récoltes étaient beaucoup plus abondantes.
OUPS: Ah, it sure was nicer back in the day... We had more food to work with back then.

JAP: Hmm, what should I make for dinner tonight...?
FR: Hum... Que devrais-je préparer pour le dîner#?
OUPS: Hmm, what should I make for dinner tonight...?

JAP: Welcome! We've got a wonderful line of weapons to choose from!
FR: Bienvenue#! J'ai de superbes armes en stock#!
OUPS: Welcome! We've got a wonderful line of weapons to choose from!

JAP: Thanks for your support!
FR: Merci et à bientôt#!
OUPS: Thanks for your support!

JAP: That new filter makes our water taste amazing! I feel bad for all those other villages.
FR: L'eau du village est savoureuse car elle est filtrée#! Les autres villages doivent en être jaloux...
OUPS: That new filter makes our water taste amazing! I feel bad for all those other villages.

JAP: I wish my kid was half as well-behaved as your Yonah.
FR: Ah, si seulement mon enfant était aussi sage que Yonah#!
OUPS: I wish my kid was half as well-behaved as your Yonah.

JAP: I heard you can't drink the water from other villages. Is that true?
FR: Maman dit que l'eau des autres villages n'est pas potable. Est-ce que c'est vrai#?
OUPS: I heard you can't drink the water from other villages. Is that true?

JAP: I want to make some money for my girl, but in a tiny village like this, it's all you can do to just survive.
FR: J'aimerais faire des économies pour offrir quelque chose à ma petite amie, mais dans un bled perdu comme celui-ci, on peut à peine gagner de quoi survivre.
OUPS: I want to make some money for my girl, but in a tiny village like this, it's all you can do to just survive.

JAP: I bet things used to be a lot different around here. A lot more fun.
FR: Je parie que la vie était bien différente avant. Beaucoup plus intéressante, quoi.
OUPS: I bet things used to be a lot different around here. A lot more fun.

JAP: Money is important, but I wouldn't change my way of life for it. Living with him makes me happier than anything else.
FR: L'argent, c'est important, mais je ne voudrais rien changer. Vivre avec lui me rend plus heureuse que tout.
OUPS: Money is important, but I wouldn't change my way of life for it. Living with him makes me happier than anything else.

JAP: Mutton is so expensive lately! I guess the sheep are getting kinda crazy, so people don't want to hunt them.
FR: La viande de mouton est tellement chère ces derniers temps#! Je suppose que personne ne veut aller à la chasse parce que les moutons sont agressifs.
OUPS: Mutton is so expensive lately! I guess the sheep are getting kinda crazy, so people don't want to hunt them.

JAP: The sheep in the northern plains are safe as long as you don't provoke them.<PAGE>But if you get 'em angry, watch out!
FR: À moins que tu ne les provoques, les moutons de la plaine septentrionale sont paisibles. Cependant, si tu les mets en colère...
OUPS: The sheep in the northern plains are safe as long as you don't provoke them.<PAGE>But if you get 'em angry, watch out!

JAP: Everyone loves mutton and goat meat, but those animals can kill people! If you go hunting, be careful.
FR: La viande de chèvre et de mouton sont très populaires, mais ces créatures peuvent tuer un homme#! Fais attention si tu vas à la chasse.
OUPS: Everyone loves mutton and goat meat, but those animals can kill people! If you go hunting, be careful.

JAP: ...Between you and me? Working security in the shopping district is mind-numbingly dull compared to working the gates.<PAGE>Still, it beats worrying about Shades, I guess.
FR: Entre toi et moi, patrouiller dans le marché est ennuyeux à mourir, surtout après avoir été posté à l'une des portes du village.<PAGE>Bah, au moins je n'ai pas à m'inquiéter de combattre des Ombres.
OUPS: ...Between you and me? Working security in the shopping district is mind-numbingly dull compared to working the gates.<PAGE>Still, it beats worrying about Shades, I guess.

JAP: You can find ruins from the old world dotted around this land.
FR: Les ruines d'une ancienne civilisation sont éparpillées de par le monde.
OUPS: You can find ruins from the old world dotted around this land.

JAP: They usually have rare and precious materials inside, so it's worth your time to do a bit of snooping.
FR: On peut habituellement y trouver des matériaux rares et précieux, alors cela vaut la peine de les explorer.
OUPS: They usually have rare and precious materials inside, so it's worth your time to do a bit of snooping.

JAP: The sheep hunt hasn't been going well. If I don't raise my prices, I'll lose my shirt!
FR: La chasse n'a pas été fructueuse. Si je n'augmente pas mes prix, je ferai faillite#!
OUPS: The sheep hunt hasn't been going well. If I don't raise my prices, I'll lose my shirt!

JAP: Welcome! We've got some new items in stock today.
FR: Bienvenue#! J'ai de nouvelles marchandises en stock#!
OUPS: Welcome! We've got some new items in stock today.

JAP: Come back soon!
FR: À bientôt#!
OUPS: Come back soon!

JAP: Giant stone buildings, iron boxes that carried people... Folks sure did a lot of amazing things back then.
FR: De gigantesques bâtiments de pierre, des boîtes de métal qui transportaient les gens...Les Anciens savaient fabriquer bien des merveilles#!
OUPS: Giant stone buildings, iron boxes that carried people... Folks sure did a lot of amazing things back then.

JAP: There's no better sight than children in high spirits. It makes me feel young just looking at them.
FR: Il n'y a rien de mieux que de voir des enfants jouer gaiement. Cela me réjouit le cœur.
OUPS: There's no better sight than children in high spirits. It makes me feel young just looking at them.

JAP: Hey, c'mon! Let's play!
FR: Hé <NIER>, viens jouer avec nous#!
OUPS: Hey, c'mon! Let's play!

JAP: Sorry, I've got work to do. Maybe next time.
FR: Désolé, le travail m'appelle. Peut-être une autre fois.
OUPS: Sorry, I've got work to do. Maybe next time.

JAP: I'm all by myself, 'cause Mom and Dad are working. And I'm booooored!
FR: Je suis tout seul parce que maman et papa travaillent. Je m'ennuie#!
OUPS: I'm all by myself, 'cause Mom and Dad are working. And I'm booooored!

JAP: Hey, come on! Stop working and play with me for once!
FR: Allez#! Arrête de travailler et viens jouer avec nous#!
OUPS: Hey, come on! Stop working and play with me for once!

JAP: My husband guards the eastern gate, and he keeps staying there later and later.<PAGE>If you see him at night, tell him to come home early for once!
FR: Mon mari garde la porte de l'est. Il rentre de plus en plus tard chaque soir.<PAGE>Si tu le vois à son poste la nuit, dis-lui de rentrer sur-le-champ#!
OUPS: My husband guards the eastern gate, and he keeps staying there later and later.<PAGE>If you see him at night, tell him to come home early for once!

JAP: Some of the gate guards make it a habit of coming home late.
FR: Certains gardes ne rentrent que très tard à la maison.
OUPS: Some of the gate guards make it a habit of coming home late.

JAP: They claim to be working, but I think they all slip off to the tavern and get hammered. It's not right, I tell ya!
FR: Ils disent qu'ils travaillent, mais je crois qu'ils vont plutôt se soûler à la taverne. C'est une honte#!
OUPS: They claim to be working, but I think they all slip off to the tavern and get hammered. It's not right, I tell ya!

JAP: Visiting Popola again today?
FR: Bonjour, <NIER>#! Viens-tu voir Popola#?
OUPS: Visiting Popola again today?

JAP: Watch you don't get surrounded by Shades when you're attacking.<PAGE>It doesn't matter how strong you are; if those things get the drop on you, it's all over!
FR: Lorsque tu combats des Ombres, tâche de ne pas te faire encercler. Peu importe ta force, si elles prennent l'avantage, tu seras perdu#!
OUPS: Watch you don't get surrounded by Shades when you're attacking.<PAGE>It doesn't matter how strong you are; if those things get the drop on you, it's all over!

JAP: Poor animals. They must be running out of food, too.
FR: Parfois, nous n'avons pas de quoi nourrir nos animaux. Les pauvres... Ils doivent être affamés.
OUPS: Poor animals. They must be running out of food, too.

JAP: You know the Junk Heap, in the northern plains? Yeah, it's a mine, where you can get metals and stuff.<PAGE>If it weren't for all the old-world machines in there, I'd be up there to mine for myself.
FR: Tu as entendu parler de la montagne des robots dans la plaine septentrionale#? Eh bien, on peut y trouver des objets en métal.<PAGE>Si ce n'était des machines dangereuses des Anciens, j'irais en récupérer moi-même.
OUPS: You know the Junk Heap, in the northern plains? Yeah, it's a mine, where you can get metals and stuff.<PAGE>If it weren't for all the old-world machines in there, I'd be up there to mine for myself.

JAP: I hear that wolves show up a lot in the desert beyond the eastern road. Sheep and goats are pushovers compared to a wolf!
FR: Certains disent qu'ils ont aperçu des loups dans le désert à l'est de la plaine. Chasser des moutons ou des chèvres est un jeu d'enfant par comparaison à des loups#!
OUPS: I hear that wolves show up a lot in the desert beyond the eastern road. Sheep and goats are pushovers compared to a wolf!

JAP: (I'm coming to see you today, Popola. I promise...)
FR: (J'irai te rendre visite aujourd'hui, Popola, je te le promets#!)
OUPS: (I'm coming to see you today, Popola. I promise...)

JAP: The library in our village is a relic from the old world. I'm amazed so many of its books survived.
FR: La bibliothèque de notre village est un des vestiges d'une civilisation ancienne. Il est surprenant que tant de livres aient survécu.
OUPS: The library in our village is a relic from the old world. I'm amazed so many of its books survived.

JAP: I can't make heads or tails of most books, but Popola can. I hope she can help us learn more about the past!
FR: Je n'arrive pas à les déchiffrer, mais Popola en est capable. J'espère qu'elle pourra nous aider à mieux comprendre notre passé#!
OUPS: I can't make heads or tails of most books, but Popola can. I hope she can help us learn more about the past!

JAP: Popola is like the village's mother. She really takes care of us.<PAGE>Like how she's always finding you odd jobs!
FR: Popola est un peu comme la mère du village. Elle prend soin de tous ses habitants.<PAGE>Elle arrive toujours à te trouver du travail, non#?
OUPS: Popola is like the village's mother. She really takes care of us.<PAGE>Like how she's always finding you odd jobs!

JAP: Sorry, but the boat's out of service right now.
FR: Tu ne peux pas utiliser ce bateau en ce moment, désolé.
OUPS: Sorry, but the boat's out of service right now.

JAP: I'm just here to make sure no kids climb aboard and start wreckin' stuff.
FR: Je ne suis ici que pour décourager les vandales.
OUPS: I'm just here to make sure no kids climb aboard and start wreckin' stuff.

JAP: We need some urban planning around here! We just keep cramming more stuff into the middle of town.<PAGE>Your place is pretty much the only one with any breathing room.
FR: Nous devrions mieux aménager le village... Essayer d'entasser toujours plus de bâtiments au centre ne sert à rien#!<PAGE>Ta maison doit bien être la seule qui est à l'écart des autres.
OUPS: We need some urban planning around here! We just keep cramming more stuff into the middle of town.<PAGE>Your place is pretty much the only one with any breathing room.

JAP: Whew! I know I have to finish my shopping before sundown, but I need a break!
FR: Ouf#! Je dois terminer mes courses avant le coucher du soleil, mais je dois faire une pause#!
OUPS: Whew! I know I have to finish my shopping before sundown, but I need a break!

JAP: The damn floodgates keep breaking down. I fix them and fix them, but they just refuse to stay in place!
FR: Ces satanées vannes sont toujours cassées#! Je les répare chaque fois, mais rien n'y fait#!
OUPS: The damn floodgates keep breaking down. I fix them and fix them, but they just refuse to stay in place!

JAP: You taking the day off? I hardly ever see you here in the afternoon.
FR: As-tu pris congé#? D'habitude, on ne te voit jamais ici l'après-midi.
OUPS: You taking the day off? I hardly ever see you here in the afternoon.

JAP: My sister's gonna rake me over the coals if I don't get my shopping done soon.<PAGE>She's such a slave driver! And if I wasn't so scared of her, I'd tell her so!
FR: Ma sœur me fera passer un mauvais quart d'heure si je ne termine pas bientôt de faire les courses.<PAGE>Elle me traite comme son esclave#! Je m'en plaindrais si je n'avais pas aussi peur d'elle...
OUPS: My sister's gonna rake me over the coals if I don't get my shopping done soon.<PAGE>She's such a slave driver! And if I wasn't so scared of her, I'd tell her so!

JAP: Day and night, the shopping district's always bustling. It's nice!
FR: Le marché est toujours achalandé, quelle que soit l'heure#!
OUPS: Day and night, the shopping district's always bustling. It's nice!

JAP: If I bought everything I wanted, I'd be broke in a minute.<PAGE>Must...show...restraint...
FR: Je n'ai pas assez d'argent de poche pour acheter tout ce que je veux...<PAGE>Oh, je n'arrive pas à choisir#!
OUPS: If I bought everything I wanted, I'd be broke in a minute.<PAGE>Must...show...restraint...

JAP: This town didn't become a trade hub until the world sank into the ocean.<PAGE>I'm sure other people weren't happy, but it was great for us!
FR: Cette ville n'est devenue un centre de commerce que lorsque les océans ont englouti le monde.<PAGE>Nous devons avoir été les seuls à en profiter#!
OUPS: This town didn't become a trade hub until the world sank into the ocean.<PAGE>I'm sure other people weren't happy, but it was great for us!

JAP: Men of the sea have a bad temper. And the women are even worse! You'd best mind your manners.
FR: Les marins ont sale caractère... et leurs femmes ne sont pas mieux#! Vous devriez surveiller vos manières.
OUPS: Men of the sea have a bad temper. And the women are even worse! You'd best mind your manners.

JAP: Thanks for the warning.
FR: Merci de m'avoir averti.
OUPS: Thanks for the warning.

JAP: This gate is too rusted to use anymore.
FR: Cette porte est rongée par la rouille. Personne ne l'utilise de nos jours.
OUPS: This gate is too rusted to use anymore.

JAP: A port town like this is a real jewel. If you can't find it here, you don't need it!
FR: Si vous ne trouvez pas ce que vous cherchez dans une splendide ville portuaire comme celle-ci, c'est que vous n'en avez pas vraiment besoin#!
OUPS: A port town like this is a real jewel. If you can't find it here, you don't need it!

JAP: There's a post office in the center of town that manages to send letters and packages all over the world!
FR: Il y a même un bureau de poste au centre de la ville. On peut envoyer des lettres et des colis à travers le monde#!
OUPS: There's a post office in the center of town that manages to send letters and packages all over the world!

JAP: And, let's see... What else? Well, we've got lots of fish, which are in pretty high demand.<PAGE>And lots of ladies, too, but...they're not as sought after. Hee hee.
FR: Et quoi d'autre#? Euh, nos marchands ont toutes sortes de poissons en stock et ils sont toujours très demandés.<PAGE>Ah, il y a aussi beaucoup de femmes célibataires, mais elles ne sont pas très demandées, elles#! Ha, ha, ha#!
OUPS: And, let's see... What else? Well, we've got lots of fish, which are in pretty high demand.<PAGE>And lots of ladies, too, but...they're not as sought after. Hee hee.

JAP: Aah! ...Don't scare me like that!
FR: Aaaah#! Tu pourrais faire plus de bruit#!
OUPS: Aah! ...Don't scare me like that!

JAP: Aah! Why you gotta be all sneaking up on people!?
FR: Gaaah#! Tu m'as fait peur#!!
OUPS: Aah! Why you gotta be all sneaking up on people!?

JAP: This is a secret place where no one can find me!<PAGE>...Well, except you, I guess. Now go away before more people come!
FR: Cet endroit est ma cachette où personne peut me trouver#!<PAGE>... Euh, à part toi, je suppose. J'espère que personne t'a suivi#!
OUPS: This is a secret place where no one can find me!<PAGE>...Well, except you, I guess. Now go away before more people come!

JAP: We're going to do our special ritual! We can't let anyone see us!
FR: Je veux pratiquer mon rituel magique, mais il fonctionnera pas si quelqu'un me regarde#!
OUPS: We're going to do our special ritual! We can't let anyone see us!

JAP: As long as you have a rod and bait, you can go fishing anywhere you like along the coastline.
FR: Si vous avez une canne à pêche et un appât, vous pouvez pêcher sur n'importe quelle berge.
OUPS: As long as you have a rod and bait, you can go fishing anywhere you like along the coastline.

JAP: You're friends with that sexy postman, aren't you? Oh, I just love a man in uniform!<PAGE>Oh, wait. You aren't friends? ...Well, you're pretty nice-looking yourself!
FR: Vous êtes l'ami du postier séduisant, non#? Oh, j'adore les hommes en uniforme#!<PAGE>Quoi#? Vous ne le connaissez pas...? Eh bien, vous n'êtes pas mal du tout, vous non plus#!
OUPS: You're friends with that sexy postman, aren't you? Oh, I just love a man in uniform!<PAGE>Oh, wait. You aren't friends? ...Well, you're pretty nice-looking yourself!

JAP: I haven't seen the postman in a few days. I hope he's all right.
FR: Je n'ai pas vu le postier depuis quelques jours. J'espère qu'il n'a rien.
OUPS: I haven't seen the postman in a few days. I hope he's all right.

JAP: I heard the lighthouse lady grumbling about some "illness." Ha! Illness my ass! She's just faking it so we all feel bad for her!
FR: J'ai entendu la vieille femme du phare se plaindre qu'elle était malade. Pfft#! Elle fait semblant de souffrir pour qu'on la prenne en pitié, voilà tout#!
OUPS: I heard the lighthouse lady grumbling about some "illness." Ha! Illness my ass! She's just faking it so we all feel bad for her!

JAP: My no-good husband starts drinking at noon. Or sometimes earlier.<PAGE>I wish he would keep it under control. He's got kids to think about!
FR: Chaque jour, mon ivrogne de mari se met à boire à midi ou même avant#!<PAGE>Si seulement il arrivait à se maîtriser#! Je dois m'occuper seule des enfants#!
OUPS: My no-good husband starts drinking at noon. Or sometimes earlier.<PAGE>I wish he would keep it under control. He's got kids to think about!

JAP: My husband goes to the tavern every day with his work buddies. If he keeps this up, I'm going to cut off his pocket money!
FR: Mon mari va à la taverne chaque jour avec les autres pêcheurs. S'il continue ainsi, je ne lui donnerai plus d'argent de poche#!
OUPS: My husband goes to the tavern every day with his work buddies. If he keeps this up, I'm going to cut off his pocket money!

JAP: My brother lives in another town, but we send letters to stay in touch. Isn't the post office great!?
FR: Mon frère habite une autre ville, mais nous nous écrivons souvent. Vive la poste#!
OUPS: My brother lives in another town, but we send letters to stay in touch. Isn't the post office great!?

JAP: I've about had it with the lighthouse lady!<PAGE>And the sad thing is, she'll probably outlive ME!
FR: J'en ai assez de la vieille femme du phare#!<PAGE>Le pire, c'est qu'elle vivra probablement plus longtemps que moi#!
OUPS: I've about had it with the lighthouse lady!<PAGE>And the sad thing is, she'll probably outlive ME!

JAP: What, this? This is the post office.
FR: Ce bâtiment#? C'est le bureau de poste, bien entendu.
OUPS: What, this? This is the post office.

JAP: I think that poor lighthouse lady is... Er, never mind. It's not really any of my business.
FR: Je crois que la pauvre vieille femme du phare est... Euh, rien. Ça ne me regarde pas.
OUPS: I think that poor lighthouse lady is... Er, never mind. It's not really any of my business.

JAP: I'd like to become a chef. And when I do, I'm going to serve something besides fish!
FR: Un jour, j'aimerais devenir chef cuisinier. Il n'y aurait jamais de poisson au menu, promis#!
OUPS: I'd like to become a chef. And when I do, I'm going to serve something besides fish!

JAP: The moorings you see offshore were part of a massive bridge in the old days. But now that the science is lost, they're little more than a good fishing spot.
FR: Les ruines au large faisaient autrefois partie d'un pont gigantesque. Malheureusement, nous n'avons plus la technologie pour le réparer de nos jours.<PAGE>Ce n'est désormais qu'un bon endroit pour pêcher.
OUPS: The moorings you see offshore were part of a massive bridge in the old days. But now that the science is lost, they're little more than a good fishing spot.

JAP: I've been working as a fisherman for three months, but I've yet to be sent on a run.<PAGE>I mean, come on! How many stupid errands are they going to make me run!?
FR: Je travaille depuis trois mois pour ces pêcheurs, mais je ne suis toujours pas allé au large. Combien de temps encore devrai-je leur servir de garçon de courses#?!
OUPS: I've been working as a fisherman for three months, but I've yet to be sent on a run.<PAGE>I mean, come on! How many stupid errands are they going to make me run!?

JAP: The new guy has talent, but he's impatient. I think we'll make him run those stupid errands for a while longer.
FR: Le petit nouveau a du talent, mais il est impatient. Je crois que nous devrions lui faire faire des courses pendant encore quelque temps.
OUPS: The new guy has talent, but he's impatient. I think we'll make him run those stupid errands for a while longer.

JAP: Young men these days got no toughness. Three months in, and he's already whining.<PAGE>He won't survive a single day at sea with that attitude!
FR: Les jeunes d'aujourd'hui manquent d'endurance. Notre nouveau mousse se plaint déjà après seulement trois mois.<PAGE>Il ne survivrait jamais au large avec une telle attitude#!
OUPS: Young men these days got no toughness. Three months in, and he's already whining.<PAGE>He won't survive a single day at sea with that attitude!

JAP: What? What do you want?<PAGE>Look, this is serious work, not some kinda circus. So get lost.
FR: Quoi#? Qu'est-ce que vous voulez#?<PAGE>écoutez, il y a des gens qui travaillent, ici, ce n'est pas un spectacle. Du vent#!
OUPS: What? What do you want?<PAGE>Look, this is serious work, not some kinda circus. So get lost.

JAP: What are you doing up there?
FR: Que faites-vous#?
OUPS: What are you doing up there?

JAP: Observing the ocean. I'm heading out on a fishing run soon.
FR: J'observe l'océan. Je pars bientôt pour le large.
OUPS: Observing the ocean. I'm heading out on a fishing run soon.

JAP: If a storm catches you off-guard out there, you'd best have kissed the wife good-bye before you left.
FR: Il ne faut pas que j'oublie d'embrasser ma femme avant de partir au cas où une tempête fasse chavirer le bateau.
OUPS: If a storm catches you off-guard out there, you'd best have kissed the wife good-bye before you left.

JAP: Watch yourself around that old lady in the lighthouse. She's nothing but trouble to everyone who crosses her path!
FR: Attention à la vieille femme du phare#! Elle n'apporte que des ennuis à tous ceux qui la rencontrent#!
OUPS: Watch yourself around that old lady in the lighthouse. She's nothing but trouble to everyone who crosses her path!

JAP: I'm hungry for blowfish, so I brought as many lugworms as I could carry. That's the only bait those blowfish seem to like.
FR: J'ai envie de manger du poisson-globe, alors j'ai apporté le plus d'arénicoles que je pouvais. C'est la seule façon d'en attraper.
OUPS: I'm hungry for blowfish, so I brought as many lugworms as I could carry. That's the only bait those blowfish seem to like.

JAP: I didn't catch a thing yesterday, which meant dinner was seaweed-wrapped seaweed!<PAGE>I better make a serious haul today, let me tell ya.
FR: Je n'ai rien attrapé hier, alors j'ai dû manger des algues aux algues pour dîner#!<PAGE>J'espère que j'aurai plus de chance aujourd'hui#!
OUPS: I didn't catch a thing yesterday, which meant dinner was seaweed-wrapped seaweed!<PAGE>I better make a serious haul today, let me tell ya.

JAP: You know that bridge out in the water? Long ago, they were apparently used for docking giant iron vehicles!
FR: Le pont au large#? On raconte qu'autrefois, on y amarrait des véhicules de métal géants#!
OUPS: You know that bridge out in the water? Long ago, they were apparently used for docking giant iron vehicles!

JAP: Welcome! We've got the freshest fish anywhere!
FR: Bienvenue#! Il n'y a pas de poisson plus frais dans la ville#!
