OUPS: Welcome! We've got the freshest fish anywhere!

JAP: I hope you come back soon!
FR: À bientôt, j'espère#!
OUPS: I hope you come back soon!

JAP: I gave her all these presents, and now she tells me she likes another guy!<PAGE>Now my heart AND my pocketbook are broken!
FR: Je lui ai donné des tas de cadeaux et ensuite elle m'a dit qu'elle me quittait pour quelqu'un d'autre#!<PAGE>Maintenant, mon cœur est brisé et ma bourse est vide#!
OUPS: I gave her all these presents, and now she tells me she likes another guy!<PAGE>Now my heart AND my pocketbook are broken!

JAP: Hey buddy, have a drink. The mug will never leave ya for another man.
FR: Buvez, mon ami, buvez#! Ce verre ne vous abandonnera jamais pour un autre homme.
OUPS: Hey buddy, have a drink. The mug will never leave ya for another man.

JAP: Us fishermen visit the tavern once a day. It's like an unwritten law for men of the sea.
FR: Les pêcheurs visitent la taverne une fois par jour. C'est la coutume des hommes de la mer.
OUPS: Us fishermen visit the tavern once a day. It's like an unwritten law for men of the sea.

JAP: Heh... I'd love a drink right about now, but the Mrs. would have my head!
FR: Ha, ha#! J'aimerais bien aller à la taverne, mais ma femme m'en empêche...
OUPS: Heh... I'd love a drink right about now, but the Mrs. would have my head!

JAP: The world used to be a lot bigger than it is now. I can't image the amazing things that are waiting for us on the ocean floor...
FR: Jadis, le monde était beaucoup plus grand. Qui sait ce que nous pourrions trouver au fond de l'océan...?
OUPS: The world used to be a lot bigger than it is now. I can't image the amazing things that are waiting for us on the ocean floor...

JAP: Work was exhausting, so I'm taking a little break. This is a great place to come and relax!
FR: Mon travail m'a épuisé, alors je me repose un peu. Cet endroit est parfait pour faire une pause.
OUPS: Work was exhausting, so I'm taking a little break. This is a great place to come and relax!

JAP: If you're ready to get serious about fishing, you'll need more than just a lure. A good variety of bait is essential.
FR: Pour devenir un jour maître pêcheur, une amorce ne suffit pas. Il est indispensable de se procurer toutes sortes d'appâts.
OUPS: If you're ready to get serious about fishing, you'll need more than just a lure. A good variety of bait is essential.

JAP: Come back if you run out of bait.
FR: Revenez me voir si vous avez besoin d'autres appâts.
OUPS: Come back if you run out of bait.

JAP: Shhh! I'm playing hide-and-seek!<PAGE>I wish they'd hurry up and find me already...
FR: Je joue à cache-cache avec mes amis#! J'espère que je les trouverai bientôt...
OUPS: Shhh! I'm playing hide-and-seek!<PAGE>I wish they'd hurry up and find me already...

JAP: We've eaten fish for the past nine weeks. Maybe I should get something else.<PAGE>...Oh, who am I kidding?
FR: Nous avons mangé du poisson neuf semaines d'affilée. Je devrais peut-être acheter autre chose.<PAGE>... Oh, je ne faisais que plaisanter, bien sûr.
OUPS: We've eaten fish for the past nine weeks. Maybe I should get something else.<PAGE>...Oh, who am I kidding?

JAP: I'll cook any fish my husband brings home. Beggars can't be choosers!
FR: Je préparerai le poisson que mon mari me rapportera, quel qu'il soit. Nécessité fait loi, après tout#!
OUPS: I'll cook any fish my husband brings home. Beggars can't be choosers!

JAP: I'm in the mood for a fancy dinner tonight! Like roast mutton with all the trimmings.
FR: J'ai envie d'un dîner gastronomique ce soir... Un gigot de mouton rôti avec la garniture habituelle m'irait très bien#!
OUPS: I'm in the mood for a fancy dinner tonight! Like roast mutton with all the trimmings.

JAP: I promised my brother I'd come visit, but now he won't come out of the house. Says his fingers are turning black or some such nonsense...
FR: J'ai promis à mon frère que je viendrais lui rendre visite, mais il ne veut pas sortir de chez lui. Il dit que ses doigts sont noirs, ou quelque chose du genre...
OUPS: I promised my brother I'd come visit, but now he won't come out of the house. Says his fingers are turning black or some such nonsense...

JAP: These stairs are tough when you're as old as I am. It makes the shopping trips quite an ordeal.
FR: À mon âge, ces escaliers sont une torture... Il m'est pénible d'aller faire les courses.
OUPS: These stairs are tough when you're as old as I am. It makes the shopping trips quite an ordeal.

JAP: People use small crafts like these to access the best fishing waters, so we have to make sure they're in tip-top shape.
FR: On utilise de petits bateaux comme ceux-ci pour atteindre les meilleurs endroits pour pêcher. Il faut qu'ils soient toujours en parfaite condition.
OUPS: People use small crafts like these to access the best fishing waters, so we have to make sure they're in tip-top shape.

JAP: Truth be told, these boats are pretty flimsy. So unless you like drowning, I'd stay far away.
FR: Ces barques ne m'ont pas l'air très solides. Si j'étais vous, je resterais sur la terre ferme.
OUPS: Truth be told, these boats are pretty flimsy. So unless you like drowning, I'd stay far away.

JAP: When I grow up, I'm gonna be a big, strong sailor on a really huge boat! ...Or a botanist. I can't decide.
FR: Quand je serai grand, je vais être un marin musclé sur un bateau énorme#! ...#Ou un botaniste. Je n'ai pas encore décidé.
OUPS: When I grow up, I'm gonna be a big, strong sailor on a really huge boat! ...Or a botanist. I can't decide.

JAP: We've got precious materials from exotic lands!
FR: J'ai des marchandises provenant de terres exotiques en stock#!
OUPS: We've got precious materials from exotic lands!

JAP: See you later!
FR: À bientôt#!
OUPS: See you later!

JAP: Hey, let's play tongue twisters!
FR: Hé, jouons aux charades#!
OUPS: Hey, let's play tongue twisters!

JAP: I bet I can come up with an awesome tongue twister before you can!
FR: Je parie que je peux trouver une meilleure charade que toi#!
OUPS: I bet I can come up with an awesome tongue twister before you can!

JAP: Hey, no grown-ups allowed! Go away!
FR: Pas d'adultes ici#! Ouste#!
OUPS: Hey, no grown-ups allowed! Go away!

JAP: Hey, things could be worse. At least I'm not desperate enough to sign on with one of those wacky cults...
FR: Oh, la situation pourrait être pire. Au moins, je ne suis pas assez désespéré pour me joindre à un de ces cultes étranges#!
OUPS: Hey, things could be worse. At least I'm not desperate enough to sign on with one of those wacky cults...

JAP: People in this town never listen to what anyone tells them. It used to drive me nuts, but now I guess I'm just used to it.
FR: Les habitants de cette ville ignorent toujours l'opinion des autres. Cela me rendait folle, mais je crois que j'ai fini par m'y habituer.
OUPS: People in this town never listen to what anyone tells them. It used to drive me nuts, but now I guess I'm just used to it.

JAP: You have to know when to let things go. Even things that make you really, really angry.
FR: Parfois, il faut savoir ignorer ce qui nous contrarie, même les choses les plus agaçantes.
OUPS: You have to know when to let things go. Even things that make you really, really angry.

JAP: I hope those two catch something! Otherwise it's nothing but old-bone soup for dinner. ...AGAIN!
FR: J'espère qu'ils attraperont quelque chose#! Sinon, on n'aura que de la soupe à l'os pour dîner, comme d'habitude#!
OUPS: I hope those two catch something! Otherwise it's nothing but old-bone soup for dinner. ...AGAIN!

JAP: My weapons may not be the latest and greatest, but my selection can't be beat!
FR: Je n'ai peut-être pas les toutes dernières armes, mais j'offre le meilleur choix qui soit#!
OUPS: My weapons may not be the latest and greatest, but my selection can't be beat!

JAP: Thank you much!
FR: Merci beaucoup#!
OUPS: Thank you much!

JAP: We've got the latest advances in medicine, and you won't find them anywhere else!
FR: J'offre des remèdes fabriqués par des apothicaires à la fine pointe de la recherche#! Vous n'en trouverez pas ailleurs#!
OUPS: We've got the latest advances in medicine, and you won't find them anywhere else!

JAP: I hope to see you again.
FR: À bientôt, j'espère#!
OUPS: I hope to see you again.

JAP: Would you care for some imported fruits and vegetables?
FR: Aimeriez-vous jeter un coup d'œil à mes marchandises importées#?
OUPS: Would you care for some imported fruits and vegetables?

JAP: Thanks for shopping.
FR: Merci bien#!
OUPS: Thanks for shopping.

JAP: It's funny how people won't bat an eye about paying more just because it's imported.
FR: Vous ne trouvez pas ça bizarre que tout le monde accepte sans sourciller de payer le prix fort pour des marchandises importées#?
OUPS: It's funny how people won't bat an eye about paying more just because it's imported.

JAP: Hmm... Should I really make fish for dinner again?
FR: Hum... Devrais-je vraiment encore préparer du poisson pour dîner#?
OUPS: Hmm... Should I really make fish for dinner again?

JAP: If you like fish, this place is paradise! You eat nothing but the freshest catch of the day!
FR: Cette ville est un paradis pour les amateurs de poisson#! On y mange le poisson le plus frais de la région#!
OUPS: If you like fish, this place is paradise! You eat nothing but the freshest catch of the day!

JAP: I love the breezes that blow through here.
FR: J'aime l'odeur de la brise marine.
OUPS: I love the breezes that blow through here.

JAP: I've got some time before the next fishing voyage, so I'd better rest up.
FR: Mon bateau lève l'ancre dans quelques jours. Je ferais mieux de me reposer.
OUPS: I've got some time before the next fishing voyage, so I'd better rest up.

JAP: The import-export business is booming! I hardly get a minute to myself these days...
FR: Mon commerce fleurit#! Je ne peux jamais prendre une minute de repos#!
OUPS: The import-export business is booming! I hardly get a minute to myself these days...

JAP: This town's better off than most, and we have our trading partners to thank for it.
FR: Grâce à nos partenaires commerciaux, notre ville est plus prospère que la moyenne.
OUPS: This town's better off than most, and we have our trading partners to thank for it.

JAP: (We welcome you, friend of our benefactor!)
FR: (Nous vous souhaitons la bienvenue, ami de notre bienfaitrice#!)
OUPS: (We welcome you, friend of our benefactor!)

JAP: (The benefactor is our friend! Therefore friends of the benefactor are friends to us as well! This is a rule.)
FR: (Notre bienfaitrice est notre amie#! Les amis de notre bienfaitrice sont donc aussi nos amis#! C'est la loi.)
OUPS: (The benefactor is our friend! Therefore friends of the benefactor are friends to us as well! This is a rule.)

JAP: (This is Facade! All here have sworn allegiance to the rules.)
FR: (Bienvenue à Façade#! Nous avons tous juré de respecter la loi#!)
OUPS: (This is Facade! All here have sworn allegiance to the rules.)

JAP: (Upholding the rules is an integral part of our daily lives.)
FR: (Cela fait partie de notre vie quotidienne.)
OUPS: (Upholding the rules is an integral part of our daily lives.)

JAP: (As per Rule 7,545, I will hereby engage in the trading of general goods. ...Welcome!)
FR: (Comme le prescrit la loi nº#7545, je suis un apothicaire. Bienvenue#!)
OUPS: (As per Rule 7,545, I will hereby engage in the trading of general goods. ...Welcome!)

JAP: (I thank you in the name of the rules!)
FR: (Au nom de la loi, je vous remercie#!)
OUPS: (I thank you in the name of the rules!)

JAP: (As per Rule 6,909, I will hereby engage in the trading of weapons! ...Would you like to buy something?)
FR: (Comme le prescrit la loi nº#6909, je suis le propriétaire de cette armurerie. Voulez-vous jeter un coup d'œil à ma marchandise#?)
OUPS: (As per Rule 6,909, I will hereby engage in the trading of weapons! ...Would you like to buy something?)

JAP: (I thank you in the name of the rules! Come back soon!)
FR: (Au nom de la loi, je vous remercie#! À bientôt, j'espère#!)
OUPS: (I thank you in the name of the rules! Come back soon!)

JAP: (They say wolf attacks have grown more frequent lately. You'd best be prepared if you venture out of town.)
FR: (On dit que plusieurs voyageurs ont été attaqués par des loups récemment. Soyez sur vos gardes#!)
OUPS: (They say wolf attacks have grown more frequent lately. You'd best be prepared if you venture out of town.)

JAP: (I heard that the leader of the wolves is jet-black from head to toe! Also, he's huge. And I mean REALLY huge.)
FR: (J'ai entendu dire que le chef de la meute de loups est noir de jais, de la pointe des oreilles jusqu'au bout des pattes#!)<PAGE>(On raconte aussi qu'il est énorme#! Même gigantesque#!)
OUPS: (I heard that the leader of the wolves is jet-black from head to toe! Also, he's huge. And I mean REALLY huge.)

JAP: (Just thinking about the wolves storming our city is enough to keep me up at night.)
FR: (J'ai si peur que les loups attaquent notre ville que je n'arrive plus à dormir...!)
OUPS: (Just thinking about the wolves storming our city is enough to keep me up at night.)

JAP: (Ssshh! A lizard just crawled into this pot.)
FR: (Chut#! Un lézard s'est glissé dans ce pot.)
OUPS: (Ssshh! A lizard just crawled into this pot.)

JAP: (Rule 432 states that you must capture any lizard that crawls into a pot. Now be quiet and let me concentrate!)
FR: (La loi nº#432 ordonne de capturer tous les lézards qui se glissent dans un pot, alors taisez-vous et laissez-moi me concentrer#!)
OUPS: (Rule 432 states that you must capture any lizard that crawls into a pot. Now be quiet and let me concentrate!)

JAP: Maybe it's just me, but some of these rules are really stupid.
FR: Certaines de ces lois sont vraiment ridicules.
OUPS: Maybe it's just me, but some of these rules are really stupid.

JAP: (As per Rule 9,102, I am responsible for the trading of strange and unusual goods...when I actually have some on hand.)
FR: (Comme le prescrit la loi nº#9102, je suis le marchand de curiosités#! ... Mais je n'ai rien à vous offrir actuellement.)
OUPS: (As per Rule 9,102, I am responsible for the trading of strange and unusual goods...when I actually have some on hand.)

JAP: (Rule 2,078 states that boys born on December 3 must keep continual watch over the quicksand!)<PAGE>(...That is why I am keeping continual watch over the quicksand.)
FR: (La loi nº#2078 ordonne que les garçons nés le troisième jour du douzième mois doivent assurer en tout temps la surveillance des sables mouvants#!)<PAGE>(... C'est pourquoi je suis ici.)
OUPS: (Rule 2,078 states that boys born on December 3 must keep continual watch over the quicksand!)<PAGE>(...That is why I am keeping continual watch over the quicksand.)

JAP: Following the rules must be pretty tough at times...
FR: Il doit parfois être difficile de respecter la loi...
OUPS: Following the rules must be pretty tough at times...

JAP: (Only nobility may enter the treasury.)
FR: (Seuls les nobles peuvent pénétrer dans la trésorerie.)
OUPS: (Only nobility may enter the treasury.)

JAP: (Every year, there's at least one child who drowns in the quicksand.)
FR: (Chaque année, au moins un enfant meurt dans les sables mouvants.)
OUPS: (Every year, there's at least one child who drowns in the quicksand.)

JAP: (You can see the entire city from this vantage point. If trouble comes, this is the first place to find it!)
FR: (On peut voir la ville entière d'ici. Si un désastre survient, c'est le meilleur endroit pour en déterminer la cause#!)
OUPS: (You can see the entire city from this vantage point. If trouble comes, this is the first place to find it!)

JAP: (I was out on an errand, but I broke Rule 7,017 on the way.)<PAGE>(Oh man, Mom's going to Rule 4,217 me when I get back! I just know it.)
FR: (J'étais partie faire des courses, mais j'ai enfreint la loi nº#7017.)<PAGE>(Ma mère va me forcer à respecter la loi nº#4217 quand je vais rentrer, j'en suis certaine#!)
OUPS: (I was out on an errand, but I broke Rule 7,017 on the way.)<PAGE>(Oh man, Mom's going to Rule 4,217 me when I get back! I just know it.)

JAP: (You can't say bad things about the prince!)
FR: (Il ne faut pas dire du mal de notre prince#!)
OUPS: (You can't say bad things about the prince!)

JAP: (But everyone's saying that he's useless! ...Or at least whispering it.)
FR: (Tout le monde sait que le prince est une mauviette#! Ou du moins, ils le disent tout bas...)
OUPS: (But everyone's saying that he's useless! ...Or at least whispering it.)

JAP: (Adherence to the rules helps to calm the soul. You would understand this if you lived here.)
FR: (Obéir à la loi réjouit l'âme. Vous pourriez le comprendre si vous habitiez ici.)
OUPS: (Adherence to the rules helps to calm the soul. You would understand this if you lived here.)

JAP: (I hope that son of mine didn't buy the wrong thing again.)
FR: (J'espère que ma fille a bien acheté ce que je lui avais demandé cette fois-ci#!)
OUPS: (I hope that son of mine didn't buy the wrong thing again.)

JAP: (If so, he broke Rule 7,017. And that means Rule 4,217 for him!)<PAGE>(...What's that? You want to know what the rules mean?)
FR: (Sinon, cela veut dire qu'elle a enfreint la loi nº#7017 et que la loi nº#4217 s'applique.)<PAGE>(... Comment#? Vous voulez savoir de quelles lois il s'agit#?)
OUPS: (If so, he broke Rule 7,017. And that means Rule 4,217 for him!)<PAGE>(...What's that? You want to know what the rules mean?)

JAP: (Rule 7,017 states that you cannot make a mistake while running an errand. Rule 4,217 says that parents must scold their children when they make a mistake.)
FR: (C'est pourtant bien simple#!)<PAGE>(La loi nº#7017 ordonne de ne jamais faire d'erreur en faisant des courses et la loi nº#4217 ordonne aux parents de réprimander leur enfant s'il fait une erreur.)
OUPS: (Rule 7,017 states that you cannot make a mistake while running an errand. Rule 4,217 says that parents must scold their children when they make a mistake.)

JAP: (As per Rule 10,547, I will hereby engage in the trading of food! Now come in, come in! Marvel at my wonderful selection!)
FR: (Comme le prescrit la loi nº#10#547, je me spécialise dans la vente des denrées comestibles#! Vous aurez l'embarras du choix#!)
OUPS: (As per Rule 10,547, I will hereby engage in the trading of food! Now come in, come in! Marvel at my wonderful selection!)

JAP: (I thank you in the name of the rules! Come back soon!)
FR: (Au nom de la loi, je vous remercie#! À bientôt, j'espère#!)
OUPS: (I thank you in the name of the rules! Come back soon!)

JAP: (In accordance with the rules, I have spent the last two years watching the quicksand.)
FR: (Comme le prescrit la loi, je surveille les sables mouvants depuis deux ans.)
OUPS: (In accordance with the rules, I have spent the last two years watching the quicksand.)

JAP: (...I gotta tell ya, I'm not exactly thrilled about my future.)
FR: (... Mon avenir ne s'annonce pas des plus brillants, mais...)
OUPS: (...I gotta tell ya, I'm not exactly thrilled about my future.)

JAP: (But I have to keep doing it, or else I'll break the rules! What do I do!?)
FR: (Je dois continuer, sinon j'enfreins la loi#! Je n'ai pas le choix#!)
OUPS: (But I have to keep doing it, or else I'll break the rules! What do I do!?)

JAP: (Welcome, benefactor.)
FR: (Bienvenue, ami de notre bienfaitrice#!)
OUPS: (Welcome, benefactor.)

JAP: (Welcome, benefactor.)
FR: (Bienvenue, ami de notre bienfaitrice#!)
OUPS: (Welcome, benefactor.)

JAP: (My professor instructed me to study the flow of the quicksand at this spot.)
FR: (Mon professeur m'a dit d'étudier l'écoulement du sable à cet endroit.)
OUPS: (My professor instructed me to study the flow of the quicksand at this spot.)

JAP: (As per Rule 4,202, I will hereby engage in the trading of materials! ...So whatcha need?)
FR: (Comme le prescrit la loi nº#4202, je vends des matériaux#! De quoi avez-vous besoin#?)
OUPS: (As per Rule 4,202, I will hereby engage in the trading of materials! ...So whatcha need?)

JAP: (I thank you in the name of the rules! Come back soon!)
FR: (Au nom de la loi, je vous remercie#! À bientôt, j'espère#!)
OUPS: (I thank you in the name of the rules! Come back soon!)

JAP: (I got in an argument with my wife. And according to the rules, I have to make up with her before the day is over, or we'll be divorced.)
FR: (Je me suis querellé avec ma femme... Selon la loi, je dois me réconcilier avec elle avant demain, sinon nous devrons divorcer.)
OUPS: (I got in an argument with my wife. And according to the rules, I have to make up with her before the day is over, or we'll be divorced.)

JAP: (My husband was cheating on me! AGAIN! I'm gonna brain him with a frying pan!)
FR: (Mon mari m'a trompée#! Et ce n'est pas la première fois#! Il va le regretter#!)
OUPS: (My husband was cheating on me! AGAIN! I'm gonna brain him with a frying pan!)

JAP: (You're an outsider!)
FR: (Un étranger#!)
OUPS: (You're an outsider!)

JAP: (Ah ha ha ha! You aren't wearing a mask! That must be so embarrassing! I mean, everyone can see your...)<PAGE>(Well, you know!)
FR: (Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha#! Tu ne portes pas de masque#! Comme ce doit être embarrassant#! Tout le monde peut voir ton...)<PAGE>(... Euh, tu sais de quoi je parle#!)
OUPS: (Ah ha ha ha! You aren't wearing a mask! That must be so embarrassing! I mean, everyone can see your...)<PAGE>(Well, you know!)

JAP: (Why are you dressed up like that? It's so weird.)
FR: (Pourquoi es-tu habillé ainsi#? C'est vraiment bizarre...)
OUPS: (Why are you dressed up like that? It's so weird.)

JAP: (You can't move in the sand with that kind of outfit.)
FR: (Ce doit être difficile de traverser le désert affublé de cette façon.)
OUPS: (You can't move in the sand with that kind of outfit.)

JAP: (Children are our greatest treasure. We must do everything we can to protect them.)
FR: (Nos enfants sont notre trésor le plus précieux. Nous devons à tout prix les protéger.)
OUPS: (Children are our greatest treasure. We must do everything we can to protect them.)

JAP: (Ugh... I can't sell any of my inventory. It's just the same old stuff, year after year.)
FR: (*soupir* Je n'arrive pas à écouler mes stocks... Cela doit bien faire des années que j'essaie de vendre les mêmes marchandises.)
OUPS: (Ugh... I can't sell any of my inventory. It's just the same old stuff, year after year.)

JAP: (We're conducting research to see if we can use the flow of the quicksand as a power source. This would be a great boon to our people!)
FR: (Nous voulons découvrir s'il est possible d'utiliser l'écoulement du sable comme source d'énergie. Cela assurerait la prospérité de notre peuple#!)
OUPS: (We're conducting research to see if we can use the flow of the quicksand as a power source. This would be a great boon to our people!)

JAP: (Apparently that ocean of sand contained water at some point. But now what land isn't swallowed by the ocean is slowly turning into sand.)
FR: (On dit que cette étendue de sable était autrefois un océan. Toutefois, toutes les terres qui n'ont pas été englouties par l'océan se font dévorer par le désert.)
OUPS: (Apparently that ocean of sand contained water at some point. But now what land isn't swallowed by the ocean is slowly turning into sand.)

JAP: (It's as if the human race is being shunned by its own home.)
FR: (C'est comme si notre monde voulait bannir la race humaine.)
OUPS: (It's as if the human race is being shunned by its own home.)

JAP: (The professor has been studying the quicksand for over ten years now.)
FR: (Le professeur étudie les sables mouvants depuis plus de dix ans.)
OUPS: (The professor has been studying the quicksand for over ten years now.)

JAP: (I'm watching over the children here, but all they do is pull pranks and call me names.)<PAGE>(I'm not sure I'm cut out for this.)
FR: (J'ai la garde des enfants, mais ils n'arrêtent pas de me jouer des tours et de me traiter de tous les noms.)<PAGE>(Je ne sais pas si je suis vraiment faite pour ce genre de travail.)
OUPS: (I'm watching over the children here, but all they do is pull pranks and call me names.)<PAGE>(I'm not sure I'm cut out for this.)

JAP: (Come on, Teach! What game are we gonna play today, huh?)
FR: (Dis, à quoi on va jouer aujourd'hui#?)
OUPS: (Come on, Teach! What game are we gonna play today, huh?)

JAP: (Come on, let's play already!)
FR: (Je veux jouer#!)
OUPS: (Come on, let's play already!)

JAP: (Stop it! You're annoying the teacher!)
FR: (Arrête d'embêter le professeur#!)
OUPS: (Stop it! You're annoying the teacher!)

JAP: (Only nobility may enter the treasury.)
FR: (Seuls les nobles peuvent pénétrer dans la trésorerie.)
OUPS: (Only nobility may enter the treasury.)

JAP: (According to Rule 12, only nobility may enter the treasury!)
FR: (La loi nº#12 affirme que seuls les nobles peuvent pénétrer dans la trésorerie#!)
OUPS: (According to Rule 12, only nobility may enter the treasury!)

JAP: (The rules stipulate that only nobility may enter the treasury.)
FR: (La loi stipule que seuls les nobles peuvent pénétrer dans la trésorerie#!)
OUPS: (The rules stipulate that only nobility may enter the treasury.)

JAP: (Did you run into any wolves while crossing the desert? They're demons, they are, and they are a pox upon the desert!)
FR: (Avez-vous aperçu des loups en traversant le désert#? Ils sont féroces, un véritable fléau#!)
OUPS: (Did you run into any wolves while crossing the desert? They're demons, they are, and they are a pox upon the desert!)

JAP: (The largest of the wolves is black as night! Apparently he acts as the pack leader.)
FR: (Le plus gros loup a un pelage noir de jais#! On dit qu'il est le chef de la meute.)
OUPS: (The largest of the wolves is black as night! Apparently he acts as the pack leader.)

JAP: (I've come to rely on the items sold here. Whenever something new comes in, I'm the first one to buy it!)
FR: (Je fais tous mes achats au magasin du niveau inférieur. Dès qu'il y a du nouveau en stock, je l'achète#!)
OUPS: (I've come to rely on the items sold here. Whenever something new comes in, I'm the first one to buy it!)

JAP: (Yes...yes, this is very nice. I'll take ten of them!)
FR: (Qu'as-tu trouvé...? Oh, formidable#! J'en prendrai dix#!)
OUPS: (Yes...yes, this is very nice. I'll take ten of them!)

JAP: (Er, what is it, by the way?)
FR: (Euh... Et qu'est-ce que c'est, au juste#?)
OUPS: (Er, what is it, by the way?)

JAP: (I was hoping to become a soldier, but I failed the test.)
FR: (Je voulais devenir guerrier, mais j'ai échoué à l'épreuve.)
OUPS: (I was hoping to become a soldier, but I failed the test.)

JAP: (The way I see it, the rules serve as a sort of mental support to the Masked People. No matter how insignificant the rule, following it instills a sense of pride in us all!)
FR: (À mon avis, la loi est l'étai moral du peuple masqué. Obéir à la loi dans ses moindres détails nous remplit d'une fierté patriotique#!)
OUPS: (The way I see it, the rules serve as a sort of mental support to the Masked People. No matter how insignificant the rule, following it instills a sense of pride in us all!)

JAP: (There are many, many books written about how to follow the rules, but not a single one about WHY we must follow the rules.)
FR: (Il y a une multitude de livres qui décrivent comment respecter la loi, mais aucun qui explique pourquoi nous devons le faire.)
OUPS: (There are many, many books written about how to follow the rules, but not a single one about WHY we must follow the rules.)

JAP: (But that's fine! Rules are the rules, and there's no point in resisting them.)
FR: (Mais ce n'est pas important#! La loi est la loi et y résister ne mène nulle part.)
OUPS: (But that's fine! Rules are the rules, and there's no point in resisting them.)

JAP: It seems like people did nothing but write books back in the old days!<PAGE>I can't read 'em, either. They're all written in funny languages.
FR: On dirait que les Anciens ne faisaient qu'écrire des livres#!<PAGE>Ils sont tous dans une langue bizarre, alors je ne peux pas les lire.
OUPS: It seems like people did nothing but write books back in the old days!<PAGE>I can't read 'em, either. They're all written in funny languages.

JAP: Mother and father are very busy, so I have to watch my little brother.<PAGE>I don't mind, actually. He's pretty cool, and we like to come here and look at the books.
FR: Maman et papa sont très occupés, alors c'est moi qui prends soin de mon petit frère.<PAGE>Ça ne me dérange pas vraiment. On s'entend plutôt bien et on aime feuilleter les livres de la bibliothèque.
OUPS: Mother and father are very busy, so I have to watch my little brother.<PAGE>I don't mind, actually. He's pretty cool, and we like to come here and look at the books.

JAP: These books speak of ancient technology far beyond anything we could ever imagine! ...What could have happened to this world?
FR: Ces livres parlent de sciences et de techniques bien au-delà ce que nous pourrions imaginer#!<PAGE>...#Que peut-il être arrivé aux Anciens#?
OUPS: These books speak of ancient technology far beyond anything we could ever imagine! ...What could have happened to this world?

JAP: Popola asked me to organize the books, but I had no idea there were so many!<PAGE>...I never should have taken this job.
FR: Popola m'a demandé de mettre de l'ordre dans la bibliothèque, mais il y a tant de livres...!<PAGE>Je n'aurais jamais dû accepter cette tâche.
OUPS: Popola asked me to organize the books, but I had no idea there were so many!<PAGE>...I never should have taken this job.

JAP: Will you continue your lie now?
FR: Allez-vous continuer à lui mentir ?
OUPS: Will you continue your lie now?

JAP: Yes. The truth can only cause her pain.
FR: Oui, la vérité ne lui apporterait que de la douleur.
OUPS: Yes. The truth can only cause her pain.

JAP: You sure about that?
FR: En êtes-vous certain ?
OUPS: You sure about that?

JAP: It's not a very happy truth, now is it?
FR: Vous devez admettre que c'est une triste vérité.
OUPS: It's not a very happy truth, now is it?

JAP: And what of her final request?
FR: Et son ultime requête ?
OUPS: And what of her final request?

JAP: I don't know! How should I know!? I'm just a damn postman.
FR: Je n'en sais rien ! Comment pourrais-je le savoir ?! Je ne suis qu'un simple postier.
OUPS: I don't know! How should I know!? I'm just a damn postman.

JAP: This is tough. Would she want to know or not?
FR: C'est un dilemme difficile. Voudrait-elle découvrir la vérité ?
OUPS: This is tough. Would she want to know or not?

JAP: Such questions are best left for philosophers. You can hardly be expected to know the
FR: Seuls les philosophes pourraient répondre à une telle question.
OUPS: Such questions are best left for philosophers. You can hardly be expected to know the

JAP: mind of another.
FR: Personne ne s'attend à ce que tu puisses savoir d'avance comment elle va réagir.
OUPS: mind of another.

JAP: It's hard to believe that the entire town was lying to her.
FR: Je n'arrive pas à croire que la ville entière lui ait menti.
OUPS: It's hard to believe that the entire town was lying to her.

JAP: I wager their intentions were good. Elsewise, they would not have carried on
FR: Je suppose qu'ils avaient de bonnes intentions.
OUPS: I wager their intentions were good. Elsewise, they would not have carried on

JAP: with the ruse for 50 years.
FR: Autrement, ils n'auraient pas perpétué ce stratagème pendant 50 ans.
OUPS: with the ruse for 50 years.

JAP: It also explains why they tasked her with keeping the lighthouse running:
FR: Cela explique aussi pourquoi ils l'ont chargée de s'occuper du phare.
OUPS: It also explains why they tasked her with keeping the lighthouse running:

JAP: so news of her love's demise would not reach her.
FR: Ainsi, elle n'a pas eu l'occasion d'apprendre le décès de son bien-aimé.
OUPS: so news of her love's demise would not reach her.

JAP: That doesn't sound like good intentions to me.
FR: Ça ne me semble pas être de bonnes intentions.
OUPS: That doesn't sound like good intentions to me.

JAP: It makes you wonder what the point of everything is.
FR: Tout ça pousse à se demander à quoi servent nos actions.
OUPS: It makes you wonder what the point of everything is.

JAP: Life is hard, and it seems the right thing
FR: La vie est dure et il semble que la meilleure décision soit rarement celle qui rend
OUPS: Life is hard, and it seems the right thing

JAP: is rarely the happy thing.
FR: les gens heureux.
OUPS: is rarely the happy thing.

JAP: Pah! It's only as complicated as you choose to make it!
FR: Pfft ! Tu peux te compliquer la vie si tu le veux. C'est ton choix.
OUPS: Pah! It's only as complicated as you choose to make it!

JAP: Was the old woman happy? Unhappy? Who can say!?
FR: La vieille femme était-elle heureuse ? Malheureuse ? Qui sait ?
OUPS: Was the old woman happy? Unhappy? Who can say!?

JAP: One can never know for true.
FR: On ne pourra jamais en être certain.
OUPS: One can never know for true.

JAP: You simply make your best attempt and move on.
FR: Tu ne peux que faire de ton mieux et aller de l'avant.
OUPS: You simply make your best attempt and move on.

JAP: I guess...
FR: Je suppose...
OUPS: I guess...

JAP: The guards at the northern, eastern, and southern gates are holding some documents for me. Can you go pick them up?
FR: Les gardes des portes du nord, de l'est et du sud ont des documents pour moi. Pourrais-tu me les apporter#?
OUPS: The guards at the northern, eastern, and southern gates are holding some documents for me. Can you go pick them up?

JAP: Sure thing.
FR: Bien sûr.
OUPS: Sure thing.

JAP: Thank you. This is a huge help.
FR: Merci beaucoup. Ton aide m'est précieuse.
OUPS: Thank you. This is a huge help.

JAP: I have the guards write up monthly updates on how things are looking outside the village. It's very helpful.
FR: J'ai demandé aux gardes de rédiger un rapport chaque mois sur l'état de la situation à l'extérieur du village. Ils sont très utiles.
OUPS: I have the guards write up monthly updates on how things are looking outside the village. It's very helpful.

JAP: Collect documents from the guards at the northern, eastern, and southern gates, okay?
FR: Va récupérer les rapports des gardes des portes du nord, de l'est et du sud.
OUPS: Collect documents from the guards at the northern, eastern, and southern gates, okay?

JAP: You got some kind of report for Popola?
FR: As-tu un rapport pour Popola#?
OUPS: You got some kind of report for Popola?

JAP: Yep! Here ya go. ...I hope she can read my handwriting,
FR: Ouaip#! Le voilà... J'espère qu'elle pourra déchiffrer mon écriture.
OUPS: Yep! Here ya go. ...I hope she can read my handwriting,

JAP: What's the word from the plains?
FR: Que se passe-t-il sur la plaine#?
OUPS: What's the word from the plains?

JAP: Shade activity's been quiet. The bridge is out, so we're not seeing as many traders as we used to, but other than that... Yeah. Pretty boring.
FR: On n'a pas détecté d'Ombre dans les alentours récemment. Il n'y a plus autant de marchands depuis que le pont s'est effondré, mais à part ça... Pas grand-chose. Plutôt tranquille.
OUPS: Shade activity's been quiet. The bridge is out, so we're not seeing as many traders as we used to, but other than that... Yeah. Pretty boring.

JAP: Anyway, thanks for giving that to Popola.
FR: Merci d'apporter mon rapport à Popola.
OUPS: Anyway, thanks for giving that to Popola.

JAP: Hey. You have some documents for Popola?
FR: Bonjour. Vous avez quelque chose pour Popola#?
OUPS: Hey. You have some documents for Popola?

JAP: Oh, yeah, my report. Sure thing.
FR: Ah oui, mon rapport. Tiens.
OUPS: Oh, yeah, my report. Sure thing.

JAP: How are things?
FR: Comment vont les choses#?
OUPS: How are things?

JAP: Quiet. I haven't seen a Shade near the village in forever. ...Which is just fine with me, thanks!
FR: C'est plutôt calme. Je n'ai pas vu d'Ombre près du village depuis des lustres, ce qui me va parfaitement#!
OUPS: Quiet. I haven't seen a Shade near the village in forever. ...Which is just fine with me, thanks!

JAP: Say hi to Popola for me!
FR: Dis bonjour à Popola de ma part#!
OUPS: Say hi to Popola for me!

JAP: You got a report for Popola?
FR: Vous avez un rapport pour Popola#?
OUPS: You got a report for Popola?

JAP: Oh! I thought she'd come get it herself. ...Well, no big whoop. Here ya go.
FR: Oh#! Je croyais qu'elle viendrait le chercher elle-même. Bah, peu importe. Le voici.
OUPS: Oh! I thought she'd come get it herself. ...Well, no big whoop. Here ya go.

JAP: Everything all right?
FR: Rien à signaler#?
OUPS: Everything all right?

JAP: Yeah, it's been real quiet lately. Got a few Shades here and there, but only on cloudy days.
FR: Non, tout est paisible ces derniers temps. J'ai aperçu quelques Ombres, mais seulement les jours nuageux.
OUPS: Yeah, it's been real quiet lately. Got a few Shades here and there, but only on cloudy days.

JAP: Tell Popola I said hi.<PAGE>...And ask her if she'll let me take her to dinner while you're at it!
FR: Salue Popola de ma part.<PAGE>... Et dis-lui aussi que j'aimerais bien l'inviter à dîner#!
OUPS: Tell Popola I said hi.<PAGE>...And ask her if she'll let me take her to dinner while you're at it!

JAP: Let's see... Mm-hmm. This is all of them. ...Gods, this man's handwriting is just terrible.<PAGE>Anyway, thank you very much. Here's your payment.
FR: Voyons voir... Hum... Bien... Grands dieux, on dirait des pattes de mouche...!<PAGE>Merci encore pour ton aide. Voici ta récompense.
OUPS: Let's see... Mm-hmm. This is all of them. ...Gods, this man's handwriting is just terrible.<PAGE>Anyway, thank you very much. Here's your payment.

JAP: Mmm? The Shade had a flower?
FR: Hum...? L'Ombre tenait une fleur#?
OUPS: Mmm? The Shade had a flower?

JAP: This is a freesia.
FR: C'est un freesia.
OUPS: This is a freesia.

JAP: The same flower that we were delivering to the woman.
FR: La même sorte de fleur que nous étions censés donner à la petite amie du marchand.
OUPS: The same flower that we were delivering to the woman.

JAP: That can't be a coincidence.
FR: Ce ne peut pas être qu'une coïncidence.
OUPS: That can't be a coincidence.

JAP: I think the woman was attacked by a Shade.
FR: Je crois qu'elle a été attaquée par une Ombre.
OUPS: I think the woman was attacked by a Shade.

JAP: This time I need three sandfish. It's a tricky devil that lives in the oceans of sand. You can catch it over near the wharf.
FR: Cette fois, j'ai envie de squilles. Ce sont des créatures rusées qui vivent dans les sables mouvants. On peut en attraper près du quai du désert. Ramène-m'en trois.
OUPS: This time I need three sandfish. It's a tricky devil that lives in the oceans of sand. You can catch it over near the wharf.

JAP: Here's your fish.
FR: J'ai attrapé ce que vous vouliez.
OUPS: Here's your fish.

JAP: Well, keelhaul my granny and call me Gladys! I reckon there ain't much left for me to teach ya, whippersnapper.
FR: Eh bien qui l'eût cru#! Je crois qu'il me reste pas grand-chose à t'apprendre, mon garçon#!
OUPS: Well, keelhaul my granny and call me Gladys! I reckon there ain't much left for me to teach ya, whippersnapper.

JAP: Works for me. I can't take much more of your slave driving.
FR: Voilà qui me convient à merveille. Je ne pourrais pas supporter beaucoup plus longtemps de me faire traiter comme un esclave.
OUPS: Works for me. I can't take much more of your slave driving.

JAP: Ya call that slave drivin'? Bah! You younger generations with yer big swords and baggy pants and fancy talk. You ain't seen war! You got no idea what slave drivin' means!
FR: Un esclave#?! Pfft#! Tu peux bien parler avec ton épée énorme, tes vêtements voyants et ton livre volant#!<PAGE>T'as pas vécu en temps de guerre#! Tu sais pas ce que c'est que d'être un esclave#!
OUPS: Ya call that slave drivin'? Bah! You younger generations with yer big swords and baggy pants and fancy talk. You ain't seen war! You got no idea what slave drivin' means!

JAP: ...Did you see that move he just did?
FR: ... As-tu vu ce qu'il vient de faire#?
OUPS: ...Did you see that move he just did?

JAP: That was no fishing move. That was the maneuver of a master assassin.<PAGE>I am beginning to fear this old man more than any Shade.
FR: Ce n'était pas une technique de pêche. C'était une technique d'assassin professionnel.<PAGE>Je crois que je crains ce vieillard plus que n'importe quelle Ombre...
OUPS: That was no fishing move. That was the maneuver of a master assassin.<PAGE>I am beginning to fear this old man more than any Shade.

JAP: Best of luck with the three sandfish!
FR: Bonne chance#! T'en auras besoin pour pêcher trois squilles#!
OUPS: Best of luck with the three sandfish!

JAP: This time I need three royal fish! And time's a-wastin', so get to it!
FR: Cette fois, je veux trois esturgeons#! Alors, qu'attends-tu donc#? Ouste#!
OUPS: This time I need three royal fish! And time's a-wastin', so get to it!

JAP: Here.
FR: Tenez.
OUPS: Here.

JAP: Well, dip my oar and call me Cecil! Looks like the fisherboy has become a fisherman!
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru#! Le moussaillon est devenu maître pêcheur#!
OUPS: Well, dip my oar and call me Cecil! Looks like the fisherboy has become a fisherman!

JAP: But do you think you can push me off of my spot? Come on! Let's go!
FR: Mais crois-tu pouvoir me détrôner#? Allez#! Montre-moi ce dont t'es capable#!
OUPS: But do you think you can push me off of my spot? Come on! Let's go!

JAP: Gar har har har! And I'm just using my left hand!
FR: Ga, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha#! Et j'utilisais que ma main gauche#!
OUPS: Gar har har har! And I'm just using my left hand!

JAP: I think we've moved beyond fishing at this point...
FR: Je crois qu'il n'est plus question de pêche, désormais...
OUPS: I think we've moved beyond fishing at this point...

JAP: Best of luck with the three royal fish!
FR: Je veux trois esturgeons#! Bonne chance#!
OUPS: Best of luck with the three royal fish!

JAP: I got somethin' special for ya this time! Go out there and catch me two blue marlin.
FR: Cette fois, j'ai une demande spéciale#! Attrape-moi deux makaires bleus#!
OUPS: I got somethin' special for ya this time! Go out there and catch me two blue marlin.

JAP: How is that special?
FR: Qu'a-t-elle de si spécial, cette demande#?
OUPS: How is that special?

JAP: Only ever caught one once, m'self.<PAGE>Bring me those fish, and I'll call ya a master fisherman for true!
FR: J'en ai attrapé qu'un seul dans ma carrière.<PAGE>Rapportes-en deux et tu mériteras vraiment le titre de maître pêcheur#!
OUPS: Only ever caught one once, m'self.<PAGE>Bring me those fish, and I'll call ya a master fisherman for true!

JAP: These the fish you wanted?
FR: Est-ce que ce sont bien les poissons que vous vouliez#?
OUPS: These the fish you wanted?

JAP: Well, I'll be. Never thought I'd see the day...
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru...? Je pensais jamais voir une chose pareille...
OUPS: Well, I'll be. Never thought I'd see the day...

JAP: Well done, master fisherman. Seems I've but one technique left to teach ya.
FR: Félicitations, maître pêcheur. On dirait qu'il me reste plus qu'une seule technique à t'apprendre.
OUPS: Well done, master fisherman. Seems I've but one technique left to teach ya.

JAP: I've taught ya everything I know, but that don't mean ya can stop learnin'! It's a big world out there, with fish the likes of which no man has ever seen.
FR: Je t'ai appris tout ce que je sais, mais ça veut pas dire que tu dois arrêter d'apprendre#!<PAGE>Notre monde est immense, qui sait quels poissons se cachent dans les profondeurs de ses océans#!
OUPS: I've taught ya everything I know, but that don't mean ya can stop learnin'! It's a big world out there, with fish the likes of which no man has ever seen.

JAP: Best of luck with the two blue marlin!
FR: Je veux deux makaires bleus#! Bonne chance#!
OUPS: Best of luck with the two blue marlin!

JAP: You know, I reckon ya just might have what it takes to catch...The Fish.<PAGE>The hyneria!
FR: Tu sais, je crois qu'un jour tu pourras attraper... le Poisson.<PAGE>L'hynéria...!
OUPS: You know, I reckon ya just might have what it takes to catch...The Fish.<PAGE>The hyneria!

JAP: The hyneria?
FR: L'hynéria#?
OUPS: The hyneria?

JAP: No man has ever hooked a hyneria and lived to tell the tale! If ya can do it, then yer a fisherman beyond even my own skill.
FR: Personne a jamais attrapé d'hynéria et réussi à s'en vanter#! Si tu arrives à le faire, c'est que tu es meilleur pêcheur que moi.
OUPS: No man has ever hooked a hyneria and lived to tell the tale! If ya can do it, then yer a fisherman beyond even my own skill.

JAP: Hmm... Where did the old timer go?
FR: Hum... Où est passé le vieil homme#?
OUPS: Hmm... Where did the old timer go?

JAP: Oh, the old fisherman? Didn't you hear? He passed away just this morning.
FR: Oh, le vieux pêcheur#? On ne vous l'a pas dit#? Il est décédé ce matin.
OUPS: Oh, the old fisherman? Didn't you hear? He passed away just this morning.

JAP: I guess that old war injury finally got the best of him.<PAGE>From what I understand, the guy used to be quite the mercenary.
FR: Je suppose qu'il a finalement succombé à ses blessures de guerre.<PAGE>On raconte que c'était un mercenaire célèbre en son temps.
OUPS: I guess that old war injury finally got the best of him.<PAGE>From what I understand, the guy used to be quite the mercenary.

JAP: That explains a lot.
FR: Ceci explique certaines choses.
OUPS: That explains a lot.

JAP: He supposedly did all kinds of terrible things back in his day. So truth be told, no one in town much cared for him.
FR: Il paraît qu'il avait commis des actes répréhensibles pendant la guerre. À vrai dire, personne ne tenait vraiment à lui dans le village.
OUPS: He supposedly did all kinds of terrible things back in his day. So truth be told, no one in town much cared for him.

JAP: But he sure seemed to enjoy your company. I think you made his last days some happy ones.
FR: Toutefois, il semblait apprécier votre compagnie. Je crois que ses derniers jours ont été ses plus heureux.
OUPS: But he sure seemed to enjoy your company. I think you made his last days some happy ones.

JAP: The hyneria would be a legendary catch! I'm sure it would be worth your while to track it down.
FR: L'hynéria serait une prise légendaire#! Essaie de la trouver, ça en vaudrait la peine#!
OUPS: The hyneria would be a legendary catch! I'm sure it would be worth your while to track it down.

JAP: Hey, I know you! You're that desperate guy who'll take any job that comes along, no matter how stupid or demeaning!
FR: Hé, je vous connais#! Vous êtes celui qui est prêt à accepter n'importe quel boulot, même s'il est ingrat ou humiliant#!
OUPS: Hey, I know you! You're that desperate guy who'll take any job that comes along, no matter how stupid or demeaning!

JAP: ...That's not really how I'd phrase it. But if you've got the money, I've got the time.
FR: ... Je ne présenterais probablement pas les choses de cette façon, mais... si le salaire en vaut la peine, je suis prêt à vous écouter.
OUPS: ...That's not really how I'd phrase it. But if you've got the money, I've got the time.

JAP: Dance! Dance for me! Ah ha ha!<PAGE>No, I'm just kidding. Listen, I've got a boat that needs some repairs. Think you can round up some materials for me?
FR: Dansez#! Dansez#! Ha, ha, ha, ha#!<PAGE>Non, je plaisante. Je dois réparer mon bateau. Pourriez-vous récupérer des matériaux pour moi#?
OUPS: Dance! Dance for me! Ah ha ha!<PAGE>No, I'm just kidding. Listen, I've got a boat that needs some repairs. Think you can round up some materials for me?

JAP: I need five logs, twenty dented metal boards, and ten stripped bolts.<PAGE>I'd ask if you're up for it, but I know you are! Ah ha ha!
FR: J'ai besoin de cinq rondins, vingt feuilles de métal bosselées et dix vieux boulons.<PAGE>...#Et je n'ai pas à vous demander si vous acceptez, hein#? Vous ne refusez jamais#! Ha, ha, ha#!
OUPS: I need five logs, twenty dented metal boards, and ten stripped bolts.<PAGE>I'd ask if you're up for it, but I know you are! Ah ha ha!

JAP: ...You're really startin' to piss me off.
FR: ... Vous commencez vraiment à m'énerver.
OUPS: ...You're really startin' to piss me off.

JAP: Here.
FR: Voilà.
OUPS: Here.

JAP: Much appreciated! Now I can get back to business!
FR: Merci bien#! Maintenant je peux retourner au travail#!
OUPS: Much appreciated! Now I can get back to business!

JAP: Here's some cash. I'll letcha know as soon as I need my floor swept or a toilet cleaned. Ah ha ha ha ha!
FR: Voici votre récompense. Si j'ai besoin de quelqu'un pour laver les planchers ou récurer les cabinets, je vous ferai signe#! Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha#!
OUPS: Here's some cash. I'll letcha know as soon as I need my floor swept or a toilet cleaned. Ah ha ha ha ha!

JAP: That's five logs, twenty dented metal boards, and ten stripped bolts. Thanks much!
FR: N'oubliez pas#: j'ai besoin de cinq rondins, vingt feuilles de métal bosselées et dix vieux boulons.
OUPS: That's five logs, twenty dented metal boards, and ten stripped bolts. Thanks much!

JAP: Oh, man. I'm in a world of trouble now...
FR: Me voilà dans le pétrin...
OUPS: Oh, man. I'm in a world of trouble now...

JAP: What's the problem?
FR: Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: What's the problem?

JAP: See, I was cooking and I... Well, I managed to start a fire that ruined my kitchen and equipment.
FR: Eh bien, je faisais la cuisine et je... Euh, un incendie a ruiné tout mon équipement#!
OUPS: See, I was cooking and I... Well, I managed to start a fire that ruined my kitchen and equipment.

JAP: I can't repair the kitchen without metal, but the only place you can find that much scrap is the Junk Heap...
FR: Je ne peux pas réparer ma cuisine sans métal, mais on ne peut trouver autant de ferraille que dans la montagne des robots.
OUPS: I can't repair the kitchen without metal, but the only place you can find that much scrap is the Junk Heap...

JAP: I see. You want me to go for you?
FR: Je vois. Vous voulez que j'y aille à votre place#?
OUPS: I see. You want me to go for you?

JAP: I need lots of material, so you'll have to brain a whole bunch of robots. That's okay, right?
FR: J'ai besoin de beaucoup de matériaux, alors tu devras détruire plusieurs robots. Ça ne te dérange pas, hein#?
OUPS: I need lots of material, so you'll have to brain a whole bunch of robots. That's okay, right?

JAP: I trust that you plan to offer us adequate compensation?
FR: Comptez-vous nous offrir une récompense appropriée au moins#?
OUPS: I trust that you plan to offer us adequate compensation?

JAP: Don't be greedy, Weiss.
FR: Ne sois pas si avide, Weiss.
OUPS: Don't be greedy, Weiss.

JAP: Well, I'm not sure what you mean by "adequate," but I'll do my best.
FR: Je ne sais pas trop ce que tu considères comme étant approprié, mais je ferai de mon mieux.
OUPS: Well, I'm not sure what you mean by "adequate," but I'll do my best.

JAP: I need one memory alloy, ten titanium alloys, and ten broken motors. Got all that?
FR: J'ai besoin d'un morceau d'alliage à mémoire de forme, dix morceaux d'alliage de titane et dix moteurs défectueux. Tu as bien noté#?
OUPS: I need one memory alloy, ten titanium alloys, and ten broken motors. Got all that?

JAP: Okay. I'll be back when I find everything.
FR: Entendu, je reviendrai vous voir lorsque j'aurai tout trouvé.
OUPS: Okay. I'll be back when I find everything.

JAP: I brought all the stuff you asked for. Is this enough?
FR: J'ai apporté tout ce qui était sur votre liste. Ça vous va#?
OUPS: I brought all the stuff you asked for. Is this enough?

JAP: Lemme see... Yep! Yep, that's all of it.<PAGE>Here. I hope this qualifies as adequate compensation.
FR: Voyons voir... Oui#! Tout y est.<PAGE>Tiens, j'espère que ceci constitue une récompense appropriée.
OUPS: Lemme see... Yep! Yep, that's all of it.<PAGE>Here. I hope this qualifies as adequate compensation.

JAP: This is more than I was expecting.
FR: Je ne m'attendais pas à recevoir une récompense si généreuse.
OUPS: This is more than I was expecting.

JAP: Yeah, well, I really appreciate all the effort you went to.
FR: Eh bien, je te suis vraiment reconnaissant.
OUPS: Yeah, well, I really appreciate all the effort you went to.

JAP: Take it, fool! It is an appropriate reward for our efforts.
FR: Accepte, bougre d'idiot#! Cette récompense est parfaitement appropriée.
OUPS: Take it, fool! It is an appropriate reward for our efforts.

JAP: And you could stand to learn more "appropriate" ways of speaking.
FR: Et tu devrais vraiment apprendre la manière «#appropriée#» de t'adresser à autrui.
OUPS: And you could stand to learn more "appropriate" ways of speaking.

JAP: I need one memory alloy, ten titanium alloys, and ten broken motors. Sound good?
FR: J'ai besoin d'un morceau d'alliage à mémoire de forme, dix morceaux d'alliage de titane et dix moteurs défectueux. Ça te va#?
OUPS: I need one memory alloy, ten titanium alloys, and ten broken motors. Sound good?

JAP: Ah, just the man I wanted to see. Do you have a moment?
FR: Ah, justement l'homme qu'il me faut#! Tu as une minute#?
OUPS: Ah, just the man I wanted to see. Do you have a moment?

JAP: Maybe.
FR: Peut-être, qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: Maybe.

JAP: Our waterwheel is on its last legs. I'd like to shore it up, but the insides are so complicated...
FR: La roue du moulin à eau ne tiendra pas longtemps. J'aimerais bien la réparer, mais le mécanisme est compliqué...
OUPS: Our waterwheel is on its last legs. I'd like to shore it up, but the insides are so complicated...

JAP: This is a wise thought on your part. That wheel is a machine of not-insignificant age. Better to repair it now than wait until it fails completely.
FR: Hum, oui, elle est plutôt ancienne. La consolider maintenant, avant qu'il ne soit trop tard, est en effet une sage décision.
OUPS: This is a wise thought on your part. That wheel is a machine of not-insignificant age. Better to repair it now than wait until it fails completely.

JAP: You got any ideas? I'm not much for this mechanical stuff.
FR: Saurais-tu comment le faire, Weiss#? Je ne m'y connais pas trop en mécanique.
OUPS: You got any ideas? I'm not much for this mechanical stuff.

JAP: Replacing the axle and the paddle boards should suffice for now. I believe the strange-thing store in Facade should have everything we need.
FR: Remplacer l'axe et les aubes devrait suffire pour le moment. Si je ne m'abuse, le magasin de curiosités de Façade devrait avoir le nécessaire.
OUPS: Replacing the axle and the paddle boards should suffice for now. I believe the strange-thing store in Facade should have everything we need.

JAP: Okay. Well, if you can handle the repairs, I can pick up the materials.
FR: Eh bien, si quelqu'un peut se charger des réparations, j'irai chercher les pièces.
OUPS: Okay. Well, if you can handle the repairs, I can pick up the materials.

JAP: Oh, thank you. I'm sure I can find someone to take care of the actual repair work.
FR: Oh, je te remercie#! Je trouverai quelqu'un, ne t'en fais pas#!
OUPS: Oh, thank you. I'm sure I can find someone to take care of the actual repair work.

JAP: Thanks for volunteering to help with the waterwheel. It's nice that someone still has a sense of community pride.
FR: Merci encore d'avoir accepté de m'aider à réparer la roue. Ça fait plaisir de rencontrer quelqu'un prêt à donner de son temps pour le bien de notre communauté.
OUPS: Thanks for volunteering to help with the waterwheel. It's nice that someone still has a sense of community pride.

JAP: I need an axle and some paddle boards. You got anything like that?
FR: J'ai besoin d'un axe et d'aubes pour une roue de moulin à eau. Vous en avez#?
OUPS: I need an axle and some paddle boards. You got anything like that?

JAP: (No, but if you bring me iron ore and logs, I could probably construct what you need.)
FR: (Non, mais je pourrais en fabriquer pour vous si j'avais du minerai de fer et des rondins.)
OUPS: (No, but if you bring me iron ore and logs, I could probably construct what you need.)

JAP: That works. How much do you need?
FR: Je vois. De combien en avez-vous besoin#?
OUPS: That works. How much do you need?

JAP: (I think ten of each should suffice.)
FR: (Je crois que dix morceaux de minerai de fer et dix rondins devraient être suffisants.)
OUPS: (I think ten of each should suffice.)

JAP: Okay. I'll be back in a bit.
FR: Entendu. Je vais m'en procurer.
OUPS: Okay. I'll be back in a bit.

JAP: Here. Is this enough?
FR: Tenez, est-ce assez pour fabriquer l'axe et les aubes#?
OUPS: Here. Is this enough?

JAP: (Ah, yes, the iron ore and logs. I will begin construction at once, but it may take some time. Is this all right?)
FR: (Ah, du minerai de fer et des rondins#! Oui, je peux m'y mettre tout de suite, mais il me faudra quelque temps pour fabriquer les pièces voulues.)
OUPS: (Ah, yes, the iron ore and logs. I will begin construction at once, but it may take some time. Is this all right?)

JAP: (I will deliver the finished goods directly to the job site. Please tell the client to be patient.)
FR: (J'irai les livrer moi-même quand j'aurai terminé. Demandez aux habitants de votre village de bien vouloir patienter, d'accord#?)
OUPS: (I will deliver the finished goods directly to the job site. Please tell the client to be patient.)

JAP: I'll let her know.
FR: Je m'en charge.
OUPS: I'll let her know.

JAP: (I will need ten pieces of iron ore and ten logs.)
FR: (J'aurai besoin de dix morceaux de minerai de fer et dix rondins.)
OUPS: (I will need ten pieces of iron ore and ten logs.)

JAP: (I will deliver the finished goods directly to the job site. Please tell the client to be patient.)
FR: (J'irai livrer les pièces moi-même quand j'aurai terminé. Demandez aux habitants de votre village de bien vouloir patienter, d'accord#?)
OUPS: (I will deliver the finished goods directly to the job site. Please tell the client to be patient.)

JAP: The parts are on the way, but it's going to take a little while.
FR: J'ai commandé les pièces nécessaires pour réparer la roue du moulin, mais elles ne sont pas encore prêtes.
OUPS: The parts are on the way, but it's going to take a little while.

JAP: That's great! I found someone to do the repair work, so we should be in business.
FR: Formidable#! J'ai trouvé quelqu'un qui pourra effectuer les réparations, alors tout devrait être réglé sous peu#!
OUPS: That's great! I found someone to do the repair work, so we should be in business.

JAP: I've got a little reward for all your hard work. Please accept it!
FR: Tiens, c'est pour te remercier de ton aide#! Je t'en prie, accepte#!
OUPS: I've got a little reward for all your hard work. Please accept it!

JAP: The village fountain is starting to break down. Sometimes it won't put out any water at all.
FR: La fontaine du village ne fonctionne plus très bien. Parfois, l'eau ne jaillit plus du tout.
OUPS: The village fountain is starting to break down. Sometimes it won't put out any water at all.

JAP: I would speculate that the source of the problem lies in the fountain's pump.
FR: Je présume que c'est au niveau de la pompe que réside le problème.
OUPS: I would speculate that the source of the problem lies in the fountain's pump.

JAP: That's my guess, too. I heard that you had parts made for the waterwheel, so I'm hoping you could do the same for the fountain.
FR: C'est bien ce que je pense, moi aussi. J'ai entendu dire que c'est toi qui as trouvé les pièces pour réparer la roue du moulin à eau.<PAGE>Je me suis dit que tu pourrais peut-être me donner un coup de main avec la fontaine.
OUPS: That's my guess, too. I heard that you had parts made for the waterwheel, so I'm hoping you could do the same for the fountain.

JAP: I'll look into it the next time I'm in Facade.
FR: Je verrai si je peux trouver une pompe la prochaine fois que je serai à Façade.
OUPS: I'll look into it the next time I'm in Facade.

JAP: Thanks for doing this!
FR: Je te remercie#!
OUPS: Thanks for doing this!

JAP: I need a replacement pump for a water fountain. You got anything like that?
FR: J'ai besoin d'une pompe de rechange pour une fontaine. Vous en avez#?
OUPS: I need a replacement pump for a water fountain. You got anything like that?

JAP: (A pump? No, that's not something I have.)
FR: (Une pompe#? Non, je n'en ai pas en stock.)
OUPS: (A pump? No, that's not something I have.)

JAP: (I could probably build one, but I'd need metal and electrical parts. It may be difficult to find them all.)
FR: (Je pourrais sans doute en fabriquer une, mais il me faudrait du métal et du matériel électrique. Il vous serait peut-être difficile de vous en procurer.)
OUPS: (I could probably build one, but I'd need metal and electrical parts. It may be difficult to find them all.)

JAP: What do you need?
FR: Dites-moi ce qu'il vous faut.
OUPS: What do you need?

JAP: (I need ten broken motors and ten severed cables. You should be able to salvage both from robots.)
FR: (J'aurais besoin de dix batteries à plat et dix câbles coupés. Vous devriez pouvoir en trouver en détruisant des robots.)
OUPS: (I need ten broken motors and ten severed cables. You should be able to salvage both from robots.)

JAP: All right. I'm on it.
FR: D'accord, je m'en charge.
OUPS: All right. I'm on it.

JAP: I got what you need.
FR: J'ai trouvé les matériaux dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I got what you need.

JAP: (Broken motors and severed cables... Yes, very good.)<PAGE>(Again, this will take a bit, but I will deliver it to the client when I am done.)
FR: (Ah, des batteries à plat et des câbles coupés#! Oui, très bien.)<PAGE>(Comme vous vous en doutez, il me faudra quelque temps pour fabriquer la pompe, mais j'irai la livrer directement au village dès qu'elle sera terminée.)
OUPS: (Broken motors and severed cables... Yes, very good.)<PAGE>(Again, this will take a bit, but I will deliver it to the client when I am done.)

JAP: I'll let him know.
FR: J'en avertirai les villageois.
OUPS: I'll let him know.

JAP: (I will need ten broken motors and ten severed cables.)
FR: (Il me faut dix batteries à plat et dix câbles coupés.)
OUPS: (I will need ten broken motors and ten severed cables.)

JAP: (You're becoming my best customer. I wish business was always this good.)
FR: (Si ça continue, vous serez bientôt mon meilleur client. Si seulement j'étais toujours aussi occupé...!)
OUPS: (You're becoming my best customer. I wish business was always this good.)

JAP: The pump is on its way. They'll deliver it once it's ready.
FR: J'ai commandé une pompe pour la fontaine. Le marchand viendra la livrer quand elle sera prête.
OUPS: The pump is on its way. They'll deliver it once it's ready.

JAP: Thanks much! Here's a little something just because I care.
FR: Merci beaucoup#! J'aimerais t'offrir ceci en guise de remerciement.
OUPS: Thanks much! Here's a little something just because I care.

JAP: Hey, remember that book you found for me? Well, there's another recipe that piqued my interest.
FR: Dites, vous vous souvenez du livre de cuisine que vous m'avez donné#? Eh bien, j'y ai trouvé une autre recette intéressante.
OUPS: Hey, remember that book you found for me? Well, there's another recipe that piqued my interest.

JAP: Would you mind helping me out again?
FR: Ça vous dirait de me donner encore un coup de main#?
OUPS: Would you mind helping me out again?

JAP: I hope it doesn't involve shark fins.
FR: J'espère qu'il n'est pas question d'ailerons de requin, cette fois.
OUPS: I hope it doesn't involve shark fins.

JAP: Nope! It's broiled catfish served over rice.
FR: Pas du tout#! C'est du poisson-chat grillé servi sur un lit de riz à la vapeur.
OUPS: Nope! It's broiled catfish served over rice.

JAP: I just need ten giant catfish and ten bags of rice. Think you can help me out?
FR: Je n'ai besoin que de dix poissons-chats et dix sacs de riz. Pensez-vous pouvoir en trouver pour moi#?
OUPS: I just need ten giant catfish and ten bags of rice. Think you can help me out?

JAP: I've got the ingredients.
FR: J'ai les ingrédients dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I've got the ingredients.

JAP: That's, uh... That's quite the fish, isn't it?
FR: Hum... Ce... ce ne sont pas des poissons comme les autres, hein#!
OUPS: That's, uh... That's quite the fish, isn't it?

JAP: I wasn't expecting it to be so slimy and smelly and gross.<PAGE>I don't suppose you'd help me out with the prep work?
FR: Je ne m'attendais pas à ce qu'ils soient aussi dégoûtants et visqueux.<PAGE>Euh, que diriez-vous de m'aider à les vider pendant que vous y êtes#?
OUPS: I wasn't expecting it to be so slimy and smelly and gross.<PAGE>I don't suppose you'd help me out with the prep work?

JAP: Sorry. The only knife work I know is cutting up Shades.
FR: Je ne sais étriper que les Ombres.
OUPS: Sorry. The only knife work I know is cutting up Shades.

JAP: Oh. Well, I guess this won't be going on the menu. Sorry about making you go all that way.
FR: Oh. Eh bien, j'imagine que je ne mettrai pas ce plat sur le menu après tout. Je suis désolé que vous vous soyez donné tant de mal pour rien.
OUPS: Oh. Well, I guess this won't be going on the menu. Sorry about making you go all that way.

JAP: Well, as long as I get paid, I don't really care. But it seems like a waste of a good fish.
FR: Du moment qu'on me paie, peu m'importe. Cela me semble pourtant dommage de gaspiller autant de poisson frais.
OUPS: Well, as long as I get paid, I don't really care. But it seems like a waste of a good fish.

JAP: That's all right. When my recipes don't turn out, I just feed them to the seals.
FR: Ah, ne vous inquiétez pas. Si je n'obtiens pas le résultat voulu en essayant de nouvelles recettes, j'en nourris les phoques.
OUPS: That's all right. When my recipes don't turn out, I just feed them to the seals.

JAP: So that's why they're all so fat.
FR: C'est donc pour cette raison qu'ils sont si dodus...
OUPS: So that's why they're all so fat.

JAP: I need ten giant catfish and ten bags of rice.
FR: J'ai besoin de dix poissons-chats et dix sacs de riz.
OUPS: I need ten giant catfish and ten bags of rice.

JAP: (Do you like flowers?)
FR: (Aimez-vous les fleurs#?)
OUPS: (Do you like flowers?)

JAP: Why? You want me to join a cult?
FR: Pourquoi#? Voulez-vous me convertir à votre religion#?
OUPS: Why? You want me to join a cult?

JAP: (Oh, no! I just enjoy flowers. But there are so few out here in the desert.)
FR: (Rien de tel#! J'aime les fleurs, voilà tout. Cependant, il y en a si peu dans le désert.)
OUPS: (Oh, no! I just enjoy flowers. But there are so few out here in the desert.)

JAP: (My dream is to find some flower seeds and turn this desert into a beautiful garden.)
FR: (Mon rêve est de trouver des graines de fleurs et de transformer le désert en jardin magnifique.)
OUPS: (My dream is to find some flower seeds and turn this desert into a beautiful garden.)

JAP: (I'm trying to collect pink moonflower seeds. It would be great if I could get ten of them.)
FR: (Je cherche des graines roses. J'aimerais en trouver dix.)
OUPS: (I'm trying to collect pink moonflower seeds. It would be great if I could get ten of them.)

JAP: If I can track them down, they're all yours.
FR: Si j'arrive à m'en procurer, je vous les apporterai.
OUPS: If I can track them down, they're all yours.

JAP: (Really!? Oh, thank you!)
FR: (Vraiment#?! Oh, merci beaucoup#!)
OUPS: (Really!? Oh, thank you!)

JAP: I've got your seeds.
FR: J'ai les graines que vous cherchiez.
OUPS: I've got your seeds.

JAP: (Bwa ha ha! Now we are one step closer to bringing forth The Order of the Demonic Blossom!)
FR: (Mouah, ha, ha, ha#! Désormais, rien ne saurait retarder l'avènement de l'ordre des pétales diaboliques#!)
OUPS: (Bwa ha ha! Now we are one step closer to bringing forth The Order of the Demonic Blossom!)

JAP: ...Sorry, what? I wasn't listening.
FR: ... Hum, quoi#? Je suis désolé, je ne faisais pas attention à ce que vous disiez.
OUPS: ...Sorry, what? I wasn't listening.

JAP: (Oh, uh...nothing. Thanks for the flowers!)
FR: (Oh, euh... ce n'est pas grave. Merci pour les graines#!)
OUPS: (Oh, uh...nothing. Thanks for the flowers!)

JAP: (I need ten pink moonflower seeds. I hope you can help.)
FR: (J'ai besoin de dix graines roses. J'espère que vous pourrez m'aider.)
OUPS: (I need ten pink moonflower seeds. I hope you can help.)

JAP: (Excuse me! Are you looking for work right now?)
FR: (Pardonnez-moi#! Cherchez-vous du travail#?)
OUPS: (Excuse me! Are you looking for work right now?)

JAP: Maybe. What kind of work?
FR: Peut-être. Quelle sorte de travail avez-vous à m'offrir#?
OUPS: Maybe. What kind of work?

JAP: (The rules state that we must make a ceremonial mask for our king, and I need help collecting the materials.)
FR: (La loi dit que nous devons fabriquer un nouveau masque de cérémonie pour notre roi.)<PAGE>(Pourriez-vous m'aider à trouver les matériaux nécessaires#?)
OUPS: (The rules state that we must make a ceremonial mask for our king, and I need help collecting the materials.)

JAP: I can do that.
FR: Bien sûr.
OUPS: I can do that.

JAP: (Thank you. I will need two things from you.)
FR: (Merci. J'ai besoin de deux sortes de matériaux.)
OUPS: (Thank you. I will need two things from you.)

JAP: (One is titanium alloy, which can be found in the Junk Heap. The other is a crystal, which is a special type of ore.)
FR: (Le premier est de l'alliage de titane, un métal qu'on peut trouver dans la montagne des robots. L'autre est du cristal, un minerai spécial.)
OUPS: (One is titanium alloy, which can be found in the Junk Heap. The other is a crystal, which is a special type of ore.)

JAP: (I will need one of each item.)
FR: (Un morceau de chacun me suffira.)
OUPS: (I will need one of each item.)

JAP: I've got your things.
FR: J'ai les matériaux dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I've got your things.

JAP: (Now I can create the mask! Oh, thank you very much!)
FR: (Je peux désormais fabriquer le masque#! Oh, merci beaucoup#!)
OUPS: (Now I can create the mask! Oh, thank you very much!)

JAP: What manner of ceremony is this mask for?
FR: Quelle sorte de masque de cérémonie est-ce donc#?
OUPS: What manner of ceremony is this mask for?

JAP: (The king shall wear this mask when he is pondering a new rule.)
FR: (Le roi portera ce masque chaque fois qu'il dictera une nouvelle loi.)
OUPS: (The king shall wear this mask when he is pondering a new rule.)

JAP: ...That's a pretty specialized mask.
FR: ... Il aura donc un usage bien spécifique.
OUPS: ...That's a pretty specialized mask.

JAP: (The king shall wear this mask when he is pondering a new rule.)
FR: (Le roi portera ce masque chaque fois qu'il dictera une nouvelle loi.)
OUPS: (The king shall wear this mask when he is pondering a new rule.)

JAP: (I will need titanium alloy and a crystal.)
FR: (J'ai besoin d'un morceau d'alliage de titane et d'un cristal.)
OUPS: (I will need titanium alloy and a crystal.)

JAP: H-help! Heeeeeelp!
FR: À l'aide#! À l'aiiiiiide#!
OUPS: H-help! Heeeeeelp!

JAP: You one of the guys trying to bust up the temple? Why should I help you?
FR: N'es-tu pas un des pillards#? Pourquoi devrais-je te porter secours#?
OUPS: You one of the guys trying to bust up the temple? Why should I help you?

JAP: Th-there's a huge Shade inside! We were just looking for treas...<PAGE>I mean, um...<PAGE>Anyway, it's HUGE!
FR: Y a une Ombre gigantesque à l'intérieur#! On était à la recherche de tré...<PAGE>Euh, je veux dire...<PAGE>Elle est vraiment énorme, cette Ombre#!
OUPS: Th-there's a huge Shade inside! We were just looking for treas...<PAGE>I mean, um...<PAGE>Anyway, it's HUGE!

JAP: I made it out, but my fellow thiev...<PAGE>I mean, uh...<PAGE>But my friends are still in there!
FR: J'ai réussi à trouver la sortie, mais les autres vol...<PAGE>Euh, je veux dire...<PAGE>... mes compagnons sont toujours à l'intérieur#!
OUPS: I made it out, but my fellow thiev...<PAGE>I mean, uh...<PAGE>But my friends are still in there!

JAP: It seems the worst-case scenario has come to pass.
FR: Il semblerait que le pire soit arrivé.
OUPS: It seems the worst-case scenario has come to pass.

JAP: Screw these guys. They made their bed, now let 'em shit in it.
FR: Qu'ils aillent se faire foutre. Ils peuvent récolter eux-mêmes la merde qu'ils ont semée.
OUPS: Screw these guys. They made their bed, now let 'em shit in it.

JAP: If that Shade is as big as they claim, it's too dangerous to let it live.
FR: Si cette Ombre est aussi énorme qu'il le prétend, nous ne pouvons pas la laisser vivre.
OUPS: If that Shade is as big as they claim, it's too dangerous to let it live.

JAP: Let's go in and take care of the Shade.
FR: Allons nous en débarrasser.
OUPS: Let's go in and take care of the Shade.

JAP: Gahh! Dammit!
FR: Gaaah#! Merde#!
OUPS: Gahh! Dammit!

JAP: Hey, asshole. There's a kid back in town who wants to play marbles, but he's two short. Think you can help?
FR: Hé, trouduc. Y a un môme en ville qui veut jouer aux billes, mais il lui en manque deux. Ça te dirait de l'aider#?
OUPS: Hey, asshole. There's a kid back in town who wants to play marbles, but he's two short. Think you can help?

JAP: Eeeeek! Keep her away from me!
FR: Aaaah#! Arrêtez-la#!
OUPS: Eeeeek! Keep her away from me!

JAP: That was some excellent restraint on your part, hussy. I expected a foul-mouthed tirade of epic proportions!
FR: Je ne savais pas que tu pouvais faire preuve d'autant de retenue, dévergondée. Je m'attendais à une de tes célèbres tirades grossières#!
OUPS: That was some excellent restraint on your part, hussy. I expected a foul-mouthed tirade of epic proportions!

JAP: Cram it up your index, book.
FR: Va te faire foutre, bouquin.
OUPS: Cram it up your index, book.

JAP: You guys done?<PAGE>Then let's tie this guy up and report back.
FR: Vous avez terminé#?<PAGE>Ligotons-le et retournons à Façade.
OUPS: You guys done?<PAGE>Then let's tie this guy up and report back.

JAP: I gave her the letter.
FR: Je lui ai remis la lettre.
OUPS: I gave her the letter.

JAP: Thank you. I would have caught nine kinds of hell if you didn't.
FR: Je vous remercie#! J'aurais vraiment été dans de beaux draps sans votre aide#!
OUPS: Thank you. I would have caught nine kinds of hell if you didn't.

JAP: Instead, we caught them for you!
FR: Et c'est nous qui l'avons été à votre place#!
OUPS: Instead, we caught them for you!

JAP: I'll take the letter for The Aerie.
FR: Je m'occuperai de la lettre pour l'Aire.
OUPS: I'll take the letter for The Aerie.

JAP: Of course you will! Gods, this man is so gullible...
FR: Mais bien sûr...! Dieux que cet homme est crédule...
OUPS: Of course you will! Gods, this man is so gullible...

JAP: Thank you. This really means a lot.
FR: Merci. J'apprécie vraiment votre aide.
OUPS: Thank you. This really means a lot.

JAP: Head west through the northern plains. You'll cross a bridge along the way.
FR: L'Aire est située à l'ouest de la plaine septentrionale. Vous aurez à traverser un pont en cours de route.
OUPS: Head west through the northern plains. You'll cross a bridge along the way.

JAP: When you get there, please give the letter to 【NPC名】.
FR: La lettre est adressée à 【NPC名】.
OUPS: When you get there, please give the letter to 【NPC名】.

JAP: I'll take the letter for the Junk Heap.
FR: Je m'occuperai de la lettre pour la montagne des robots.
OUPS: I'll take the letter for the Junk Heap.

JAP: Why am I not surprised?
FR: Quelle surprise...!
OUPS: Why am I not surprised?

JAP: Oh, I can't thank you enough.
FR: Oh, je ne sais comment vous remercier#!
OUPS: Oh, I can't thank you enough.

JAP: Make for the northern plains, then just keep heading north.
FR: La montagne des robots est située au nord de la plaine septentrionale.
OUPS: Make for the northern plains, then just keep heading north.

JAP: The letter goes to the elder of the two brothers.
FR: La lettre est adressée au frère aîné.
OUPS: The letter goes to the elder of the two brothers.

JAP: Are you 【NPC名】? I've got a letter for you from Seafront.
FR: Êtes-vous 【NPC名】#? J'ai une lettre de Littoral pour vous.
OUPS: Are you 【NPC名】? I've got a letter for you from Seafront.

JAP: Begone outsider! We don't need your...<PAGE>Um...a letter you say? Well, I suppose I'll take it.
FR: Sortez d'ici, étranger#! Nous ne tolérons pas votre...<PAGE>Euh... Une lettre, vous dites#? Eh bien, je suppose que je pourrais y jeter un coup d'œil.
OUPS: Begone outsider! We don't need your...<PAGE>Um...a letter you say? Well, I suppose I'll take it.

JAP: Hey, I have a letter for you. It's from Seafront.
FR: Bonjour, j'ai une lettre de Littoral pour toi.
OUPS: Hey, I have a letter for you. It's from Seafront.

JAP: It's probably from the merchants guild. We've been doing some work with them lately.<PAGE>Anyway, thanks for delivering it.
FR: C'est probablement une lettre de la chambre de commerce. Nous faisons affaire avec eux depuis quelque temps.<PAGE>Merci de me l'avoir apportée.
OUPS: It's probably from the merchants guild. We've been doing some work with them lately.<PAGE>Anyway, thanks for delivering it.

JAP: I gave her the letter.
FR: Je lui ai remis la lettre.
OUPS: I gave her the letter.

JAP: I hope you are finished saddling us with these pointless errands.
FR: J'espère que vous n'essaierez pas de nous encombrer d'une autre de vos tâches ingrates.
OUPS: I hope you are finished saddling us with these pointless errands.

JAP: I'm sorry. I just can't get my leg to heal.
FR: Je suis désolé. Ma jambe ne semble pas vouloir guérir.
OUPS: I'm sorry. I just can't get my leg to heal.

JAP: You should rest. Pushing yourself too hard won't help anyone.
FR: Vous devriez vous reposer. Vous surmener ne mènera nulle part.
OUPS: You should rest. Pushing yourself too hard won't help anyone.

JAP: I'll help you for as long as it takes.
FR: Je vous donnerai un coup de main jusqu'à ce que vous soyez rétabli.
OUPS: I'll help you for as long as it takes.

JAP: I suppose you'll be proffering one of your kidneys next?
FR: Et je suppose que tu lui offriras de devenir sa béquille si sa jambe ne guérit jamais#?
OUPS: I suppose you'll be proffering one of your kidneys next?

JAP: Actually, if you don't mind, there is something I need...
FR: À vrai dire, j'aurais un service à vous demander...
OUPS: Actually, if you don't mind, there is something I need...

JAP: I've got a letter for you, Popola.
FR: J'ai une lettre pour toi, Popola.
OUPS: I've got a letter for you, Popola.

JAP: A letter for me? Well, what could this... Oh, dear.
FR: Une lettre#? Pour moi#? Qu'est-ce qui peut bien... Oh non.
OUPS: A letter for me? Well, what could this... Oh, dear.

JAP: What is it?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What is it?

JAP: Listen, I know this going to sound ungrateful, but I need a little more help.
FR: écoutez, je sais que c'est beaucoup demander, mais j'ai encore besoin de votre aide.
OUPS: Listen, I know this going to sound ungrateful, but I need a little more help.

JAP: I've got two more letters. One is heading for The Aerie, and the other is going to the Junk Heap.<PAGE>My long-distance deliveryman is out right now, and with my leg and all...
FR: J'ai deux autres lettres à distribuer, une pour l'Aire et l'autre pour la montagne des robots.<PAGE>Celui qui se charge habituellement de la distribution du courrier dans les régions éloignées ne reviendra pas à temps, et avec ma jambe, vous savez…
OUPS: I've got two more letters. One is heading for The Aerie, and the other is going to the Junk Heap.<PAGE>My long-distance deliveryman is out right now, and with my leg and all...

JAP: Say nothing! We have done more than enough to aid this goldbricking layabout!
FR: Ne dis pas un mot#! Nous avons déjà assez aidé ce fieffé tire-au-flanc#!
OUPS: Say nothing! We have done more than enough to aid this goldbricking layabout!

JAP: When you get there, please give the letter to 【NPC名】.
FR: La lettre est adressée à 【NPC名】.
OUPS: When you get there, please give the letter to 【NPC名】.

JAP: The letter goes to the elder of the two brothers.
