FR: La lettre est adressée au frère aîné.
OUPS: The letter goes to the elder of the two brothers.

JAP: I have a letter for a woman named Popola. I think she's from your village, right?
FR: J'ai une lettre pour une femme appelée Popola. Elle habite votre village, n'est-ce pas#?
OUPS: I have a letter for a woman named Popola. I think she's from your village, right?

JAP: She is, and I'd be happy to deliver it for you.
FR: Oui, et il me fera plaisir de lui apporter cette lettre.
OUPS: She is, and I'd be happy to deliver it for you.

JAP: Oh, thank you.
FR: Oh, merci#!
OUPS: Oh, thank you.

JAP: For the love of...
FR: J'abandonne...
OUPS: For the love of...

JAP: Oh, thank you.
FR: Oh, merci#!
OUPS: Oh, thank you.

JAP: Hey. Working today too, huh?
FR: Bonjour#! Alors, on travaille dur aujourd'hui#?
OUPS: Hey. Working today too, huh?

JAP: Hey there! Are you looking for something in particular?
FR: Bonjour#! Besoin de quelque chose en particulier#?
OUPS: Hey there! Are you looking for something in particular?

JAP: Still workin' eh? Yeah, I guess you can get a lot done when the sun never sets.
FR: Toujours occupé, hein#? On peut accomplir tant de choses lorsque le soleil ne se couche jamais#!
OUPS: Still workin' eh? Yeah, I guess you can get a lot done when the sun never sets.

JAP: Lovely weather, isn't it? If that "climate change" I heard about means we have fewer rainy days, then I'm all for it.
FR: Beau temps, n'est-ce pas#? Si nous avons moins de jours pluvieux à cause de ces «#changements climatiques#» dont j'ai entendu parler, je suis pour#!
OUPS: Lovely weather, isn't it? If that "climate change" I heard about means we have fewer rainy days, then I'm all for it.

JAP: Oh, you aren't out hunting today?
FR: Oh, tu ne vas pas à la chasse aujourd'hui#?
OUPS: Oh, you aren't out hunting today?

JAP: Try not to run around in the shopping district. It's crowded, and we don't want people getting knocked down or hurt.
FR: Pas de course dans le marché, d'accord#? C'est un endroit achalandé et tu pourrais bousculer ou même blesser quelqu'un#!
OUPS: Try not to run around in the shopping district. It's crowded, and we don't want people getting knocked down or hurt.

JAP: Hey. Workin' hard, huh?
FR: Bonjour#! Toujours aussi occupé#?
OUPS: Hey. Workin' hard, huh?

JAP: I've got some wonderful items in stock today. Why not sample a few before dinner?
FR: J'ai des objets formidables en stock aujourd'hui. Que dirais-tu d'en acheter quelques-uns avant le dîner#?
OUPS: I've got some wonderful items in stock today. Why not sample a few before dinner?

JAP: Those young people sure are full of energy.
FR: Ces jeunes gens ont tant d'énergie#!
OUPS: Those young people sure are full of energy.

JAP: Hello. How's Yonah doing?
FR: Bonjour#! Comment va Yonah aujourd'hui#?
OUPS: Hello. How's Yonah doing?

JAP: You've been visiting the library a lot lately, haven't you?
FR: Tu vas souvent à la bibliothèque ces temps-ci, non#?
OUPS: You've been visiting the library a lot lately, haven't you?

JAP: Be careful if you leave the village. I hear the animals have all gone loco.
FR: Sois prudent si tu sors du village. J'ai entendu dire que les animaux sauvages sont devenus fous.
OUPS: Be careful if you leave the village. I hear the animals have all gone loco.

JAP: If you leave the village, watch out for animals as well as Shades. We've lost two people to animal attacks just this month!
FR: Si tu t'aventures hors du village, fais aussi attention aux animaux et pas seulement aux Ombres. Deux villageois sont morts le mois dernier#!
OUPS: If you leave the village, watch out for animals as well as Shades. We've lost two people to animal attacks just this month!

JAP: Don't you think it's a wasted opportunity to leave this village square like this?
FR: Tu ne penses pas que c'est dommage de laisser la place du village telle qu'elle est#?
OUPS: Don't you think it's a wasted opportunity to leave this village square like this?

JAP: (Sorry, no entry.)
FR: (Je suis désolé, vous ne pouvez pas entrer.)
OUPS: (Sorry, no entry.)

JAP: (No entry allowed!)
FR: (Vous ne pouvez pas entrer#!)
OUPS: (No entry allowed!)

JAP: The metal bridge offshore used to carry large iron boxes filled with people and cargo! Or so they say. ...Personally, I think that's a bunch of bullplop.
FR: Vous avez remarqué ce pont de métal au large#? Certains prétendent que d'énormes boîtes de fer transportant des gens et des marchandises l'empruntaient autrefois.<PAGE>À mon avis, ce ne sont que des foutaises.
OUPS: The metal bridge offshore used to carry large iron boxes filled with people and cargo! Or so they say. ...Personally, I think that's a bunch of bullplop.

JAP: Oi! A new face in town! Here to buy something, handsome?
FR: Oh, un étranger#! Voulez-vous acheter quelque chose, mon beau#?
OUPS: Oi! A new face in town! Here to buy something, handsome?

JAP: Shhhh! Stay away from here, mister!
FR: Chut#! Ne vous approchez pas, monsieur#!
OUPS: Shhhh! Stay away from here, mister!

JAP: Oh! Hey, it's you! How 'bout a drink at the tavern?
FR: Oh, bonjour#! Que diriez-vous d'aller prendre un verre#?
OUPS: Oh! Hey, it's you! How 'bout a drink at the tavern?

JAP: Sorry, the boat's outta service until we finish our daily inspection.
FR: Je regrette, mais nous n'avons pas encore terminé l'inspection du bateau. Revenez plus tard.
OUPS: Sorry, the boat's outta service until we finish our daily inspection.

JAP: It seems like a lot of rude, short-tempered people live here. I guess folks can afford to worry about little things when their bellies are full and the weather is good.
FR: Il paraît que cette ville est remplie de gens impolis et coléreux. Je suppose qu'il est facile de s'emporter pour un rien quand on a le ventre plein et que le soleil brille.
OUPS: It seems like a lot of rude, short-tempered people live here. I guess folks can afford to worry about little things when their bellies are full and the weather is good.

JAP: B-Brother?
FR: Papa...?
OUPS: B-Brother?

JAP: You all right, Yonah?
FR: Ça va, Yonah ?
OUPS: You all right, Yonah?

JAP: Sorry, Brother. ...I'm sorry. It'll stop in a second. I promise.
FR: Désolée, papa. Pardon… Je ne ferai plus de bruit, je te le promets.
OUPS: Sorry, Brother. ...I'm sorry. It'll stop in a second. I promise.

JAP: ...Yonah.
FR: ... Yonah.
OUPS: ...Yonah.

JAP: ...Yeah?
FR: Q-quoi ?
OUPS: ...Yeah?

JAP: Don't touch that book. Not ever.
FR: Ne touche pas à ce livre. N'y touche jamais.
OUPS: Don't touch that book. Not ever.

JAP: ...Do you hear me?
FR: Tu m'entends ?
OUPS: ...Do you hear me?

JAP: Yes, Brother.
FR: D'accord, papa.
OUPS: Yes, Brother.

JAP: Yonah! Talk to me!
FR: Yonah ! Réponds-moi !
OUPS: Yonah! Talk to me!

JAP: Brother...are you all right?
FR: Ça va papa ?
OUPS: Brother...are you all right?

JAP: Don't worry about me. I'm fine.
FR: Ne t'en fais pas pour moi. Je n'ai rien.
OUPS: Don't worry about me. I'm fine.

JAP: That's good. Oh, look! I...I found this while you were gone.
FR: Ouf ! Oh, regarde ce que j'ai trouvé pendant ton absence.
OUPS: That's good. Oh, look! I...I found this while you were gone.

JAP: A cookie? Hey, that's your favorite.
FR: Des biscuits ? Hé, et tes préférés, en plus.
OUPS: A cookie? Hey, that's your favorite.

JAP: Here, we can split it, okay?
FR: Tiens, on va les partager, d'accord ?
OUPS: Here, we can split it, okay?

JAP: No. You take it.
FR: Non, garde-les.
OUPS: No. You take it.

JAP: Brother, no. You need to eat something.
FR: Papa, tu dois manger quelque chose.
OUPS: Brother, no. You need to eat something.

JAP: ...All right. Give me the small half.
FR: ... Très bien. Donne-moi le plus petit, alors.
OUPS: ...All right. Give me the small half.

JAP: No. Come on, Brother! You're bigger than me, you have to eat to sur—
FR: Non. Allez, papa ! T'es plus grand que moi. Tu dois manger pour...
OUPS: No. Come on, Brother! You're bigger than me, you have to eat to sur—

JAP: I should go to the library and see what Popola's up to.
FR: Je dois aller à la bibliothèque. Popola m'attend.
OUPS: I should go to the library and see what Popola's up to.

JAP: I hope you can find her before she leaves the village...
FR: J'espère que j'arriverai à la trouver avant qu'elle ne sorte du village...
OUPS: I hope you can find her before she leaves the village...

JAP: Maybe she found some other way in...
FR: Elle a peut-être trouvé un autre chemin...
OUPS: Maybe she found some other way in...

JAP: Something's there...
FR: Il y a quelque chose...
OUPS: Something's there...

JAP: I'm coming, Yonah!
FR: J'arrive, Yonah !
OUPS: I'm coming, Yonah!

JAP: I have to help Yonah first.
FR: Je dois d'abord porter secours à Yonah.
OUPS: I have to help Yonah first.

JAP: Ugh! Some kind of power is blocking me.
FR: Quelque chose m'empêche d'avancer#!
OUPS: Ugh! Some kind of power is blocking me.

JAP: You stand in the presence of ancient wisdom!
FR: Tu es en présence d'un recueil de connaissances antiques !
OUPS: You stand in the presence of ancient wisdom!

JAP: I am a text of the darkest, most arcane type,
FR: Je recèle un savoir ésotérique et obscur.
OUPS: I am a text of the darkest, most arcane type,

JAP: and I could be of great assistance to you.
FR: Je pourrais t'être d'une grande utilité.
OUPS: and I could be of great assistance to you.

JAP: I don't trust talking books.
FR: Je ne fais pas confiance aux livres qui parlent.
OUPS: I don't trust talking books.

JAP: Your time is short, skeptic.
FR: Tu n'as pas de temps à perdre, sceptique.
OUPS: Your time is short, skeptic.

JAP: Even now, the girl you seek is in grave danger.
FR: En ce moment même, la jeune fille que tu recherches est en grave danger.
OUPS: Even now, the girl you seek is in grave danger.

JAP: Yonah!
FR: Yonah !
OUPS: Yonah!

JAP: I will grant you one final chance. Bow your head
FR: Je t'accorde une dernière chance. Incline-toi devant moi et assume mon pouvoir,
OUPS: I will grant you one final chance. Bow your head

JAP: and accept my power, or go it alone and fail.
FR: ou accepte ta défaite inéluctable.
OUPS: and accept my power, or go it alone and fail.

JAP: Bwah hah hah! I am Grimoire Weiss!
FR: Ga ha ha ! Je suis le Grimoire Weiss !
OUPS: Bwah hah hah! I am Grimoire Weiss!

JAP: My very name brings kingdoms to their knees!
FR: Le simple fait de mentionner mon nom met des royaumes à genoux !
OUPS: My very name brings kingdoms to their knees!

JAP: ...You'd better be everything you claim to be.
FR: ... J'espère pour toi que tu te montreras à la hauteur de tes vantardises.
OUPS: ...You'd better be everything you claim to be.

JAP: Nice to meet you, Weiss.
FR: Enchanté, Weiss.
OUPS: Nice to meet you, Weiss.

JAP: Gah! You will refer to me by my full and proper name!
FR: Gah ! Adresse-toi à moi correctement : par mon nom complet !
OUPS: Gah! You will refer to me by my full and proper name!

JAP: You stand in the presence of ancient wisdom!
FR: Tu es en présence d'un recueil de connaissances antiques !
OUPS: You stand in the presence of ancient wisdom!

JAP: What's that?
FR: Qu'est-ce que c'est ?
OUPS: What's that?

JAP: Wait... That song...
FR: Un instant... Cette chanson...
OUPS: Wait... That song...

JAP: When the great black book, Grimoire Noir, plunges the world into chaos...
FR: Lorsque le grand livre noir, le Grimoire Noir, fera sombrer le monde dans le chaos...
OUPS: When the great black book, Grimoire Noir, plunges the world into chaos...

JAP: The white book, Grimoire Weiss, will appear with his Sealed Verses.
FR: Le livre blanc, le Grimoire Weiss, apparaîtra doté de ses vers scellés.
OUPS: The white book, Grimoire Weiss, will appear with his Sealed Verses.

JAP: He will then vanquish Grimoire Noir and restore harmony to the world.
FR: Il triomphera du Grimoire Noir et rétablira la paix dans le monde.
OUPS: He will then vanquish Grimoire Noir and restore harmony to the world.

JAP: ...Or so the legend goes.
FR: ... Enfin, c'est ce que la légende raconte.
OUPS: ...Or so the legend goes.

JAP: What's a "Sealed Verse?"
FR: Qu'est-ce qu'un « vers scellé » ?
OUPS: What's a "Sealed Verse?"

JAP: These records are really old, so I can't say for sure.
FR: Difficile à dire, ces documents sont très vieux.
OUPS: These records are really old, so I can't say for sure.

JAP: I imagine it's...some kind of magic.
FR: Je suppose que c'est... une forme de sortilège.
OUPS: I imagine it's...some kind of magic.

JAP: Is anyone here?
FR: Le village semble désert...
OUPS: Is anyone here?

JAP: We don't trust you.
FR: Nous ne vous faisons pas confiance.
OUPS: We don't trust you.

JAP: I'm looking for someone who knows about the Sealed Verses.
FR: Je cherche quelqu'un qui sait quelque chose au sujet des vers scellés.
OUPS: I'm looking for someone who knows about the Sealed Verses.

JAP: You're like her! Like Kainé!
FR: Vous êtes comme elle ! Comme Kainé !
OUPS: You're like her! Like Kainé!

JAP: Shut up and listen to me!
FR: Taisez-vous et écoutez-moi !
OUPS: Shut up and listen to me!

JAP: Cursed! You are cursed!
FR: Maudit ! Vous êtes maudit !
OUPS: Cursed! You are cursed!

JAP: Well, this appears to be a glorious waste of time.
FR: Eh bien, on dirait que ceci est une prodigieuse perte de temps.
OUPS: Well, this appears to be a glorious waste of time.

JAP: Leave our village at once!
FR: Sortez de notre village tout de suite ! Vous n'êtes pas le bienvenu !
OUPS: Leave our village at once!

JAP: We dare not defy the Shades...
FR: Nous n'osons pas défier les Ombres...
OUPS: We dare not defy the Shades...

JAP: We must kill Kainé!
FR: Nous devons tuer Kainé !
OUPS: We must kill Kainé!

JAP: That woman was tainted by a Shade, and now look at her...
FR: Cette fille a été souillée par une Ombre, et regardez ce qu'elle est devenue...
OUPS: That woman was tainted by a Shade, and now look at her...

JAP: Scared... I'm so scared... I'll never leave my home again.
FR: J'ai peur... J'ai si peur… Je ne sortirai plus jamais de ma maison.
OUPS: Scared... I'm so scared... I'll never leave my home again.

JAP: What a pathetic bunch of rabble!
FR: Quelle misérable racaille !
OUPS: What a pathetic bunch of rabble!

JAP: Leave our village at once!
FR: Sortez de notre village tout de suite ! Vous n'êtes pas le bienvenu !
OUPS: Leave our village at once!

JAP: We dare not defy the Shades...
FR: Nous n'osons pas défier les Ombres...
OUPS: We dare not defy the Shades...

JAP: We don't trust you.
FR: Nous ne vous faisons pas confiance.
OUPS: We don't trust you.

JAP: You're like her! Like Kainé!
FR: Vous êtes comme elle ! Comme Kainé !
OUPS: You're like her! Like Kainé!

JAP: Cursed! You are cursed!
FR: Maudit ! Vous êtes maudit !
OUPS: Cursed! You are cursed!

JAP: We don't trust you.
FR: Nous ne vous faisons pas confiance.
OUPS: We don't trust you.

JAP: Leave our village at once!
FR: Sortez de notre village tout de suite ! Vous n'êtes pas le bienvenu !
OUPS: Leave our village at once!

JAP: It would appear there are no powerful Shades here...
FR: Il semblerait qu'il n'y a pas d'Ombre puissante dans ce village...
OUPS: It would appear there are no powerful Shades here...

JAP: The Sealed Verses would never be found in such a place.
FR: Jamais nous ne trouverons un vers scellé dans un endroit pareil.
OUPS: The Sealed Verses would never be found in such a place.

JAP: Ah, crap. I knew this would happen.
FR: Ah, merde. Je savais que ça allait arriver.
OUPS: Ah, crap. I knew this would happen.

JAP: Is that all?
FR: L'avons-nous vaincue ?
OUPS: Is that all?

JAP: What are you waiting for, fool? Attack her!
FR: As-tu perdu la tête ? Qu'attends-tu donc ? Attaque-la !
OUPS: What are you waiting for, fool? Attack her!

JAP: Huh?
FR: Hein ?
OUPS: Huh?

JAP: By my very pages! This girl wields magic!
FR: Par mes illustres pages ! Cette fille maîtrise la magie !
OUPS: By my very pages! This girl wields magic!

JAP: Our attacks are failing!
FR: Nos attaques n'ont aucun effet !
OUPS: Our attacks are failing!

JAP: Goddammit...
FR: Saloperie...
OUPS: Goddammit...

JAP: Stop, fool! Magical attacks are useless against this one!
FR: Arrête, imbécile ! Il est inutile d'utiliser des attaques magiques contre elle !
OUPS: Stop, fool! Magical attacks are useless against this one!

JAP: Oh. Fantastic.
FR: Oh. Formidable.
OUPS: Oh. Fantastic.

JAP: Perhaps she's brought a companion?
FR: Elle a peut-être invité un ami ?
OUPS: Perhaps she's brought a companion?

JAP: Ohhhhhhhhhh!!
FR: Ooooooooooh !
OUPS: Ohhhhhhhhhh!!

JAP: The hell is going on here?
FR: Mais enfin qu'est-ce qui se passe ?
OUPS: The hell is going on here?

JAP: Stay outta my way!
FR: Dégage !
OUPS: Stay outta my way!

JAP: He's mine, you idiots!
FR: C'est mon adversaire, espèces d'idiots !
OUPS: He's mine, you idiots!

JAP: It would appear that we are not the focus of her anger.
FR: Il semblerait que nous ne sommes pas la cause de sa colère.
OUPS: It would appear that we are not the focus of her anger.

JAP: Doesn't look like it.
FR: Ça n'en a pas l'air.
OUPS: Doesn't look like it.

JAP: I've never seen the like.
FR: Je n'ai jamais rien vu de tel.
OUPS: I've never seen the like.

JAP: This one has been possessed by a Shade.
FR: Elle est possédée par une Ombre.
OUPS: This one has been possessed by a Shade.

JAP: She exists as neither fully human nor other.
FR: Elle n'est ni humaine ni monstre.
OUPS: She exists as neither fully human nor other.

JAP: I guess half-human is better than no human at all.
FR: Je suppose qu'être à moitié humaine est mieux que ne pas être humaine du tout.
OUPS: I guess half-human is better than no human at all.

JAP: But if that part goes, I'll cut her down like all the rest.
FR: Mais si elle perd son humanité, je la tuerai comme les autres.
OUPS: But if that part goes, I'll cut her down like all the rest.

JAP: You know about The Aerie, right?
FR: Tu connais l'Aire, n'est-ce pas ?
OUPS: You know about The Aerie, right?

JAP: A little.
FR: Un peu.
OUPS: A little.

JAP: A quaint burg filled with terribly unsociable people!
FR: Un petit village pittoresque aux habitants peu sociables !
OUPS: A quaint burg filled with terribly unsociable people!

JAP: Well, apparently Shades are descending on the village in huge numbers.
FR: Eh bien, il paraît qu'une horde d'Ombres a envahi le village.
OUPS: Well, apparently Shades are descending on the village in huge numbers.

JAP: Right. Let's go, Weiss.
FR: Je vois. Allons-y, Weiss.
OUPS: Right. Let's go, Weiss.

JAP: Shall I wager that trollop in her underpants has something to do with this decision?
FR: Oserais-je parier que cette traînée en petite tenue a influencé ta décision ?
OUPS: Shall I wager that trollop in her underpants has something to do with this decision?

JAP: Hmmm. We seem to have received a missive.
FR: Hum, il semblerait que nous avons reçu une missive.
OUPS: Hmmm. We seem to have received a missive.

JAP: There's a letter for you.
FR: Tu as reçu une lettre.
OUPS: There's a letter for you.

JAP: Bah! This is clearly a trap!
FR: Bah ! Il est évident qu'il s'agit d'un piège !
OUPS: Bah! This is clearly a trap!

JAP: Maybe. But we're going to check it out anyway.
FR: Peut-être. Mais nous allons tout de même y jeter un coup d'œil.
OUPS: Maybe. But we're going to check it out anyway.

JAP: Well, we've come this far. I suppose we can't turn back now.
FR: Eh bien, nous sommes venus jusqu'ici. Je suppose qu'il ne servirait à rien de reculer maintenant.
OUPS: Well, we've come this far. I suppose we can't turn back now.

JAP: Well, we've come this far. I suppose we can't turn back now.
FR: Eh bien, nous sommes venus jusqu'ici. Je suppose qu'il ne servirait à rien de reculer maintenant.
OUPS: Well, we've come this far. I suppose we can't turn back now.

JAP: This boyfriend better be worth it.
FR: J'espère que son petit ami en vaut la peine.
OUPS: This boyfriend better be worth it.

JAP: I don't like this one bit!
FR: Cet endroit ne me dit rien qui vaille !
OUPS: I don't like this one bit!

JAP: You sound scared, Weiss.
FR: On dirait que tu as peur, Weiss.
OUPS: You sound scared, Weiss.

JAP: Pah! What an absurd suggestion!
FR: Pfft ! Quelle odieuse insinuation !
OUPS: Pah! What an absurd suggestion!

JAP: I don't like this one bit!
FR: Cet endroit ne me dit rien qui vaille !
OUPS: I don't like this one bit!

JAP: You sound scared, Weiss.
FR: On dirait que tu as peur, Weiss.
OUPS: You sound scared, Weiss.

JAP: What's this? The picture has changed.
FR: Qu'est-ce que c'est ? Cette peinture n'est pas la même.
OUPS: What's this? The picture has changed.

JAP: Who are you?
FR: Qui êtes-vous ?
OUPS: Who are you?

JAP: Think we should look for Kainé?
FR: Tu crois que nous devrions chercher Kainé ?
OUPS: Think we should look for Kainé?

JAP: Leave her! That woman is capable enough on her own.
FR: Oublie-la ! Cette fille peut très bien se débrouiller toute seule.
OUPS: Leave her! That woman is capable enough on her own.

JAP: True enough.
FR: Tu as raison.
OUPS: True enough.

JAP: Whoa!
FR: Oh !
OUPS: Whoa!

JAP: Yaaaaahhh!
FR: Aaaah !
OUPS: Yaaaaahhh!

JAP: I'm coming with you. It's unfair to let you go on your own.
FR: Je vous accompagne. Il serait inconvenant de vous laisser y aller seuls.
OUPS: I'm coming with you. It's unfair to let you go on your own.

JAP: And besides, it might be fun to put my eyes to good use for once!
FR: Et d'ailleurs, ce sera peut-être amusant d'utiliser mes yeux à bon escient pour une fois !
OUPS: And besides, it might be fun to put my eyes to good use for once!

JAP: Oh, great. Why does every book I meet have a bad attitude?
FR: Formidable. Pourquoi tous les livres que je rencontre ont-ils un comportement hostile ?
OUPS: Oh, great. Why does every book I meet have a bad attitude?

JAP: Ho, aren't we clever! As if any mere tome could compare to the wonderment that is Grimoire Weiss!
FR: Oh, comme tu es drôle#! Tu oserais comparer un livre ordinaire avec la merveille qu'est le Grimoire Weiss#?
OUPS: Ho, aren't we clever! As if any mere tome could compare to the wonderment that is Grimoire Weiss!

JAP: Petrification is a fearsome power indeed!
FR: La pétrification est en effet un pouvoir redoutable !
OUPS: Petrification is a fearsome power indeed!

JAP: Is this bastard ever gonna stop!?
FR: N'abandonnera-t-il donc jamais ?!
OUPS: Is this bastard ever gonna stop!?

JAP: I'll petrify the pages! You strike the final blow!
FR: Je vais pétrifier ses pages ! Donne-lui le coup de grâce !
OUPS: I'll petrify the pages! You strike the final blow!

JAP: Oh no! I can't petrify it!
FR: Oh, non ! Je ne peux pas le pétrifier !
OUPS: Oh no! I can't petrify it!

JAP: Dammit! I can't hurt this thing!
FR: Bon sang ! Je n'arrive pas à le blesser !
OUPS: Dammit! I can't hurt this thing!

JAP: O, fated day! Is this the end for Grimoire Weiss!?
FR: Ô jour fatidique ! Serait-ce la fin du Grimoire Weiss ?!
OUPS: O, fated day! Is this the end for Grimoire Weiss!?

JAP: Does this goddamn house even have an exit?
FR: Est-ce que cette putain de maison a une sortie ?
OUPS: Does this goddamn house even have an exit?

JAP: Kainé!
FR: Kainé !
OUPS: Kainé!

JAP: And where have you been, hmmm?
FR: Où étais-tu donc passée ?
OUPS: And where have you been, hmmm?

JAP: Lost. ...Where've you been?
FR: Perdue. Et vous ?
OUPS: Lost. ...Where've you been?

JAP: Getting our asses handed to us by a floating dictionary!
FR: En train de nous faire démolir par un dictionnaire volant !
OUPS: Getting our asses handed to us by a floating dictionary!

JAP: This foe's strength is beyond measure!
FR: La puissance de cet adversaire est incommensurable !
OUPS: This foe's strength is beyond measure!

JAP: So what's the plan then!?
FR: Alors, quel est notre plan d'attaque ?!
OUPS: So what's the plan then!?

JAP: I am an arcane text, not some manual of combat!
FR: Je suis un grimoire mystérieux, pas un guide stratégique !
OUPS: I am an arcane text, not some manual of combat!

JAP: You are supposed to deal with such matters!
FR: Tu es censé te charger de ces détails !
OUPS: You are supposed to deal with such matters!

JAP: You guys run! I'll hold it off while you escape!
FR: Fuyez ! Je l'occuperai pendant que vous vous échappez.
OUPS: You guys run! I'll hold it off while you escape!

JAP: Who's this guy?
FR: C'est qui, lui ?
OUPS: Who's this guy?

JAP: That's Emil. He's the kid that runs this—
FR: C'est émile. C'est le garçon qui...
OUPS: That's Emil. He's the kid that runs this—

JAP: Fuck, this book is a real asshole!
FR: Putain de merde, ce livre est un enculé de première !
OUPS: Fuck, this book is a real asshole!

JAP: ...Yeah, I should've warned you about that, Emil.
FR: Euh oui, j'aurais dû te prévenir, émile...
OUPS: ...Yeah, I should've warned you about that, Emil.

JAP: Ah, the sweet dulcet tones of the woman
FR: Ah, sa douce voix féminine retentit de nouveau à mes oreilles#!
OUPS: Ah, the sweet dulcet tones of the woman

JAP: ring in my ears yet again!
FR: Sortez d'ici !
OUPS: ring in my ears yet again!

JAP: You guys go! This is my fight, I can't ask you to die for me!
FR: C'est à moi de me battre et je ne peux pas vous demander de mourir pour moi !
OUPS: You guys go! This is my fight, I can't ask you to die for me!

JAP: Bold words! And yet I see your knees quake like warm butter.
FR: Braves paroles ! Et pourtant, je vois que tes genoux tremblent de peur.
OUPS: Bold words! And yet I see your knees quake like warm butter.

JAP: Save the heroics for when you're older, kid.
FR: Tu pourras jouer les héros quand tu seras plus grand.
OUPS: Save the heroics for when you're older, kid.

JAP: Would you all please shut the hell up and fight?
FR: Vous pourriez vous la fermer et vous battre ?
OUPS: Would you all please shut the hell up and fight?

JAP: Am I buggin' you, Kainé?
FR: Je te déconcentre, Kainé ?
OUPS: Am I buggin' you, Kainé?

JAP: I'm just saying, if you bastards wanna have a goddamn civilized discussion on the merits of bravery and sacrifice, we can do it later.
FR: Si, en bons connards que vous êtes, vous voulez avoir une putain de conversation sérieuse sur les mérites de la bravoure et du sacrifice, on se fera ça plus tard.
OUPS: I'm just saying, if you bastards wanna have a goddamn civilized discussion on the merits of bravery and sacrifice, we can do it later.

JAP: Is this your way of encouraging us!?
FR: C'est comme ça que tu nous encourages ?!
OUPS: Is this your way of encouraging us!?

JAP: Have we truly sunk to motivational speeches from a woman in her undergarments?
FR: Sommes-nous tombés si bas que nous avons besoin des paroles d'encouragement prodiguées par une fille en petite tenue ?
OUPS: Have we truly sunk to motivational speeches from a woman in her undergarments?

JAP: I guess so!
FR: Je suppose !
OUPS: I guess so!

JAP: Now!
FR: Maintenant !
OUPS: Now!

JAP: Come back soon, everyone!
FR: À bientôt#!
OUPS: Come back soon, everyone!

JAP: It may take time, but I shall find a way to cure my master's eyes. I swear it!
FR: Je n'aurai pas de cesse que je trouve un moyen de guérir les yeux de Monsieur émile. Je vous le jure#!
OUPS: It may take time, but I shall find a way to cure my master's eyes. I swear it!

JAP: Mmmm...
FR: Hum…
OUPS: Mmmm...

JAP: I saw you exchange some words with that Emil lad earlier.
FR: J'ai remarqué que tu as échangé quelques mots avec le petit émile tout à l'heure.
OUPS: I saw you exchange some words with that Emil lad earlier.

JAP: Hopefully it was nothing...inappropriate for a young man of his age? Hmmm?
FR: J'espère qu'il n'y avait rien... d'inapproprié pour un jeune homme de son âge dans votre conversation ? Hummm ?
OUPS: Hopefully it was nothing...inappropriate for a young man of his age? Hmmm?

JAP: Speak the truth, hussy!
FR: Réponds, traînée !
OUPS: Speak the truth, hussy!

JAP: Book? ...Shut up.
FR: Bouquin ? ... La ferme.
OUPS: Book? ...Shut up.

JAP: The manor is a rather gloomy place, but perhaps we should pay it another visit.
FR: Le manoir est un endroit plutôt lugubre, mais nous devrions peut-être rendre visite à émile.
OUPS: The manor is a rather gloomy place, but perhaps we should pay it another visit.

JAP: And be careful, please! It's gotten really scary in there.
FR: Et s'il vous plaît, soyez prudent#! C'est un endroit dangereux#!
OUPS: And be careful, please! It's gotten really scary in there.

JAP: You know, Weiss? Sometimes you can be a real ass.
FR: Tu sais, Weiss, parfois tu peux être vraiment sans-cœur.
OUPS: You know, Weiss? Sometimes you can be a real ass.

JAP: I cannot stand the way you insist on meddling in the affairs of others!
FR: Je ne supporte pas le fait que tu insistes à t'immiscer dans les affaires des autres !
OUPS: I cannot stand the way you insist on meddling in the affairs of others!

JAP: They have a rough life. I just wanna help.
FR: Ces gamins ont la vie dure. Je veux simplement les aider.
OUPS: They have a rough life. I just wanna help.

JAP: Yes, well, I suppose it's hardly suitable work for children.
FR: Il est vrai que ce n'est pas un travail approprié pour des enfants...
OUPS: Yes, well, I suppose it's hardly suitable work for children.

JAP: They both look pretty skinny.
FR: Ils sont plutôt maigres.
OUPS: They both look pretty skinny.

JAP: And the elder has been giving his share of the food to his brother.
FR: Et l'aîné donne sa part de nourriture à son frère,
OUPS: And the elder has been giving his share of the food to his brother.

JAP: I'm sure of it!
FR: j'en suis certain !
OUPS: I'm sure of it!

JAP: You can't possibly believe that the mother managed to fight her way down here!
FR: Tu ne peux quand même pas croire que leur mère s'est rendue jusqu'ici !
OUPS: You can't possibly believe that the mother managed to fight her way down here!

JAP: Mmm...
FR: Hum...
OUPS: Mmm...

JAP: Or, for that matter, that she has been collecting scrap metal for a solid week?
FR: Ou encore qu'elle a passé toute une semaine à ramasser de la ferraille ?
OUPS: Or, for that matter, that she has been collecting scrap metal for a solid week?

JAP: Um...
FR: Euh...
OUPS: Um...

JAP: Open your eyes, fool! The woman is clearly—
FR: Ouvre les yeux, bougre d'imbécile ! Cette femme est manifestement…
OUPS: Open your eyes, fool! The woman is clearly—

JAP: That's enough, Weiss!
FR: Ça suffit, Weiss !
OUPS: That's enough, Weiss!

JAP: Those kids are in a bad way. Maybe they just need a...miracle.
FR: Ces enfants mènent une vie misérable. Ils ont peut-être juste besoin d'un miracle.
OUPS: Those kids are in a bad way. Maybe they just need a...miracle.

JAP: Miracles? Pah!
FR: Un miracle ? Pfft !
OUPS: Miracles? Pah!

JAP: Let's go.
FR: Allons-y.
OUPS: Let's go.

JAP: ...Let's go.
FR: ... Partons.
OUPS: ...Let's go.

JAP: I'm all Gideon has left. I can't cry in front of him.
FR: Je suis tout ce qui lui reste. Je ne peux pas pleurer devant lui.
OUPS: I'm all Gideon has left. I can't cry in front of him.

JAP: I'm worried about Yonah. Let's go back.
FR: Je me fais du souci pour Yonah. Allons la voir.
OUPS: I'm worried about Yonah. Let's go back.

JAP: Let's visit The Aerie. They've got Shades there.
FR: Allons éliminer les Ombres qui ont envahi le village de l'Aire.
OUPS: Let's visit The Aerie. They've got Shades there.

JAP: Indeed. And we may just find a Sealed Verse, besides.
FR: Oui, nous pourrions y trouver un vers scellé.
OUPS: Indeed. And we may just find a Sealed Verse, besides.

JAP: Come back soon!
FR: À bientôt#!
OUPS: Come back soon!

JAP: Hey, guys, I need you to pick me up a fish.
FR: Salut#! J'ai besoin d'un poisson. Pourriez-vous vous en charger#?
OUPS: Hey, guys, I need you to pick me up a fish.

JAP: Grimoire Weiss is not some common errand boy!
FR: Le Grimoire Weiss n'est pas un simple garçon de courses#!
OUPS: Grimoire Weiss is not some common errand boy!

JAP: Sorry, but the village is running low on medicinal elixir.
FR: Désolée, mais le village n'a presque plus d'élixir médicinal.
OUPS: Sorry, but the village is running low on medicinal elixir.

JAP: And I can't make it without the liver of a shaman fish.
FR: Et je ne peux pas en préparer sans le foie d'un poisson-shaman.
OUPS: And I can't make it without the liver of a shaman fish.

JAP: Where can I find one?
FR: Où pourrais-je en trouver ?
OUPS: Where can I find one?

JAP: You should be able to fish one out of the waters near Seafront.
FR: Tu devrais pouvoir en pêcher près du village de Littoral.
OUPS: You should be able to fish one out of the waters near Seafront.

JAP: Sorry. I know it's a bother, but you're the only ones I trust.
FR: Je suis désolée de vous embêter avec ça, mais vous êtes les seuls sur qui je peux compter.
OUPS: Sorry. I know it's a bother, but you're the only ones I trust.

JAP: Stairs are...rough going on these old bones...
FR: Mes vieux os... n'aiment pas ces escaliers...
OUPS: Stairs are...rough going on these old bones...

JAP: But what if he...if he returns today?
FR: Mais... il pourrait revenir aujourd'hui.
OUPS: But what if he...if he returns today?

JAP: Can't let the lighthouse...stay dark...
FR: Je dois allumer... le phare...
OUPS: Can't let the lighthouse...stay dark...

JAP: A shaman fish? Yeah, you can catch those down at the shore.
FR: Un poisson-shaman#? Ouais, on peut en attraper sur la plage.
OUPS: A shaman fish? Yeah, you can catch those down at the shore.

JAP: Yeah, we got shaman fish. Probably don't see many of those inland, huh?
FR: Oui, nous avons des poissons-shamans. Vous ne devez probablement pas en trouver beaucoup loin de la mer, hein#?
OUPS: Yeah, we got shaman fish. Probably don't see many of those inland, huh?

JAP: It smells like the sea.
FR: Ah, l'odeur de la mer.
OUPS: It smells like the sea.

JAP: The people here seem nice.
FR: Les habitants de cette ville semblent accueillants.
OUPS: The people here seem nice.

JAP: Perhaps the healing properties of this shaman fish keep them in good spirits!
FR: Les propriétés curatives du poisson-shaman les aident peut-être à garder le moral#!
OUPS: Perhaps the healing properties of this shaman fish keep them in good spirits!

JAP: It seems we'll be forced to climb these stairs like common pack mules!
FR: Il semblerait que nous allons devoir monter cet escalier comme de vulgaires mules#!
OUPS: It seems we'll be forced to climb these stairs like common pack mules!

JAP: This is madness! We've no business being in such a place!
FR: C'est de la folie#! Nous n'avons aucune raison de nous aventurer dans un tel endroit#!
OUPS: This is madness! We've no business being in such a place!

JAP: Pah! Bah! There's sand between my pages!
FR: Ptoui ! Ptoui ! J'ai du sable entre mes pages !
OUPS: Pah! Bah! There's sand between my pages!

JAP: I've got sand in places I didn't know I had.
FR: J'ai du sable dans des recoins de mon corps qui m'étaient jusqu'à présent inconnus.
OUPS: I've got sand in places I didn't know I had.

JAP: I warned you about this!
FR: Je t'avais pourtant prévenu !
OUPS: I warned you about this!

JAP: We should turn back while there's still time.
FR: Nous devrions faire demi-tour pendant qu'il en est encore temps.
OUPS: We should turn back while there's still time.

JAP: So this was a graveyard, eh?
FR: Alors, c'était un cimetière#?
OUPS: So this was a graveyard, eh?

JAP: Strange... All the headstones look new.
FR: étrange... Toutes les pierres tombales ont l'air récentes.
OUPS: Strange... All the headstones look new.

JAP: The wolves must have brought down all these people. What a cruel fate.
FR: Ils ont dû être la proie des loups. Quel triste sort#!
OUPS: The wolves must have brought down all these people. What a cruel fate.

JAP: *Siiiigh*
FR: *soupir*
OUPS: *Siiiigh*

JAP: What is it, Popola?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il, Popola#?
OUPS: What is it, Popola?

JAP: Our water quality is dropping. I think we need to find a filter.
FR: L'eau du puits du village n'est plus aussi pure qu'elle l'était. Je crois que nous devrions installer un filtre.
OUPS: Our water quality is dropping. I think we need to find a filter.

JAP: You want me to build one?
FR: Tu veux que j'en construise un#?
OUPS: You want me to build one?

JAP: Thanks, that's sweet. But it's not the kind of thing you can just whip up.
FR: C'est gentil, mais ce n'est pas le genre de chose que l'on peut bricoler sans plan précis.
OUPS: Thanks, that's sweet. But it's not the kind of thing you can just whip up.

JAP: Then you must locate a trader who specializes in the construction of such devices!
FR: Nous devons donc trouver un artisan spécialisé dans la construction de tels objets#!
OUPS: Then you must locate a trader who specializes in the construction of such devices!

JAP: I know of such a man. He lives in a town called Facade, deep in the desert.
FR: J'en connais un. Il habite dans la ville de Façade, au milieu du désert.
OUPS: I know of such a man. He lives in a town called Facade, deep in the desert.

JAP: But the people there have an...interesting social structure.
FR: Toutefois, la ville possède un ordre social... hors du commun. Nous ne sommes plus
OUPS: But the people there have an...interesting social structure.

JAP: We've sort of fallen out of contact with them.
FR: en contact avec eux.
OUPS: We've sort of fallen out of contact with them.

JAP: Listen, if you can learn anything about them, would you please let me know?
FR: Si jamais tu as plus d'informations sur eux, fais-moi signe, d'accord#?
OUPS: Listen, if you can learn anything about them, would you please let me know?

JAP: What's so strange about this other town? Different language? Different customs?
FR: En quoi cette ville peut-elle être si différente#? Parlent-ils une autre langue#? Ont-ils des coutumes étranges#?
OUPS: What's so strange about this other town? Different language? Different customs?

JAP: Perhaps more than we know. What kind of city shuts itself off from the outside world?
FR: Elle pourrait être plus singulière que nous ne pourrions l'imaginer. Quelle sorte de ville refuse tout contact avec le monde extérieur#?
OUPS: Perhaps more than we know. What kind of city shuts itself off from the outside world?

JAP: I want to help Popola, but...
FR: Je veux aider Popola, mais...
OUPS: I want to help Popola, but...

JAP: A town locked away in the desert...
FR: Une ville isolée dans le désert...
OUPS: A town locked away in the desert...

JAP: We have to get in so we can find a water filter.
FR: Nous devons trouver un moyen d'y entrer pour trouver un filtre à eau.
OUPS: We have to get in so we can find a water filter.

JAP: Oh, we can get in.
FR: Oh, on pourra y entrer.
OUPS: Oh, we can get in.

JAP: We have no quarrel with these people, Kainé.
FR: Nous n'avons rien contre ces gens, Kainé.
OUPS: We have no quarrel with these people, Kainé.

JAP: Fighting our way in won't accomplish anything.
FR: Entrer de force dans leur ville ne nous mènera nulle part.
OUPS: Fighting our way in won't accomplish anything.

JAP: Who said anything about fighting? There's a perfectly normal way inside Facade.
FR: Qui a parlé de se battre ? Il existe une façon bien normale d'entrer dans Façade.
OUPS: Who said anything about fighting? There's a perfectly normal way inside Facade.

JAP: There's a normal way?
FR: Une façon normale ?
OUPS: There's a normal way?

JAP: Yeah, and it's a lot easier to enter than your village. ...At least for me.
FR: Oui, et il est beaucoup plus facile d'y entrer que dans ton village... Du moins pour moi.
OUPS: Yeah, and it's a lot easier to enter than your village. ...At least for me.

JAP: I don't suppose you wish to share this plan of yours? Or tell us what you know of this city?
FR: Tu ne compterais pas nous faire part de ton plan, par hasard ? Ou encore nous dire ce que tu sais au sujet de cette ville ?
OUPS: I don't suppose you wish to share this plan of yours? Or tell us what you know of this city?

JAP: Shut your cover, book. You'll find out soon enough.
FR: La ferme, bouquin. Tu comprendras bien assez tôt.
OUPS: Shut your cover, book. You'll find out soon enough.

JAP: B-book! How dare you! I have never been treated with such an utter lack of decency and—
FR: Bou-bouquin ! Comment oses-tu ?! Jamais je n'ai été traité avec aussi peu de décence et…
OUPS: B-book! How dare you! I have never been treated with such an utter lack of decency and—

JAP: Easy, Weiss. Let's see what she's planning.
FR: Du calme, Weiss. Voyons voir ce qu'elle a en tête.
OUPS: Easy, Weiss. Let's see what she's planning.

JAP: So what's Facade like?
FR: Alors, quelle sorte de ville est Façade ?
OUPS: So what's Facade like?

JAP: It's strange. Let's just leave it at that.
FR: C'est une ville étrange. Tenons-nous-en là.
OUPS: It's strange. Let's just leave it at that.

JAP: Stranger than a boorish young woman who battles monsters in her undergarments!?
FR: Plus étrange qu'une jeune fille grossière en sous-vêtements qui se bat contre des monstres ?!
OUPS: Stranger than a boorish young woman who battles monsters in her undergarments!?

JAP: ...Let's go.
FR: ... Allons-y.
OUPS: ...Let's go.

JAP: Wolves!
FR: Des loups !
OUPS: Wolves!

JAP: Look out!
FR: Attention !
OUPS: Look out!

JAP: Wait. They're leaving.
FR: Attendez, ils se retirent.
OUPS: Wait. They're leaving.

JAP: That one appears to be the pack leader.
FR: On dirait que ce loup noir est le chef de la meute.
OUPS: That one appears to be the pack leader.

JAP: What is this, a fountain?
FR: Qu'est-ce que c'est, un puits#?
OUPS: What is this, a fountain?

JAP: It appears to be out of service.
FR: Il semble tari.
OUPS: It appears to be out of service.

JAP: Maybe I should have studied languages when I was a kid...
FR: J'aurais peut-être dû apprendre d'autres langues quand j'étais petit...
OUPS: Maybe I should have studied languages when I was a kid...

JAP: You could speak a thousand tongues and still fail if you lack knowledge of another's culture.
FR: Tu pourrais parler mille langues différentes, mais toujours échouer si tu ne possèdes pas les connaissances nécessaires pour comprendre la culture d'un autre peuple.
OUPS: You could speak a thousand tongues and still fail if you lack knowledge of another's culture.

JAP: Come on, Weiss. Help me out here.
FR: Allez, Weiss. Aide-moi un peu.
OUPS: Come on, Weiss. Help me out here.

JAP: I am a brilliant book of unspeakable value, not some dog-eared travel guide!
FR: Je suis un livre formidable d'une valeur inestimable, pas un guide touristique !
OUPS: I am a brilliant book of unspeakable value, not some dog-eared travel guide!

JAP: Mmm... I find this town odd. We are clearly outsiders, and yet none give us a second glance.
FR: Hum... Cette ville est curieuse. Nous sommes manifestement des étrangers, mais personne ne nous remarque.
OUPS: Mmm... I find this town odd. We are clearly outsiders, and yet none give us a second glance.

JAP: It's calm. I like it. ...I just wish I could talk to somebody.
FR: C'est une ville tranquille. Elle me plaît. Si seulement je pouvais parler à quelqu'un...!
OUPS: It's calm. I like it. ...I just wish I could talk to somebody.

JAP: Perhaps it would be best to follow this Fyra girl's lead, hmm?
FR: Nous devrions sans doute la suivre.
OUPS: Perhaps it would be best to follow this Fyra girl's lead, hmm?

JAP: (It's not so bad.)
FR: (Ce n'est pas si mal que ça.)
OUPS: (It's not so bad.)

JAP: (Although I used to ask the same question. And then someone told me...)
FR: (Cependant, un jour j'ai posé la même question et quelqu'un m'a répondu...)
OUPS: (Although I used to ask the same question. And then someone told me...)

JAP: ("Rules do not exist to bind you. They exist so you may know your freedoms.")
FR: («#Le but des lois n'est pas de contraindre, mais de révéler la liberté.#»)
OUPS: ("Rules do not exist to bind you. They exist so you may know your freedoms.")

JAP: (When I look at it like that, they don't bother me.)
FR: (Quand je considère la question de cette façon, les lois ne me dérangent pas.)
OUPS: (When I look at it like that, they don't bother me.)

JAP: Whatever gets you through the day.
FR: Si ça peut t'aider de voir les choses ainsi...
OUPS: Whatever gets you through the day.

JAP: (This is a store. You should be able to find what you need here.)
FR: (Voici un magasin. Vous devriez pouvoir y trouver ce dont vous avez besoin.)
OUPS: (This is a store. You should be able to find what you need here.)

JAP: (Well, hello there, Fyra! Are these visitors?)
FR: (Oh, bonjour Fyra#! Ce sont des étrangers#?)
OUPS: (Well, hello there, Fyra! Are these visitors?)

JAP: We need a water filter. Can you help us?
FR: Nous avons besoin d'un filtre à eau. Pourriez-vous nous aider#?
OUPS: We need a water filter. Can you help us?

JAP: (I have such an item, but I need to assemble it first.)
FR: (J'ai les pièces nécessaires, mais je devrai l'assembler pour vous.)
OUPS: (I have such an item, but I need to assemble it first.)

JAP: (I can have it finished by tomorrow. Would you come back then?)
FR: (Il sera prêt demain. Pourriez-vous revenir le chercher quand il sera fini#?)
OUPS: (I can have it finished by tomorrow. Would you come back then?)

JAP: Yes, that would be acceptable.
FR: Oui, cela nous convient.
OUPS: Yes, that would be acceptable.

JAP: Thanks for showing us around, Fyra.
FR: Merci de nous avoir fait visiter la ville, Fyra.
OUPS: Thanks for showing us around, Fyra.

JAP: (You're welcome.)
FR: (De rien.)
OUPS: (You're welcome.)

JAP: Thanks to your efforts, I am beginning to grasp the basics of this language.
FR: Grâce à toi, je commence à comprendre les éléments de base de votre langue.
OUPS: Thanks to your efforts, I am beginning to grasp the basics of this language.

JAP: (That's great! I'll guide you to the exit, then.)
FR: (Formidable#! Bon, je vais vous guider jusqu'à la sortie.)
OUPS: (That's great! I'll guide you to the exit, then.)

JAP: I think she wants us to come back someday. What do you say, Kainé?
FR: Je crois qu'elle veut que nous revenions lui rendre visite un jour. Qu'en dis-tu, Kainé ?
OUPS: I think she wants us to come back someday. What do you say, Kainé?

JAP: I say let's go.
FR: Je dis partons.
OUPS: I say let's go.

JAP: Looks like all those rules are getting in the way.
FR: On dirait que leurs lois sont soudainement bien encombrantes.
OUPS: Looks like all those rules are getting in the way.

JAP: This is their way and their system of laws. As outsiders, we have no say in the matter.
FR: Ils possèdent leurs propres us et coutumes. En tant qu'étrangers, nous ne pouvons pas intervenir…
OUPS: This is their way and their system of laws. As outsiders, we have no say in the matter.

JAP: ...Come. We should be off.
FR: Allez. Nous devrions partir.
OUPS: ...Come. We should be off.

JAP: These people should stop arguing about rules and follow Fyra's lead.
FR: Les habitants de la ville devraient arrêter de se disputer et suivre plutôt l'exemple de Fyra.
OUPS: These people should stop arguing about rules and follow Fyra's lead.

JAP: She seems to possess almost boundless stores of energy.
FR: Elle semble posséder des réserves infinies d'énergie.
OUPS: She seems to possess almost boundless stores of energy.

JAP: Fyra... Hold on... I need to rest...
FR: Fyra... Attends... J'ai besoin de me reposer.
OUPS: Fyra... Hold on... I need to rest...

JAP: This girl must possess extreme patriotism. Look how she gives all for the sake of her prince!
FR: Le patriotisme de cette jeune fille est sans égal. Regardez comment elle sacrifie tout pour son prince !
OUPS: This girl must possess extreme patriotism. Look how she gives all for the sake of her prince!

JAP: I wonder what this missing prince is like.
FR: Je me demande quelle sorte d'homme est le prince.
OUPS: I wonder what this missing prince is like.

JAP: The man is tasked to protect his people, and yet they toil to
FR: Il a pour tâche de protéger ses sujets et pourtant ce sont eux qui s'efforcent de le sauver#?
OUPS: The man is tasked to protect his people, and yet they toil to

JAP: save him? I think that tells us everything we need to know.
FR: Je crois que c'est tout ce qu'il y a à savoir.
OUPS: save him? I think that tells us everything we need to know.

JAP: (Who's there? State your name!)
FR: (Qui va là#?)
OUPS: (Who's there? State your name!)

JAP: Just a foolhardy band of rescuers! Don't mind us.
FR: Nous ne sommes qu'une intrépide équipe de secours ! Ne faites pas attention à nous.
OUPS: Just a foolhardy band of rescuers! Don't mind us.

JAP: (What!?)
FR: (Comment#?!)
OUPS: (What!?)

JAP: ...Someone's here!?
FR: ... Il y a quelqu'un !
OUPS: ...Someone's here!?

JAP: Well, that was unusual.
FR: Eh bien, voilà qui est plutôt inhabituel.
OUPS: Well, that was unusual.

JAP: Come on. Let's go save him.
FR: Allons lui porter secours.
OUPS: Come on. Let's go save him.

JAP: By all means, let us go save the rude little anklebiter.
FR: Mais bien sûr ! Allons sauver le gamin impoli...!
OUPS: By all means, let us go save the rude little anklebiter.

JAP: Oh, what now?
FR: Oh, et quoi encore ?
OUPS: Oh, what now?

JAP: I guess we'll have to play by the rules.
FR: On dirait que nous allons devoir respecter les lois.
OUPS: I guess we'll have to play by the rules.

JAP: I'd like to ask you about the Black Scrawl.
FR: J'aimerais vous poser une question au sujet de la nécrose runique.
OUPS: I'd like to ask you about the Black Scrawl.

JAP: (Ah, yes. The foul disease that claimed my father's life.)
FR: (Ah, la maladie insidieuse qui a emporté mon père...)
OUPS: (Ah, yes. The foul disease that claimed my father's life.)

JAP: We heard that you were searching for a cure. Did you ever learn anything?
FR: On dit que vos apothicaires étaient à la recherche d'un remède. Qu'ont-ils découvert#?
OUPS: We heard that you were searching for a cure. Did you ever learn anything?

JAP: (I'm sorry, no. Everything we tried ended in failure.)
FR: (Pas grand-chose. Aucune de leurs potions n'a eu d'effet.)
OUPS: (I'm sorry, no. Everything we tried ended in failure.)

JAP: It seems there is no way around it. We'll have to collect the Sealed Verses one by one.
FR: Il semblerait que nous n'avons pas le choix. Nous devrons trouver tous les vers scellés.
OUPS: It seems there is no way around it. We'll have to collect the Sealed Verses one by one.

JAP: Yeah. Thankfully, there aren't too many left.
FR: Oui. Heureusement que nous y sommes presque.
OUPS: Yeah. Thankfully, there aren't too many left.

JAP: (Pardon me, but what are these "Sealed Verses"?)
FR: (Que sont ces vers scellés dont vous parlez#?)
OUPS: (Pardon me, but what are these "Sealed Verses"?)

JAP: We're not sure. But if I find them all, I can save my sister from the Black Scrawl.
FR: Nous n'en sommes pas certains, mais si j'arrive à tous les récupérer, je pourrai guérir ma fille de la nécrose runique.
OUPS: We're not sure. But if I find them all, I can save my sister from the Black Scrawl.

JAP: You...don't know what they are?
FR: Tu... ne sais pas ce qu'ils sont#?
OUPS: You...don't know what they are?

JAP: I don't know and I don't much care. I just want to save my sister.
FR: Non, et je m'en fiche. Mon seul souci est de sauver ma fille.
OUPS: I don't know and I don't much care. I just want to save my sister.

JAP: I'll run around collecting a bunch of crystal horse manure if that's what it takes.
FR: Je ferais n'importe quoi pour y arriver.
OUPS: I'll run around collecting a bunch of crystal horse manure if that's what it takes.

JAP: Yonah doesn't have the strength to fight this disease.
FR: Yonah n'a pas la force nécessaire pour combattre la maladie.
OUPS: Yonah doesn't have the strength to fight this disease.

JAP: We must find Grimoire Noir at once. Only this can save her.
FR: Nous devons trouver le Grimoire Noir dès que possible. C'est la seule solution.
OUPS: We must find Grimoire Noir at once. Only this can save her.

JAP: I'll deal with the Shades!
FR: Je me charge de ces Ombres !
OUPS: I'll deal with the Shades!

JAP: Go seal the gate! Move!
FR: Va sceller la porte ! Allez !
OUPS: Go seal the gate! Move!

JAP: Okay!
FR: D'accord !
OUPS: Okay!

JAP: You're all going to die!
FR: Vous allez tous mourir !
OUPS: You're all going to die!

JAP: I'll kill every last one of you!
FR: Je vous tuerai toutes jusqu'à la dernière !
OUPS: I'll kill every last one of you!

JAP: Ha! These foes are hardly worthy of our steel!
FR: Ha ! Elles ne sont pas dignes de ta lame !
OUPS: Ha! These foes are hardly worthy of our steel!

JAP: Come on! Bring everything you got!
FR: Viens ! Montre-moi ce dont tu es capable !
OUPS: Come on! Bring everything you got!

JAP: Pathetic! Even in death they disgust me!
FR: Pitoyable ! Même leur mort me dégoûte !
OUPS: Pathetic! Even in death they disgust me!

JAP: Dear god, what is that brute!?
FR: Ciel ! Que peut bien être cette brute ?!
OUPS: Dear god, what is that brute!?

JAP: Something that's gonna die.
FR: Quelque chose qui va mourir.
OUPS: Something that's gonna die.

JAP: Look where he's going!
FR: Regarde où elle se dirige...!
OUPS: Look where he's going!

JAP: Like hell he is!
FR: Je ne la laisserai pas faire !
OUPS: Like hell he is!

JAP: Underestimate us at your own peril, fiend!
FR: Si tu nous sous-estimes, ce sera à tes risques et périls !
OUPS: Underestimate us at your own peril, fiend!

JAP: Keep hitting it! At some point, it's gotta start working!
FR: Continue de l'attaquer ! Ça finira bien par marcher !
OUPS: Keep hitting it! At some point, it's gotta start working!

JAP: Is she trying to raise our morale, or is she honestly that insane?
FR: Essaie-t-elle de nous encourager ou est-elle vraiment aussi insensée qu'elle n'en a l'air ?
OUPS: Is she trying to raise our morale, or is she honestly that insane?

JAP: Probably both. Let's go!
FR: Probablement les deux. Allons-y !
OUPS: Probably both. Let's go!

JAP: Come on! Keep pushing him!
FR: Allez ! Continue à repousser l'Ombre !
OUPS: Come on! Keep pushing him!

JAP: No! You must press the attack!
FR: Non ! Vous devez continuer !
OUPS: No! You must press the attack!

JAP: You're gonna die today, shit-hog!
FR: C'est aujourd'hui que tu vas mourir, ragot de merde !
OUPS: You're gonna die today, shit-hog!

JAP: Shit-hog? Oh come now, that's not even a real word!
FR: Ragot de merde ? Oh, allons ! Ce n'est même pas une vraie insulte !
OUPS: Shit-hog? Oh come now, that's not even a real word!

JAP: Looks like you've learned how to swing that thing.
FR: On dirait que t'as enfin appris à te battre#!
OUPS: Looks like you've learned how to swing that thing.

JAP: So glad you noticed.
FR: Content de savoir que tu l'as remarqué.
OUPS: So glad you noticed.

JAP: You're almost there! Keep pushing!
FR: Tu y es presque ! Continue !
OUPS: You're almost there! Keep pushing!

JAP: You really know how to put up a fight, Kainé.
FR: Tu te débrouilles pas mal, Kainé.
OUPS: You really know how to put up a fight, Kainé.

JAP: Die, you big shithead!
FR: Meurs, enculé !
OUPS: Die, you big shithead!

JAP: (Heavy breathing)
FR: (Heavy breathing)
OUPS: (Heavy breathing)

JAP: (Heavy breathing)
FR: (Heavy breathing)
OUPS: (Heavy breathing)

JAP: Emil! You can't keep fighting like this.
FR: émile ! Tu ne peux pas continuer de te battre comme ça.
OUPS: Emil! You can't keep fighting like this.

JAP: I must... There is no other choice...
FR: Je le dois... Je n'ai pas le choix...
OUPS: I must... There is no other choice...

JAP: I can't remember...why I came here...
FR: Je ne me souviens pas... pourquoi je suis venu ici...
OUPS: I can't remember...why I came here...

JAP: Get out of there, Emil!
FR: Sors d'ici, émile !
OUPS: Get out of there, Emil!

JAP: No! I refuse to abandon these people now!
FR: Non ! Je refuse d'abandonner ces gens !
OUPS: No! I refuse to abandon these people now!

JAP: You told me once that my eyes had value, and that I shouldn't be ashamed of them!
FR: Tu m'as dit l'autre fois que mes yeux serviraient à quelque chose et que je ne devais pas en avoir honte !
OUPS: You told me once that my eyes had value, and that I shouldn't be ashamed of them!

JAP: You told me that even a life such as mine had purpose!
FR: Que même une vie comme la mienne a un but !
OUPS: You told me that even a life such as mine had purpose!

JAP: I won't just sit around and let you fight while I stay behind!
FR: Je ne resterai pas derrière à rien faire alors que vous combattez !
OUPS: I won't just sit around and let you fight while I stay behind!

JAP: Emil...
FR: émile...
OUPS: Emil...

JAP: Just don't die on me.
FR: Tu ferais mieux de ne pas mourir.
OUPS: Just don't die on me.

JAP: I won't, Kainé! Let's take care of this shit-hog!
FR: Entendu, Kainé ! Occupons-nous de ce « ragot de merde » !
OUPS: I won't, Kainé! Let's take care of this shit-hog!

JAP: I like it!
FR: Ça le fait !
OUPS: I like it!

JAP: We can't let any more Shades in here!
FR: Nous ne pouvons pas laisser passer d'autres Ombres !
OUPS: We can't let any more Shades in here!

JAP: Our magic has no effect!
FR: Nos sorts ne nous sont d'aucune utilité !
OUPS: Our magic has no effect!

JAP: Shit!
FR: Saloperie de merde !
OUPS: Shit!

JAP: He's healing too quickly!
FR: Elle se remet trop rapidement !
OUPS: He's healing too quickly!

JAP: We need a better plan.
FR: Nous avons besoin d'une meilleure stratégie.
OUPS: We need a better plan.

JAP: Perhaps we could chase him to the basement and seal him there.
FR: Nous pourrions peut-être la repousser jusqu'au sous-sol et l'y enfermer.
OUPS: Perhaps we could chase him to the basement and seal him there.

JAP: Those walls are thick rock; I doubt even this beast could break them.
FR: Ces murs de pierre sont solides. Je doute que même cette créature puisse les détruire.
OUPS: Those walls are thick rock; I doubt even this beast could break them.

JAP: Works for me.
FR: Ça me va.
OUPS: Works for me.

JAP: Great! I love basements!
FR: Super ! J'adore les sous-sols !
OUPS: Great! I love basements!

JAP: Do it! Push him to the basement!
FR: Vas-y ! Pousse-la dans le sous-sol !
OUPS: Do it! Push him to the basement!

JAP: Damn you!
FR: Sois maudit !
OUPS: Damn you!

JAP: Our true memories are still there! How dare you ignore them!?
FR: Nos vrais souvenirs sont toujours là ! Comment oses-tu les ignorer ?!
OUPS: Our true memories are still there! How dare you ignore them!?

JAP: Perhaps you should have scribbled them in my margins, hmmm?
FR: Tu aurais peut-être dû les griffonner dans mes marges#!
OUPS: Perhaps you should have scribbled them in my margins, hmmm?

JAP: Damn... This library isn't gonna hold for long.
FR: Bon sang ! La bibliothèque ne tiendra pas longtemps.
OUPS: Damn... This library isn't gonna hold for long.

JAP: We must finish this quickly!
FR: Finissons-en au plus vite !
OUPS: We must finish this quickly!

JAP: And you are the last one left, Noir!
FR: Et tu es le dernier, Noir !
OUPS: And you are the last one left, Noir!

JAP: N-Noir...? You impertinent fool!
FR: N-noir...? Quelle impertinence !
OUPS: N-Noir...? You impertinent fool!

JAP: See, I was in it, and you were in it too, and we were riding around on this huge pink cloud, and then—
FR: Tu vois, j'étais dans mon rêve, et tu étais avec moi, et on se promenait ensemble sur un immense nuage rose, et puis...
OUPS: See, I was in it, and you were in it too, and we were riding around on this huge pink cloud, and then—

JAP: Yonah? I'm sorry. I have to go. You can tell me when I get back.
FR: Yonah ? Je suis désolé, ma chérie, mais je dois y aller. Tu pourras me le raconter à mon retour.
OUPS: Yonah? I'm sorry. I have to go. You can tell me when I get back.

JAP: Oh, wait! Can you get me a book while you're out?
FR: Oh, attends ! Tu peux me rapporter un livre de la bibliothèque ?
OUPS: Oh, wait! Can you get me a book while you're out?

JAP: Sure. Now stay here and rest. We can't have your cough coming back.
FR: Bien sûr. Maintenant, reste ici et repose-toi. Il ne faudrait pas que tu recommences à tousser.
OUPS: Sure. Now stay here and rest. We can't have your cough coming back.

JAP: Don't stay out too long.
FR: Ne rentre pas trop tard.
OUPS: Don't stay out too long.

JAP: Okay!
FR: D'accord#!
OUPS: Okay!

JAP: Uh, well, we're here from—<WAIT=2.0>
FR: Euh, nous sommes venus de...<WAIT=2.0>
OUPS: Uh, well, we're here from—<WAIT=2.0>

JAP: Strangers! Go away!
FR: Des étrangers ! Sortez d'ici !
OUPS: Strangers! Go away!

JAP: Wait! Listen to—<WAIT=1.5>
FR: Attendez ! écoutez...<WAIT=1.5>
OUPS: Wait! Listen to—<WAIT=1.5>

JAP: Enough! Leave this village at once, and never return!
FR: Assez ! Partez immédiatement et ne revenez jamais !
OUPS: Enough! Leave this village at once, and never return!

JAP: What a pathetic bunch of rabble!
FR: Quelle misérable racaille !
OUPS: What a pathetic bunch of rabble!

JAP: Please take care of yourself.
FR: Sois prudent.
OUPS: Please take care of yourself.

JAP: These sound like some smart chickens.
FR: Elles semblent être bien intelligentes, vos poules.
OUPS: These sound like some smart chickens.

JAP: Yeah, they're clever little buggers. Anyway, just ask around; I bet someone in town will have an idea where to look.
FR: Ouaip, elles sont rusées, les petites coquines#! Tu devrais demander l'avis des autres villageois. Ils sauront peut-être où trouver les œufs.
OUPS: Yeah, they're clever little buggers. Anyway, just ask around; I bet someone in town will have an idea where to look.

JAP: I...I have things to attend to. Come back tomorrow, please!
FR: Je... je suis occupé. Revenez demain#!
OUPS: I...I have things to attend to. Come back tomorrow, please!

JAP: Go to the back room. There's something there you should see.
FR: Allez à l'arrière. Vous trouverez la réponse à vos questions.
OUPS: Go to the back room. There's something there you should see.

JAP: Look, I've told you what I think. Deliver the letter, or go tell her the truth.
FR: Je vous ai donné mon avis. Donnez-lui la lettre ou dites-lui la vérité.
OUPS: Look, I've told you what I think. Deliver the letter, or go tell her the truth.

JAP: It's up to you.
FR: À vous de choisir.
OUPS: It's up to you.

JAP: But I want to ask you a favor.
FR: Mais avant, j'aurais une faveur à vous demander.
OUPS: But I want to ask you a favor.

JAP: You must forget we ever had this conversation.
FR: Oubliez que nous avons eu cette conversation.
OUPS: You must forget we ever had this conversation.

JAP: The entire town has worked on this story, and they did so to make me happy.
FR: Les habitants de la ville ont concocté cette histoire pour me rendre heureuse.
OUPS: The entire town has worked on this story, and they did so to make me happy.

JAP: I don't want their hard work to go to waste, so I will carry on as if I am none the wiser.
FR: Je ne voudrais pas que leurs efforts aient été vains, alors je vais faire comme si de rien n'était.
OUPS: I don't want their hard work to go to waste, so I will carry on as if I am none the wiser.

JAP: As you wish.
FR: Comme vous le désirez.
OUPS: As you wish.

JAP: Please tell the postman...thank you.
FR: Je vous en prie... Remerciez le postier de ma part.
OUPS: Please tell the postman...thank you.

JAP: We will.
FR: Ce sera fait.
OUPS: We will.

JAP: This must be the egg. We'd better get this back to the tavern lady.
FR: Ce doit être ce que nous cherchions. Rapportons-le à la tavernière.
OUPS: This must be the egg. We'd better get this back to the tavern lady.

JAP: Pfft. Here we are, a stone's throw from the ocean, and not a single man in town knows how to fish properly.
FR: Pfft#! Même à deux pas de l'océan, il n'y a personne qui sache pêcher correctement#!
OUPS: Pfft. Here we are, a stone's throw from the ocean, and not a single man in town knows how to fish properly.

JAP: Being where we are, we're all spoiled for choice when it comes to seafood.
FR: Dans une ville comme la nôtre, nous avons vraiment l'embarras du choix en matière de poissons et de fruits de mer#!
OUPS: Being where we are, we're all spoiled for choice when it comes to seafood.

JAP: (The rules can be difficult at times...)
FR: (Il est parfois difficile de respecter la loi...)
OUPS: (The rules can be difficult at times...)

JAP: Well, that makes ten. Better take these back to the client.
FR: Je crois que j'ai dix peaux de loup.
OUPS: Well, that makes ten. Better take these back to the client.

JAP: So beautiful! Reminds me of back when I was a lot younger, it does. Prettier, too.
FR: Rapportons-les au marchand de curiosités. Quelle mélodie magnifique#! Elle me rappelle ma jeunesse…
OUPS: So beautiful! Reminds me of back when I was a lot younger, it does. Prettier, too.

JAP: I don't know where that song comes from, but it's odd how it seems to evoke the past inside my mind...
FR: Je n'ai jamais entendu cette chanson, mais en l'écoutant, mon cœur se remplit d'une certaine nostalgie...
OUPS: I don't know where that song comes from, but it's odd how it seems to evoke the past inside my mind...

JAP: Well, that was fun! Hopefully it won't be so long until the next time.
FR: Je me suis bien amusée#! J'espère que nous aurons encore l'occasion de chanter ensemble bientôt#!
OUPS: Well, that was fun! Hopefully it won't be so long until the next time.

JAP: Heavens, what a thrill! I'd no idea she had it in her.
FR: J'en ai encore des frissons#! Je ne savais pas qu'elles avaient autant de talent#!
OUPS: Heavens, what a thrill! I'd no idea she had it in her.

JAP: Me neither.
FR: Moi non plus.
OUPS: Me neither.

JAP: My leg's still bothering me. I don't think I can get back to my rounds for a bit.
FR: Ma jambe n'est toujours pas guérie. Je ne peux pas faire mes tournées.
OUPS: My leg's still bothering me. I don't think I can get back to my rounds for a bit.

JAP: I hope you can reason with her better than I have...
FR: J'espère que vous pourrez la convaincre.
OUPS: I hope you can reason with her better than I have...

JAP: <LIST=2693>I told her the truth.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=2693>Je lui ai dit la vérité.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=2693>I told her the truth.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=2693>No, I didn't.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=2693>Je lui ai menti.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=2693>No, I didn't.</LIST>

JAP: Great. That's everything the runaway kid asked for. Time to head back.
FR: Bien, j'ai ce que le fugueur m'avait demandé. Allons le rejoindre à la taverne de Littoral.
OUPS: Great. That's everything the runaway kid asked for. Time to head back.

JAP: Talk about your broken homes, eh? Yeesh...
FR: Quelle famille maffieuse...!
OUPS: Talk about your broken homes, eh? Yeesh...

JAP: Another Shade...? They just don't give up, do they?
FR: Une autre Ombre...? Elles n'abandonnent donc jamais#!
OUPS: Another Shade...? They just don't give up, do they?

JAP: Let's move!
FR: Allons-y#!
OUPS: Let's move!

JAP: We lost him...
FR: Nous l'avons perdu de vue...
OUPS: We lost him...

JAP: Let's go check out the wolves' den.
FR: Rendons-nous vite à la tanière des loups#!
OUPS: Let's go check out the wolves' den.

JAP: (Over here, you mangy curs! Your entire pack is history today!)
FR: (Sales cabots#! Je massacrerai votre meute#!)
OUPS: (Over here, you mangy curs! Your entire pack is history today!)

JAP: We're too late! Come on, we have to keep him from getting killed!
FR: Nous arrivons trop tard#! Allez#! Protégeons-le#!
OUPS: We're too late! Come on, we have to keep him from getting killed!

JAP: OHMIGOSH! THERE'S A HUGE PACK OF SHADES RIGHT—
FR: ATTENTION#! IL Y A PLUSIEURS OMBRES...
OUPS: OHMIGOSH! THERE'S A HUGE PACK OF SHADES RIGHT—

JAP: Shut up.
FR: La ferme.
OUPS: Shut up.

JAP: Uh... What's that big thing on the right?
FR: Euh... C'est quoi ça, à droite, là-bas#?
OUPS: Uh... What's that big thing on the right?

JAP: Fool me once, shame on you! Fool me twice,
FR: Oh, tu penses pouvoir nous duper une troisième fois#?!
OUPS: Fool me once, shame on you! Fool me twice,

JAP: and I shall smite you with unholy magic!
FR: Je te donnerai une leçon dont tu te souviendras avec ma magie#!
OUPS: and I shall smite you with unholy magic!

JAP: It's a pack of wolves!
FR: Une meute de loups#!
OUPS: It's a pack of wolves!

JAP: Maybe if I cut out your tongue, you won't be so...
FR: Si je te coupe la langue, tu ne pourras plus...
OUPS: Maybe if I cut out your tongue, you won't be so...

JAP: Oh, crap. It IS a pack of wolves!
FR: Mince, il y a vraiment une meute de loups#!
OUPS: Oh, crap. It IS a pack of wolves!

JAP: (Are you the one who saved our king?)
FR: (Êtes-vous celui qui a sauvé notre roi#?)
OUPS: (Are you the one who saved our king?)

JAP: It was nothing. Really.
FR: Je n'ai pas vraiment fait grand-chose.
OUPS: It was nothing. Really.

JAP: (We owe you a great debt! We would be nothing without him to guide us.)
FR: (Je ne sais comment vous remercier#! Sans lui, notre peuple serait perdu#!)
OUPS: (We owe you a great debt! We would be nothing without him to guide us.)

JAP: (By the way, do you happen to possess a royal compass?)
FR: (Au fait, possédez-vous une boussole royale#?)
OUPS: (By the way, do you happen to possess a royal compass?)

JAP: What is that?
FR: Qu'est-ce donc#?
OUPS: What is that?

JAP: (It allows you to traverse sandstorms without losing your way. It's one of our most handy tools!)
FR: (Elle permet de s'orienter lors de tempêtes de sable. C'est une de nos inventions les plus utiles#!)
OUPS: (It allows you to traverse sandstorms without losing your way. It's one of our most handy tools!)

JAP: (Please, feel free to take it.)
FR: (Je vous prie, acceptez celle-ci.)
OUPS: (Please, feel free to take it.)

JAP: You sure?
FR: Vraiment#?
OUPS: You sure?

JAP: (Of course! The Masked People always repay their debts.)
FR: (Bien sûr#! Le peuple masqué s'acquitte toujours de ses dettes.)
OUPS: (Of course! The Masked People always repay their debts.)

JAP: Then we would be honored to receive it.
FR: Alors, je l'accepte avec gratitude.
OUPS: Then we would be honored to receive it.

JAP: (Sir?)
FR: (Pardonnez-moi...)
OUPS: (Sir?)

JAP: What is it?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What is it?

JAP: (In exchange for protecting the king, I shall grant you full usage of the sandspout well.)
FR: (En guise de remerciement pour avoir protégé le roi, j'aimerais vous donner la permission d'utiliser le puits de sable.)
OUPS: (In exchange for protecting the king, I shall grant you full usage of the sandspout well.)

JAP: You'll do what now?
FR: De quoi s'agit-il#?
OUPS: You'll do what now?

JAP: (Have you noticed the stone structures in the desert?)
FR: (Avez-vous remarqué les structures en pierre dans le désert#?)
OUPS: (Have you noticed the stone structures in the desert?)

JAP: Uh...yeah, I saw something like that.
FR: Euh, oui, je crois que j'ai aperçu quelque chose du genre...
OUPS: Uh...yeah, I saw something like that.

JAP: (Those structures allow you to speed to your destination by means of underground sand flows.)
FR: (Elles permettent de se déplacer très rapidement d'un endroit à l'autre en empruntant les courants souterrains.)
OUPS: (Those structures allow you to speed to your destination by means of underground sand flows.)

JAP: (The system is normally reserved for royalty, but I shall grant you special usage privileges.)
FR: (Habituellement, son usage est réservé aux nobles, mais je vous accorderai une dispense.)
OUPS: (The system is normally reserved for royalty, but I shall grant you special usage privileges.)

JAP: Is this another rule?
FR: Serait-ce parce qu'une loi vous le prescrit#?
OUPS: Is this another rule?

JAP: (No. It is simply the will of our king.)
FR: (Non, parce que telle est la volonté du roi.)
OUPS: (No. It is simply the will of our king.)

JAP: Oh. Well in that case, I'm happy to accept.
FR: Oh. Dans ce cas, j'accepte avec plaisir.
OUPS: Oh. Well in that case, I'm happy to accept.

JAP: What might that be?
FR: Hum, qu'est-ce que c'est#?
OUPS: What might that be?

JAP: It's my mother's old diary.
FR: Le journal de ma femme.
OUPS: It's my mother's old diary.

JAP: Mother's?
FR: Vraiment#? J'ai du mal à croire qu'une femme ait accepté de t'épouser#!
OUPS: Mother's?

JAP: She's dead. The Black Scrawl took her.
FR: Elle est décédée. La nécrose runique l'a emportée.
OUPS: She's dead. The Black Scrawl took her.

JAP: Sorry for asking.
FR: Toutes mes excuses. Mes propos étaient déplacés.
OUPS: Sorry for asking.

JAP: It's all right. I've made my peace with it.
FR: Ce n'est pas grave. Elle est morte il y a longtemps.
OUPS: It's all right. I've made my peace with it.

JAP: This is the diary my mother left behind.
FR: C'est tout ce qui me reste d'elle.
OUPS: This is the diary my mother left behind.

JAP: Reading it reminds me of when our family was still whole. ...And happy.
FR: Je le feuillette parfois... Il me rappelle l'époque où nous étions une famille normale... une famille heureuse.
OUPS: Reading it reminds me of when our family was still whole. ...And happy.

JAP: I see...
FR: Je vois...
OUPS: I see...

JAP: I usually stop before the end, though. The last few entries are pretty bizarre.
FR: Cependant, je n'arrive jamais à le lire jusqu'à la dernière page. Les derniers messages sont trop étranges.
OUPS: I usually stop before the end, though. The last few entries are pretty bizarre.

JAP: In what way?
FR: Que veux-tu dire par là#?
OUPS: In what way?

JAP: Well, here.
FR: Tiens.
OUPS: Well, here.

JAP: Take a look...
FR: Regarde...
OUPS: Take a look...

JAP: The diary again?
FR: Veux-tu encore jeter un coup d'œil au journal de ta femme#?
OUPS: The diary again?

JAP: Yeah. Lately I haven't been able to stop thinking about it.
FR: Oui, ces derniers temps, je n'arrête pas d'y penser.
OUPS: Yeah. Lately I haven't been able to stop thinking about it.

JAP: The "world of the recycled vessel"...
FR: «#Le monde des vaisseaux vacants...#»
OUPS: The "world of the recycled vessel"...

JAP: ...My word!
FR: Par mon vélin...!
OUPS: ...My word!

JAP: Something wrong?
FR: Quelque chose ne va pas#?
OUPS: Something wrong?

JAP: I feel as if I've just awoken from a most unpleasant dream.
FR: C'est comme si je m'éveillais d'un cauchemar.
OUPS: I feel as if I've just awoken from a most unpleasant dream.

JAP: That happens to me whenever I read this.
FR: La même chose m'arrive chaque fois que je lis ces pages.
OUPS: That happens to me whenever I read this.

JAP: So, is this it?
FR: C'est tout#?
OUPS: So, is this it?

JAP: Huh?
FR: Hein#?
OUPS: Huh?

JAP: Is this the final entry of the diary?
FR: A-t-elle écrit autre chose dans son journal#?
OUPS: Is this the final entry of the diary?

JAP: Yeah. That's it.
FR: Non, rien d'autre.
OUPS: Yeah. That's it.

JAP: Interesting.
FR: Fascinant.
OUPS: Interesting.

JAP: You figure out anything?
FR: As-tu compris de quoi elle parlait#?
OUPS: You figure out anything?

JAP: I fear not.
FR: J'ai bien peur que non.
OUPS: I fear not.

JAP: Didn't think you would.
FR: Je m'en doutais bien.
OUPS: Didn't think you would.

JAP: Some villager in the northern plains has a job for you.
FR: Un villageois a du travail pour toi sur la plaine septentrionale.
OUPS: Some villager in the northern plains has a job for you.

JAP: Guy looked like he was a little bit crazy, so go easy. All right?
FR: Je crois qu'il a une araignée dans le plafond. Sois prudent, d'accord#?
OUPS: Guy looked like he was a little bit crazy, so go easy. All right?

JAP: Ah, <NIER>!
FR: Ah, <NIER>#!
OUPS: Ah, <NIER>!

JAP: You need something?
FR: Vous avez besoin de mon aide#?
OUPS: You need something?

JAP: I need revenge!
FR: Je veux me venger#!
OUPS: I need revenge!

JAP: Last month, my wife disturbed the sheep that roam these plains,
FR: Ma femme a malencontreusement effrayé les moutons de la plaine
OUPS: Last month, my wife disturbed the sheep that roam these plains,

JAP: and the foul creatures kicked the very life from her.
FR: et ces créatures infernales l'ont piétinée à mort#!
OUPS: and the foul creatures kicked the very life from her.

JAP: I came here to enact my revenge, but the fate I desire for them
FR: Je veux exercer ma vengeance, mais je ne pourrais pas les faire souffrir
OUPS: I came here to enact my revenge, but the fate I desire for them

JAP: is too cruel for me to carry out on my own.
FR: suffisamment par moi-même.
OUPS: is too cruel for me to carry out on my own.

JAP: You're not just gonna hunt 'em down?
FR: Vous n'allez pas les chasser#?
OUPS: You're not just gonna hunt 'em down?

JAP: No! That is unacceptable!
FR: Non#! Ce ne serait pas assez cruel#!
OUPS: No! That is unacceptable!

JAP: ...Oh boy.
FR: ... Hum.
OUPS: ...Oh boy.

JAP: They must suffer as she suffered!
FR: Ils doivent souffrir comme ma femme a souffert#!
OUPS: They must suffer as she suffered!

JAP: My good man, we are hardly in the business of punting fluffy animals to death.
FR: Sachez, monsieur, que nous ne sommes pas du genre à prendre plaisir à piétiner des animaux#!
OUPS: My good man, we are hardly in the business of punting fluffy animals to death.

JAP: I hear that you have tamed the wild boars, yes? That you can mount and ride them
FR: Mais tu sais apprivoiser des sangliers, non#? On dit que tu peux monter sur leur dos comme
OUPS: I hear that you have tamed the wild boars, yes? That you can mount and ride them

JAP: as one would a pack animal of old?
FR: s'ils n'étaient que des bêtes de somme#!
OUPS: as one would a pack animal of old?

JAP: This will be my revenge! Mount your boar and ride headlong into the sheep!
FR: Aide-moi à venger ma femme#! Monte sur le dos d'un sanglier
OUPS: This will be my revenge! Mount your boar and ride headlong into the sheep!

JAP: Annihilate them and all their kin across this plain!
FR: et fonce dans tous les moutons que tu verras sur la plaine#!
OUPS: Annihilate them and all their kin across this plain!

JAP: Hardly the most civilized of assignments.
FR: Tout cela me semble quelque peu barbare...
OUPS: Hardly the most civilized of assignments.

JAP: Save your civilized concerns for one who has not felt my pain!
FR: Peu m'importe#! Rien d'autre ne pourra apaiser ma douleur#!
OUPS: Save your civilized concerns for one who has not felt my pain!

JAP: These animals must suffer! They must pay for what they have done to my beloved!
FR: Ces créatures infectes doivent souffrir#! Elles doivent payer pour ce qu'elles ont fait à ma femme#!
OUPS: These animals must suffer! They must pay for what they have done to my beloved!

JAP: Those animals took all that was good in my life. Make them suffer! Make them pay!
FR: Ces créatures infectes ont tué la seule personne qui comptait pour moi#! Fais-les souffrir#! Fais-les payer#!
OUPS: Those animals took all that was good in my life. Make them suffer! Make them pay!

JAP: You've slain <NUM> of them!?
FR: Tu en as tué <NUM>#?!
OUPS: You've slain <NUM> of them!?

JAP: Ah, thank you. I'm sure my wife sleeps easier now.
FR: Ah, je te remercie. Grâce à toi, ma femme repose en paix.
OUPS: Ah, thank you. I'm sure my wife sleeps easier now.

JAP: Here is your payment.
FR: Voici ta récompense.
OUPS: Here is your payment.

JAP: Come back whenever you like. I will be here.
FR: Reviens quand tu veux, je t'attendrai.
OUPS: Come back whenever you like. I will be here.

JAP: Hee hee. Eee hee hee hee!
FR: Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha#!
OUPS: Hee hee. Eee hee hee hee!

JAP: ...You couldn't kill them? I hope it was not cowardice that stayed your hand!
FR: ... Tu n'en as pas tué#? J'espère que ce n'est pas parce que tu es un lâche#!
OUPS: ...You couldn't kill them? I hope it was not cowardice that stayed your hand!

JAP: Well, if you change your mind, I will be here.
FR: Eh bien, si tu changes d'avis, reviens me voir.
OUPS: Well, if you change your mind, I will be here.

JAP: Well, crap. Guess I won't be crossing here...
FR: Mince... Je ne pourrai pas traverser.
OUPS: Well, crap. Guess I won't be crossing here...

JAP: I had no idea Shades were loose so close to the village...
FR: Je ne pensais pas que les Ombres oseraient s'aventurer si près du village...
OUPS: I had no idea Shades were loose so close to the village...

JAP: A man can't even go hunting in peace anymore...
FR: On ne peut même plus chasser en paix de nos jours...
OUPS: A man can't even go hunting in peace anymore...

JAP: I'd better get this meat back to the shopkeeper.
FR: Je devrais apporter la viande de mouton à l'apothicaire.
OUPS: I'd better get this meat back to the shopkeeper.

JAP: That ought to be enough.
FR: Ça devrait suffire.
OUPS: That ought to be enough.

JAP: It smells like the sea.
