FR: Ah, l'odeur de la mer.
OUPS: It smells like the sea.

JAP: The people here seem nice.
FR: Les habitants de cette ville semblent accueillants.
OUPS: The people here seem nice.

JAP: Perhaps the healing properties of this shaman fish keep them in good spirits!
FR: Les propriétés curatives du poisson-shaman les aident peut-être à garder le moral#!
OUPS: Perhaps the healing properties of this shaman fish keep them in good spirits!

JAP: Guess we'd better find a good fishing spot...
FR: Essayons de trouver un bon endroit pour pêcher...
OUPS: Guess we'd better find a good fishing spot...

JAP: I think you need to move in the opposite direction from the way the fish is going.
FR: Je crois que tu dois bouger dans la direction inverse de celle de ta prise.
OUPS: I think you need to move in the opposite direction from the way the fish is going.

JAP: Careful, now.
FR: Doucement...
OUPS: Careful, now.

JAP: When the fishing pole makes a large movement, you need to move your body as well.
FR: Lorsque ta canne à pêche bouge, tu dois réagir en conséquence.
OUPS: When the fishing pole makes a large movement, you need to move your body as well.

JAP: I know, all right?
FR: Je sais#!
OUPS: I know, all right?

JAP: Perfect. Let's get this back to Yonah.
FR: Bien. Apportons-le à Yonah.
OUPS: Perfect. Let's get this back to Yonah.

JAP: This is madness! We've no business being in such a place!
FR: C'est de la folie#! Nous n'avons aucune raison de nous aventurer dans un tel endroit#!
OUPS: This is madness! We've no business being in such a place!

JAP: Don't we have business to attend to here?
FR: N'avons-nous pas encore à faire dans la ville#?
OUPS: Don't we have business to attend to here?

JAP: It would seem we are impeding progress.
FR: Il semblerait que nous sommes sur son chemin.
OUPS: It would seem we are impeding progress.

JAP: (Oh my gosh!)
FR: (Ça alors#!)
OUPS: (Oh my gosh!)

JAP: I don't have time for sightseeing.
FR: Ce n'est pas le moment d'errer sans but.
OUPS: I don't have time for sightseeing.

JAP: I don't need to go out quite yet.
FR: Je n'ai pas besoin de sortir du village.
OUPS: I don't need to go out quite yet.

JAP: She couldn't have left the village...
FR: Elle ne pourrait pas avoir quitté le village...
OUPS: She couldn't have left the village...

JAP: I think Popola said to head east...
FR: Je crois que Popola a dit d'aller vers l'est...
OUPS: I think Popola said to head east...

JAP: I'd better look around town some more.
FR: Je devrais fouiller la ville.
OUPS: I'd better look around town some more.

JAP: I need to gather more info from the villagers.
FR: Je dois interroger les villageois et obtenir plus d'informations.
OUPS: I need to gather more info from the villagers.

JAP: I need to kill all the Shades first.
FR: Je dois d'abord me débarrasser des Ombres.
OUPS: I need to kill all the Shades first.

JAP: I can't get in yet...
FR: Je ne peux pas encore y entrer.
OUPS: I can't get in yet...

JAP: This place is lousy with Shades. There's got to be a Sealed Verse nearby.
FR: Cet endroit fourmille d'Ombres. Il doit y avoir un vers scellé dans les environs.
OUPS: This place is lousy with Shades. There's got to be a Sealed Verse nearby.

JAP: This isn't where I need to be going.
FR: Ce n'est pas l'endroit où je dois aller.
OUPS: This isn't where I need to be going.

JAP: I don't think you can venture in here again.
FR: Je ne crois pas que tu puisses pénétrer de nouveau en cet endroit.
OUPS: I don't think you can venture in here again.

JAP: The sandstorm's too intense to go any further.
FR: La tempête m'empêche d'aller plus loin.
OUPS: The sandstorm's too intense to go any further.

JAP: Another Shade...? They just don't give up, do they?
FR: Une autre Ombre...? Elles n'abandonnent donc jamais#!
OUPS: Another Shade...? They just don't give up, do they?

JAP: Let's move!
FR: Allons-y#!
OUPS: Let's move!

JAP: Mmm? The Shade had a flower?
FR: Hum...? L'Ombre tenait une fleur#?
OUPS: Mmm? The Shade had a flower?

JAP: This is a freesia.
FR: C'est un freesia.
OUPS: This is a freesia.

JAP: The same flower that we were delivering to the woman.
FR: La même sorte de fleur que nous étions censés donner à la petite amie du marchand.
OUPS: The same flower that we were delivering to the woman.

JAP: That can't be a coincidence.
FR: Ce ne peut pas être qu'une coïncidence.
OUPS: That can't be a coincidence.

JAP: I think the woman was attacked by a Shade.
FR: Je crois qu'elle a été attaquée par une Ombre.
OUPS: I think the woman was attacked by a Shade.

JAP: OHMIGOSH! THERE'S A HUGE PACK OF SHADES RIGHT—
FR: ATTENTION#! IL Y A PLUSIEURS OMBRES...
OUPS: OHMIGOSH! THERE'S A HUGE PACK OF SHADES RIGHT—

JAP: Shut up.
FR: La ferme.
OUPS: Shut up.

JAP: Uh... What's that big thing on the right?
FR: Euh... C'est quoi ça, à droite, là-bas#?
OUPS: Uh... What's that big thing on the right?

JAP: Fool me once, shame on you! Fool me twice,
FR: Oh, tu penses pouvoir nous duper une troisième fois#?!
OUPS: Fool me once, shame on you! Fool me twice,

JAP: and I shall smite you with unholy magic!
FR: Je te donnerai une leçon dont tu te souviendras avec ma magie#!
OUPS: and I shall smite you with unholy magic!

JAP: It's a pack of wolves!
FR: Une meute de loups#!
OUPS: It's a pack of wolves!

JAP: Maybe if I cut out your tongue, you won't be so...
FR: Si je te coupe la langue, tu ne pourras plus...
OUPS: Maybe if I cut out your tongue, you won't be so...

JAP: Oh, crap. It IS a pack of wolves!
FR: Mince, il y a vraiment une meute de loups#!
OUPS: Oh, crap. It IS a pack of wolves!

JAP: (Over here, you mangy curs! Your entire pack is history today!)
FR: (Sales cabots#! Je massacrerai votre meute#!)
OUPS: (Over here, you mangy curs! Your entire pack is history today!)

JAP: We're too late! Come on, we have to keep him from getting killed!
FR: Nous arrivons trop tard#! Allez#! Protégeons-le#!
OUPS: We're too late! Come on, we have to keep him from getting killed!

JAP: So how was the village?
FR: Et le village, il était comment#?
OUPS: So how was the village?

JAP: Oh, it was truly magnificent. There are no words, really.
FR: Je n'ai jamais vu d'endroit plus merveilleux. J'ai peine à trouver les mots appropriés pour le décrire.
OUPS: Oh, it was truly magnificent. There are no words, really.

JAP: Huh. Neat.
FR: Super.
OUPS: Huh. Neat.

JAP: Let's go back to Popola.
FR: Retournons voir Popola.
OUPS: Let's go back to Popola.

JAP: She'll probably want to know what's going on in there.
FR: Nous devrions lui dire ce qui s'est passé dans la forêt.
OUPS: She'll probably want to know what's going on in there.

JAP: We can't have anyone know what our ritual is. Good-bye.
FR: J'ai fait un vœu, mais c'est un secret#! Si je te dis ce que c'est, il se réalisera pas#!
OUPS: We can't have anyone know what our ritual is. Good-bye.

JAP: Look...
FR: Regarde...
OUPS: Look...

JAP: Would that be the canine we were looking for?
FR: Serait-ce le corps d'un chien#?
OUPS: Would that be the canine we were looking for?

JAP: So this is the Shade that was sealed away!
FR: Ça devait être l'Ombre qui avait été scellée dans le temple...
OUPS: So this is the Shade that was sealed away!

JAP: That was intense. No wonder they sealed that thing up.
FR: Elle nous a donné du fil à retordre. Je comprends pourquoi le peuple masqué ne voulait pas qu'elle sorte d'ici.
OUPS: That was intense. No wonder they sealed that thing up.

JAP: Still, it should not have been our fight in the first place.
FR: Nous n'aurions tout de même pas dû avoir à nous en occuper.
OUPS: Still, it should not have been our fight in the first place.

JAP: True enough. Let's grab the surviving bandit and take him back to Facade.
FR: Tu as raison. Allons retrouver le pillard qui a réussi à sortir du temple et ramenons-le à Façade.
OUPS: True enough. Let's grab the surviving bandit and take him back to Facade.

JAP: Hey! I don't see you around here very often. Wanna split a round?
FR: Hé#! On ne te voit pas souvent dans les alentours. Que dirais-tu d'un petit verre#?
OUPS: Hey! I don't see you around here very often. Wanna split a round?

JAP: She didn't ever find out about her love, did she?
FR: La vieille femme du phare n'a jamais su la vérité à propos de son bien-aimé, hein#?
OUPS: She didn't ever find out about her love, did she?

JAP: At least she's in a better place now.
FR: Au moins, la vieille femme du phare doit être heureuse là où elle est maintenant.
OUPS: At least she's in a better place now.

JAP: If I may...
FR: Dis...
OUPS: If I may...

JAP: What is it?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What is it?

JAP: What are we doing here?
FR: Que faisons-nous ici#?
OUPS: What are we doing here?

JAP: We're organizing all this stuff.
FR: Nous mettons de l'ordre dans ces marchandises.
OUPS: We're organizing all this stuff.

JAP: Let me rephrase myself. This is for the sake of the merchant in training, yes?
FR: Laisse-moi reformuler ma question. Tu fais tout cela pour l'apprenti marchand, n'est-ce pas#?
OUPS: Let me rephrase myself. This is for the sake of the merchant in training, yes?

JAP: Yes.
FR: Oui.
OUPS: Yes.

JAP: Then would it not be more appropriate for him to take care of his own belongings?
FR: Alors, ne serait-il pas plus approprié qu'il s'occupe lui-même de ses effets personnels#?
OUPS: Then would it not be more appropriate for him to take care of his own belongings?

JAP: The man's in a pinch, Weiss. We're just helping him out.
FR: Il est dans le pétrin, Weiss. Nous lui donnons un coup de main, voilà tout.
OUPS: The man's in a pinch, Weiss. We're just helping him out.

JAP: I yearn for the day when someone shows such kindness to us.
FR: J'attends avec grande impatience le jour où quelqu'un fera preuve de tant de générosité envers nous.
OUPS: I yearn for the day when someone shows such kindness to us.

JAP: What a faithful animal!
FR: Quel fidèle compagnon#!
OUPS: What a faithful animal!

JAP: ...You think Max and Granddad are together in heaven?
FR: ... Tu crois que papi et Max sont ensemble au ciel#?
OUPS: ...You think Max and Granddad are together in heaven?

JAP: I do.
FR: Oui.
OUPS: I do.

JAP: I'm sure of it.
FR: J'en suis convaincu.
OUPS: I'm sure of it.

JAP: Thanks, but I think you're forgetting someone.
FR: Merci, mais je crois que vous oubliez quelqu'un.
OUPS: Thanks, but I think you're forgetting someone.

JAP: This is going to take a while.
FR: On en a pour un moment...
OUPS: This is going to take a while.

JAP: Yes! I finally caught it!
FR: Enfin !
OUPS: Yes! I finally caught it!

JAP: Too bad it took 278 tries...
FR: Et tu n'as eu qu'à essayer 278 fois...!
OUPS: Too bad it took 278 tries...

JAP: (The recipient is the king's right-hand man. The message is: "The Men of the Mask work for the king.")
FR: (Transmettez le message suivant au garde à la gauche de l'entrée du palais#: «#Le peuple masqué est dévoué au roi.#»)
OUPS: (The recipient is the king's right-hand man. The message is: "The Men of the Mask work for the king.")

JAP: (The recipient is the person taking care of the children. The message is: "Child care can be difficult.")
FR: (Transmettez ce message à la personne qui prend soin des enfants#: «#élever des enfants est parfois difficile.#»)
OUPS: (The recipient is the person taking care of the children. The message is: "Child care can be difficult.")

JAP: (The recipient is the southeastern guardian. The message is: "Only nobility may enter the treasury.")
FR: (Transmettez ce message au garde du sud-est#: «#Seuls les nobles peuvent entrer dans la trésorerie.#»)
OUPS: (The recipient is the southeastern guardian. The message is: "Only nobility may enter the treasury.")

JAP: (The recipient is the long-winded person. The message is: "Quicksand.")
FR: (Transmettez ce message à la personne la plus prolixe de la ville#: «#Sables mouvants#».)
OUPS: (The recipient is the long-winded person. The message is: "Quicksand.")

JAP: (I'm sorry we couldn't be more help...)
FR: (Je suis désolé de ne pas avoir pu vous prêter main-forte...)
OUPS: (I'm sorry we couldn't be more help...)

JAP: We didn't do much. Your son is still young and reckless, but he has the heart of a warrior.
FR: Nous n'avons pas fait grand-chose. Votre fils est jeune et imprudent, mais il possède l'âme d'un guerrier.
OUPS: We didn't do much. Your son is still young and reckless, but he has the heart of a warrior.

JAP: (Yes. He is my pride and joy.)
FR: (Oui, j'en suis très fier.)
OUPS: (Yes. He is my pride and joy.)

JAP: What's going on!?
FR: Que se passe-t-il#?!
OUPS: What's going on!?

JAP: How can I help you?
FR: En quoi puis-je vous être utile#?
OUPS: How can I help you?

JAP: Oh, also...
FR: Oh, en passant...
OUPS: Oh, also...

JAP: Come back whenever you have a free minute!
FR: Reviens me voir bientôt#!
OUPS: Come back whenever you have a free minute!

JAP: (I would appreciate it if you could come back another day.)
FR: (Veuillez revenir un autre jour.)
OUPS: (I would appreciate it if you could come back another day.)

JAP: I'll do whatever it takes to keep the two of us together.
FR: Je ferais n'importe quoi pour que nous restions ensemble.
OUPS: I'll do whatever it takes to keep the two of us together.

JAP: Might as well head for Facade.
FR: Nous devrions nous rendre à Façade.
OUPS: Might as well head for Facade.

JAP: (Hey, you came back! Oh, here! Watch this...)
FR: (Vous êtes revenus#! Oh, regardez un peu...!)
OUPS: (Hey, you came back! Oh, here! Watch this...)

JAP: (My liege, the mask was not meant to be spun in such a manner!
FR: (Votre Majesté, le masque n'est pas fait pour être tournoyé ainsi#!
OUPS: (My liege, the mask was not meant to be spun in such a manner!

JAP: ...Oh, dear.)
FR: Oh, misère...)
OUPS: ...Oh, dear.)

JAP: (It's all right. We weren't discussing anything important.)
FR: (Ne vous inquiétez pas. Nous ne parlions pas de choses importantes.)
OUPS: (It's all right. We weren't discussing anything important.)

JAP: (Not important!?)
FR: (Pas importantes#?!)
OUPS: (Not important!?)

JAP: (My liege...)
FR: (Votre Majesté...)
OUPS: (My liege...)

JAP: Things are getting really bad here...
FR: La situation empire chaque jour...
OUPS: Things are getting really bad here...

JAP: I'm sure Yonah would love some extra time with you.
FR: Je suis certaine que Yonah aimerait pouvoir passer plus de temps avec toi.
OUPS: I'm sure Yonah would love some extra time with you.

JAP: Yeah. I'm sure she would.
FR: Tu as raison.
OUPS: Yeah. I'm sure she would.

JAP: I heard about Yonah. I...I don't know what to say. I'm so sorry.
FR: J'ai appris ce qui était arrivé à Yonah. Je... je ne sais pas quoi te dire. Je suis tellement désolée.
OUPS: I heard about Yonah. I...I don't know what to say. I'm so sorry.

JAP: (Might as well check out that tavern Popola mentioned.)
FR: (Hum, je devrais peut-être aller à la taverne comme me l'a suggéré Popola...)
OUPS: (Might as well check out that tavern Popola mentioned.)

JAP: I really wanted to give her a Lunar Tear, but as I'm sure you know, the whole reason they call 'em "legendary" is that they're so hard to cultivate...
FR: Je voulais lui offrir une larme lunaire, mais je n'arrive pas à en cultiver. Elles ne sont pas «#légendaires#» pour rien#!
OUPS: I really wanted to give her a Lunar Tear, but as I'm sure you know, the whole reason they call 'em "legendary" is that they're so hard to cultivate...

JAP: But I did manage to cultivate a freesia.
FR: Cependant, j'ai réussi à cultiver des freesias.
OUPS: But I did manage to cultivate a freesia.

JAP: She's always liked freesias, so I guess things turned out for the best.
FR: Elle a toujours aimé les freesias, alors je suppose que c'est pour le mieux#!
OUPS: She's always liked freesias, so I guess things turned out for the best.

JAP: I know Yonah means everything to you, but don't overwork yourself, all right?
FR: Je sais que Yonah est ce qu'il y a de plus important pour toi, mais ne te surmène pas trop, d'accord#?
OUPS: I know Yonah means everything to you, but don't overwork yourself, all right?

JAP: Once you arrive, be sure to speak to the village chief.
FR: Ne manque pas de t'adresser au chef du village une fois arrivé.
OUPS: Once you arrive, be sure to speak to the village chief.

JAP: He lives in the gold-colored house up on the highest point in The Aerie.
FR: Il habite dans la maison jaune tout en haut de l'Aire.
OUPS: He lives in the gold-colored house up on the highest point in The Aerie.

JAP: Good.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: Good.

JAP: Once you arrive, be sure to speak to the village chief.
FR: Ne manque pas de t'adresser au chef du village une fois arrivé.
OUPS: Once you arrive, be sure to speak to the village chief.

JAP: He lives in the gold-colored house up on the highest point in The Aerie.
FR: Il habite dans la maison jaune tout en haut de l'Aire.
OUPS: He lives in the gold-colored house up on the highest point in The Aerie.

JAP: Good.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: Good.
